name: 3/4 sit-up
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
  2. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  3. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button in towards your spine.
  4. Slowly lift your head, shoulders, and upper back off the ground, while keeping your lower back pressed into the floor.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, exhaling as you lift up and inhaling as you lower back down.
  8. For added challenge, you can hold a weight or medicine ball against your chest as you perform the exercise.

name: 45Â° side bend
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Place your right hand on your right hip and raise your left arm straight overhead.
  3. Inhale deeply and as you exhale, slowly bend your upper body to the right side, keeping your left arm straight and your hand reaching towards the right.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your left side.
  5. Inhale and slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise on the opposite side by placing your left hand on your left hip and raising your right arm straight overhead.
  7. Perform 10-15 repetitions on each side.

name: air bike
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat and handlebars to your height.
  2. Place your feet on the pedals and secure them with the straps.
  3. Begin pedaling with your arms and legs simultaneously.
  4. Start with a warm-up of 5-10 minutes at a moderate pace.
  5. Gradually increase the resistance level to increase the intensity of the workout.
  6. Alternate between high-intensity intervals and recovery periods.
  7. For a high-intensity interval, pedal as fast as you can for 20-30 seconds.
  8. For a recovery period, pedal at a slower pace for 60-90 seconds.
  9. Repeat the high-intensity interval and recovery period for 10-20 minutes.
  10. Cool down with 5-10 minutes of pedaling at a slow pace.
  11. Stretch your legs and arms after the workout.

name: all fours squad stretch
instructions:
1. Start on your hands and knees, with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
  2. Keep your spine in a neutral position, with your head in line with your back.
  3. Extend your right leg behind you, keeping it straight and parallel to the ground.
  4. At the same time, lift your left arm in front of you, keeping it straight and parallel to the ground.
  5. Hold this position for 10-15 seconds, feeling a stretch in your right hip and left shoulder.
  6. Return to the starting position on all fours.
  7. Repeat the stretch on the other side, extending your left leg behind you and lifting your right arm in front of you.
  8. Continue alternating sides for 5-10 repetitions on each side.
  9. Remember to breathe deeply and evenly throughout the exercise.
  10. As you become more comfortable with the stretch, you can increase the duration of each hold or add a slight twist to the torso for an additional stretch.

name: alternate heel touchers
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
  2. Place your arms flat on the ground beside your body.
  3. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
  4. Slowly lift your head, neck, and shoulders off the ground.
  5. Bring your left hand towards your left heel, while keeping your right hand on the ground beside you.
  6. Lower your upper body back to the ground and repeat on the other side, bringing your right hand towards your right heel.
  7. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe deeply.
  9. For a more advanced variation, try extending your legs straight up towards the ceiling while performing the exercise.

name: alternate lateral pulldown
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting at a cable machine with a high pulley attachment.
  2. Grasp the handle with one hand and sit with your back straight facing the machine.
  3. Engage your core and keep your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Begin the exercise by pulling the handle down towards your hip while keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. As you lower the handle, rotate your torso to the opposite side.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position while rotating your torso back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise on the opposite side.
  8. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each side.

name: ankle circles
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Lift one foot off the ground and extend it in front of you.
  3. Slowly rotate your ankle clockwise, making small circles with your foot.
  4. Complete 10 rotations in a clockwise direction.
  5. Switch to counterclockwise rotations and complete 10 rotations in that direction.
  6. Lower your foot back to the ground and repeat the exercise with the other foot.
  7. Continue alternating between feet for 2-3 sets of 10 rotations in each direction.

name: archer pull up
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of a pull-up bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Jump up and grip the bar with one hand overhand and the other hand underhand, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
  4. Pull your shoulder blades down and back, and engage your core.
  5. Begin the movement by pulling with your upper arm and elbow, while keeping your lower arm and hand stationary.
  6. As you pull yourself up towards the bar, rotate your torso and lift your knee up towards your opposite elbow.
  7. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar and your elbow is at a 90-degree angle.
  8. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  9. Repeat the movement, alternating sides with each repetition.
  10. Perform 3 sets of 8-12 repetitions, resting for 60 seconds between sets.

name: archer push up
instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet together.
  2. Shift your weight to your left hand and rotate your body to the right, extending your right arm out to the side like an archer pulling back a bowstring.
  3. Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your right arm extended out to the side.
  4. Push back up to the starting position, shifting your weight to your right hand and rotating your body to the left, extending your left arm out to the side.
  5. Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your left arm extended out to the side.
  6. Push back up to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: arm slingers hanging bent knee legs
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy bar or ledge that can support your weight.
  2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended.
  3. Bend your knees and bring them up towards your chest.
  4. Slowly lower your legs back down, straightening them out as much as possible.
  5. As you lower your legs, simultaneously swing your arms forward and up towards the bar.
  6. Return to the starting position with your arms fully extended and your legs bent.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: arm slingers hanging straight legs
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy bar or branch to hang from.
  2. Jump up and grab the bar with both hands, shoulder-width apart.
  3. Engage your core and slowly lift your legs up until they are parallel to the ground.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, making sure to keep your legs straight and your toes pointed.
  5. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for a set of 10-15 reps.
  7. As you progress, you can increase the number of reps or add ankle weights for an extra challenge.

name: arms apart circular toe touch (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out to the sides, parallel to the ground.
  2. Take a deep breath and engage your core muscles.
  3. Slowly bend forward at the waist, keeping your legs straight but not locked.
  4. As you bend forward, bring your arms down and around in a circular motion, reaching towards your toes.
  5. Try to touch your toes with your fingertips, but don't force it if you can't reach that far.
  6. Hold the stretch for a few seconds, feeling the stretch in your hamstrings and lower back.
  7. Slowly raise your arms back up to the starting position as you come back up to standing.
  8. Repeat for several reps, focusing on keeping your core engaged and your movements slow and controlled.

name: arms overhead full sit-up (male)
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on your back with your arms extended overhead, palms facing up, and your legs straight out in front of you.
  2. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
  3. Sit up by bringing your arms forward and reaching towards your toes. Keep your legs straight and your feet on the ground.
  4. As you sit up, exhale and contract your abs. Keep your chin tucked towards your chest and your shoulders relaxed.
  5. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position, inhaling as you go. Keep your arms extended overhead and your feet on the ground.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. For added difficulty, hold a weight or medicine ball in your hands as you perform the exercise.
  8. Make sure to stretch your abs and back after completing the exercise.

name: assisted chest dip (kneeling)
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy dip bar or parallel bars that can support your weight.
  2. Kneel down in front of the bars and place your hands on the bars shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest is level with the bars.
  4. Push yourself back up by straightening your arms, keeping your core engaged.
  5. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  6. Remember to keep your elbows close to your body and avoid flaring them out.
  7. If you need assistance, have a partner hold your legs or use a resistance band to help lift you up.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the difficulty by using a weighted vest or holding a dumbbell between your feet.
  9. Always listen to your body and stop if you feel any pain or discomfort.
  10. Stretch your chest and triceps after the exercise to prevent soreness.

name: assisted hanging knee raise
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar or other stable overhead structure to hang from.
  2. Step up onto a bench or other platform so that you can easily reach the bar.
  3. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended, feet off the ground.
  5. Engage your core muscles and lift your knees up towards your chest, keeping your feet together.
  6. Hold the top position for a moment, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. If you're having trouble with the exercise, try bending your knees slightly or using a spotter to assist you with the movement.
  9. As you get stronger, you can increase the difficulty by straightening your legs or adding ankle weights.

name: assisted hanging knee raise with throw down
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar or any stable overhead structure that you can hang from.
  2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  3. Engage your core muscles and bring your knees up towards your chest.
  4. At the top of the movement, throw your legs down towards the ground.
  5. As your legs come down, resist the urge to let go of the bar and instead use your core muscles to control the movement.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: assisted lying calves stretch
instructions:
1. Lie down on your back with your legs extended straight out in front of you.
  2. Place a towel or resistance band around the ball of your right foot, holding onto the ends with both hands.
  3. Slowly pull your foot towards your head, keeping your leg straight, until you feel a stretch in your calf muscle.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release and switch sides.
  5. Repeat the stretch on both sides for 2-3 sets.

name: assisted lying glutes stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place a resistance band or towel around the ball of your right foot and hold the ends of the band/towel with both hands.
  3. Slowly straighten your right leg, pulling the band/towel towards you until you feel a stretch in your glutes and hamstring.
  4. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then release and repeat on the other leg.
  5. For a deeper stretch, you can gently pull the band/towel towards you while keeping your leg straight.
  6. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times on each leg.

name: assisted lying gluteus and piriformis stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your right ankle on your left knee, just above the knee joint.
  3. Use your hands to gently pull your left thigh towards your chest, feeling a stretch in your right gluteus and piriformis muscles.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing your muscles.
  5. Release the stretch and switch sides, placing your left ankle on your right knee and pulling your right thigh towards your chest.
  6. Repeat the stretch on each side 2-3 times, gradually increasing the duration of the stretch as your muscles loosen up.
  7. Be sure to listen to your body and avoid any pain or discomfort during the stretch.
  8. You can also modify the stretch by using a yoga strap or towel to assist with the stretch if needed.
  9. Remember to breathe deeply and relax your muscles throughout the stretch to maximize the benefits.

name: assisted lying leg raise with lateral throw down
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on your back on a yoga mat or a comfortable surface.
  2. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Place your arms by your sides with your palms facing down.
  4. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
  5. Slowly lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight and together.
  6. As you lift your legs, simultaneously lift your arms off the ground and extend them straight above your head.
  7. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs and arms back down to the starting position.
  8. Repeat this movement for several reps.
  9. To add the lateral throw down, as you lower your legs and arms back down to the starting position, lower them to one side of your body.
  10. Pause briefly, then lift them back up to the center and repeat on the other side.
  11. Continue alternating sides for several reps.
  12. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe deeply and steadily.

name: assisted lying leg raise with throw down
instructions:
1. Lie flat on your back on a yoga mat or any comfortable surface.
  2. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Place a small medicine ball or any lightweight object between your feet.
  4. Engage your core muscles and lift your legs up towards the ceiling, keeping them straight and together.
  5. Hold the medicine ball or object between your feet throughout the exercise.
  6. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position, but do not let them touch the ground.
  7. As you lift your legs back up, throw the medicine ball or object towards your hands, catching it with your hands above your chest.
  8. Lower your arms and legs back down to the starting position.
  9. Repeat the exercise for 10-12 repetitions, or as many as you can comfortably perform.
  10. Rest for 30-60 seconds and repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: assisted motion russian twist
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground. Lean back slightly so that your torso is at a 45-degree angle to the ground.
  2. Hold a medicine ball or dumbbell with both hands directly in front of your chest. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your feet off the ground, balancing on your sit bones. Your shins should be parallel to the ground.
  4. Slowly twist your torso to the right, keeping your arms straight and the medicine ball or dumbbell in front of your chest. Pause briefly at the end of the movement.
  5. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement to the left. This completes one repetition.
  6. Perform 10-12 repetitions of the exercise, then rest for 30-60 seconds before repeating for 2-3 sets total.

name: assisted parallel close grip pull-up
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy horizontal bar that can support your weight.
  2. Stand directly under the bar and reach up to grab it with both hands.
  3. Place your palms facing each other and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and pull yourself up towards the bar.
  5. As you pull up, keep your elbows close to your body.
  6. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
  7. Hold this position for a few seconds.
  8. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  9. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: assisted prone hamstring
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your stomach on a mat or padded surface with your legs straight out behind you.
  2. Have a partner or trainer stand at your feet and hold onto your ankles.
  3. Engage your core and lift your chest slightly off the ground to protect your lower back.
  4. Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks, while keeping your thighs on the ground.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, feeling the stretch in your hamstrings.
  6. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position, keeping them straight and your thighs on the ground.
  7. Repeat for several repetitions, focusing on controlled movements and feeling the stretch in your hamstrings.
  8. Switch roles with your partner or trainer so that both of you have a chance to perform the exercise.

name: assisted prone lying quads stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat or exercise mat.
  2. Place a rolled-up towel or small pillow under your hips to help support your lower back.
  3. Bend your left knee and bring your heel towards your buttocks, grasping your ankle with your left hand.
  4. Slowly pull your heel towards your buttocks until you feel a stretch in your left thigh.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing your muscles.
  6. Release the stretch and repeat on the other side, bending your right knee and grasping your ankle with your right hand.
  7. Repeat the stretch on each side 2-3 times, gradually increasing the duration of the stretch as your muscles become more flexible.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and relax your muscles during the stretch, avoiding any sudden or jerky movements.
  9. If you experience any pain or discomfort during the stretch, stop immediately and consult with a healthcare professional.

name: assisted prone rectus femoris stretch
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your stomach on a comfortable surface.
  2. Bend one knee and bring your heel towards your buttocks.
  3. Grasp your ankle with one hand and hold onto a stable object with the other hand for support.
  4. Gently pull your heel towards your buttocks until you feel a stretch in the front of your thigh.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, making sure to breathe deeply and relax your muscles.
  6. Release the stretch and repeat on the other leg.
  7. Perform 2-3 sets of the stretch on each leg, taking breaks as needed.

name: assisted pull-up
instructions:
1. Find an assisted pull-up machine or use a resistance band to assist with the exercise.
  2. Stand on the platform or place the resistance band around your foot and attach the other end to the pull-up bar.
  3. Grab onto the pull-up bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and pull your shoulder blades down and back.
  5. Bend your elbows and pull yourself up towards the bar, keeping your chest lifted.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  8. Gradually decrease the assistance from the machine or resistance band as you become stronger.

name: assisted seated pectoralis major stretch with stability ball
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Hold a light dumbbell in each hand and bring your arms up to shoulder height, with your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Slowly lean forward, allowing your arms to extend out in front of you while keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your chest muscles, but be sure not to overextend or strain yourself.
  5. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, then slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the stretch for 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions, or as directed by your fitness instructor or physical therapist.
  7. Remember to breathe deeply and exhale as you lean forward into the stretch.
  8. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or hold the stretch for a longer period of time.
  9. Be sure to consult with a healthcare professional before beginning any new exercise program, especially if you have a history of back or shoulder injuries.

name: assisted side lying adductor stretch
instructions:
1. Lie down on your side on a comfortable surface, with your legs straight and stacked on top of each other.
  2. Bend your bottom knee slightly for stability.
  3. Slowly bring your top leg up and over your bottom leg, placing your foot on the ground in front of your bottom leg.
  4. Use your hand to gently press your top knee down towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your inner thigh.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing your muscles.
  6. Release the stretch and repeat on the other side.

name: assisted sit-up
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Have a partner or trainer stand behind you and hold your feet down securely.
  3. Place your hands behind your head or across your chest.
  4. Engage your core and lift your upper body off the ground towards your knees.
  5. Exhale as you lift up and inhale as you lower back down.
  6. Lower your upper body back down to the starting position with control.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your neck in a neutral position and avoid pulling on your head or neck with your hands.
  9. Focus on using your abdominal muscles to lift your upper body rather than relying on momentum or pulling with your arms.
  10. Stretch your abs and lower back after the exercise to prevent any soreness or stiffness.

name: assisted standing chin-up
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy horizontal bar that can support your weight.
  2. Stand underneath the bar and grasp it with an underhand grip, palms facing towards you.
  3. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bend your knees.
  4. Engage your core and shoulder muscles by pulling your shoulder blades down and back.
  5. Slowly lift yourself up towards the bar by bending your elbows and pulling your chin towards the bar.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and hold for a few seconds.
  7. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position, keeping your core and shoulder muscles engaged.
  8. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: assisted standing pull-up
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy bar or ledge that is high enough for you to hang from with your arms fully extended.
  2. Stand facing the bar/ledge and place your hands on it, shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step back a few feet from the bar/ledge and lean forward slightly, keeping your arms straight.
  4. Bend your knees and lift your feet off the ground, balancing on the balls of your feet.
  5. Slowly pull yourself towards the bar/ledge, using your arms to lift your body up.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement, with your chin above the bar/ledge.
  7. Lower yourself back down to the starting position, keeping your arms straight and your feet off the ground.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: assisted standing triceps extension (with towel)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a towel with both hands and raise it above your head, keeping your elbows close to your ears.
  3. Slowly lower the towel behind your head, bending your elbows and keeping them close to your ears.
  4. Stop when your elbows are at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Slowly raise the towel back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and keeping your elbows close to your ears.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 reps.

name: assisted triceps dip (kneeling)
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy chair or bench and place it behind you.
  2. Kneel down in front of the chair or bench and place your hands on the edge, shoulder-width apart.
  3. Slide your feet forward so that your knees are directly under your hips and your arms are straight.
  4. Slowly lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight and close to the chair or bench.
  5. Stop when your upper arms are parallel to the ground, making sure not to let your shoulders shrug up towards your ears.
  6. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms, but don't lock your elbows.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your neck relaxed throughout the exercise.
  9. If you experience any pain or discomfort, stop immediately and consult a doctor or fitness professional.

name: assisted wide-grip chest dip (kneeling)
instructions:
1. Find a dip station or parallel bars that are about shoulder-width apart.
  2. Place your hands on the bars, palms facing forward, and step back so your arms are straight and your feet are on the ground.
  3. Kneel down on a mat or pad, keeping your back straight and your knees close together.
  4. Bend your arms and lower your body down until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Push yourself back up to the starting position, using your chest and triceps to lift your body.
  6. Repeat for 8-12 reps, or as many as you can do with proper form.
  7. Rest for 30-60 seconds, then repeat for 2-3 sets.
  8. As you get stronger, you can try lifting one leg off the ground or adding weight to your dip belt.

name: astride jumps (male)
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and jump forward, landing with one foot in front of the other.
  3. Jump again, switching the position of your feet so that the other foot is now in front.
  4. Continue jumping forward, alternating the position of your feet with each jump.
  5. Make sure to land softly and with control to avoid injury.
  6. Repeat for several sets, taking breaks as needed.

name: back and forth step
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Take a step forward with your right foot, bending your knee and keeping your left foot in place.
  3. Push off your right foot and bring it back to the starting position.
  4. Take a step forward with your left foot, bending your knee and keeping your right foot in place.
  5. Push off your left foot and bring it back to the starting position.
  6. Continue alternating steps forward and backward for the desired number of repetitions or time.

name: back extension on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on an exercise ball, with your hands placed behind your head and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Engage your core and slowly lift your upper body off the ball, keeping your neck in a neutral position.
  3. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions, or as many as you can comfortably perform.
  5. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest while performing the exercise.
  6. Be sure to breathe deeply throughout the exercise and maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: back lever
instructions:
1. Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Engage your shoulder blades and pull them down and back.
  3. Bend your knees and tuck them up towards your chest.
  4. Slowly begin to lower your legs and straighten them out behind you, keeping your body in a straight line.
  5. Continue to lower your body until it is parallel to the ground.
  6. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly raise your legs back up towards your chest and return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: back pec stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Interlock your fingers behind your back.
  3. Slowly raise your arms up and away from your body, keeping them straight.
  4. Feel the stretch in your back and shoulders.
  5. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds.
  6. Release your hands and bring your arms back down to your sides.
  7. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times.

name: backward jump
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bend your knees and jump backwards as far as you can.
  3. Land on the balls of your feet and immediately jump backwards again.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your knees slightly bent throughout the exercise.
  6. As you become more comfortable with the movement, try to jump farther and faster.
  7. Remember to always land softly to avoid injury.
  8. Finish the exercise by standing up straight and taking a few deep breaths.

name: balance board
instructions:
1. Step 1: Place the balance board on a flat surface, ensuring it is stable and secure.
  2. Step 2: Stand on the balance board with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  3. Step 3: Keep your core engaged and your eyes looking straight ahead.
  4. Step 4: Shift your weight to one side of the board, lifting the opposite foot off the ground.
  5. Step 5: Hold this position for 10-30 seconds, then switch sides and repeat.
  6. Step 6: As you become more comfortable with the exercise, try shifting your weight in different directions to challenge your balance.
  7. Step 7: Perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions, or as recommended by your fitness instructor or physical therapist.
  8. Step 8: Always use caution and stop the exercise if you feel any pain or discomfort.
  9. Step 9: When finished, carefully step off the balance board and store it in a safe place.

name: band alternating biceps curl
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, and place the exercise band under the arches of both feet.
  2. Grasp the handles of the band with your palms facing forward and your arms extended down at your sides.
  3. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, exhale and curl the band up towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and inhale.
  5. Slowly lower the band back down to the starting position, while exhaling.
  6. Repeat the movement with the opposite arm.
  7. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the tension of the band as needed to increase or decrease the resistance.
  10. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions for optimal results.

name: band alternating v-up
instructions:
1. Begin by lying down on your back with your legs straight and your arms extended above your head, holding the exercise band with both hands.
  2. Place the exercise band around the arches of your feet, holding the ends of the band securely in your hands.
  3. Engage your core and lift your legs and upper body off the ground, simultaneously pulling the exercise band towards your feet.
  4. As you lift your legs and upper body, bring your hands towards your feet, performing a v-up motion.
  5. Lower your legs and upper body back down to the starting position while keeping the exercise band taut.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, alternating which foot the exercise band is wrapped around.

name: band assisted pull-up
instructions:
1. Attach the exercise band to a pull-up bar or sturdy anchor point above you.
  2. Step onto the exercise band and grip the bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your back muscles and pull your chest towards the bar while keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  7. Gradually decrease the thickness of the exercise band or increase the number of reps to progress the exercise and eventually work towards unassisted pull-ups.

name: band assisted wheel rollerout
instructions:
1. Start by placing the exercise band around a stable anchor point, such as a pole or heavy piece of furniture.
  2. Grab the handles of the exercise band and kneel down on a mat or soft surface.
  3. Place the wheel roller in front of your knees and hold onto the handles with both hands.
  4. Engage your core muscles and slowly roll the wheel forward, extending your arms in front of you.
  5. As you roll out, keep your back straight and your abs tight to prevent your lower back from sagging.
  6. Once you have reached a comfortable distance, hold the position for a few seconds before rolling back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and control throughout the movement.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the difficulty by moving the anchor point farther away or using a thicker resistance band.

name: band bench press
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on a bench with your back flat against the bench and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Place the exercise band under the bench and hold onto the handles with your hands.
  3. Extend your arms straight up above your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Slowly lower your arms down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause when your hands are at chest level, then slowly push your arms back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: band bent-over hip extension
instructions:
1. Step 1: Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, and place the exercise band around your ankles.
  2. Step 2: Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  3. Step 3: Place your hands on your hips or hold onto a stable object for balance.
  4. Step 4: Slowly lift one leg behind you, keeping your knee straight and your foot flexed.
  5. Step 5: Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your leg back down.
  6. Step 6: Repeat the movement with the other leg.
  7. Step 7: Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  8. Step 8: To increase the intensity, you can use a stronger exercise band or add ankle weights.
  9. Step 9: Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: band bicycle crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place the exercise band around the soles of your feet and hold the handles in each hand, with your arms extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Bring your hands to the sides of your head and lift your head, neck, and shoulders off the ground.
  4. Simultaneously, bring your right knee towards your chest and extend your left leg out straight, while twisting your torso to bring your left elbow towards your right knee.
  5. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side, bringing your left knee towards your chest and extending your right leg out straight, while twisting your torso to bring your right elbow towards your left knee.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  7. Remember to engage your core muscles throughout the exercise and keep your movements controlled and smooth.

name: band close-grip pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach the exercise band to a sturdy overhead anchor point, such as a pull-up bar or door frame.
  2. Grab the exercise band with both hands, using an overhand grip with your palms facing down.
  3. Step back from the anchor point until you feel tension in the band.
  4. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and engage your core muscles.
  5. Bring your hands down to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Slowly pull the band down towards your hips, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.
  7. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
  9. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise, inhaling as you pull the band down and exhaling as you release the tension.

name: band close-grip push-up
instructions:
1. Place the exercise band around your back, just below your shoulder blades.
  2. Get into a push-up position with your hands close together, directly under your shoulders.
  3. Lower yourself down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Push yourself back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: band concentration curl
instructions:
1. Step 1: Begin by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the ground, holding an exercise band with both hands.
  2. Step 2: Place the center of the band under the arches of your feet and hold onto the ends of the band with your hands.
  3. Step 3: Keep your elbows close to your sides and your forearms parallel to the ground.
  4. Step 4: Slowly curl the band up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows in place and your wrists straight.
  5. Step 5: Hold the contraction for a second, then slowly lower the band back down to the starting position.
  6. Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Step 7: To increase the resistance, move your hands closer together on the band or use a thicker band.

name: band fixed back close grip pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach the exercise band to a secure anchor point above your head.
  2. Grasp the band with a close grip, with your palms facing towards each other.
  3. Stand facing the anchor point, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  5. Pull the band down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
  7. Slowly release the band back to the starting position, keeping tension on the band.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you pull the band down and exhaling as you release it back up.
  10. Vary the resistance of the band by adjusting the distance from the anchor point or using a different resistance band.
  11. Stretch your back and shoulders after the exercise to prevent soreness.

name: band fixed back underhand pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach the exercise band to a sturdy anchor point above your head.
  2. Grasp the exercise band with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
  3. Step back until the exercise band is stretched and your arms are fully extended.
  4. Engage your back muscles and pull the exercise band down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
  6. Slowly release the exercise band back to the starting position, keeping your arms fully extended.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band front lateral raise
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and placing the exercise band under your feet.
  2. Hold the handles of the exercise band with your palms facing your thighs.
  3. Slowly raise your arms out to the sides until they are at shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your arms back down to your thighs.
  5. Repeat for 10-12 reps, or as many as you feel comfortable with.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Variations: You can also do this exercise while seated or kneeling, or by using a resistance band with higher tension for a more challenging workout.

name: band front raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the exercise band under both feet.
  2. Hold the band in each hand with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
  3. Keep your arms straight and lift them up in front of you until they are parallel to the ground.
  4. Hold this position for a second or two, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and avoid arching your back during the exercise.
  7. For added resistance, you can use a heavier exercise band or step further away from the anchor point of the band.

name: band hip lift
instructions:
1. Place the exercise band around your thighs, just above your knees.
  2. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  3. Engage your core and glutes.
  4. Slowly lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
  5. Hold for a few seconds, then lower your hips back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 reps.

name: band horizontal pallof press
instructions:
1. Attach an exercise band to a sturdy anchor point at chest height.
  2. Stand perpendicular to the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the exercise band with both hands and extend arms straight out in front of the chest.
  4. Engage the core and maintain a stable stance.
  5. Slowly pull the band towards the chest, keeping the arms straight and parallel to the ground.
  6. Hold the position for 2-3 seconds, then slowly release back to starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps on one side, then switch sides.

name: band jack knife sit-up
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your legs straight and your arms extended above your head, holding the exercise band with both hands.
  2. Wrap the exercise band around the arches of your feet and hold onto the handles of the band with your hands.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your head, shoulders, and legs off the ground simultaneously, bringing your hands towards your feet.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your abs.
  5. Slowly lower your head, shoulders, and legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band kneeling one arm pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach the exercise band to a sturdy anchor point above your head.
  2. Kneel down on one knee facing the anchor point with the opposite foot flat on the ground.
  3. Grasp the exercise band with one hand and extend your arm upwards towards the anchor point.
  4. Slowly pull the band down towards your side, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment and then slowly release the band back up towards the anchor point.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch sides.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and maintain good posture throughout the exercise.

name: band kneeling twisting crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by kneeling on the floor with an exercise band looped around a sturdy anchor point behind you.
  2. Hold the ends of the band with both hands, bringing them to your chest.
  3. Engage your core muscles and slowly twist your torso to one side, bringing your elbow towards your opposite knee.
  4. Pause for a moment, feeling the contraction in your oblique muscles.
  5. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
  6. Complete 10-15 repetitions on each side, or as many as you can comfortably perform with good form.
  7. For an added challenge, increase the resistance of the exercise band or perform the exercise on an unstable surface, such as a balance board or exercise ball.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply throughout the exercise and maintain good posture to protect your back.
  9. Stretch your abs and obliques after completing the exercise to prevent muscle soreness and tightness.

name: band lying hip internal rotation
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place an exercise band around your thighs, just above your knees.
  3. Bring your feet together and keep your heels touching.
  4. Slowly rotate your knees outwards, keeping your feet together and your thighs parallel.
  5. Pause for a moment at the end of the movement, then slowly bring your knees back together.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your lower back pressed into the ground throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the tension of the exercise band as needed to increase or decrease the difficulty of the exercise.

name: band lying straight leg raise
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back on a yoga mat or a flat surface.
  2. Secure one end of the exercise band to a sturdy object, such as the leg of a table or a heavy piece of furniture.
  3. Loop the other end of the exercise band around the sole of your foot and hold onto the band with your hands.
  4. With your leg straight, slowly lift your foot towards the ceiling while keeping your core engaged and your lower back pressed into the mat.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with the other leg.
  7. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain good form throughout the exercise.

name: band one arm overhead biceps curl
instructions:
1. Step on the center of the exercise band with one foot and hold the other end of the band with the opposite hand.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Keep your arm straight down by your side with your palm facing forward.
  4. Slowly curl your arm up towards your shoulder, bending at the elbow and keeping your upper arm stationary.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep muscles.
  6. Slowly lower your arm back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  8. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the opposite arm.

name: band one arm single leg split squat
instructions:
1. Step 1: Secure the exercise band around a sturdy object at knee height.
  2. Step 2: Stand facing away from the anchor point and loop the exercise band around your left ankle.
  3. Step 3: Lift your right foot off the ground and extend your leg behind you.
  4. Step 4: Lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your left foot planted on the ground.
  5. Step 5: As you lower your body, extend your right leg behind you, keeping it in line with your torso.
  6. Step 6: Push through your left heel to return to the starting position.
  7. Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides.

name: band one arm standing low row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the anchor point of the exercise band.
  2. Hold the exercise band handle with one hand and step back to create tension in the band.
  3. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
  4. With your arm extended straight down, pull the exercise band handle towards your waist, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly release back to the starting position.
  6. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the tension of the exercise band as needed to increase or decrease the difficulty of the exercise.
  9. Stretch your arms and back after completing the exercise.

name: band one arm twisting chest press
instructions:
1. Secure one end of the exercise band to a stationary object, such as a door handle or sturdy pole.
  2. Stand facing away from the object and hold the other end of the band in your right hand, with your arm extended straight out in front of you.
  3. Step away from the object to create tension in the band.
  4. Slowly bring your right arm across your chest, twisting your torso to the left, until your hand is near your left shoulder.
  5. Pause briefly, then slowly release back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left arm and repeat the exercise.

name: band one arm twisting seated row
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Wrap the exercise band around the bottom of your feet and hold onto the handles with one hand.
  3. Extend your arm straight out in front of you, keeping your elbow slightly bent.
  4. Slowly pull the band towards your chest, twisting your torso to the side and keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause and hold for a few seconds, then slowly release the band back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: band pull through
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and placing an exercise band around your ankles.
  2. Take a step forward with your left foot and a step back with your right foot, keeping tension on the band.
  3. Shift your weight onto your left foot and hinge forward at the hips, reaching your right hand through your legs to grab the band.
  4. Pull the band through your legs with your right hand, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  5. Return to the starting position by standing up straight and bringing your right hand back to your side.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 10-12 reps on one side before switching to the other side.

name: band push sit-up
instructions:
1. Begin by securing an exercise band around a sturdy object, such as a pole or heavy piece of furniture.
  2. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  3. Hold the exercise band with both hands, keeping your arms straight and extended above your chest.
  4. Engage your core muscles and slowly sit up, pulling the exercise band towards your knees as you do so.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band reverse fly
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the exercise band under your feet, holding the handles with both hands.
  2. Keeping your arms straight, lift them up to shoulder height, with your palms facing down.
  3. Slowly pull the band apart, squeezing your shoulder blades together, and bringing your arms out to your sides.
  4. Pause for a moment and then slowly release the tension, bringing your arms back to the starting position with control.
  5. Repeat for 10-12 repetitions, or as many as you can do with proper form.
  6. Take a break and repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: band reverse wrist curl
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Place the exercise band under your feet and hold the other end with your palms facing down.
  3. Slowly curl your wrists upwards, keeping your palms facing down and your arms stationary.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly lower your wrists back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 repetitions, or until you feel fatigued.
  6. For an added challenge, you can use a heavier resistance band or increase the number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: band seated hip internal rotation
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Place an exercise band around both of your knees, just above your knees.
  3. Make sure your feet are hip-width apart and your toes are pointing forward.
  4. Engage your core and sit up tall with your shoulders relaxed.
  5. Slowly rotate your right knee inward, towards your left knee, while keeping your left knee stationary.
  6. Hold for a few seconds, then slowly return your right knee to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the movement on your left side, rotating your left knee inward towards your right knee.
  8. Continue alternating between your right and left sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. Remember to keep your movements slow and controlled, and to maintain good posture throughout the exercise.
  10. Once you have completed the desired number of repetitions, remove the exercise band from your knees and stretch your hips and legs as needed.

name: band seated twist
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a chair with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Place the exercise band around your midsection and hold onto both ends with your hands.
  3. Keeping your arms straight, twist your torso to the right as far as you can without moving your hips.
  4. Hold the position for 2-3 seconds, then slowly twist back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the twist to the left side, holding for 2-3 seconds before returning to the starting position.
  6. Continue alternating twists for a total of 10-12 repetitions on each side.

name: band shoulder press
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and placing the exercise band under your feet.
  2. Hold the exercise band handles with both hands and bring them up to shoulder level, keeping your elbows bent and your palms facing forward.
  3. Press the exercise band up overhead, extending your arms fully and keeping your core engaged.
  4. Slowly lower the exercise band back down to shoulder level, maintaining control and keeping your elbows bent.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to keep your shoulders relaxed.

name: band shrug
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and placing the exercise band under your feet, holding one end of the band in each hand.
  2. Make sure the band is taut and your arms are fully extended down by your sides.
  3. Next, raise your shoulders up towards your ears, contracting the trapezius muscles in your upper back.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat this movement for 10-15 reps, or as many as you can comfortably perform.
  6. Remember to keep your arms straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. For an added challenge, you can increase the resistance of the band by holding it closer to the ends, or by using a thicker band.
  8. Once you have completed your desired number of reps, release the band from your feet and stretch out your shoulders and upper back to cool down.

name: band side triceps extension
instructions:
1. Step 1: Securely anchor the exercise band to a stationary object, such as a door or post.
  2. Step 2: Grasp the handle of the exercise band with your right hand and stand with your left side facing the anchor point.
  3. Step 3: Extend your right arm straight out to the side, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Step 4: Slowly bend your elbow to lower the handle down towards your shoulder.
  5. Step 5: Pause for a moment, then slowly straighten your arm to return to the starting position.
  6. Step 6: Repeat the exercise for 10-12 repetitions on your right arm before switching to your left arm.

name: band single leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and placing the exercise band around the ball of your right foot.
  2. Hold the ends of the band in each hand and lift your left foot off the ground, balancing on your right foot.
  3. Slowly raise your right heel off the ground, keeping your toes on the floor.
  4. Hold for a few seconds at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your heel back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for 10-15 reps, then switch to your left foot and repeat the exercise.
  6. For an added challenge, you can increase the tension of the exercise band or hold a weight in your free hand.

name: band single leg reverse calf raise
instructions:
1. Attach one end of the exercise band to a sturdy anchor point such as a door knob or post.
  2. Loop the other end of the exercise band around the ball of your foot and hold onto the band with your hands for stability.
  3. Stand facing away from the anchor point with your feet hip-width apart.
  4. Shift your weight onto one foot and lift the other foot off the ground.
  5. Slowly lower your heel towards the ground, feeling the stretch in your calf muscle.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise your heel back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for 10-12 reps on one leg, then switch to the other leg.
  8. Perform 2-3 sets on each leg, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: band single leg split squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and placing the exercise band under the arch of your left foot.
  2. Hold the ends of the band with both hands and raise your left foot off the ground, extending your leg behind you.
  3. Lower your body into a split squat position by bending your right knee and lowering your left knee towards the ground.
  4. Make sure your right knee stays directly above your ankle and doesn't extend past your toes.
  5. As you lower your body, pull the exercise band towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Pause at the bottom of the squat and then push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
  7. Complete 10-12 reps on your right leg before switching to your left leg.

name: band squat
instructions:
1. Step 1: Secure the band. Loop the exercise band around a sturdy anchor point, such as a pole or door handle, at about waist height.
  2. Step 2: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the band behind you. Hold the band with both hands and bring it up to your shoulders, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
  3. Step 3: Engage your core and lower your body down into a squatting position. Keep your weight in your heels and your knees in line with your toes.
  4. Step 4: As you rise back up to a standing position, push against the resistance of the band to engage your glutes and hamstrings. Keep your arms bent and close to your body throughout the movement.
  5. Step 5: Repeat the squat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping the band taut throughout the exercise.

name: band squat row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing on the exercise band with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding the handles with an overhand grip.
  2. Hold your arms straight in front of you with the band taut.
  3. Squat down, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
  4. As you rise back up to standing, pull your elbows back, squeezing your shoulder blades together to perform a row.
  5. Lower your arms back down to the starting position and repeat for 10-12 reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
  7. For a more challenging workout, increase the resistance of the band or perform more reps.
  8. Remember to stretch before and after the exercise to prevent injury and improve flexibility.

name: band standing crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching one end of the exercise band to a sturdy object, such as a doorknob or post, at waist height.
  2. Stand facing the attachment point with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the other end of the exercise band with both hands and hold it at chest level, with your elbows bent and pointing outward.
  4. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button in towards your spine.
  5. Exhale and slowly crunch your upper body forward, bringing your elbows towards your knees. Keep your chin tucked in and your gaze forward.
  6. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, then inhale and slowly return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions, then switch sides and attach the exercise band to the opposite side to work the other side of your body.

name: band standing rear delt row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and placing the exercise band under your feet.
  2. Hold the handles of the band with your palms facing each other and your arms extended in front of you.
  3. Keeping your elbows close to your body, pull the band towards your chest by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and then slowly return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. You can vary the resistance of the band by adjusting your grip or using a different band with a different level of resistance.

name: band standing twisting crunch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the exercise band under your feet.
  2. Hold the exercise band with both hands at chest level, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
  3. Engage your core and twist your torso to the right, keeping your hips facing forward.
  4. As you twist, bring your left elbow towards your right knee, squeezing your obliques.
  5. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side, twisting to the left and bringing your right elbow towards your left knee.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and avoid leaning forward or backwards as you twist.
  8. You can increase the difficulty of this exercise by using a heavier resistance band or by adding a pulse at the end of each twist.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you twist and exhaling as you return to the starting position.

name: band step-up
instructions:
1. Place the exercise band around your ankles and stand facing a sturdy step or bench.
  2. Step up onto the bench with your right foot, making sure to keep your left foot on the ground.
  3. As you step up, lift your left leg behind you, keeping it straight and in line with your body.
  4. Lower your left leg back down to the ground and step back down with your right foot.
  5. Repeat the exercise for 10-12 repetitions on your right leg before switching to your left leg.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. For an added challenge, hold dumbbells in each hand or increase the resistance of the exercise band.

name: band stiff leg deadlift
instructions:
1. Step 1: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart on top of the exercise band. Hold the band with both hands in front of your body, keeping your arms straight.
  2. Step 2: Hinge at the hips and slowly lower your torso towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged. As you lower your torso, allow the exercise band to stretch and pull against your hands.
  3. Step 3: Continue lowering your torso until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Make sure to keep your knees slightly bent throughout the movement to avoid locking them out.
  4. Step 4: Hold the stretch for 1-2 seconds, then slowly raise your torso back up to the starting position, using your hamstrings and glutes to power the movement.
  5. Step 5: Repeat for 10-12 reps, then switch to the other side of the exercise band and repeat the exercise.
  6. Step 6: To increase the difficulty of the exercise, you can use a heavier exercise band or hold weights in your hands while performing the movement.
  7. Step 7: Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower your torso and exhaling as you raise it back up.
  8. Step 8: Always consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise program, especially if you have a history of back or knee injuries.

name: band straight back stiff leg deadlift
instructions:
1. Place the exercise band under both feet and stand with feet hip-width apart.
  2. Grasp the band with both hands, palms facing towards you.
  3. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you hinge forward at the hips, lifting one leg straight behind you.
  4. Lower the band towards the ground, keeping your standing leg slightly bent and your back straight.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat on the other side.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: band straight leg deadlift
instructions:
1. Start by placing the exercise band under both feet and standing with your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Hold the ends of the band with both hands, palms facing towards your body.
  3. Engage your core muscles and keep your back straight as you hinge forward at your hips, lowering your upper body towards the ground.
  4. As you lower your upper body, lift your right leg straight behind you, keeping it in line with your torso.
  5. Lower your right leg back down to the ground as you lift your upper body back up to standing position.
  6. Repeat the exercise with your left leg.
  7. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band twisting overhead press
instructions:
1. Begin by standing on the exercise band with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hold onto the handles of the exercise band with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Bring the exercise band up to shoulder height, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  4. Twist your torso to the right, keeping your arms in the same position.
  5. Press the exercise band overhead, extending your arms fully and keeping your palms facing forward.
  6. Lower the exercise band back down to shoulder height, while twisting your torso back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise, this time twisting your torso to the left before pressing the exercise band overhead.
  8. Complete 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each side.

name: band two legs calf raise - (band under both legs) v. 2
instructions:
1. Place the exercise band under both legs, just above the ankles.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
  3. Raise your heels off the ground as high as you can, keeping your toes on the ground.
  4. Hold the raised position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your heels back to the ground.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. For added resistance, use a thicker exercise band or increase the tension of the band by pulling it tighter.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Perform this exercise regularly to strengthen and tone your calf muscles.

name: band underhand pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach the exercise band to a sturdy anchor point above your head.
  2. Grasp the handles of the exercise band with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
  3. Stand facing the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  4. Engage your core and keep your chest lifted throughout the exercise.
  5. Slowly pull the handles down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Pause for a moment when the handles are at chest level.
  7. Slowly release the tension in the exercise band and return to the starting position with your arms fully extended overhead.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band v-up
instructions:
1. Begin by laying down flat on your back with your legs straight and your arms extended above your head, holding the exercise band with both hands.
  2. Wrap the exercise band around the arches of your feet and hold the ends of the band with your hands.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your legs off the ground, simultaneously lifting your upper body off the ground to meet your legs.
  4. Keep your arms extended and reach towards your feet with the exercise band, keeping your legs straight and together.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds before slowly lowering your legs and upper body back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps or time.

name: band vertical pallof press
instructions:
1. Start by attaching an exercise band to a sturdy anchor point at chest height.
  2. Stand with your side facing the anchor point and grab the band with both hands, holding it at chest height.
  3. Step away from the anchor point until there is tension in the band.
  4. Engage your core and press the band out in front of you, keeping your arms straight and parallel to the floor.
  5. Hold the band out in front of you for a few seconds, making sure to keep your core engaged and your body stable.
  6. Slowly return the band back to your chest, resisting the pull of the band as you do so.
  7. Repeat for several reps before switching sides and performing the exercise again.

name: band wrist curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Wrap the exercise band around your hand and hold it securely.
  3. Extend your arm straight out in front of you, keeping your elbow close to your side.
  4. Curl your wrist upward, pulling the exercise band towards your forearm.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly release back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions, then switch to the other hand.
  7. For a more challenging workout, use a heavier resistance band or increase the number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  9. Finish by stretching your wrists and forearms to prevent injury and promote flexibility.

name: band y-raise
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and placing the exercise band under the arches of your feet.
  2. Grasp the ends of the band with your palms facing inward and your arms straight down at your sides.
  3. Slowly raise your arms out to the sides, forming a "Y" shape with your body.
  4. Keep your arms straight as you raise them, and focus on using your shoulder muscles to lift the band.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then lower your arms back down to your sides.
  6. Repeat for 10-12 repetitions, then rest for 30 seconds before completing another set.
  7. As you become stronger, you can increase the resistance of the band by using a thicker band or by standing farther away from the anchor point.

name: barbell alternate biceps curl
instructions:
1. Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing upwards, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Keep your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary.
  4. Slowly curl the barbell up towards your shoulder, exhaling as you lift.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, inhaling as you release.
  7. Repeat the movement with your other arm, alternating between left and right.
  8. Perform 2-3 sets of 8-12 repetitions, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  9. Gradually increase the weight of the barbell as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  10. Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise to avoid injury and maximize results.

name: barbell bench front squat
instructions:
1. Start by setting up a barbell bench in a squat rack.
  2. Load the bar with an appropriate weight, making sure it is evenly distributed on both sides.
  3. Stand in front of the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes pointing slightly outward.
  4. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Lift the bar off the rack and step back, ensuring your feet are firmly planted on the ground.
  6. Squat down, keeping your back straight and your chest up, until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  7. Pause for a moment, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the squat rack.
  10. Stretch your legs and hips to cool down and prevent injury.

name: barbell bench press
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet on the ground and your eyes under the bar.
  2. Place your hands on the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and grip the bar tightly.
  3. Lift the bar off the rack and hold it above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  4. Lower the bar down to your chest in a controlled manner while keeping your elbows tucked in.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement before pushing the bar back up to the starting position.
  6. Make sure to exhale as you push the bar up and inhale as you lower it down.
  7. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of reps and sets.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the rack.

name: barbell bench squat
instructions:
1. Start by setting up the barbell on the bench press rack at a height where you can comfortably unrack it while standing up.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and position yourself underneath the barbell.
  3. Place your hands on the barbell, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your palms facing away from you.
  4. Unrack the barbell by lifting it off the rack with your arms fully extended and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  5. Step back from the rack and position your feet shoulder-width apart with your toes pointing slightly outward.
  6. Slowly lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  7. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly lower.
  8. Pause for a moment, then push through your heels and stand back up to the starting position.
  9. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  10. Rack the barbell back on the bench press rack once you have completed your set.

name: barbell bent arm pullover
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with your head at one end and your feet on the floor.
  2. Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart, and hold it straight up over your chest with your arms fully extended.
  3. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  4. When the barbell is just above your head, pause for a moment, then slowly lift it back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to perform the exercise with proper form.
  8. Exhale as you lift the barbell back up and inhale as you lower it behind your head.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting any exercise and consult with a trainer or doctor if you have any concerns or injuries.

name: barbell bent over row
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grab the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  4. Lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping your arms straight.
  5. Once the barbell is just above the ground, pull it up towards your chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down towards the ground.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe in as you lower the barbell and out as you pull it up towards your chest.

name: barbell biceps curl (with arm blaster)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and keep your back straight.
  2. Hold the barbell with an underhand grip at shoulder-width distance.
  3. Place the arm blaster around your upper arms, just above your elbows.
  4. Slowly curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows locked in place by the arm blaster.
  5. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows locked in place by the arm blaster.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell clean and press
instructions:
1. Start with the barbell on the ground in front of you, with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Bend down and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Stand up, keeping your back straight and your arms extended.
  4. As you stand up, use your legs and hips to lift the barbell up to your shoulders, bringing your elbows forward and under the bar.
  5. Once the barbell is on your shoulders, take a deep breath and brace your core.
  6. Press the barbell overhead, extending your arms fully and locking out your elbows at the top.
  7. Lower the barbell back down to your shoulders, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  8. From the shoulders, lower the barbell back down to the ground, bending your knees and keeping your back straight as you lower it to the ground.
  9. Repeat steps 2-8 for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell clean-grip front squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outwards.
