  2. Place the barbell on the front of your shoulders, with your elbows pointing forward and your hands gripping the barbell just outside of your shoulders.
  3. Engage your core and keep your chest up as you lower yourself into a squat position, bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
  4. Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then push up through your heels to return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the barbell as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. Consult a fitness professional if you are unsure about proper form or have any concerns about your ability to perform this exercise safely and effectively.

name: barbell close-grip bench press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on a flat bench with your feet flat on the ground and your eyes under the bar.
  2. Grasp the bar with a close grip (hands shoulder-width apart or closer) and lift it off the rack.
  3. Lower the bar straight down in a controlled manner until it touches your chest.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, and then push the bar back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the rack.

name: barbell curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grab the barbell with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hold the barbell at arm's length in front of your thighs with your palms facing up.
  3. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, exhale and curl the barbell up towards your chest, contracting your biceps. Your elbows should not move forward or backward during the curl.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the curl, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  5. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: barbell deadlift
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the barbell on the floor in front of you.
  2. Bend down and grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Engage your core and lift the bar off the ground, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. As you lift the bar, focus on driving your hips forward and squeezing your glutes.
  5. Once you are standing upright with the barbell, pause for a moment and then slowly lower it back down to the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell decline bench press
instructions:
1. Set up the decline bench at a 30 to 45-degree angle.
  2. Lie down on the bench with your feet secured firmly at the end of the bench.
  3. Grab the barbell with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  5. Slowly lower the barbell down towards your chest while inhaling.
  6. Pause for a second when the barbell is just above your chest.
  7. Push the barbell back up to the starting position while exhaling.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. When you are finished, carefully rack the barbell back onto the rack.
  10. Stretch your chest and shoulders to help prevent soreness and injury.

name: barbell decline bent arm pullover
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a decline bench with your head at the lower end of the bench and your feet secured at the upper end.
  2. Grasp the barbell with both hands, keeping your palms facing upward and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Extend your arms above your chest, keeping them straight but not locked out.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight and your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the barbell back to the starting position above your chest.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back firmly pressed against the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully rack the barbell and sit up slowly.
  9. Stretch your chest and shoulders gently to cool down and prevent injury.

name: barbell decline close grip to skull press
instructions:
1. Start by lying on a decline bench with your head lower than your feet.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a close grip, with your palms facing each other and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold the barbell with your arms extended above your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows in and your upper arms stationary.
  5. Pause for a moment, then push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.

name: barbell decline pullover
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a decline bench with your head at the lower end and your feet securely anchored at the upper end.
  2. Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold the barbell straight above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the barbell back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise.
  10. Once finished, carefully rack the barbell and sit up slowly.

name: barbell decline wide-grip press
instructions:
1. Set up a decline bench at a 45-degree angle, and place the barbell on the rack at the head of the bench.
  2. Lie down on the bench with your feet secured at the bottom and your head towards the floor.
  3. Grasp the barbell with a wide grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows out to the sides.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your core engaged and maintaining a steady breathing pattern.
  7. When you have finished your set, carefully rack the barbell and sit up slowly.

name: barbell decline wide-grip pullover
instructions:
1. Begin by lying down on a decline bench with your feet securely locked in the footrests. Your head should be at the lower end of the bench.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a wide grip, with your palms facing away from you. Your hands should be shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold the barbell above your chest with your arms fully extended. This is your starting position.
  4. Inhale and slowly lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight. You should feel a stretch in your chest and lats.
  5. Exhale and slowly raise the barbell back to the starting position, keeping your arms straight.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
  7. After you have finished your set, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell drag curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
  2. Keep your elbows close to your body and lift the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  3. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell floor calf raise
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a barbell on the floor in front of you.
  2. Stand with your toes on the edge of the barbell, with your heels hanging off the back.
  3. Place your hands on a wall or sturdy object for balance.
  4. Raise your heels as high as possible, contracting your calf muscles.
  5. Lower your heels back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Variation: To increase the difficulty, you can hold a weight plate or dumbbell on top of your thighs while performing the exercise.

name: barbell front chest squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward, with the barbell resting on the front of your shoulders.
  2. Grab the barbell with both hands, palms facing up, and lift it off the rack.
  3. Bend your knees and lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
  4. Keep your back straight and your chest up throughout the movement.
  5. Push through your heels and stand back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, carefully lower the barbell back onto the rack.

name: barbell front raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with a slight bend in your knees.
  2. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing down.
  3. Bring the barbell up to shoulder height, keeping your arms straight and your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell back down to starting position.
  5. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to ensure proper form and to challenge yourself.
  8. As you progress, you can also try variations such as alternating arms or using dumbbells instead of a barbell.

name: barbell front raise and pullover
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bring the barbell up to shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Slowly raise the barbell straight up in front of you until your arms are fully extended.
  5. Hold for a second, then slowly lower the barbell back down to shoulder height.
  6. Next, lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  7. Slowly raise the barbell back up to shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  8. Hold for a second, then slowly lower the barbell back down behind your head.
  9. Repeat this exercise for 10-12 reps, then rest for 30 seconds before completing another set.
  10. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, and only use a weight that you can comfortably lift.

name: barbell front squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Place the barbell on your shoulders, with your hands gripping the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Engage your core and keep your chest up as you begin to lower your body into a squat position.
  4. Bend at the knees and hips, keeping your weight in your heels and your knees in line with your toes.
  5. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, then exhale and push through your heels to return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell full squat
instructions:
1. Start by placing the barbell on a squat rack at about chest height.
  2. Stand facing the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  3. Step under the barbell and position it across the back of your shoulders, resting on your traps.
  4. Grip the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Take a deep breath and brace your core.
  6. Bend your knees and lower your hips down and back as if you were sitting into a chair.
  7. Keep your chest up and your back straight as you descend, and make sure your knees stay in line with your toes.
  8. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground or lower.
  9. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, then exhale and push through your heels to stand back up.
  10. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell full squat (back pov)
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the barbell resting on your upper back. Your hands should be gripping the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Take a deep breath and brace your core.
  3. Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping your chest up and your back straight. Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, then exhale and push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your knees in line with your toes and to avoid letting your knees cave inward.
  7. As you progress, you may want to increase the weight of the barbell or the number of repetitions in each set.
  8. Always use proper form and technique to avoid injury.

name: barbell full squat (side pov)
instructions:
1. Begin by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes slightly pointed outwards.
  2. Place the barbell on your upper back, resting it on your trapezius muscles, and grip the bar with both hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Inhale deeply and brace your core muscles.
  4. Bend your knees and lower your body downwards, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  5. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can go without compromising your form.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat and then exhale as you push back up through your heels to return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When you have completed your set, carefully rack the barbell back onto the squat rack.

name: barbell full zercher squat
instructions:
1. Begin by placing the barbell on the ground and loading it with your desired weight.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward, and position the barbell in front of your shins.
  3. Squat down and grab the barbell with both hands, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  4. Lift the barbell by driving through your heels and straightening your legs, bringing the barbell up to your thighs.
  5. From here, position the barbell in the crook of your elbows, with your forearms supporting the weight.
  6. Stand up straight, keeping your core engaged and your chest lifted.
  7. Take a deep breath in and lower your body down into a squat, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body and your chest lifted.
  8. Lower your body down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  9. Drive through your heels and lift your body back up to the starting position.
  10. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell glute bridge
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on a flat bench or on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place a barbell across your hips and hold it firmly with both hands, keeping your palms facing down.
  3. Engage your glutes and core muscles as you lift your hips off the ground, pushing the barbell up towards the ceiling.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your glutes as hard as you can.
  5. Slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position, keeping your core engaged and your glutes activated throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell glute bridge two legs on bench (male)
instructions:
1. Place a bench parallel to a barbell rack and adjust it to a height that allows you to reach the barbell comfortably.
  2. Load the barbell with an appropriate weight and place it on the rack.
  3. Lie down on your back on the bench with your knees bent and your feet flat on the bench.
  4. Position yourself so that your shoulder blades are resting on the bench and your hips are just off the edge of the bench.
  5. Reach up and grip the barbell with both hands, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
  6. Engage your glutes and core muscles and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, keeping your feet firmly planted on the bench.
  7. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then carefully lower the barbell back onto the rack.
  9. Rest for a few moments, then repeat for additional sets as desired.

name: barbell good morning
instructions:
1. Start by placing a barbell on the back of your shoulders, just below the base of your neck. Your feet should be shoulder-width apart.
  2. With your back straight, slowly bend forward at the hips, keeping your knees slightly bent and your core engaged.
  3. Lower your torso until it is parallel to the floor, or until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
  4. Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position by using your glutes and hamstrings to lift your torso back up.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise to avoid injury.
  7. If you are new to this exercise, start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the movement.
  8. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or medical professional before starting if you have any concerns or medical conditions.

name: barbell guillotine bench press
instructions:
1. Set up the bench press station by adjusting the barbell to a height that is just above your head when you are lying down on the bench.
  2. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back flat against the bench.
  3. Grasp the barbell with both hands, using a wide grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it directly above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  5. Slowly lower the barbell down towards your neck, keeping your elbows pointed outwards and your wrists straight.
  6. Stop when the barbell is just above your neck, with your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
  7. Pause for a moment, then push the barbell back up to the starting position, using your chest muscles to lift the weight.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When you have finished your set, carefully rack the barbell back onto the rack.

name: barbell hack squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Place the barbell behind your legs, resting it on the back of your thighs.
  3. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lower your body by bending at your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  5. Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  6. Push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell high bar squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell resting on the squat rack at shoulder height.
  2. Position yourself under the bar so that it rests on your upper traps and shoulders.
  3. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Step back from the rack and position your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outward.
  5. Take a deep breath and brace your core, then begin to lower your body by bending at the hips and knees.
  6. Keep your chest up and your back straight as you descend, lowering your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  7. Drive through your heels to stand back up, exhaling as you do so.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. When finished, carefully rack the bar back on the squat rack.

name: barbell incline bench press
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on the incline bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Grab the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in and your wrists straight.
  4. Pause when the barbell is just above your chest, and then push it back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Remember to breathe in as you lower the barbell and breathe out as you push it back up.
  7. Make sure to keep your back flat against the bench and your feet firmly planted on the ground throughout the exercise.
  8. Start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the exercise.
  9. Always have a spotter present to assist you with the weight if needed.

name: barbell incline close grip bench press
instructions:
1. Set up a bench at a 30-45 degree incline.
  2. Load the desired weight onto the barbell and secure it with collars.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back and head firmly pressed against the bench.
  4. Grip the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing each other.
  5. Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause briefly when the barbell touches your chest, then push it back up to the starting position, exhaling as you lift.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, rack the barbell and sit up slowly.

name: barbell incline reverse-grip press
instructions:
1. Start by lying on an incline bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a reverse grip, with your palms facing towards your face and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your chest.
  6. Press the barbell back up to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell incline row
instructions:
1. Start by setting up the barbell on an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
  2. Stand facing the bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your head up, and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip.
  4. With your arms fully extended, pull the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Hold the contraction for a second, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
  8. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself and avoid injury.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting your workout and cool down afterwards to prevent injury and promote recovery.

name: barbell incline shoulder raise
instructions:
1. Start by setting up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle and placing a barbell on the ground in front of it.
  2. Stand facing the bench and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. With your feet shoulder-width apart and your core engaged, lift the barbell up to your chest, keeping your elbows bent.
  4. Slowly raise the barbell up and over your head, straightening your arms as you go. Keep your elbows slightly bent to avoid locking them out.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to your chest.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the ground and repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell jefferson squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell placed between your legs.
  2. Place one foot in front of the other, so that the toes of one foot are touching the heel of the other foot.
  3. Reach down and grab the barbell with both hands, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. Slowly lift the barbell off the ground, straightening your legs as you do so.
  5. As you lift the barbell, twist your torso slightly so that your shoulders are facing the foot that is in front.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the ground, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps, then switch the position of your feet and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: barbell jm bench press
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your eyes directly under the barbell.
  2. Take a grip on the bar that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your palms facing away from your body.
  3. Unrack the barbell and slowly lower it down towards your chest while keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  4. Pause at the bottom of the movement, making sure the barbell is touching your chest.
  5. Push the barbell back up towards the starting position, exhaling as you lift.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the barbell back onto its supports.

name: barbell jump squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell resting on your upper back, just below your neck.
  2. Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
  3. Once you are in the squat position, explosively jump up into the air while keeping the barbell on your upper back.
  4. Land softly on the ground and immediately lower yourself back into the squat position.
  5. Repeat the jump squat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Use a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and always warm up properly before starting any exercise.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to rest as needed.
  9. Finish the exercise by carefully placing the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell lateral lunge
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointed forward.
  2. Hold a barbell with both hands, resting it on the back of your shoulders.
  3. Take a large step to the right with your right foot, keeping your left foot in place.
  4. Bend your right knee and lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the floor.
  5. Keep your left leg straight and your left foot flat on the ground.
  6. Push off with your right foot and return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise on the left side, taking a large step to the left with your left foot.
  8. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each side.

name: barbell low bar squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and position the barbell on your shoulders, with your hands gripping the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Step back from the rack and position your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outward.
  3. Engage your core and keep your chest up as you begin to lower your body down into a squat, bending at your knees and hips.
  4. Lower your body down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  5. Push through your heels and lift your body back up to the starting position, straightening your legs and hips.
  6. Repeat the squat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell lunge
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Hold the barbell with both hands, palms facing down, and place it across the back of your shoulders.
  3. Take a step forward with your right foot, bending your knee and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
  4. Make sure your left knee is hovering just above the ground, but not touching it.
  5. Push through your right heel and return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat on the other side, taking a step forward with your left foot and bending your left knee.
  7. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  10. Stretch your legs after completing the exercise to prevent injury and aid in recovery.

name: barbell lying back of the head tricep extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your head resting on the bench.
  2. Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip and extend your arms straight up over your chest.
  3. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your elbows close to your head and your upper arms stationary.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the barbell back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  8. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or medical professional before beginning if you have any concerns or pre-existing conditions.

name: barbell lying close-grip press
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly on the ground.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a close grip, with your hands no more than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it over your chest with your arms extended.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause when the barbell is just above your chest, then push the barbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the barbell back onto the rack.

name: barbell lying close-grip triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your head resting comfortably on the bench.
  2. Grasp a barbell with a close grip, with your palms facing inward and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows close to your head and your upper arms stationary.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  5. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions, taking care to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  6. Once you have completed your set, carefully lower the barbell back down to the starting position and release your grip.
  7. Take a brief rest, then repeat the exercise for additional sets as desired.

name: barbell lying extension
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a bench or exercise mat with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent.
  2. Hold the barbell with both hands, palms facing up and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbows locked and your shoulders relaxed.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell towards your head, bending your elbows and keeping them close to your head.
  5. Stop when the barbell is a few inches above your forehead, then slowly raise it back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself while maintaining proper form.
  9. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or medical professional before beginning if you have any concerns or health issues.

name: barbell lying lifting (on hip)
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with both hands, using an overhand grip, and hold it with your arms extended straight up over your chest.
  3. Lower the barbell slowly and under control to your hips, keeping your arms straight and your elbows locked.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then lift the barbell back up to the starting position by pushing through your hips and glutes.
  5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the weight or reps to continue to challenge yourself.

name: barbell lying preacher curl
instructions:
1. Start by laying flat on a preacher bench with your chest firmly pressed against the padding and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Grab the barbell with an underhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Slowly lift the barbell towards your chest while keeping your elbows stationary and your upper arms firmly pressed against the padding.
  4. Hold the contraction for a few seconds before slowly lowering the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your upper arms and elbows stationary throughout the entire exercise to isolate the biceps.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling on the way up and exhaling on the way down.
  9. Finish by carefully placing the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell lying triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your head at the edge of the bench.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, placing your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Extend your arms straight up, directly above your chest.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows stationary and close to your head.
  5. Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your forehead.
  6. Slowly lift the barbell back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.
  9. Stretch your triceps by bringing one arm across your chest and gently pulling it towards your body, holding for 10-15 seconds before switching arms.

name: barbell lying triceps extension skull crusher
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet planted firmly on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
  2. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart, and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows stationary and close to your head.
  4. Pause when the barbell is just above your forehead, then slowly lift it back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back pressed firmly against the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the barbell as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  8. As with any exercise, start with a lower weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable and confident with the movement.

name: barbell narrow stance squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing straight ahead.
  2. Place the barbell on your upper back, resting it on your traps and shoulders.
  3. Take a deep breath and brace your core.
  4. Slowly lower yourself into a squat, keeping your chest up and your back straight.
  5. As you lower, bring your feet closer together, so they are only a few inches apart. This is the narrow stance.
  6. Lower your hips until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  7. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat.
  8. Push through your heels and stand back up, exhaling as you do so.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  10. When finished, carefully rack the barbell and stretch your legs and hips.

name: barbell one arm bent over row
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in one hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  3. Bring the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  4. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and avoid using momentum to lift the weight.
  7. Choose a weight that is challenging but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Perform 2-3 sets of 8-12 repetitions on each arm, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  9. As you progress, you can increase the weight or the number of repetitions to continue challenging your muscles.

name: barbell one arm floor press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Grasp the barbell with one hand, using an overhand grip, and hold it above your chest with your arm fully extended.
  3. Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Pause when the barbell is just above your chest, then press it back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat the exercise with your other arm.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the ground throughout the exercise.
  7. Be sure to use a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and ability.
  8. Always warm up properly before beginning any exercise routine, and consult with a certified personal trainer or healthcare professional if you have any concerns about your ability to perform this exercise safely.

name: barbell one arm side deadlift
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell on the ground to your side.
  2. Place your hand on the barbell with an overhand grip and keep your arm straight.
  3. Bend your knees slightly and hinge at your hips, lowering your torso towards the ground.
  4. As you lower your torso, lift the barbell off the ground with your arm, keeping it close to your body.
  5. Continue lowering your torso until you feel a stretch in your hamstring and glutes.
  6. Hold the position for a few seconds before slowly standing back up, keeping your arm straight and the barbell close to your body.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides.

name: barbell one arm snatch
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell on the ground in front of you.
  2. With one hand, grip the barbell with an overhand grip and lift it off the ground, bringing it to hip level.
  3. As you lift the bar, simultaneously bend your knees and hips, lowering your body into a quarter squat position.
  4. With explosive power, extend your hips and knees, driving the barbell upwards in a straight line.
  5. As the barbell reaches its highest point, quickly drop under it, rotating your elbow under the bar to catch it in a locked-out overhead position.
  6. Stand up fully, with the barbell overhead and your arm extended straight.
  7. Lower the barbell back down to the ground, with control.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat the exercise with the other hand.

name: barbell one leg squat
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a barbell on your shoulders, behind your neck, and positioning your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lift one leg off the ground and extend it forward, keeping it parallel to the ground.
  3. Slowly lower your body by bending your supporting leg, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. Lower your body until your thigh is parallel to the ground, or as low as you can go while maintaining proper form.
  5. Pause for a moment, then push through your heel to return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: barbell overhead squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointed slightly outward.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a wide grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell overhead, keeping your arms straight and elbows locked out.
  4. Bend your knees and lower your hips into a squat position, keeping your back straight and chest up.
  5. Lower down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  6. Push through your heels and stand back up, keeping the barbell overhead the entire time.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, lower the barbell back down to the starting position.

name: barbell palms down wrist curl over a bench
instructions:
1. Start by placing a bench in front of you and placing a barbell on the bench.
  2. Sit on the bench and place your forearms on the bench with your palms facing down and your wrists hanging off the edge.
  3. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Slowly lift the barbell by flexing your wrists, keeping your forearms flat on the bench. Make sure to keep your elbows stationary and your wrists straight.
  5. Hold the barbell at the top of the movement for a couple of seconds and then slowly lower it back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your movements slow and controlled, focusing on using your wrist muscles to lift the weight.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the barbell back on the bench.
  9. Stretch your wrists and forearms after the exercise to prevent injury.

name: barbell palms up wrist curl over a bench
instructions:
1. Place a bench in front of a barbell loaded with an appropriate weight.
  2. Sit on the bench and place your forearms on it, palms facing up.
  3. Grasp the barbell with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lift the barbell by flexing your wrists, keeping your forearms still.
  5. Hold for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell pendlay row
instructions:
1. Load the barbell with an appropriate weight and place it on the floor in front of you.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward, and your shins touching the barbell.
  3. Bend your knees and hinge at your hips to reach down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core, straighten your back, and lift the barbell off the ground, keeping it close to your shins.
  5. With your elbows close to your body, pull the barbell up towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the floor, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, gently place the barbell back on the floor.

name: barbell pin presses
instructions:
1. Set up a barbell on a squat rack with the desired weight.
  2. Adjust the height of the barbell so that it is at chest level when you are seated on a bench.
  3. Sit on the bench and position yourself under the barbell.
  4. Grasp the barbell with a shoulder-width grip and lift it off the rack.
  5. Lower the barbell towards your chest until it touches the safety pins.
  6. Pause for a moment and then push the barbell back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell preacher curl
instructions:
1. Start by adjusting the preacher bench to your desired height and position the barbell on the rack at the bottom of the bench.
  2. Stand facing the preacher bench and place your upper arms on the bench pad, with your chest against the pad.
  3. Grasp the barbell with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Slowly lift the barbell towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary and close to the bench pad.
  5. Contract your biceps at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack and step away from the bench.

name: barbell press sit-up
instructions:
1. Step 1: Lie down on a flat bench with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Step 2: Grasp a barbell with both hands using an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step 3: Hold the barbell above your chest with your arms extended.
  4. Step 4: Inhale and slowly lower your torso towards the bench, keeping your feet flat on the floor.
  5. Step 5: As you lower your torso, bend your elbows and bring the barbell towards your chest.
  6. Step 6: Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then exhale and use your abs to lift your torso back up to the starting position.
  7. Step 7: At the top of the movement, extend your arms and press the barbell back up towards the ceiling.
  8. Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell prone incline curl
instructions:
1. Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
  2. Load the barbell with an appropriate weight.
  3. Lie face down on the incline bench with your chest against the pad and your arms hanging straight down, holding the barbell with an underhand grip.
  4. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, exhaling as you lift.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, inhaling as you lower.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the barbell and sit up slowly.

name: barbell pullover
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly on the ground and your head hanging off the end of the bench.
  2. Grasp the barbell with both hands, using an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Extend your arms above your chest, keeping them straight.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight and your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Once the barbell is behind your head, pause for a moment, and then slowly raise it back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.

name: barbell pullover to press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with your feet placed firmly on the ground.
  2. Hold the barbell with both hands and extend your arms straight up over your chest.
  3. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head while keeping your arms straight.
  4. Once the barbell has reached a comfortable position behind your head, slowly bring it back up to the starting position.
  5. As you bring the barbell up, press it up towards the ceiling until your arms are fully extended.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position and repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Make sure to use a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and ability.
  9. Consult with a certified personal trainer or fitness professional if you are unsure about proper form or technique.

name: barbell rack pull
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the barbell rack.
  2. Position the barbell at mid-thigh height on the rack.
  3. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and lift the barbell off the rack, pulling it towards your body until it is at hip height.
  5. Hold the position for a moment, squeezing your glutes and shoulder blades together.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the rack, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell rear delt raise
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, making sure your hands are slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bring the barbell up to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Slowly lift the barbell up and away from your body, keeping your arms straight.
  5. Continue lifting the barbell until your arms are parallel to the ground and your shoulder blades are squeezed together.
  6. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell rear delt row
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  4. Bring the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Vary the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself and progress over time.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting any exercise and to consult with a trainer or doctor if you have any concerns or injuries.

name: barbell rear lunge
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and your hands holding the barbell at shoulder height.
  2. Take a big step back with one foot, keeping your torso upright and your core engaged.
  3. Lower your back knee towards the ground, making sure your front knee stays directly over your ankle.
  4. Pause at the bottom of the lunge, then push through your front heel to return to standing.
  5. Repeat on the other side, stepping back with your opposite foot.
  6. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each side, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: barbell rear lunge v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your barbell resting on your shoulders behind your neck.
  2. Take a step back with your right foot and lower your body until your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. Your right knee should be hovering just above the ground.
  3. Push through your left heel to return to the starting position.
  4. Repeat on the other side, stepping back with your left foot and lowering your body until your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each leg, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  6. Make sure to keep your chest up, your core engaged, and your knees in line with your toes throughout the exercise.

name: barbell revers wrist curl v. 2
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing down.
  3. Slowly raise the barbell by curling your wrists towards your body, keeping your elbows stationary at your sides.
  4. Hold the barbell at the top of the movement for a second before slowly lowering it back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  6. For variation, you can also perform this exercise with a reverse grip, holding the barbell with an underhand grip and curling your wrists up and towards your body.

name: barbell reverse close-grip bench press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a reverse grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing towards your face.
  3. Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it directly above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your chest.
  6. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  7. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell reverse curl
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
  2. Hold the barbell in front of your thighs, with your arms fully extended.
  3. Slowly curl the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Hold the barbell at the top of the movement for a moment, then slowly lower it back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  8. Remember to breathe regularly throughout the exercise.
  9. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.

name: barbell reverse grip bent over row
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Place the barbell on the floor in front of you and grip it with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your head up, until your torso is parallel to the floor.
  4. Engage your core and pull the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower the barbell and exhaling as you pull it up.
  8. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the weight of the barbell to continue challenging your muscles.
  9. Always use proper form and technique to avoid injury.
  10. If you experience any pain or discomfort during the exercise, stop immediately and consult a medical professional.

name: barbell reverse grip decline bench press
instructions:
1. Set up the decline bench at a 30-45 degree angle.
  2. Load the barbell with an appropriate weight and place it on the rack.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet secured under the footpads.
  4. Grab the barbell with a reverse grip (palms facing towards you) with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  5. Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement before pushing the barbell back up to starting position.
  7. Complete the desired number of repetitions, ensuring proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Rack the barbell and sit up to exit the bench.

name: barbell reverse grip incline bench press
instructions:
1. Begin by setting up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle and placing a barbell on the rack at a weight that is comfortable for you to lift.
  2. Position yourself on the bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back pressed firmly against the bench.
  3. Reach up and grip the barbell with your palms facing towards your body, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your chest, then push it back up to the starting position, keeping your arms straight but not locked.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back pressed firmly against the bench and your feet flat on the floor throughout the exercise.
  7. When you have finished your set, carefully rack the barbell back on the rack and sit up slowly.

name: barbell reverse grip incline bench row
instructions:
1. Position the barbell on the incline bench, with the weights on the ground and the bar resting on the edge of the bench.
  2. Stand facing the bench and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lean forward and place your chest on the bench, with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  4. Keep your back straight and engage your core muscles.
  5. Pull the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the ground.

name: barbell reverse grip skullcrusher
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a reverse grip, meaning your palms should be facing towards your face.
  3. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbows in close to your head.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows in the same position.
  5. Stop the barbell when it is just above your forehead.
  6. Pause for a moment, then use your triceps to push the barbell back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell reverse preacher curl
instructions:
1. Place a barbell on a preacher bench with the weight you want to use.
  2. Stand facing the preacher bench with your chest against the pad and your arms extended over the bench, gripping the barbell with an overhand grip.
  3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell towards your shoulders by flexing your forearms.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  5. Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell reverse wrist curl
instructions:
1. Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lower the barbell down towards your thighs, keeping your arms straight.
  4. Slowly lift the barbell up towards your body, curling your wrists back towards your forearms.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your forearms and wrists.
  6. Slowly lower the barbell back down towards your thighs.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell rollerout
instructions:
1. Start by kneeling on the floor and placing your hands on the barbell with your palms facing down and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Slowly roll the barbell forward while keeping your core tight and your back straight.
  3. Roll the barbell out as far as you can while maintaining control.
  4. Pause for a moment in the extended position before rolling the barbell back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell rollerout from bench
instructions:
1. Start by kneeling on a mat or soft surface, with your hands gripping the barbell just outside shoulder-width apart.
  2. Place the barbell on the bench in front of you, making sure it is secure and won't move during the exercise.
  3. Engage your core and slowly roll the barbell forward, extending your arms and keeping your hips in line with your shoulders.
  4. When you feel a stretch in your abs and your arms are extended in front of you, pause for a moment before slowly rolling the barbell back towards your body.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, making sure to keep your core engaged and your hips stable throughout the exercise.
  6. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the bench and stand up slowly.

name: barbell romanian deadlift
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, toes pointing forward, and grip the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you hinge forward at the hips, pushing your butt back and lowering the barbell towards the ground.
  3. Keep your knees slightly bent and your weight in your heels.
  4. Lower the barbell as far as you can while maintaining a flat back and without rounding your shoulders.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then engage your glutes and hamstrings to lift the barbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to not lift with your back.

name: barbell seated behind head military press
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell up and position it behind your head, resting on your upper traps.
  4. Press the barbell up over your head, fully extending your arms.
  5. Lower the barbell back down behind your head, keeping your elbows pointed out to the sides.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. When finished, carefully lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  9. Stretch your shoulders and triceps after completing the exercise.

name: barbell seated bradford rocky press
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip and your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bring the barbell up to shoulder height, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Press the barbell overhead, extending your arms fully.
  5. Lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Bring the barbell back up to shoulder height and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Remember to breathe in as you lower the barbell behind your head and breathe out as you press it overhead.
  9. When finished, carefully lower the barbell back down to your thighs and stand up.

name: barbell seated calf raise
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Place a barbell on your thighs, holding it with an overhand grip.
  3. Slowly raise your heels off the ground, using only your calves. Keep your knees stationary throughout the movement.
  4. Hold the contraction for a second, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight on the barbell as needed to challenge your calf muscles.
  8. As you progress, you can also try doing the exercise one leg at a time for an added challenge.
  9. Remember to stretch your calves after the exercise to prevent tightness and injury.

name: barbell seated calf raise
instructions:
1. Place a barbell on a rack at a comfortable height.
  2. Sit on a bench or chair in front of the barbell.
  3. Place the balls of your feet on the barbell, with your heels hanging off the edge.
  4. Grasp the barbell with your hands for stability.
  5. Slowly raise your heels as high as you can, contracting your calf muscles.
  6. Hold the contraction for a few seconds.
  7. Lower your heels back down to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. Adjust the weight on the barbell as needed.
  10. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.

name: barbell seated close grip behind neck triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, back straight, and head facing forward.
  2. Grasp the barbell with both hands using a close grip, with your palms facing up.
  3. Lift the barbell up and behind your head, keeping your elbows close to your head.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell down towards your shoulders by bending your elbows.
  5. Pause for a moment, then use your triceps to lift the barbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your elbows close to your head throughout the exercise to maximize the effectiveness of the triceps extension.
  8. Also, be sure to use a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and to warm up properly before beginning the exercise.

name: barbell seated close-grip concentration curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground, holding the barbell with an underhand grip and your hands close together.
  2. Rest your elbows on the inside of your thighs, just above your knees.
  3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell towards your chest, contracting your biceps.
  4. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the weight or reps to continue challenging your biceps.

name: barbell seated good morning
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Place a barbell across your shoulders, behind your neck.
  3. Slowly lean forward, hinging at your hips, while keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Lower your torso until it is parallel to the ground or until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position, using your glutes and hamstrings to lift your torso back up.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: barbell seated overhead press
instructions:
1. Set up the barbell on a squat rack at a height that is comfortable for you to lift it from a seated position.
  2. Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, your back straight, and your core engaged.
  3. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it at shoulder height with your elbows bent and the bar resting on the front of your shoulders.
  5. Press the barbell up and overhead, extending your arms fully without locking your elbows.
  6. Hold the barbell overhead for a moment, then lower it back down to shoulder height with control.
  7. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions, keeping your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.
  8. When you are finished, carefully rack the barbell back on the squat rack.

name: barbell seated overhead triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing forward, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bring the barbell up and over your head, keeping your elbows close to your head and your upper arms stationary.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, bending at the elbows and keeping your upper arms stationary.
  5. Extend your arms back up to the starting position, making sure to keep your elbows close to your head and your upper arms stationary throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  8. After completing the exercise, carefully lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  9. Stretch your triceps by reaching one arm up and over your head, bending at the elbow and gently pulling your elbow towards your head with your other hand. Hold for 10-15 seconds and repeat on the other side.

name: barbell seated twist
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
  2. Hold a barbell with both hands at chest level, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  3. Slowly twist your torso to the right, keeping your arms straight and the barbell close to your chest.
  4. Pause for a moment at the end of the twist, then slowly return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the twist to the left side, pausing at the end of the movement before returning to the starting position.
  6. Complete 10-12 repetitions of the exercise, then rest for 30 seconds before repeating for 2-3 sets.

name: barbell shrug
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands positioned slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell by extending your arms and lifting your shoulders towards your ears.
  4. Hold the barbell at the top of the movement for a few seconds, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
  6. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lift the barbell and exhaling as you lower it.
  8. Start with a light weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the movement.
  9. Avoid using momentum to lift the barbell, and focus on using your shoulder muscles to perform the exercise.
  10. As with any exercise, consult with a fitness professional before beginning and stop immediately if you experience any pain or discomfort.

name: barbell side bent v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a barbell with both hands, palms facing down, and let it rest against the front of your thighs.
  3. Slowly lean your torso to the right side, keeping your back straight and your abs tight.
  4. Lower the barbell towards your right knee, maintaining control and stability throughout the movement.
  5. Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then return to the starting position by lifting your torso back up to a vertical position.
  6. Repeat the exercise on the left side, leaning your torso to the left and lowering the barbell towards your left knee.
  7. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each side, with a rest period of 30-60 seconds in between sets.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and exhale as you lower the barbell towards your knee.
  9. Gradually increase the weight of the barbell as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.

name: barbell side split squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place a barbell on your shoulders, holding it with both hands, palms facing forward.
  3. Take a large step to the side with your right foot, keeping your left foot in place.
  4. Bend your right knee and lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
  5. Keep your torso upright and your chest lifted throughout the movement.
  6. Push through your right foot to return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping to the left and bending your left knee.
  8. Perform 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each side, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: barbell side split squat v. 2
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Hold a barbell with both hands, resting it on the back of your shoulders.
  3. Take a large step to the side with one foot, keeping your toes pointed forward.
  4. Bend your knee and lower your body until your thigh is parallel to the ground.
  5. Push through your heel to return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat on the other side.
  7. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Make sure to keep your chest up and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight of the barbell as necessary to maintain proper form.
  10. Finish the exercise by returning the barbell to the starting position and stepping back to the original stance.

name: barbell single leg deadlift
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with a barbell on the floor in front of you.
  2. Place your left foot behind you and lift it off the ground, balancing on your right foot.
  3. With your left hand, grab the barbell and lift it off the ground, keeping your back straight and your right knee slightly bent.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping your left leg lifted and your back straight.
  5. Lower the barbell until it is just above the ground, then slowly lift it back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat with your right leg.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: barbell single leg split squat
instructions:
1. Start by placing a barbell on your shoulders, holding it with both hands at shoulder width apart.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and take a step forward with one foot, keeping your torso upright.
  3. Slowly lower your body by bending your knees until your back knee is almost touching the ground.
  4. Make sure your front knee is directly above your ankle and not over your toes.
  5. Pause for a second at the bottom of the movement, then push back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat on the other side.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  9. Perform the exercise in a controlled manner to avoid injury.
  10. As you progress, you can increase the difficulty of the exercise by holding dumbbells in each hand or using a heavier barbell.

name: barbell sitted alternate leg raise
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a flat bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a barbell with both hands, palms facing down, and rest it on your thighs.
  3. Engage your abs and lift one leg off the ground, keeping it straight.
  4. Slowly lower your leg back down to the ground and repeat the movement with the other leg.
  5. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise to avoid straining your lower back.
  7. You can increase the difficulty of the exercise by adding weight to the barbell or by holding the barbell in an overhead position.

name: barbell sitted alternate leg raise (female)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Place a barbell across your thighs, holding it securely with both hands.
  3. Slowly lift your right leg off the ground, keeping it straight and parallel to the floor.
  4. Hold for a few seconds, then lower your right leg back down to the floor.
  5. Repeat with your left leg, lifting it off the ground and holding for a few seconds before lowering it back down.
  6. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the barbell or add ankle weights for an extra challenge.
  9. Remember to stretch your legs and back after completing the exercise.

name: barbell skier
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out in front of you, holding the barbell with an overhand grip.
  2. Slowly lower your body into a squat position, keeping your chest up and your back straight.
  3. As you squat down, raise the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in and your shoulders back.
  4. Once you reach the bottom of the squat, pause for a moment, then explosively push up through your legs, straightening your body and lifting the barbell up above your head.
  5. As you lift the barbell, jump your feet together and land in a standing position with your arms fully extended overhead.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to your chest as you squat back down, then repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell speed squat
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a barbell on a squat rack at a height that is comfortable for you to lift.
  2. Load the barbell with weights that you can comfortably lift for 8-10 reps.
  3. Stand facing the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  4. Reach down and grab the bar with both hands, making sure your grip is comfortable and secure.
  5. Engage your core and lift the bar off the rack, taking a step or two back to clear the rack.
  6. Position the barbell on your upper back, just below your neck, and take a deep breath in.
  7. Lower your body down into a squat, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
  8. As you lower yourself, push your hips back and down, keeping your weight on your heels.
  9. Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground, and then quickly push yourself back up to the starting position.
  10. Repeat for 8-10 reps, making sure to keep your form and speed consistent throughout the exercise.
  11. When finished, carefully lower the bar back onto the squat rack and step away.

name: barbell split squat v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by placing a barbell on your shoulders, behind your neck. Make sure the bar is centered and secure.
