  2. Take a large step forward with one leg and plant your foot firmly on the ground. The other leg should remain stationary, with your foot behind you.
  3. Lower your body by bending both knees, until your front thigh is parallel to the ground. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Push through your front foot to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch legs and repeat the exercise.
  5. Make sure to keep your weight centered over your front foot and avoid leaning forward or backward.
  6. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to ensure proper form and to challenge yourself appropriately.
  7. As with any exercise, start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable and confident with the movement.
  8. Remember to breathe regularly throughout the exercise and to stretch your muscles before and after your workout.

name: barbell squat (on knees)
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Place the barbell behind your knees and hold onto it with an overhand grip.
  3. Lower yourself down onto your knees, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Slowly begin to stand back up, pushing through your heels and keeping the barbell close to your body.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Remember to keep your knees in line with your toes and to not let them cave inwards.
  7. Also, make sure to keep your chest lifted and your shoulders back throughout the exercise.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the barbell back onto the rack.
  9. Stretch your quads and hamstrings to cool down.

name: barbell squat jump step rear lunge
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a barbell on your shoulders and standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Squat down until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  3. From the squat position, jump up explosively, driving through your feet.
  4. Land softly and immediately step back with one foot into a rear lunge position.
  5. Bend both knees, lowering your back knee towards the ground, keeping your chest up and your core engaged.
  6. Push through your front foot to return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the jump and rear lunge on the opposite side.
  8. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell standing ab rollerout
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a barbell with both hands, palms facing down.
  2. Engage your core and slowly roll the barbell forward, keeping your arms straight and your back flat.
  3. Roll the barbell out as far as you can without arching your back or letting your hips drop.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly roll the barbell back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your core engaged and your back flat throughout the exercise.
  6. As you become more advanced, you can increase the difficulty by adding weight to the barbell or using a narrower grip.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to stop if you experience any pain or discomfort.

name: barbell standing back wrist curl
instructions:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the barbell with an underhand grip, with your palms facing up and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Keep your arms straight and close to your body, with your elbows tucked in at your sides.
  3. Slowly raise the barbell towards your body by flexing your wrists, keeping your arms stationary and your elbows tucked in.
  4. Hold the barbell at the top of the movement for a second, then slowly lower it back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Keep your movements slow and controlled throughout the exercise.
  7. Keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
  8. Adjust the weight of the barbell as necessary to challenge yourself without sacrificing form.
  9. Rest for 30-60 seconds between sets, and aim to complete 3-4 sets of 10-15 repetitions.

name: barbell standing bradford press
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell up to shoulder height, with your elbows bent and the bar resting on the front of your shoulders.
  4. Press the barbell up above your head, straightening your arms fully.
  5. As you lower the barbell back down, bring it behind your head and lower it to the back of your neck.
  6. Press the barbell back up above your head, returning it to the starting position in front of your shoulders.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell standing calf raise
instructions:
1. Place a barbell on the floor and load it with an appropriate weight.
  2. Stand facing the barbell and position your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bend down and grasp the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the floor and holding it at arm's length in front of your thighs.
  5. Slowly rise up onto the balls of your feet, lifting your heels as high as possible.
  6. Hold this position for a few seconds, then lower your heels back down to the floor.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully lower the barbell back down to the floor.

name: barbell standing close grip curl
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an underhand grip, with your hands placed close together.
  3. Hold the barbell at arm's length in front of your thighs.
  4. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, curl the barbell up towards your chest.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the curl, squeezing your biceps.
  6. Slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell standing close grip military press
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing forward.
  2. Assume a grip on the barbell that is slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart, with your palms facing forward.
  3. Lift the barbell up to your shoulders, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  4. Take a deep breath and brace your core muscles.
  5. Press the barbell overhead, extending your arms fully at the top of the movement.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to your shoulders, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  7. Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully lower the barbell back down to the ground.
  9. Stretch your shoulders and arms after completing the exercise.

name: barbell standing concentration curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Keep your upper arms close to your sides, and your elbows stationary throughout the exercise.
  3. Exhale and curl the barbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your wrist straight.
  4. Hold the contraction for a second and inhale as you slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
  6. Switch arms and repeat the exercise with your other arm.

name: barbell standing front raise over head
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold the barbell at waist level with your arms fully extended.
  4. Slowly raise the barbell straight up in front of you, keeping your arms straight and your core engaged.
  5. Continue lifting the barbell until it is directly overhead, with your arms fully extended.
  6. Hold the barbell in this position for a moment, then slowly lower it back down to waist level.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell standing leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place a barbell across your shoulders, resting it on the back of your neck.
  3. Hold onto the barbell with both hands for stability.
  4. Raise your heels off the ground, lifting your body up onto your toes.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your heels back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat this movement for several repetitions, aiming for 10-15 reps per set.
  7. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the barbell to make the exercise more challenging.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Perform this exercise as part of a larger leg workout, or as a standalone exercise to strengthen and tone your calf muscles.

name: barbell standing overhead triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lift the barbell overhead, fully extending your arms.
  3. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, bending at the elbows and keeping your upper arms close to your head.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you, but that you can still perform with proper form.
  8. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or medical professional before beginning if you have any concerns or underlying health conditions.

name: barbell standing reverse grip curl
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, slowly curl the barbell up towards your chest, exhaling as you lift the weight.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, inhaling as you lower the weight.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the weight of the barbell to continue challenging your muscles.

name: barbell standing rocking leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, resting it on the back of your shoulders.
  3. Slowly raise your heels off the ground, keeping your knees straight.
  4. Rock forward onto the balls of your feet, then back onto your heels.
  5. Lower your heels back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Variations can include using dumbbells or a calf raise machine instead of a barbell.

name: barbell standing twist
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a barbell with both hands, keeping your arms extended in front of you.
  3. Slowly twist your torso to the right, keeping your hips facing forward.
  4. Pause for a moment, then twist your torso to the left.
  5. Repeat this twisting motion for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to protect your lower back.
  7. Gradually increase the weight of the barbell as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and evenly throughout the exercise.
  9. Finish the exercise by slowly lowering the barbell to the starting position.

name: barbell standing wide grip biceps curl
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip that is wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Keep your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
  4. Curl the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your wrists straight and your elbows stationary.
  5. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the curl and hold for a second.
  6. Slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you curl the barbell up and exhaling as you lower it back down.
  9. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself and avoid injury.
  10. Stretch your biceps after completing the exercise to prevent soreness and improve flexibility.

name: barbell standing wide military press
instructions:
1. Step 1: Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward. Reach down and grip the barbell with an overhand grip that is wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Step 2: Lift the barbell up to your shoulders and rest it on your clavicles. Your palms should be facing forward, and your elbows should be pointing out to the sides.
  3. Step 3: Take a deep breath and brace your core muscles. This will help stabilize your body during the exercise.
  4. Step 4: Begin pressing the barbell upward until your arms are fully extended, but do not lock out your elbows. Keep your core muscles engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.
  5. Step 5: Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to your clavicles.
  6. Step 6: Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.
  7. Step 7: When you are finished with the exercise, carefully lower the barbell back down to the ground.

name: barbell standing wide-grip curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp a barbell with an overhand grip that is wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hold the barbell at arm's length in front of your thighs with your palms facing away from your body.
  3. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, exhale and curl the barbell up towards your chest.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  5. Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting the exercise and stretch afterwards to prevent injury.

name: barbell step-up
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a barbell on your shoulders, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Step up onto a bench or platform with your right foot, ensuring that your entire foot is placed firmly on the bench.
  3. Press through your right foot and lift your body up onto the bench, bringing your left foot up to meet your right foot.
  4. Step back down with your left foot, followed by your right foot.
  5. Repeat the exercise, alternating which foot you step up with first.
  6. Keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you, but allows you to maintain proper form.
  8. Perform 3-4 sets of 10-12 reps per leg.

name: barbell stiff leg good morning
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place the barbell on your shoulders behind your neck, making sure it is securely in place.
  3. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you hinge forward at the hips, pushing your buttocks back as if you were sitting in a chair.
  4. Lower your torso until it is parallel to the floor, keeping your knees slightly bent and your weight on your heels.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, feeling the stretch in your hamstrings and glutes.
  6. Slowly raise your torso back up to the starting position, using your glutes and hamstrings to pull yourself up.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, making sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

name: barbell straight leg deadlift
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place the barbell on the floor in front of you and stand behind it with your feet hip-width apart.
  3. Bend down and grip the bar with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keeping your back straight and your core tight, lift the barbell off the ground by extending your hips and knees.
  5. As you stand up, keep your arms straight and the barbell close to your body.
  6. Once you are standing straight, slowly lower the barbell back down to the ground by bending at your hips and knees.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell sumo deadlift
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointed slightly outward.
  2. Place a barbell on the ground in front of you, with your shins touching the bar.
  3. Reach down and grip the bar with both hands, palms facing down and hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and lift the bar off the ground, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  5. As you lift the bar, push through your heels and drive your hips forward.
  6. Once you reach a standing position, pause for a moment before lowering the bar back down to the ground.
  7. Lower the bar by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  8. Lower the bar until it touches the ground, then repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell thruster
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bring the barbell up to your shoulders, resting it on your collarbone. Your elbows should be pointing forward, with your upper arms parallel to the ground.
  3. Lower your body into a squat, keeping your knees behind your toes and your chest up. Your thighs should be parallel to the ground.
  4. As you stand up from the squat, press the barbell overhead, extending your arms fully. Your elbows should be locked out at the top of the movement.
  5. Lower the barbell back down to your shoulders as you lower your body into another squat. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.

name: barbell upright row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold the barbell in front of your thighs with your arms fully extended.
  4. Lift the barbell straight up, keeping it close to your body and leading with your elbows.
  5. Continue lifting until the barbell reaches chest height.
  6. Hold for a moment, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell upright row v. 2
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly closer than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hold the barbell in front of your thighs, with your arms extended and your elbows slightly bent.
  3. Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, exhale and lift the barbell straight up towards your chin, leading with your elbows.
  4. As you lift the barbell, keep it close to your body and avoid swinging or jerking the weight.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then inhale and lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise, and avoid using momentum or excessive weight that could cause injury.

name: barbell upright row v. 3
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell straight up towards your chin, keeping it close to your body.
  4. As you lift the bar, exhale and focus on engaging your shoulder muscles.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back down to starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  7. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your back straight and your shoulders relaxed.
  8. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself without sacrificing form.
  9. Always warm up properly before beginning any exercise routine.
  10. Consult with a fitness professional if you have any questions or concerns about performing the exercise safely and effectively.

name: barbell wide bench press
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly on the ground.
  2. Grab the barbell with a wide grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  4. Lower the barbell slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body.
  5. When the barbell is just above your chest, pause for a moment, then push it back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the barbell back on the rack.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight of the barbell as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.

name: barbell wide reverse grip bench press
instructions:
1. Set up the barbell on the bench press rack at a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level.
  2. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back and head resting comfortably on the bench.
  3. Reach up and grasp the bar with a wide, reverse grip (palms facing away from your body) with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lift the bar off the rack and hold it directly above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  5. Inhale and lower the bar slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause for a moment when the bar is just above your chest.
  7. Exhale and push the bar back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
  9. When you are finished, carefully rack the bar on the bench press rack.

name: barbell wide squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your toes pointed slightly outward.
  2. Hold a barbell with both hands, placing your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bring the barbell up to your shoulders, keeping your elbows pointed down and in front of your body.
  4. Engage your core and glutes as you lower your body into a squat, keeping your back straight and your chest lifted.
  5. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  6. Push through your heels to stand back up, keeping your core and glutes engaged throughout the movement.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell wide-grip upright row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip that is wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bring the barbell up towards your chin, keeping your elbows high and your shoulders back.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Be sure to use a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and ability.
  8. Consult with a fitness professional if you are unsure about proper form or technique.
  9. As with any exercise, stop immediately if you experience any pain or discomfort.

name: barbell wrist curl
instructions:
1. Start by selecting a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and strength. Make sure the barbell is properly loaded with weights on both ends.
  2. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Hold the barbell with both hands, palms facing up, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Slowly lift the barbell towards your body, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your wrists straight.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise for a desired number of repetitions or until you feel fatigued.
  6. Take a short break, then repeat the exercise for another set of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise and to keep your body stable and balanced.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the barbell or the number of repetitions to continue challenging your muscles.
  9. Finish the exercise by carefully placing the barbell back on the rack or the floor.

name: barbell wrist curl v. 2
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, with your palms facing up and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Rest your forearms on the bench, with your wrists hanging off the edge.
  4. Slowly curl the barbell upwards, using only your wrists. Keep your forearms stationary on the bench.
  5. Hold the barbell at the top of the curl for a few seconds, then slowly lower it back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  7. Gradually increase the weight of the barbell as you become stronger.
  8. Be sure to warm up your wrists before beginning this exercise to prevent injury.
  9. Do not use momentum or swing the barbell to lift it. Keep the movement slow and controlled.
  10. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, exhaling as you curl the barbell up and inhaling as you lower it down.

name: barbell zercher squat
instructions:
1. Start by setting up the barbell on a squat rack at a height that is comfortable for you to lift.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  3. Position the barbell in the crook of your elbows, with your palms facing upward and your fingers gripping the bar tightly.
  4. Lift the barbell up and off the rack, stepping back to clear the way for your squat.
  5. Lower your body down into a squatting position, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  6. As you lower your body, keep the barbell securely in the crook of your elbows, using your arms to support the weight.
  7. Lower yourself down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  8. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then push yourself back up to a standing position.
  9. Repeat the exercise for several reps, making sure to maintain proper form throughout.
  10. When you are finished, carefully return the barbell to the squat rack and release your grip.

name: basic toe touch (male)
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Slowly raise both arms above your head, keeping them straight and parallel to each other.
  3. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your legs straight and your back flat.
  4. Reach your hands towards your toes, trying to touch them with your fingertips.
  5. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in your hamstrings and lower back.
  6. Slowly raise your torso back up to a standing position, keeping your arms above your head.
  7. Lower your arms back down to your sides.
  8. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 repetitions.

name: battling ropes
instructions:
1. Select a set of battling ropes that are appropriate for your fitness level. The heavier the rope, the more resistance you will feel during the exercise.
  2. Find a secure anchor point to attach the ropes to. This can be a pole, fence, or any other sturdy object.
  3. Stand facing the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
  4. Grab one end of each rope in each hand and raise your arms so that they are parallel to the ground.
  5. Begin to alternate raising and lowering each arm, creating a wave-like motion in the ropes.
  6. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, try incorporating different movements such as slams, circles, and figure-eights.
  7. Continue the exercise for a set amount of time or until you feel fatigued.
  8. Stretch your arms and shoulders after the exercise to prevent injury and reduce soreness.

name: bear crawl
instructions:
1. Start on all fours with your hands and feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lift your knees off the ground and begin to walk forward with your hands and feet.
  3. Move your left hand and right foot forward at the same time, then your right hand and left foot.
  4. Keep your back flat and your core engaged as you move forward.
  5. Continue crawling forward for a set distance or time.
  6. To turn around, rotate your body and switch the leading hand and foot.
  7. Crawl back to your starting position.
  8. Repeat for desired number of sets and repetitions.

name: behind head chest stretch
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
  2. Slowly raise your arms behind your head and interlock your fingers.
  3. Gently pull your arms downwards, towards your lower back, while keeping your head and neck straight.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, while taking deep breaths.
  5. Release the stretch and return to your starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise 2-3 times.

name: bench dip (knees bent)
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy exercise bench or chair and sit on the edge of it.
  2. Place your hands on the bench with your fingers facing forward and your palms resting on the edge of the bench.
  3. Slide your feet out in front of you and bend your knees at a 90-degree angle.
  4. Lift your hips off the bench and move your feet forward so that your body is in front of the bench. Your arms should be straight and supporting your weight.
  5. Slowly lower your body down by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body. Your hips should be close to the bench.
  6. Stop when your arms are at a 90-degree angle and then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: bench dip on floor
instructions:
1. Place your hands on the edge of a sturdy bench or chair with your fingers pointing forward.
  2. Walk your feet forward until your legs are almost straight and your heels are on the floor.
  3. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
  4. Push your body back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  5. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: bench hip extension
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on the exercise bench with your hips at the edge of the bench and your legs hanging off the end.
  2. Place your hands on the bench for support and keep your head down.
  3. Engage your glutes and lift your legs up until they are parallel to the floor.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for a desired number of repetitions.
  6. For a more challenging variation, you can add ankle weights or a resistance band around your ankles.

name: bench pull-ups
instructions:
1. Position the exercise bench under a sturdy horizontal bar or pull-up bar.
  2. Stand on the bench and reach up to grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step off the bench and hang from the bar, arms fully extended.
  4. Engage your back and arm muscles to pull your body up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, with your chin above the bar.
  6. Lower your body back down to the starting position, with arms fully extended.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. To make the exercise more challenging, you can add weight by using a weight belt or holding a dumbbell between your feet.
  9. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, avoiding swinging or using momentum to complete the movement.
  10. Stretch your back and arm muscles after the exercise to prevent injury and improve flexibility.

name: bent knee lying twist (male)
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Extend your arms out to the sides, palms facing down.
  3. Slowly lower both knees to one side, keeping your shoulders flat on the ground.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in your lower back and hips.
  5. Bring your knees back to center and repeat on the other side.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 3-4 sets on each side, taking deep breaths and relaxing your body as you hold the stretch.
  7. Be sure to listen to your body and stop if you feel any pain or discomfort.
  8. As you become more flexible, you can increase the duration of the stretch or try variations such as straightening one leg while twisting the other knee to the opposite side.

name: biceps leg concentration curl
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your legs spread apart and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand and place your elbow on the inside of your right thigh, just above the knee. Your palm should be facing up.
  3. Slowly curl the weight towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow stationary and your palm facing up.
  4. Hold the contraction for a second and then lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch arms.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Focus on squeezing your bicep at the top of the movement for maximum muscle activation.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to challenge yourself and avoid using momentum to lift the weight.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-12 reps on each arm for a complete workout.

name: biceps narrow pull-ups
instructions:
1. Begin by finding a pull-up bar that allows for a narrow grip.
  2. Stand underneath the bar and reach up to grab it with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your biceps and pull your body up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps before slowly lowering yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight between your feet or wear a weighted vest.

name: biceps pull-up
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar that is sturdy and can support your weight.
  2. Stand underneath the pull-up bar and reach up to grip the bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your biceps and pull your body up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  5. When your chin is above the bar, pause for a moment before slowly lowering yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to breathe throughout the exercise and keep your core engaged to maintain proper form.
  8. If you are having difficulty completing a full pull-up, try using an assisted pull-up machine or resistance bands to help support your weight.
  9. As you build strength, you can increase the difficulty of the exercise by adding weight or performing variations such as chin-ups or wide-grip pull-ups.

name: body-up
instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet together.
  2. Lower your body down to the ground by bending your elbows and keeping your body straight.
  3. Once your chest touches the ground, push up with your arms and lift your body up into a plank position.
  4. From the plank position, lift your right hand and left foot off the ground simultaneously, holding for a few seconds.
  5. Lower your right hand and left foot back down to the ground and repeat the same movement with your left hand and right foot.
  6. Continue alternating between lifting your right hand and left foot and your left hand and right foot for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Finish the exercise by lowering your body back down to the ground and pushing up into the starting push-up position.

name: bodyweight drop jump squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lower yourself into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees directly above your feet.
  3. From the squat position, jump up as high as you can.
  4. As soon as you land, immediately drop back into the squat position.
  5. Repeat the jump and drop into the squat position for the desired number of reps.

name: bodyweight incline side plank
instructions:
1. Start by positioning yourself in a side plank position with your feet stacked on top of each other and your elbow on the ground directly beneath your shoulder.
  2. Place your free hand on your hip or extend it towards the ceiling.
  3. Now, raise your hips off the ground and create a straight line from your head to your heels.
  4. Next, lift your top leg up and hold it in the air for a few seconds.
  5. Lower your leg back down and repeat the movement for several reps before switching sides.
  6. For an added challenge, you can place your feet on an elevated surface such as a bench or step to increase the incline of the plank.
  7. Remember to engage your core and keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  8. Breathe deeply and hold the position for as long as you can, gradually increasing the duration as you become stronger.
  9. Repeat the exercise regularly as part of your fitness routine to improve your core strength and stability.

name: bodyweight kneeling triceps extension
instructions:
1. Start in a kneeling position with your toes touching the ground and your hands placed on the floor, shoulder-width apart.
  2. Slowly lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
  3. Once your elbows are at a 90-degree angle, pause for a moment before pushing your body back up to the starting position.
  4. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
  5. For an added challenge, you can place your hands closer together or further apart, or lift one leg off the ground while performing the exercise.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and take breaks as needed.
  8. Finish the exercise by stretching your triceps and any other muscles that feel tight.

name: bodyweight side lying biceps curl
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your side with your legs straight and your head resting on your arm or a pillow.
  2. Bend your bottom arm at the elbow and place your hand on your chest.
  3. Extend your top arm straight out in front of you with your palm facing up.
  4. Slowly curl your top arm towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep.
  6. Slowly lower your arm back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with your other arm.

name: bodyweight squatting row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms hanging down by your sides.
  2. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing your hips back as if you were sitting in a chair.
  3. As you squat, lift your arms up to shoulder height, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  4. When you reach the bottom of your squat, pause for a moment and then begin to rise back up to the starting position.
  5. As you rise, lower your arms back down to your sides.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: bodyweight squatting row (with towel)
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a towel on the ground in front of you.
  2. Lower your body into a squatting position, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
  3. Grab the towel with both hands, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing down.
  4. As you stand up from the squat, pull the towel towards your chest, bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Lower the towel back down to the ground as you lower your body into the squatting position again.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 repetitions.
  7. For an added challenge, hold the squat position for a few seconds before standing up and rowing the towel.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply throughout the exercise and engage your core muscles to maintain balance and stability.

name: bodyweight standing calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place your hands on your hips or hold onto a wall or sturdy object for balance.
  2. Slowly raise your heels off the ground, lifting your body weight onto the balls of your feet.
  3. Hold the raised position for a few seconds, feeling the stretch in your calf muscles.
  4. Lower your heels back down to the ground, keeping your movements slow and controlled.
  5. Repeat the movement for several repetitions, aiming for 10-15 reps per set.
  6. You can increase the difficulty of the exercise by performing it on a step or ledge, allowing for a greater range of motion.
  7. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your posture upright throughout the exercise.
  8. Remember to breathe steadily and avoid locking your knees at the top of the movement.
  9. As you progress, you can add weight by holding dumbbells or wearing a weighted vest.
  10. Include the bodyweight standing calf raise in your regular workout routine to improve calf strength and definition.

name: bodyweight standing close-grip one arm row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and your weight evenly distributed between both feet.
  2. Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell in your right hand, with your palm facing your body.
  3. Bring your right arm close to your torso, keeping your elbow tucked in.
  4. Bend forward at your hips, keeping your back straight, until your torso is at a 45-degree angle to the floor.
  5. Extend your right arm down towards the floor, then pull the weight up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  7. Complete 10-12 repetitions on your right side, then switch to your left arm and repeat the exercise.
  8. Complete 2-3 sets of the exercise, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: bodyweight standing close-grip row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended in front of you.
  2. Bring your hands together and grip them tightly.
  3. Slowly pull your hands towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Slowly release your hands back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Variations of this exercise can be done with a resistance band or by using dumbbells.

name: bodyweight standing one arm row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell or a kettlebell in one hand with your arm extended down in front of you.
  3. Engage your core and keep your back straight.
  4. Slowly lift the weight towards your chest by bending your elbow and pulling your shoulder blade back.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your shoulder blade.
  6. Slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on one side before switching to the other arm.
  8. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions on each arm.

name: bodyweight standing one arm row (with towel)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a towel in one hand.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
  3. Extend your arm holding the towel straight down towards the ground.
  4. Engage your back muscles and pull the towel towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Hold for a second and then slowly lower the towel back towards the ground.
  6. Complete 10-12 repetitions on one side before switching to the other arm.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets on each arm.

name: bodyweight standing row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Extend your arms in front of you, palms facing down.
  3. Engage your shoulder blades by pulling them down and back.
  4. Bend your elbows and pull your hands towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  6. Slowly lower your hands back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: bodyweight standing row (with towel)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a towel on the ground in front of you.
  2. Step on the towel with both feet and grab onto the ends of the towel with your hands.
  3. Keep your arms straight and lean forward, creating tension in the towel.
  4. Slowly pull the towel towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a second at the top of the movement and then slowly release the towel back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions.
  7. To increase the difficulty, step back further from the towel or use a thicker towel.
  8. Remember to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.

name: bottoms-up
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hold a kettlebell or dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing up.
  3. Bring the weight up to your shoulder and bend your elbow to hold it there.
  4. Engage your core and glutes, then press the weight overhead, straightening your arm.
  5. Lower the weight back down to your shoulder.
  6. Keeping your core and glutes engaged, slowly lower the weight down to your side, until your arm is fully extended and the weight is at your side.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat.

name: box jump down with one leg stabilization
instructions:
1. Stand facing a sturdy box or bench that is at a comfortable height for you to jump onto.
  2. Place one foot on the box and the other foot on the ground.
  3. Bend your knee slightly and jump off the box with your foot that is on the box.
  4. As you jump off the box, swing your other leg forward and land on the ground with it.
  5. As soon as you land, stabilize your body by bending your knees and lowering your hips.
  6. Hold this position for a few seconds before standing up straight.
  7. Repeat the exercise for several reps before switching legs.

name: bridge - mountain climber (cross body)
instructions:
1. Start in a bridge position, with your hands and feet on the ground and your hips lifted off the floor.
  2. Bring your right knee towards your left elbow, crossing your body diagonally.
  3. Return your right leg to the starting position and repeat with your left knee towards your right elbow.
  4. Alternate between the two sides, keeping your core engaged and your hips lifted throughout the exercise.
  5. Continue for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  6. To increase the intensity, you can perform the exercise at a faster pace or hold a weight on your hips.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: burpee
instructions:
1. Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lower your body into a squat position with your hands on the ground in front of you.
  3. Kick your feet back into a plank position, keeping your arms extended.
  4. Lower your chest to the ground, then push up with your arms to return to the plank position.
  5. Jump your feet back up to your hands and stand up.
  6. Jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead.
  7. Land back in the starting position and repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: butt-ups
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands palms-down on the ground by your sides.
  3. Engage your glutes and lift your hips up towards the ceiling.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your glutes.
  5. Slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. For an added challenge, try holding a weight on your hips or lifting one leg off the ground while performing the exercise.

name: butterfly yoga pose
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
  2. Bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet together, allowing your knees to fall out to the sides.
  3. Bring your heels as close to your body as possible.
  4. Place your hands on your ankles or feet.
  5. Sit up tall, lengthening your spine and engaging your core.
  6. Using your elbows, gently press your knees down towards the floor.
  7. Hold this pose for 30-60 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing into the stretch.
  8. To release the pose, slowly bring your knees back together and extend your legs out in front of you.

name: cable alternate shoulder press
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and adjust the weight accordingly.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back facing the pulley.
  3. Grab the cable with one hand and bring it up to shoulder level, with your elbow bent and pointing outwards.
  4. Press the cable up and away from your body, extending your arm fully.
  5. Lower the cable back down to shoulder level and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Switch hands and repeat the exercise on the opposite side.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.

name: cable alternate triceps extension
instructions:
1. Attach a cable handle to a high pulley on a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing away from the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the cable handle with one hand and bring it behind your head, keeping your elbow close to your ear.
  4. Extend your arm up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbow stationary.
  5. Lower the cable handle back down behind your head, keeping your elbow close to your ear.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.

name: cable assisted inverse leg curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and set the weight to a manageable resistance.
  2. Lie face down on a flat bench with the cable between your legs and your feet hooked under the ankle pad.
  3. Grab the bench with your hands to stabilize yourself.
  4. Slowly curl your legs up towards your glutes, keeping your knees straight.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary to maintain proper form and challenge yourself.

name: cable bar lateral pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach the cable bar to the pulley system at the top of the machine.
  2. Adjust the weight to a comfortable level.
  3. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Grab the cable bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you pull the cable bar down towards your chest.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  7. Slowly release the cable bar back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. Switch to an underhand grip for variation.
  10. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.

name: cable bench press
instructions:
1. Attach the handles to the cables on a cable machine at a height that is comfortable for you.
  2. Sit on the bench facing the machine and grab the handles with an overhand grip.
  3. Bring the handles to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  4. Push the handles away from your chest, extending your arms fully.
  5. Slowly bring the handles back to your chest, maintaining control and keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to breathe properly throughout the exercise, exhaling as you push the handles away from your chest and inhaling as you bring them back in.
  8. Adjust the weight on the cable machine as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.

name: cable close grip curl
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing up.
  4. Keep your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
  5. Exhale and curl the bar up towards your chest, keeping your wrists straight and your elbows stationary.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  7. Inhale and slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your wrists straight.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable concentration curl
instructions:
1. Attach a single grip handle to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handle with an underhand grip and bring it up to your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Hold the contraction for a few seconds and then slowly lower the handle back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch arms.
  6. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight on the cable machine as necessary to ensure proper form and a challenging workout.
  8. Perform 3-4 sets of 10-12 repetitions for optimal results.

name: cable concentration extension (on knee)
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and adjust the weight to a comfortable level.
  2. Sit on a bench with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
  3. Place your elbows on the inside of your thighs and hold the handle of the cable with both hands.
  4. Exhale and extend your arms out in front of you, keeping your elbows on your thighs and your back straight.
  5. Pause for a moment and then slowly return to the starting position, inhaling as you do so.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable cross-over lateral pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach the cable cross-over machine to a high pulley on each side.
  2. Stand in the middle of the machine, facing away from the pulleys.
  3. Grasp one handle in each hand with palms facing down.
  4. Step forward with one foot and lean slightly forward, keeping your back straight.
  5. Bring your arms down and out to your sides in a wide arc, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  6. Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull the handles down and across your body towards your hips.
  7. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and your movements controlled throughout the exercise.

name: cable cross-over revers fly
instructions:
1. Start by attaching two D-handles to the high pulleys of a cable machine.
  2. Stand in the middle of the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out to the sides, holding the handles.
  3. Slowly cross your arms in front of your body, bringing the handles together in front of your chest.
  4. Pause for a second, then slowly return to the starting position with your arms extended out to the sides.
  5. Next, hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  6. Slowly lift your arms out to the sides, keeping them straight, until they are level with your shoulders.
  7. Pause for a second, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable cross-over variation
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching the handles to the cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand in the middle of the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold one handle in each hand with your palms facing down.
  4. Step forward with one foot and bend your knee slightly. This will help you maintain balance throughout the exercise.
  5. Extend your arms out to the sides, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  6. Bring your hands together in front of your chest, crossing one hand over the other.
  7. Pause for a moment, then slowly return your arms back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch the position of your feet and cross the opposite hand over the other.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  10. Adjust the weight of the cable machine as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.

name: cable curl
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching a cable handle to the lowest setting on a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the cable handle with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
  4. Keep your elbows close to your sides and slowly curl the handle towards your shoulders, squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handle back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with your other arm.
  7. For an added challenge, increase the weight on the cable machine or use a different handle attachment.

name: cable deadlift
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grab the cable handle with both hands, palms facing each other.
  4. Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, hinge at the hips and lower your torso towards the ground.
  5. As you lower your torso, allow your arms to straighten and the cable to pull your hands towards the ground.
  6. Once you reach your maximum range of motion, squeeze your glutes and hamstrings to pull yourself back up to standing.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: cable decline fly
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and set the weight to your desired resistance.
  2. Lie on a decline bench with your head at the lower end and your feet secured at the top end.
  3. Grasp the cable handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms straight up above your chest.
  4. Slowly lower your arms out to your sides, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, until your hands are level with your shoulders.
  5. Pause briefly, then slowly bring your arms back up to the starting position, squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable decline one arm press
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and adjust the weight according to your strength level.
  2. Stand facing away from the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold the handle of the cable with one hand and extend your arm forward, keeping your elbow slightly bent.
  4. Slowly lower the handle towards your opposite hip, keeping your arm close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the handle back up to the starting position.
  6. Complete a set of 10-12 reps on one side, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  7. Perform 3-4 sets of the exercise, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: cable decline press
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley machine and set the weight to a comfortable amount.
  2. Position a bench in front of the machine and adjust it to a decline angle of around 30 degrees.
  3. Grab the handles of the cable with an overhand grip and sit on the bench with your feet securely planted on the ground.
  4. Slowly lower the handles towards your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly push the handles back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or healthcare professional before attempting if you have any concerns or pre-existing conditions.

name: cable decline seated wide-grip row
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and sit on a decline bench facing the machine with your feet securely on the footrests.
  2. Grasp the cable attachment with a wide grip, palms facing down.
  3. Keep your back straight and lean forward slightly, keeping your chest up.
  4. Pull the cable towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together and keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly release the cable back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable drag curl
instructions:
1. Attach a handle to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grab the handle with an underhand grip and step back until your arms are fully extended.
  4. Keeping your elbows close to your body, curl the handle towards your chest by dragging it along your body.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handle back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with your other arm.

name: cable floor seated wide-grip row
instructions:
1. Attach the cable handle to the low pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the handle with both hands using a wide overhand grip.
  4. Keep your back straight and your chest up as you pull the handle towards your waist.
  5. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  6. Slowly release the handle back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: cable forward raise
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and stand facing away from the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Grasp the cable with both hands, palms facing down, and extend your arms straight out in front of you.
  3. Keeping your arms straight, raise the cable up and forward until it reaches shoulder height.
  4. Hold for a moment, then slowly lower the cable back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and perform the exercise with the opposite arm.

name: cable front raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Attach a handle to a low pulley cable machine and adjust the weight to a comfortable level.
  3. Grab the handle with an overhand grip and bring it up to chest level, keeping your arms straight.
  4. Slowly raise the cable up in front of you until your arms are parallel to the ground.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds before slowly lowering the cable back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: cable front shoulder raise
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching a cable to a low pulley and grabbing the handle with one hand.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  4. Slowly raise your arm straight out in front of you, keeping it parallel to the ground.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement and then slowly lower your arm back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides.
  7. Remember to keep your movements slow and controlled, and to breathe steadily throughout the exercise.
  8. Variations of this exercise can include using different attachments or adjusting the height of the pulley to work different areas of the shoulders.

name: cable hammer curl (with rope)
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and your core engaged.
  3. Grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing each other, and keep your elbows close to your sides.
  4. Begin the movement by flexing your elbows and curling the rope towards your shoulders.
  5. Keep your wrists straight throughout the movement.
  6. Hold the contraction for a second and then slowly lower the rope back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to exhale as you curl the rope up and inhale as you lower it back down.
  9. Adjust the weight as necessary to ensure proper form and to challenge yourself appropriately.
  10. Finish the exercise by releasing the rope and stepping away from the machine.

name: cable high pulley overhead tricep extension
instructions:
1. Adjust the cable machine to a high pulley position.
  2. Attach a rope or handle to the cable.
  3. Stand facing away from the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Grasp the rope or handle with both hands and bring it behind your head, keeping your elbows close to your ears.
  5. Extend your arms upwards, straightening your elbows, until your arms are fully extended.
  6. Pause for a moment and then slowly lower the rope or handle back down behind your head, bending your elbows.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: cable high row (kneeling)
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar to the cable machine at a high level.
  2. Kneel down in front of the cable machine facing the bar with your knees hip-width apart and your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you pull the bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Slowly release the bar back to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged throughout the movement.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Once finished, carefully release the bar and stand up.

name: cable hip adduction
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley machine and adjust the weight according to your fitness level.
  2. Stand with your left side facing the machine, feet shoulder-width apart, and your left hand resting on the machine for support.
  3. Attach an ankle strap to your right ankle and attach it to the cable.
  4. Slowly lift your right leg out to the side, keeping your knee straight and your foot flexed.
  5. Squeeze your glutes and inner thigh muscles as you lift your leg as high as possible without rotating your hips.
  6. Hold for a second or two at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and perform the exercise with your left leg.

name: cable incline bench press
instructions:
1. Adjust the incline bench to a comfortable angle.
  2. Attach the exercise cable to the weight stack and adjust the weight to your desired resistance.
  3. Grab the handles of the exercise cable and sit on the incline bench facing the cable machine.
  4. Plant your feet firmly on the ground and engage your core muscles.
  5. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  6. Inhale and slowly lower the handles towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  7. Exhale and push the handles away from your chest, extending your arms back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully release the handles and stand up from the bench.
  10. Return the exercise cable to its original position and adjust the weight stack as needed.
  11. Stretch your chest and arms to cool down.

name: cable incline bench row
instructions:
1. Adjust the height of the cable machine to chest level.
  2. Attach a straight bar or V-bar to the cable machine.
  3. Set an incline bench at a 45-degree angle in front of the cable machine.
  4. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  5. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  6. Lean forward, keeping your back straight, and rest your chest on the incline bench.
  7. Extend your arms fully, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  8. Pull the bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  9. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  10. Lower the bar back to the starting position with control.
  11. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  12. Switch to an underhand grip and repeat the exercise.

name: cable incline fly
instructions:
1. Attach the cable to the lowest setting on the pulley system and adjust the weight to your desired resistance.
  2. Stand facing away from the pulley system and grasp the handles with an overhand grip.
  3. Step forward with one foot and lean forward slightly, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
  4. Bring your arms up and out to the sides, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  5. Continue to raise your arms until they are parallel to the ground.
  6. Slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position, keeping the same slight bend in your elbows.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs and repeating the exercise.

name: cable incline fly (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Set up a stability ball in front of an exercise cable machine.
  2. Select the desired weight on the machine and attach the handles to the cables.
  3. Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your core engaged.
  4. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and bring them up to shoulder height with your arms extended out to your sides.
  5. Slowly and simultaneously bring the handles together in front of your chest, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position with your arms extended out to your sides.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight as necessary and repeat for additional sets.

name: cable incline pushdown
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar to the high pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grab the bar with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Step back a few feet from the machine and lean forward slightly, keeping your back straight.
  5. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, push the bar down towards your thighs, exhaling as you do so.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position, inhaling as you do so.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable incline triceps extension
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a high pulley and select the desired weight.
  2. Stand facing away from the cable machine and grab the handle with an overhand grip.
  3. Step forward with one foot and lean forward slightly, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Bring your upper arms close to your head, keeping your elbows in and your forearms perpendicular to the floor.
  5. Extend your arms fully, pushing the handle down towards the floor.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with your other arm.

name: cable judo flip
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the cable machine.
  2. Grasp the cable handle with both hands, palms facing down, and bring it up to your chest.
  3. Step forward with your left foot, bending your left knee and keeping your right leg straight behind you.
  4. As you step forward, rotate your torso to the left and extend your arms, pulling the cable across your body.
  5. Continue to rotate your torso and pull the cable until it is behind your back and your arms are fully extended.
  6. Release the cable and pivot on your left foot, bringing your right foot forward and bending your right knee.
  7. As you pivot, bring your left foot up and around, using it to flip your body over and land on your back.
  8. Roll forward onto your hands and knees, then stand up and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: cable kickback
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and select the appropriate weight.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the handle with one hand and bring it to your side, keeping your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
  4. Keeping your upper arm stationary, extend your forearm backward, pushing the cable away from your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your tricep.
  6. Slowly lower the cable back to the starting position.
  7. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.

name: cable kneeling crunch
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a high pulley and kneel down facing away from the machine.
  2. Grab the cable with both hands and place them behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
  3. Engage your core and slowly lean forward while keeping your back straight.
  4. Exhale and contract your abs to bring your elbows towards your knees.
  5. Hold the contraction for a few seconds before slowly returning to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable kneeling rear delt row (with rope) (male)
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to the cable machine at the lowest setting.
  2. Kneel down facing the machine with your knees hip-width apart.
  3. Grasp the rope with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
  5. Pull the rope towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  7. Slowly lower the rope back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: cable kneeling triceps extension
instructions:
1. Attach a cable handle to a low pulley and kneel down facing away from the weight stack.
  2. Grasp the handle with both hands and bring your hands up to shoulder height, keeping your elbows close to your head and your palms facing each other.
  3. Extend your arms fully, keeping your elbows stationary and close to your head.
  4. Slowly lower the handle back down to your shoulders, keeping your elbows in the same position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable lat pulldown full range of motion
instructions:
1. Attach the cable pulley to the high position on the cable machine.
  2. Choose a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and attach the cable attachment to the pulley.
  3. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  4. Grasp the cable attachment with both hands with an overhand grip, palms facing away from you.
  5. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you pull the cable down towards your chest.
  6. As you pull the cable down, squeeze your shoulder blades together and keep your elbows close to your body.
  7. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the cable back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to maintain proper form.
  10. Once you have completed your set, release the cable attachment and return the weight to its starting position.

name: cable lateral pulldown (with rope attachment)
instructions:
1. Attach the rope attachment to the cable pulley machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the rope attachment with both hands, palms facing each other, and bring it down to your chest level.
  4. Engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  5. Exhale and pull the rope down towards your hips, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause for a moment and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  7. Inhale and slowly release the rope back to the starting position, keeping your arms straight but not locked.
  8. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully release the rope attachment and return it to its original position on the cable pulley machine.
  10. Stretch your back and shoulders to cool down.

name: cable lateral pulldown with v-bar
instructions:
1. Attach a v-bar to a cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the v-bar with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keeping your core engaged, pull the v-bar down towards your sides, bringing your elbows down and back.
  5. Pause for a moment and squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
  6. Slowly release the v-bar back up to the starting position, keeping your arms straight but elbows slightly bent.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: cable lateral raise
instructions:
