1. Attach a cable handle to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing the machine.
  3. Grasp the handle with one hand and stand with your arm straight down at your side.
  4. Slowly raise your arm out to the side, keeping it straight, until it reaches shoulder height.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your arm back down to your side.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight on the cable machine as needed to ensure proper form and technique.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each arm.

name: cable low fly
instructions:
1. Attach the cable to the lowest setting on the machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the handles of the cable with an overhand grip.
  4. With your arms slightly bent, bring your hands together in front of your body, keeping them at shoulder height.
  5. Slowly lower your hands out to the sides, keeping your arms straight but not locked.
  6. Stop when your hands are at or slightly below shoulder level.
  7. Pause for a moment, then slowly raise your hands back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, release the handles and return the cable to its starting position.

name: cable low seated row
instructions:
1. Attach a cable handle to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Sit on the bench with your feet flat on the ground, and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the handle with both hands, palms facing each other, and extend your arms straight out in front of you.
  4. Slowly pull the handle towards your torso, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
  6. Pause for a moment and then slowly return to the starting position, keeping your arms extended.
  7. Repeat for desired reps and sets.

name: cable lying bicep curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and select the appropriate weight.
  2. Lie flat on your back on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your head at the end of the bench.
  3. Grasp the cable handles with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
  4. Keep your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
  5. Slowly curl the cable handles towards your shoulders while keeping your wrists straight.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the cable handles back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Exhale as you curl the cable handles up and inhale as you lower them back down.
  9. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.

name: cable lying close-grip curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and select the desired weight.
  2. Lie down on a bench facing the cable machine and grab the cable bar with a close grip, palms facing up.
  3. Keep your upper arms stationary and curl the bar towards your chest by flexing your forearms.
  4. Pause for a second at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  5. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Once finished, carefully release the bar and sit up.
  8. Adjust the weight or rest as needed before performing another set.

name: cable lying extension pullover (with rope attachment)
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to the low pulley of a cable machine and lie down on a bench with your head at the end of the bench and your feet on the floor.
  2. Hold the rope with your hands, palms facing each other, and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Keeping your arms straight, lower the rope behind your head until your arms are parallel to the floor.
  4. Slowly raise the rope back to the starting position while keeping your arms straight.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable lying fly
instructions:
1. Attach the handles of the exercise cable to the low pulleys of a cable machine.
  2. Lie down on a flat bench with your head towards the cable machine.
  3. Grasp the handles of the cables with your palms facing each other and your arms extended above your chest.
  4. Lower your arms out to the sides in a wide arc, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  5. Stop when your hands are in line with your shoulders.
  6. Pause briefly, then slowly bring your arms back up to the starting position, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable lying triceps extension v. 2
instructions:
1. Attach a rope handle to the low pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Lie on a bench facing up, with your head at the end of the bench closest to the cable machine.
  3. Grasp the rope handle with both hands, palms facing each other and elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  4. Extend your arms straight up, keeping your elbows stationary and close to your head.
  5. Lower the rope handle back down towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary and perpendicular to the floor.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then extend your arms back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
  8. After completing your set, carefully release the rope handle and sit up slowly.

name: cable middle fly
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching two handles to the cables on a cable machine, and setting them at a height just below shoulder level.
  2. Stand in the center of the machine, facing the handles with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, with your palms facing down and your arms extended straight out to the sides.
  4. Keeping your arms straight and your core engaged, slowly bring your hands together in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles as you do so.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, aiming for 10-12 reps per set.
  7. Variations: You can adjust the height of the cables to target different areas of the chest, or use different grip styles (such as an underhand grip) to target different muscle groups.

name: cable one arm bent over row
instructions:
1. Attach a handle to a low cable pulley and stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Grab the handle with one hand and step back until your arm is fully extended and you feel tension in the cable.
  3. Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
  4. With your elbow close to your body, pull the handle towards your waist, squeezing your shoulder blade as you lift.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handle back to the starting position.
  6. Complete 8-12 repetitions on one arm before switching to the other side.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets on each arm, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  8. Adjust the weight or cable height as needed to ensure proper form and challenge.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper posture.
  10. Consult with a trainer or healthcare professional before beginning any new exercise program.

name: cable one arm curl
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching a cable handle to the lowest setting on a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handle with one hand, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Slowly curl the handle towards your shoulder, keeping your wrist straight.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your bicep.
  6. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: cable one arm decline chest fly
instructions:
1. Attach a single handle to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Lie down on a decline bench with your head at the lower end and feet at the higher end.
  3. Grab the handle with one hand and extend your arm straight up above your chest.
  4. Slowly lower your arm out to the side, keeping it slightly bent, until your hand is in line with your shoulder.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly bring your arm back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps, then switch to the other arm.
  7. Keep your core engaged and back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary to maintain proper form and challenge yourself.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets of 8-12 reps on each arm.

name: cable one arm fly on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a light to moderate weight on the cable machine and attach the handle to the low pulley.
  2. Place an exercise ball on the floor and sit on it with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Grab the handle with one hand and bring it up to shoulder height.
  4. Extend your arm out to the side, keeping a slight bend in your elbow.
  5. Bring your arm back to the starting position, making sure to control the weight as you lower it.
  6. Complete 10-12 reps on one side before switching to the other arm.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets on each arm.
  8. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight as needed to maintain proper form and challenge yourself.
  10. Stretch your arms and shoulders after completing the exercise.

name: cable one arm incline fly on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a weight that you can comfortably lift for 10-12 reps.
  2. Place an exercise ball in front of you and sit on it with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Hold the cable handle in one hand and extend your arm out to the side, keeping a slight bend in your elbow.
  4. Slowly lower your arm in an arc motion, keeping your elbow slightly bent, until your hand is in line with your shoulder.
  5. Pause for a moment and then slowly raise your arm back up to the starting position, keeping your elbow slightly bent throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for 10-12 reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the weight or reps to continue challenging your muscles.
  9. Always warm up before starting any exercise routine and consult with a trainer or doctor before trying new exercises.

name: cable one arm incline press
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and adjust the weight to your desired resistance.
  2. Stand facing away from the cable machine, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the cable with one hand and bring your arm up to shoulder height, keeping your elbow bent.
  4. Lean forward slightly and brace your core to maintain stability.
  5. Press the cable forward and up until your arm is fully extended, keeping your elbow slightly bent throughout the movement.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the cable back down to your starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with your other arm.

name: cable one arm incline press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a weight that you are comfortable with and attach it to one end of the cable machine.
  2. Position an exercise ball in front of the cable machine and sit on it with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Grasp the handle of the cable with one hand and bring it up to your shoulder level, keeping your elbow bent.
  4. Slowly press the handle upwards, extending your arm fully and keeping your core engaged.
  5. Lower the handle back down to your shoulder level, maintaining control and keeping your elbow close to your body.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
  7. Remember to breathe evenly throughout the exercise and maintain good posture.

name: cable one arm lateral bent-over
instructions:
1. Attach a cable handle to the low pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handle with one hand and step back until there is tension on the cable.
  4. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your abs engaged.
  5. Extend your arm straight down, keeping a slight bend in your elbow.
  6. Keeping your arm straight, raise it out to the side until it is parallel to the ground.
  7. Pause for a moment, then slowly lower your arm back down to the starting position.
  8. Complete the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat.

name: cable one arm lateral raise
instructions:
1. Attach a handle to a low pulley cable machine and adjust the weight to a manageable amount.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your side facing the cable machine.
  3. Grasp the handle with one hand and keep your arm straight, with a slight bend in the elbow.
  4. Slowly raise your arm to the side, keeping it parallel to the floor. Exhale as you lift the weight.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your arm back down to the starting position. Inhale as you lower the weight.
  6. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one arm before switching to the other side.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of sets.

name: cable one arm preacher curl
instructions:
1. Choose a cable machine with a preacher bench attachment.
  2. Adjust the preacher bench to your desired height and angle. Sit on the bench with your chest against the pad and your arm extended over the bench.
  3. Grasp the cable handle with an underhand grip and keep your elbow close to the pad.
  4. Slowly curl the handle towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep.
  6. Lower the handle back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching arms.

name: cable one arm press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a cable machine with a low pulley and attach a single handle to the cable.
  2. Select a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and attach the handle to the cable.
  3. Place an exercise ball in front of the cable machine and sit on the ball with your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Hold the handle with one hand and bring it up to shoulder level, keeping your elbow bent.
  5. Slowly press the handle away from your body until your arm is fully extended.
  6. Pause for a moment and then slowly bring the handle back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch arms.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight as needed and rest for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  10. When finished, carefully remove the handle from the cable and return the weight to its starting position.

name: cable one arm pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach a single handle to a high pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the handle with one hand, palm facing down.
  4. Extend your arm fully overhead, keeping your elbow close to your ear.
  5. Slowly pull the handle down towards your side, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  6. Pause for a moment when the handle is at your side.
  7. Slowly release the handle back to the starting position, fully extending your arm overhead.
  8. Repeat for desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.

name: cable one arm reverse preacher curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley machine.
  2. Choose the appropriate weight and adjust the machine accordingly.
  3. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Grasp the handle with an underhand grip and position your upper arm against the preacher bench, with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Slowly lower the weight until your arm is fully extended.
  6. Curl the weight up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm against the preacher bench.
  7. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep.
  8. Lower the weight back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching arms.

name: cable one arm straight back high row (kneeling)
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and select an appropriate weight.
  2. Kneel down facing the weight stack and grab the handle with one hand.
  3. Extend your arm straight out in front of you, keeping your back straight and abs engaged.
  4. Slowly pull the handle towards your chest while keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  6. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.

name: cable one arm tricep pushdown
instructions:
1. Attach a single handle to the cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the handle with one hand, keeping your elbow close to your body and your palm facing down.
  4. Extend your arm down until it is fully straightened, squeezing your tricep at the bottom of the movement.
  5. Slowly release the handle back up to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Complete 2-3 sets of 10-12 reps on each arm, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: cable overhead curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a high pulley and select the desired weight.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the handle with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and bring your hands up to your shoulders.
  4. Keep your elbows tucked in and stationary throughout the exercise.
  5. Exhale and curl the handle up towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  6. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  7. Inhale and slowly lower the handle back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable overhead curl on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a weight that you are comfortable with and attach it to a cable machine.
  2. Sit on an exercise ball and make sure your feet are flat on the ground.
  3. Hold the cable with both hands and extend your arms straight up above your head.
  4. Slowly curl the cable down towards your head, keeping your elbows stationary and close to your ears.
  5. Pause for a second and then slowly raise the cable back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise.
  10. When finished, carefully release the cable and stand up from the exercise ball.

name: cable overhead triceps extension (rope attachment)
instructions:
1. Attach a rope attachment to a cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing away from the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing each other, and extend your arms straight above your head.
  4. Keeping your elbows close to your head, slowly lower the rope behind your head until your forearms are parallel to the floor.
  5. Pause for a moment, then contract your triceps to bring the rope back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.

name: cable palm rotational row
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and select an appropriate weight.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handle with an overhand grip and extend your arms in front of your body.
  4. Rotate your palms to face each other.
  5. Engage your back muscles and pull the cable towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  7. Slowly release the cable back to the starting position, rotating your palms back to the starting position as you do so.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the opposite arm.

name: cable preacher curl
instructions:
1. Attach the cable to the lowest pulley on a cable machine.
  2. Choose the appropriate weight and adjust the preacher bench to a comfortable height.
  3. Place your arms on the bench and grasp the cable attachment with an underhand grip.
  4. Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the cable attachment towards your shoulders.
  5. Hold the contraction for a second and inhale as you slowly lower the cable back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
  8. Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise and avoid swinging or using momentum to lift the weight.
  9. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  10. Stretch your biceps after completing the exercise to prevent soreness and promote flexibility.

name: cable press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a set of dumbbells that you can comfortably lift for the desired number of reps.
  2. Place an exercise ball on the floor and position yourself on the ball so that your lower back is supported and your feet are planted firmly on the ground.
  3. Grasp the handles of the cable machine and bring them to your chest level, with your elbows bent and your palms facing down.
  4. Press the handles away from your body, extending your arms fully, while keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Slowly lower the handles back to your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.

name: cable pull through (with rope)
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching a rope to a cable machine at the lowest setting.
  2. Stand facing away from the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the rope with both hands and bring it between your legs, keeping your arms straight and your core engaged.
  4. Slowly stand up, pulling the rope through your legs and extending your hips forward until you are standing upright.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the rope back down between your legs, bending at the hips and keeping your back straight.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar or rope to the high pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Adjust the weight to a comfortable level.
  3. Stand facing the cable machine and grab the bar or rope with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Step back a few feet to create tension on the cable.
  5. Keep your chest lifted and your core engaged.
  6. Exhale as you pull the bar or rope down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  7. Pause at the bottom of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  8. Inhale as you slowly release the bar or rope back to the starting position.
  9. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: cable pulldown (pro lat bar)
instructions:
1. Attach the pro lat bar to the cable pulley machine at the top position.
  2. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart and grab the bar with an overhand grip that is wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. While keeping your back straight and core engaged, pull the bar down towards your chest by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  4. Pause for a second at the bottom of the movement and then slowly release the bar back to the starting position, making sure to keep your arms straight but not locked.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. When finished, carefully release the bar and step away from the machine.

name: cable pulldown bicep curl
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar to the cable machine and adjust the weight to your desired resistance.
  2. Stand facing the machine and grasp the bar with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step back slightly, keeping your arms extended and your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your biceps and pull the bar down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  6. Slowly release the bar back to the starting position, keeping your arms extended but not locked out.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: cable pushdown
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar or rope to the high pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the bar or rope with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keep your elbows close to your body and your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
  5. Exhale and push the bar or rope downward, extending your elbows until your arms are fully extended.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then inhale and slowly return to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable pushdown (straight arm) v. 2
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar to a high pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing down.
  4. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you slowly push the bar down towards your thighs, exhaling as you do so.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return the bar to the starting position, inhaling as you do so.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable pushdown (with rope attachment)
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to the cable machine at the highest possible position.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the rope with an overhand grip, with your palms facing down and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keep your elbows tucked in close to your sides, and your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
  5. Exhale and pull the rope down towards your thighs, extending your elbows fully.
  6. Pause for a moment, then inhale and slowly return the rope to the starting position, keeping tension on the cable throughout the movement.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable rear delt row (stirrups)
instructions:
1. Attach the stirrup handles to the low pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms in front of you.
  4. Keeping your back straight, pull your elbows back and squeeze your shoulder blades together as you bring the handles towards your chest.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.

name: cable rear delt row (with rope)
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to a cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
  4. Keeping your back straight, lean forward slightly at the hips.
  5. Pull the rope towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  7. Slowly release the rope back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: cable rear drive
instructions:
1. Attach the cable to the low pulley on a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the handle with both hands and extend your arms forward.
  4. Slowly pull the handle back towards your hips while keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the end of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch sides and repeat the exercise on the other side.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary to ensure proper form and challenge.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions for optimal results.

name: cable rear pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to the pulldown machine and adjust the weight according to your fitness level.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the cable with an overhand grip, with your hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keeping your back straight and your chest up, pull the cable down towards your chest by contracting your shoulder blades.
  5. Pause for a moment when the cable reaches your chest.
  6. Slowly release the cable back to the starting position, keeping your arms straight but not locked.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When you are finished, release the cable and step away from the machine.

name: cable reverse crunch
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and lie down on your back facing away from the machine.
  2. Hold the cable with both hands above your head and keep your arms straight.
  3. Bend your knees and raise your legs up until your thighs are perpendicular to the floor and your calves are parallel to the floor.
  4. Slowly curl your hips towards your chest, lifting your butt off the floor and contracting your abs.
  5. Hold the contraction for a second and then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable reverse curl
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar or rope to the low pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the bar or rope with an overhand grip (palms facing down).
  4. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, curl the bar or rope towards your shoulders.
  5. Pause at the top of the motion, then slowly lower the bar or rope back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch to an underhand grip (palms facing up) to target the biceps in a slightly different way.

name: cable reverse grip triceps pushdown (sz-bar) (with arm blaster)
instructions:
1. Attach the sz-bar to the cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Attach the arm blaster to your upper arms to isolate your triceps.
  3. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back straight.
  4. Grasp the sz-bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up) and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  5. Bring your elbows close to your sides and keep them stationary throughout the exercise.
  6. Slowly push the sz-bar down towards your thighs, squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
  7. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement before slowly raising the sz-bar back up to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. Remember to keep your back straight and avoid swinging your body throughout the exercise.
  10. Once finished, detach the arm blaster and return the sz-bar to its starting position on the cable machine.

name: cable reverse one arm curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Attach a cable to a low pulley and hold the handle with one hand.
  3. Step back until there is tension on the cable. Keep your elbow close to your body and your palm facing down.
  4. Curl your hand towards your shoulder while keeping your elbow stationary.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep.
  6. Lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps and then switch arms.

name: cable reverse preacher curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley machine and adjust the weight according to your strength level.
  2. Sit on the preacher bench facing the machine and adjust the height of the seat so that your armpits are resting comfortably on the top of the pad.
  3. Grasp the cable with an underhand grip and place your arms straight in front of you, resting your elbows on the pad.
  4. Slowly curl the cable towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary and close to the pad.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the cable back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.
  8. When finished, carefully release the cable and stand up from the bench.
  9. Stretch your biceps and forearms to cool down and prevent injury.

name: cable reverse wrist curl
instructions:
1. Attach a handle to the low pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the handle with an overhand grip and extend your arms straight in front of you.
  4. Keeping your arms stationary, flex your wrists to pull the handle towards your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handle back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch to an underhand grip and repeat the exercise to work the muscles on the other side of your forearms.
  8. Remember to keep your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
  9. Use a weight that allows you to maintain proper form and complete the desired number of repetitions.
  10. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions as part of your forearm and grip strength training routine.

name: cable reverse-grip pushdown
instructions:
1. Attach a rope attachment to the high pulley of a cable machine.
  2. Adjust the weight on the machine to a suitable amount.
  3. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  4. Grasp the rope attachment with an underhand grip (palms facing up).
  5. Keep your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
  6. Extend your arms downward, pushing the rope attachment towards your thighs.
  7. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement and squeeze your triceps.
  8. Slowly release the rope attachment back up to the starting position.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable reverse-grip straight back seated high row
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar attachment to the cable machine at a high position.
  2. Sit on the bench facing the cable machine and place your feet on the footrests.
  3. Grab the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up).
  4. Sit up straight with your back against the pad and your arms extended in front of you.
  5. Exhale and pull the bar towards your upper abs, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause for a moment and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  7. Inhale and slowly release the bar back to the starting position with your arms extended in front of you.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable rope crossover seated row
instructions:
1. Attach the cable rope to a low pulley on a cable machine.
  2. Sit down on the bench facing the machine and place your feet on the footrests.
  3. Grab the cable ropes with an overhand grip, one in each hand.
  4. Keep your arms straight and pull the ropes towards your chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Hold the contraction for a few seconds and then slowly release the ropes back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. After completing the desired number of reps, switch the position of your hands on the cables so that they are now in an underhand grip.
  8. Repeat the exercise, pulling the cables towards your chest and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  9. Hold the contraction for a few seconds and then slowly release the ropes back to the starting position.
  10. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  11. When finished, carefully release the cables and stand up from the bench.

name: cable rope elevated seated row
instructions:
1. Attach a cable rope to a cable machine at a high position.
  2. Grab the ends of the rope with an overhand grip.
  3. Sit on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
  4. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Pull the rope towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.
  6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the rope back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable rope extension incline bench row
instructions:
1. Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle and attach a cable rope to a low pulley on a cable machine.
  2. Grasp the rope with both hands and sit on the incline bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Lean forward and extend your arms straight out in front of you, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Slowly pull the rope towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the rope back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the opposite arm.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary and repeat the exercise for 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

name: cable rope hammer preacher curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable rope to a low pulley machine.
  2. Select a weight that you are comfortable with.
  3. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Grasp the cable rope with both hands and bring it up to your chest level.
  5. Position your elbows on the preacher bench with your upper arms parallel to the floor.
  6. Ensure your palms are facing each other and your wrists are in a neutral position.
  7. Slowly curl the cable rope towards your shoulders while keeping your upper arms stationary.
  8. Hold the contraction for a second and then slowly lower the cable rope back to the starting position.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  10. Switch hands and repeat the exercise for the other arm.

name: cable rope high pulley overhead tricep extension
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to a high pulley and adjust the weight to a comfortable level.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the rope with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
  4. Bring your arms up and overhead, keeping your elbows close to your ears and your upper arms stationary.
  5. Slowly lower the rope behind your head, keeping your elbows stationary and your forearms parallel to the floor.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the rope back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable rope incline tricep extension
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to the cable machine at the highest pulley position.
  2. Stand facing the machine and grab the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
  3. Step back a few feet and lean forward, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Keep your elbows close to your head and slowly lower the rope behind your head, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  5. Pause for a moment when your forearms are parallel to the ground.
  6. Slowly raise the rope back to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable rope lying on floor tricep extension
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold the cable rope with both hands, palms facing each other, and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Lower the cable rope behind your head while keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your head.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the cable rope back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable rope one arm hammer preacher curl
instructions:
1. Stand in front of a cable machine with a rope attachment at the lowest setting.
  2. Attach the rope to the cable and hold it with one hand.
  3. Place the back of your arm against the preacher bench and hold onto the bench with your other hand for support.
  4. Keep your elbow close to your body and curl the rope towards your shoulder.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and slowly lower the rope back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch arms.

name: cable rope seated row
instructions:
1. Attach the cable rope to a low pulley machine.
  2. Sit on the bench with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent.
  3. Grab the cable rope with an overhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lean forward slightly, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  5. Pull the cable towards your body, keeping your elbows close to your sides and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release the cable back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, carefully release the cable and stand up from the bench.

name: cable russian twists (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Hold the exercise cable with both hands and extend your arms out in front of you at shoulder height.
  3. Engage your core and slowly rotate your torso to the right, bringing the cable towards your right hip.
  4. Pause for a moment, then rotate back to the center, keeping your arms extended.
  5. Rotate to the left, bringing the cable towards your left hip.
  6. Pause for a moment, then rotate back to the center.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability on the stability ball.
  9. Adjust the weight of the cable as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  10. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise.

name: cable seated chest press
instructions:
1. Adjust the cable machine to a comfortable height, usually around chest level.
  2. Choose the appropriate weight for your fitness level and attach the handles to the cable.
  3. Sit on the bench facing the cable machine and grasp the handles with an overhand grip.
  4. Keep your feet flat on the floor and your back straight against the bench.
  5. Bring the handles towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  8. To increase the difficulty, you can adjust the weight or use a narrower grip on the handles.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, exhaling as you push the handles away from your chest and inhaling as you bring them back in.
  10. After completing your set, carefully release the handles and stand up from the bench.

name: cable seated crunch
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and sit on a bench facing the cable machine.
  2. Grab the cable with both hands and bring it to the back of your neck, keeping your elbows bent.
  3. Slowly lean back until your abs engage and your back is at a 45-degree angle with the ground.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly sit up while contracting your abs.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and avoid using momentum to complete the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you crunch up and inhale as you lower back down to the starting position.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to ensure proper form and challenge.
  9. Finish your set, then release the cable and rest.

name: cable seated curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Attach a cable handle to a low pulley on a cable machine.
  3. Grasp the handle with an underhand grip and bring it up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  5. Slowly lower the handle back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch arms and repeat the exercise with the other arm.

name: cable seated high row (v-bar)
instructions:
1. Attach a v-bar to the cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Sit on the bench facing the cable machine and place your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Grab the v-bar with an overhand grip, making sure your hands are shoulder-width apart.
  4. Sit up straight and pull your shoulders back.
  5. Begin the exercise by pulling the v-bar towards your chest while keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause for a second at the top of the movement and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  7. Slowly lower the v-bar back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.
  10. When finished, carefully release the v-bar and stand up.

name: cable seated one arm alternate row
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching a handle to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Sit on a bench facing the machine with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Grab the handle with one hand and keep your arm extended straight down towards the floor.
  4. Engage your core and pull the handle towards your torso, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the handle back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Ensure that your back remains straight throughout the exercise and that you are not using momentum to complete the movement.
  8. Exhale as you pull the handle towards your torso and inhale as you lower it back down.
  9. Adjust the weight on the machine as necessary to achieve the appropriate level of resistance.
  10. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each arm as part of your upper body strength training routine.

name: cable seated one arm concentration curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Attach a cable to a low pulley machine and sit facing the machine.
  3. Grasp the cable handle with one hand and bring it up towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your bicep.
  5. Slowly lower the cable back down to the starting position.
  6. Complete 8-12 repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets on each arm.

name: cable seated overhead curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley machine and sit on a bench facing the machine.
  2. Grasp the handle with an underhand grip and bring it up to shoulder level, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your sides.
  3. Exhale and curl the handle up towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  5. Inhale and slowly lower the handle back down to starting position, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your sides.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  7. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: cable seated rear lateral raise
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair facing the cable machine with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Grasp the handle of the cable with your right hand and bring it across your body so that it is in front of your left shoulder.
  3. Keep your elbow slightly bent and your wrist straight.
  4. Slowly raise your right arm out to the side until it is parallel to the ground.
  5. Pause for a second at the top of the movement and then slowly lower your arm back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch sides.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight on the cable machine as necessary to ensure that you are able to perform the exercise with proper form.
  9. Complete 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each side.

name: cable seated row
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the bench in front of the cable machine, with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Grasp the handle of the cable attachment with both hands, making sure your grip is secure.
  3. Lean forward slightly, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Pull the cable attachment towards your body, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your shoulders down and back.
  5. Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull the cable attachment towards your body.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release the cable attachment back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, and to breathe deeply and steadily as you perform each repetition.
  9. Once you have completed your set, carefully release the cable attachment and stand up from the bench.
  10. Stretch your back and shoulders to cool down and prevent injury.

name: cable seated shoulder internal rotation
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and sit on a bench facing the machine.
  2. Grasp the cable handle with your right hand and place your elbow on the inside of your right thigh.
  3. Keep your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle and your forearm parallel to the ground.
  4. Exhale and slowly rotate your shoulder inward, bringing your hand toward your stomach.
  5. Inhale and slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch sides.

name: cable seated twist
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Attach a cable handle to a low pulley cable machine and sit facing the machine.
  3. Grasp the handle with both hands and extend your arms in front of your body.
  4. Slowly twist your torso to one side, keeping your arms straight and parallel to the ground.
  5. Pause for a moment at the end of the movement, then slowly twist back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the movement, twisting to the opposite side.
  7. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable seated wide-grip row
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar to a cable machine and sit on the bench with your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Grab the bar with an overhand grip that is wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lean forward slightly and keep your back straight.
  4. With your arms extended, pull the bar towards your chest by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly release the bar back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your elbows close to your sides throughout the exercise and avoid using momentum to complete the movement.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. Stretch your back and shoulders after completing the exercise.

name: cable shoulder press
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching the cable to a high pulley and selecting the desired weight.
  2. Stand facing away from the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the cable handles with both hands and bring them up to shoulder height, with your elbows bent and pointing outwards.
  4. Push the handles upwards and away from your body, extending your arms fully and bringing the handles together at the top of the movement.
  5. Hold for a brief moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handles back down to shoulder height, keeping your elbows out to the sides.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.

name: cable shrug
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching a cable to a low pulley machine and selecting the desired weight.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and a slight bend in your elbows.
  3. Grasp the cable with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. With your shoulders relaxed, shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, keeping your arms straight.
  5. Hold the shrug for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: cable side bend
instructions:
1. Begin by attaching a cable to a low pulley and selecting an appropriate weight.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the handle with one hand.
  3. Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, slowly bend to the side away from the cable.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, feeling a stretch in your oblique muscles.
  5. Slowly return to the starting position, keeping your core engaged throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on one side before switching to the other side.

name: cable side bend crunch (bosu ball)
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a cable handle in your right hand.
  2. Place your left foot on top of a Bosu ball, and rest your left hand on your hip.
  3. Engage your core and slowly bend your torso to the right, bringing the cable handle towards your right knee.
  4. Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
  5. Complete 10-12 repetitions on the right side, then switch sides and repeat on the left.
  6. For an added challenge, increase the weight of the cable or add more repetitions.

name: cable side crunch
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and select the desired weight.
  2. Stand sideways to the cable with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handle with the hand closest to the cable and place your other hand on your hip.
  4. Keeping your back straight and your abs engaged, pull the cable towards your hip while bending sideways.
  5. Pause for a moment and then slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one side before switching to the other side.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of sets.

name: cable squat row (with rope attachment)
instructions:
1. Attach the rope attachment to the cable machine at the lowest setting.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grab the rope with both hands, palms facing each other, and bring it towards your chest.
  4. Squat down as if you were sitting in a chair, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
  5. As you stand back up, pull the rope towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Lower the rope back down to the starting position as you squat down again.
  7. Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: cable squatting curl
instructions:
1. Attach the cable handle to the lowest setting on the cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold the cable handle with both hands, palms facing up.
  4. Squat down, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
  5. As you stand back up, curl the cable handle towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Lower the cable handle back down as you squat back down.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable standing back wrist curl
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and select the desired weight.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the cable with an overhand grip and extend your arms straight in front of you.
  4. Keeping your elbows stationary, curl your wrists back towards your body.
  5. Pause for a moment and then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch to an underhand grip and repeat the exercise to target the muscles on the other side of your forearm.

name: cable standing calf raise
instructions:
1. Attach the cable to the lowest setting on the cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold onto the cable with both hands and lift it so that it is taut.
  4. Slowly raise your heels off the ground, keeping your legs straight.
  5. Hold for a moment at the top of the movement.
  6. Slowly lower your heels back down to the ground.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable standing cross-over high reverse fly
instructions:
1. Attach a handle to each side of a cable machine and adjust the pulleys to the highest position.
  2. Stand in the center of the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
  4. Keeping your arms straight, cross one arm over the other in front of your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position and repeat with the opposite arm crossing over.
  6. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and avoid swinging your body during the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight on the machine as needed to maintain proper form and challenge yourself.
  9. Stretch your shoulders and upper back after completing the exercise.

name: cable standing crunch
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a high pulley and select an appropriate weight.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine and grab the handle with both hands, palms facing down.
  3. Step back a few feet to create tension in the cable.
  4. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and keep your knees slightly bent.
  5. Bring your elbows to your sides and engage your core muscles.
  6. Exhale and crunch your torso down towards your knees, keeping your arms and elbows close to your body.
  7. Inhale and slowly return to the starting position, keeping tension on the cable throughout the movement.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable standing crunch (with rope attachment)
instructions:
1. Attach the rope attachment to a high pulley on a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine and grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
  3. Step back a few feet to create tension in the cable.
  4. Engage your core muscles and bend your elbows to bring the rope down towards your forehead.
  5. As you bring the rope down, simultaneously crunch your upper body forward, bringing your elbows towards your knees.
  6. Hold the contraction for a second or two before slowly returning to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: cable standing fly
instructions:
1. Attach the handles to the cable machine at the desired height.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and a slight bend in your knees.
  3. Grab the handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
  4. Keep your elbows slightly bent and your palms facing forward.
  5. Engage your chest muscles and slowly bring the handles together in front of your body, keeping your arms straight but not locked.
  6. Hold the contraction for a second and then slowly release back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight as needed to challenge yourself while maintaining proper form.
  10. When finished, carefully release the handles and step away from the cable machine.

name: cable standing hip extension
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and adjust the weight according to your fitness level.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold onto the cable with one hand for support.
  4. Shift your weight onto one leg and lift the opposite leg off the ground slightly.
  5. Keeping your core tight, extend your lifted leg straight back behind you while squeezing your glutes.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  7. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one leg before switching to the other leg.

name: cable standing inner curl
instructions:
1. Attach a handle to the lowest setting on a cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the handle with an underhand grip and keep your elbows close to your body.
  4. Curl the handle towards your chest by bending your elbows.
  5. Hold the contraction for a moment and slowly lower the handle back down to starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps and switch arms.

name: cable standing lift
instructions:
1. Start by attaching a handle to a cable machine at the lowest setting, making sure it is secure.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handle with one hand, keeping your arm straight and your palm facing inwards towards your body.
  4. Slowly lift the handle up towards your shoulder, keeping your arm straight and your elbow locked in place.
  5. Hold the handle at shoulder height for a few seconds, then slowly lower it back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe steadily.
  8. Adjust the weight of the cable machine as needed to increase or decrease the intensity of the exercise.
  9. Once you have completed your set, release the handle and step away from the cable machine.

name: cable standing one arm triceps extension
instructions:
1. Attach a single handle to a cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing away from the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Reach behind your head with one arm and grasp the handle with an overhand grip.
  4. Extend your arm fully, keeping it close to your head.
  5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position, bending at the elbow.
  6. Complete 10-12 reps on one arm before switching to the other side.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: cable standing one leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and select an appropriate weight.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Place your left foot slightly behind your right foot, keeping your left heel off the ground.
  4. Hold onto the cable with your right hand and place your left hand on your hip.
  5. Slowly raise your right heel off the ground, keeping your knee straight.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your calf muscles.
  7. Slowly lower your heel back down to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch to the other leg.

name: cable standing pulldown (with rope)
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to the cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
  4. Keep your arms straight and pull the rope down towards your thighs, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the rope back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.

name: cable standing rear delt row (with rope)
instructions:
1. Start by attaching a rope to a cable machine at the lowest setting.
  2. Grab the rope with both hands and stand facing the machine.
  3. Take a few steps back to create tension in the cable.
  4. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  5. Keeping your core engaged, pull the rope towards your chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Be sure to keep your elbows close to your body throughout the exercise.
  9. To increase the intensity, you can use a heavier weight or perform the exercise with one arm at a time.
  10. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: cable standing reverse grip one arm overhead tricep extension
instructions:
1. Attach a handle to the cable machine at a high position.
  2. Grab the handle with an underhand grip (palms facing up).
  3. Step away from the cable machine and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Extend your arm overhead, keeping your elbow close to your head.
  5. Slowly lower the weight behind your head by bending your elbow.
  6. Pause when your forearm is parallel to the ground.
  7. Extend your arm back to the starting position, squeezing your tricep at the top of the movement.
  8. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of sets.
  10. Adjust the weight as necessary to challenge yourself but maintain proper form.

name: cable standing row (v-bar)
instructions:
1. Attach a v-bar to a cable machine at a height that allows you to comfortably stand with your arms extended.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and core engaged.
  3. Grasp the v-bar with an overhand grip, palms facing each other, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keeping your back straight and your elbows close to your body, pull the v-bar towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the v-bar back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, release the v-bar and step away from the cable machine.

name: cable standing shoulder external rotation
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a pulley at shoulder height.
  2. Stand perpendicular to the pulley with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the cable handle with your far hand, keeping your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle and your upper arm parallel to the floor.
  4. Keep your core engaged and your shoulder blades pulled down and back.
  5. Slowly rotate your arm away from your body, keeping your elbow tucked in and your upper arm stationary.
  6. Pause at the end of the range of motion, then slowly return to the starting position.
  7. Complete 10-12 reps on one side before switching to the other side.
  8. Perform 2-3 sets of the exercise with a rest period of 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: cable standing twist row (v-bar)
instructions:
1. Attach a v-bar to a cable machine at chest height.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the v-bar with both hands, palms facing each other, and extend your arms fully in front of you.
  4. Keeping your core engaged, twist your torso to the right and pull the v-bar towards your right hip, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Slowly return to the starting position with arms extended in front of you.
  6. Repeat the twist and row motion on the left side.
  7. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable standing up straight crossovers
instructions:
1. Attach two cable handles to the high pulleys of a cable machine.
  2. Stand in the middle of the machine, facing away from the pulleys.
  3. Grab the handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms out to the sides, parallel to the floor.
  4. Bring your arms together in front of your body, crossing the cables in the middle.
  5. Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position, keeping them straight and parallel to the floor.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Vary the resistance by adjusting the weight on the cable machine.

name: cable straight arm pulldown
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar to the cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing the machine and grip the bar with both hands using an overhand grip.
  3. Extend your arms fully and keep them straight throughout the exercise.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and pull the bar down towards your thighs, keeping your arms straight.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the bar back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Focus on keeping your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to ensure proper form and challenge.

name: cable straight arm pulldown (with rope)
instructions:
1. Attach a rope to the cable machine at the highest setting.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grab the rope with both hands, palms facing each other, and extend your arms straight out in front of you.
  4. Keeping your arms straight, pull the rope down towards your thighs by contracting your lats and shoulder blades.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the rope back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.

name: cable straight back seated row
instructions:
1. Attach a straight bar or rope to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Sit on the bench facing the machine, with your feet flat on the floor and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the bar or rope with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  5. Begin by pulling the bar or rope towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Pause when the bar or rope is close to your chest, then slowly return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to make the exercise more challenging or easier.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, exhaling as you pull the bar or rope towards your chest.
  10. Gradually increase the weight and reps as your strength and endurance improve.

name: cable supine reverse fly
instructions:
1. Adjust the cable machine to the appropriate weight and attach the D-handles to the cables.
  2. Lie down on a bench facing up with your feet flat on the ground and your head resting comfortably on the bench.
  3. Grasp the D-handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  4. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lower the cables out to the side of your body, bringing your hands to just below shoulder level.
  5. Pause briefly and then slowly raise your arms back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Variations: You can also perform this exercise standing up, or with one arm at a time for a unilateral workout.

name: cable thibaudeau kayak row
instructions:
1. Attach a cable or resistance band to a low anchor point, such as a sturdy pole or weight plate.
  2. Sit on the floor facing the anchor point, with your legs straight out in front of you and your feet against the base of the anchor point.
  3. Grasp the cable or resistance band with both hands, with your palms facing each other and your arms extended straight out in front of you.
  4. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  5. Begin the rowing motion by pulling the cable or resistance band towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. As you pull the cable or resistance band towards your chest, twist your torso towards the side of the arm that is pulling.
  7. Pause briefly at the top of the motion, squeezing your shoulder blades together and keeping your core engaged.
  8. Slowly release the cable or resistance band back to the starting position, twisting your torso back to center as you go.
  9. Repeat the rowing motion for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat on the other side.

name: cable triceps pushdown (v-bar)
instructions:
1. Attach a v-bar to the cable machine at the high pulley.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the v-bar with an overhand grip, keeping your hands close together.
  4. Position your elbows at your sides, with your forearms parallel to the ground.
  5. Push the v-bar down towards the floor, using only your triceps to extend your arms.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, squeezing your triceps.
  7. Slowly release the v-bar back to the starting position, keeping your elbows at your sides.
  8. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: cable triceps pushdown (v-bar) (with arm blaster)
instructions:
1. Attach the v-bar to the cable machine and adjust the weight to your desired resistance.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the v-bar with an overhand grip and bring your elbows to your sides, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  4. If using an arm blaster, place it around your upper arms and secure it in place.
  5. Exhale and extend your arms down, keeping your elbows close to your body, until your arms are fully extended.
  6. Inhale and slowly return the v-bar to the starting position by bending your elbows.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable tuck reverse crunch
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a high pulley and adjust the weight to your desired resistance.
  2. Stand facing the cable machine and hold onto the handle with both hands, arms extended straight in front of you.
  3. Step back until your arms are fully extended and there is tension on the cable.
  4. Bend your knees and lift your feet off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
  5. As you bring your knees towards your chest, contract your abs and curl your hips off the ground, rounding your lower back.
  6. Hold the contraction for a second and then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: cable twist
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a low pulley and stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hold the cable handle with both hands and extend your arms straight out in front of you.
  3. Keeping your arms straight, twist your torso to the left as far as you can go without moving your hips.
  4. Hold the contraction for a second and then slowly twist back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the movement, this time twisting your torso to the right.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your abs engaged throughout the movement and avoid using momentum to twist.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary and perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions.

name: cable twist (up-down)
instructions:
1. Attach a cable to a high pulley and stand facing the machine.
  2. Grasp the handle with both hands and step away from the machine, keeping your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Extend your arms straight up above your head, keeping your elbows locked in place.
  4. Slowly twist your torso to one side, keeping your hips facing forward and your arms straight. Exhale as you twist.
  5. Pause briefly at the end of the twist, then slowly return to the starting position. Inhale as you return.
  6. Repeat the twist on the opposite side, exhaling as you twist and inhaling as you return to the starting position.
  7. Continue alternating twists for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable twisting pull
instructions:
1. Attach a cable handle to a high pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing the machine.
  3. Grasp the handle with both hands, palms facing down.
  4. Extend your arms out in front of you, keeping them parallel to the floor.
  5. Slowly twist your torso to the right, pulling the handle across your body until it's next to your right hip.
  6. Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the movement to the left side, pulling the handle across your body to your left hip.
  8. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps.
  9. Keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  10. Avoid using momentum to swing the handle across your body.

name: cable two arm curl on incline bench
instructions:
1. Set up an incline bench with the cable machine positioned at the bottom of the bench.
  2. Attach two single handles to the cable machine.
  3. Adjust the weight on the cable machine to your desired resistance.
  4. Sit on the incline bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  5. Grasp the handles with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
  6. Lean back on the incline bench, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  7. With your elbows close to your sides, curl the handles towards your shoulders, keeping your wrists straight.
  8. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handles back down to the starting position.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  10. When finished, carefully release the handles and sit up on the incline bench.
  11. Adjust the weight on the cable machine or rest for a moment before beginning your next set.

name: cable two arm tricep kickback
instructions:
1. Attach a cable handle to a low pulley cable machine.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the cable handle with both hands and bring it up to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  4. Extend your arms back behind you, keeping your elbows stationary and your palms facing down.
