  3. Grab the dumbbells and lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Hold the dumbbells with your palms facing forward and your arms extended above your chest.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle from your body.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then push the dumbbells back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. After completing your set, carefully place the dumbbells on the ground and sit up slowly.
  9. Rest for a minute or two before starting your next set.
  10. Remember to breathe evenly throughout the exercise and maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: dumbbell incline curl
instructions:
1. Start by selecting two dumbbells of equal weight and adjusting an incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  2. Stand facing the bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended down towards the floor, holding the dumbbells in each hand with an underhand grip.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your palms facing upwards.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement for a brief moment, squeezing your biceps and ensuring that your shoulders remain stationary.
  5. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, keeping your arms fully extended and your back straight throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, ensuring that you maintain proper form and control throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell incline curl v. 2
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a pair of dumbbells that you can comfortably lift for 8-12 reps.
  2. Adjust an incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  3. Grab the dumbbells and lie back on the bench with your feet flat on the floor.
  4. Start with your arms fully extended and palms facing forward.
  5. Slowly curl the weights towards your shoulders while keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  7. Lower the weights back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid swinging your arms to lift the weights.
  10. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the dumbbells on the floor and sit up on the bench.

name: dumbbell incline fly
instructions:
1. Start by adjusting the incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  2. Grab a pair of dumbbells and lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Hold the dumbbells with your palms facing each other and your arms extended above your chest.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  5. Lower the dumbbells until your arms are parallel to the ground.
  6. Pause for a moment, then slowly raise the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower the dumbbells and exhaling as you raise them.
  10. When you're finished, carefully place the dumbbells on the ground and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell incline fly on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose dumbbells of an appropriate weight for your fitness level.
  2. Sit on an exercise ball and walk your feet forward until your head, shoulders, and upper back are resting on the ball.
  3. Hold the dumbbells with your palms facing each other and your arms extended above your chest.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides, keeping your arms slightly bent at the elbows.
  5. Stop when your arms are level with your shoulders.
  6. Pause for a moment, then slowly lift the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain balance on the ball.
  9. Exhale as you lift the dumbbells and inhale as you lower them.
  10. After completing the exercise, carefully sit up and step off the exercise ball.

name: dumbbell incline hammer curl
instructions:
1. Start by adjusting a bench to a 45-degree angle.
  2. Grab a pair of dumbbells and sit on the bench with your back against the pad.
  3. Hold the dumbbells in a neutral grip (palms facing each other) with your arms extended straight down and elbows close to your sides.
  4. Slowly curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary and squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
  5. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back against the pad and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the dumbbells on the ground and adjust the bench back to its original position.

name: dumbbell incline hammer press
instructions:
1. Begin by adjusting the bench to an incline of 30-45 degrees.
  2. Grab a pair of dumbbells and sit on the bench with your back against the pad.
  3. Plant your feet firmly on the ground and keep your back straight.
  4. Hold the dumbbells in each hand with your palms facing each other and your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Slowly press the dumbbells up towards the ceiling, keeping your palms facing each other throughout the movement.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to keep your core engaged.
  9. When you are finished, carefully place the dumbbells on the ground and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell incline hammer press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Place an exercise ball on the floor and sit on it with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other.
  3. Lie back on the exercise ball with your head and shoulders resting on the ball.
  4. Bend your elbows and bring the dumbbells to your chest.
  5. Extend your arms and press the dumbbells up towards the ceiling.
  6. Lower the dumbbells back to your chest and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge yourself without compromising form.
  9. Remember to breathe in as you lower the dumbbells and breathe out as you press them up.
  10. Finish the exercise by lowering the dumbbells back to your chest and sitting up on the exercise ball.

name: dumbbell incline inner biceps curl
instructions:
1. Start by selecting a pair of dumbbells that are appropriate for your strength level. Sit on an incline bench with your back against the bench and your feet firmly on the ground.
  2. Hold the dumbbells with an underhand grip and let your arms hang straight down with your palms facing forward.
  3. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement and hold for a second.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your back flat against the bench and avoid swinging your arms or using momentum to lift the weights.
  8. You can also vary the angle of the bench to target different parts of your biceps.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.

name: dumbbell incline one arm fly
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level and goals.
  2. Adjust the incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  4. Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing inward and your arm extended straight up above your chest.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell out to the side, keeping your arm straight and your palm facing inward.
  6. Lower the weight until your arm is parallel to the ground.
  7. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the weight back up to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat the exercise on the opposite side.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  10. Exhale as you lift the weight and inhale as you lower it.
  11. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.

name: dumbbell incline one arm fly on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell weight that you are comfortable with and can easily lift.
  2. Place an exercise ball in front of you and sit on it with your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Slowly walk your feet forward, rolling the ball down your back until your head, neck, and shoulders are supported by the ball.
  4. Hold the dumbbell in one hand, with your arm extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell out to the side, keeping your arm straight and parallel to the ground.
  6. Pause when your arm is parallel to the ground and then slowly raise the dumbbell back up towards the ceiling, keeping your arm straight.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your hips level throughout the exercise.
  9. Exhale as you lift the dumbbell and inhale as you lower it down.
  10. Remember to take breaks as needed and stop if you experience any pain or discomfort.

name: dumbbell incline one arm hammer press
instructions:
1. Start by setting up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle and positioning a dumbbell on each side of the bench.
  2. With your feet planted firmly on the ground, sit down on the bench and pick up one of the dumbbells with an overhand grip.
  3. Bring the dumbbell up to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Press the dumbbell up and away from your body, keeping your wrist straight and your elbow slightly bent.
  5. Lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder in a controlled manner.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm.
  7. When you have completed the desired number of repetitions for both arms, place the dumbbells back on the ground and stand up from the bench.

name: dumbbell incline one arm hammer press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell that is appropriate for your fitness level and goals.
  2. Place an exercise ball on a flat surface and sit on the ball with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Roll your body forward until your back is resting comfortably on the ball and your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle.
  4. Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing inward towards your body.
  5. Extend your arm straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbow slightly bent.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  7. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then press the dumbbell back up towards the ceiling.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  9. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  10. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.

name: dumbbell incline one arm lateral raise
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level.
  2. Adjust the incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  3. Place the dumbbell on the floor next to the bench.
  4. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported and your feet firmly on the ground.
  5. Grasp the dumbbell with one hand and extend your arm straight down towards the floor.
  6. Slowly lift the dumbbell up and out to the side, keeping your arm straight and your elbow slightly bent.
  7. Continue lifting until your arm is parallel to the ground.
  8. Pause for a moment and then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  9. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
  10. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell incline one arm press
instructions:
1. Start by lying on an incline bench with a dumbbell in one hand, resting on your chest.
  2. Position your feet firmly on the ground and engage your core muscles.
  3. Extend your arm upwards, pushing the dumbbell towards the ceiling.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to your chest.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch arms.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your wrist straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the incline bench to increase or decrease the difficulty of the exercise.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the movement and maintain proper form.

name: dumbbell incline one arm press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and goals.
  2. Place an exercise ball on a flat surface and sit on it with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing inward and extend your arm straight up towards the ceiling.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest while keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then press the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you press the dumbbell up and inhale as you lower it down.
  9. Remember to always use proper form and technique to avoid injury.

name: dumbbell incline palm-in press
instructions:
1. Start by lying on an incline bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inwards towards your body.
  3. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  4. Lower the dumbbells down towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then push the dumbbells back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and keep your core engaged to maintain proper form.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the dumbbells back on the floor and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell incline press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a pair of dumbbells that are appropriate for your strength level.
  2. Place an exercise ball in front of a flat bench.
  3. Sit on the exercise ball and slowly walk your feet forward until your upper back is resting on the bench and your hips are lifted.
  4. Hold the dumbbells with an overhand grip and position them at shoulder level with your elbows bent and your palms facing forward.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest while keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle from your body.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then press the dumbbells back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully lower the dumbbells to your sides and sit up on the exercise ball.

name: dumbbell incline raise
instructions:
1. Start by selecting a pair of dumbbells that are appropriate for your fitness level.
  2. Adjust the incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground and your head at the top of the bench.
  4. Hold the dumbbells in each hand with your palms facing inwards towards your body.
  5. Extend your arms straight out in front of your body, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  6. Slowly raise the dumbbells up towards the ceiling, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing each other.
  7. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  8. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  10. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell incline rear lateral raise
instructions:
1. Choose a pair of dumbbells that are appropriate for your fitness level.
  2. Adjust an incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  3. Lie face down on the bench with your chest and stomach resting on the bench and your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Hold the dumbbells with an overhand grip and let them hang down towards the floor.
  5. Engage your shoulder blades by pulling them down and back.
  6. Exhale and lift the dumbbells up to shoulder height, keeping your arms straight and your elbows slightly bent.
  7. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully place the dumbbells back on the ground and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell incline row
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a pair of dumbbells that are appropriate for your strength level.
  2. Place the dumbbells on the floor at the base of an incline bench.
  3. Stand facing the bench and bend over to pick up the dumbbells with an overhand grip.
  4. Place your right knee and right hand on the bench, keeping your back straight and parallel to the floor.
  5. Extend your left arm straight down towards the floor with the dumbbell in your hand.
  6. Slowly pull the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  7. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  8. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with your left knee and left hand on the bench.
  10. Remember to keep your back straight and avoid any jerking or swinging motions during the exercise.

name: dumbbell incline shoulder raise
instructions:
1. Start by lying on an incline bench with your chest facing up and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing down and your arms extended straight down towards the ground.
  3. Slowly raise both dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows slightly bent and your palms facing down.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the incline of the bench to increase or decrease the difficulty of the exercise.
  8. Choose a weight that is challenging but still allows you to maintain proper form.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets of 8-12 repetitions, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: dumbbell incline shrug
instructions:
1. Set up a bench at a 30-45 degree incline.
  2. Grab a pair of dumbbells with an overhand grip and sit on the bench with your feet firmly planted on the floor.
  3. Lean back against the bench, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. With your arms extended, shrug your shoulders up towards your ears.
  5. Hold the contraction for a few seconds, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your shoulders down and back throughout the exercise, and avoid hunching forward.
  8. Variations of this exercise include using a barbell instead of dumbbells, or performing the exercise standing instead of sitting on a bench.

name: dumbbell incline t-raise
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Extend your arms down towards the floor with your palms facing each other.
  3. Slowly raise the dumbbells up and out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor.
  4. Hold for a moment, then lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell incline triceps extension
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on an incline bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Take a dumbbell in each hand and raise them above your head, keeping your arms straight.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells behind your head, bending at the elbows only.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then use your triceps to raise the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Be sure to keep your elbows close to your head throughout the movement to maximize the activation of your triceps muscles.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower the dumbbells and exhaling as you raise them.
  8. When you're finished, carefully lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position and sit up slowly.
  9. Stretch your triceps gently to prevent soreness and promote flexibility.

name: dumbbell incline twisted flyes
instructions:
1. Start by setting an incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  2. Grab a pair of dumbbells and lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, with your palms facing each other.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides of your body, keeping your arms straight.
  5. As you lower the dumbbells, twist your wrists so that your palms are facing the ground.
  6. Pause for a moment, then slowly raise the dumbbells back up to the starting position, twisting your wrists back to the starting position as you lift.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell incline two arm extension
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a pair of dumbbells that are appropriate for your fitness level.
  2. Lie down on an incline bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back supported by the bench.
  3. Hold the dumbbells with an overhand grip and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  4. Lower the dumbbells towards your ears by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then extend your arms back up towards the ceiling.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When you are finished, carefully place the dumbbells on the ground and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell incline y-raise
instructions:
1. Start by placing a bench at a 45-degree angle and grabbing a pair of dumbbells.
  2. Lie face down on the bench with your chest and stomach pressed against the bench.
  3. Hold the dumbbells with your palms facing each other and your arms fully extended below your shoulders.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and lift the dumbbells up and out to the side, forming a Y-shape with your arms.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and focus on keeping your arms straight and your shoulders away from your ears.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to ensure proper form and challenge.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions for optimal results.

name: dumbbell iron cross
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Extend your arms out to your sides, parallel to the floor, with your palms facing down.
  3. Slowly bring the dumbbells together in front of your chest, crossing them over each other.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your chest muscles.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell kickback
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your left hand resting on your left thigh for support.
  3. Bring your right elbow up to a 90-degree angle, keeping it close to your body.
  4. Extend your right arm behind you, straightening it out behind your body.
  5. Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Complete the desired number of repetitions on your right arm, then switch to your left arm and repeat the exercise.

name: dumbbell kickbacks on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Place an exercise ball on the floor and kneel down behind it.
  2. Pick up a dumbbell with your right hand and place your left hand on the exercise ball for support.
  3. Extend your right arm back, keeping it close to your body and parallel to the floor. Your elbow should be bent at a 90-degree angle.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to starting position.
  5. Repeat for desired number of reps on your right arm, then switch to your left arm.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Gradually increase the weight of the dumbbell as you get stronger.
  8. Perform 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each arm, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: dumbbell kneeling bicep curl exercise ball
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a set of dumbbells that are appropriate for your fitness level.
  2. Place an exercise ball on the floor and kneel in front of it.
  3. Place your elbows on top of the exercise ball and hold the dumbbells with an underhand grip.
  4. Keep your back straight and engage your core muscles.
  5. Slowly curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders while keeping your elbows stationary.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  7. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully place the dumbbells on the floor and stand up from the exercise ball.
  10. Stretch your biceps and any other muscles that feel tight.

name: dumbbell lateral raise
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand. Make sure your palms are facing your body.
  2. Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  3. Slowly raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground. Make sure to keep your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Hold this position for a second or two, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to breathe in as you lift the dumbbells and breathe out as you lower them.
  7. For an added challenge, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or perform the exercise while standing on one leg.

name: dumbbell lateral to front raise
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand by your sides.
  2. Keep your arms straight and lift the dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder level.
  3. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  4. Next, lift the dumbbells up in front of your body until they reach shoulder level.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  6. Repeat this sequence, alternating between lateral raises and front raises, for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your shoulders relaxed throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you lift the dumbbells and inhale as you lower them.
  9. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  10. Finish the exercise by lowering the dumbbells back down to your sides and returning to a standing position.

name: dumbbell lunge
instructions:
1. Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand, with your palms facing inwards towards your body.
  2. Take a big step forward with your right foot, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  3. Lower your body down by bending your knees, until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is almost touching the floor.
  4. Make sure your front knee is directly above your ankle and not pushed out too far.
  5. Push back up through your right heel, straightening your right leg and bringing your left foot back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat on the other side, taking a big step forward with your left foot and completing the same movement.
  7. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe deeply as you lunge.
  9. When you're finished, place the dumbbells back on the ground and stretch out your legs and hips to cool down.

name: dumbbell lunge with bicep curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inwards.
  2. Take a large step forward with your left foot, bending your left knee to a 90-degree angle, while keeping your right leg straight behind you.
  3. As you lunge forward, simultaneously curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the lunge, then push off your left foot to return to the starting position, lowering the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  5. Repeat the lunge with your right leg, curling the dumbbells towards your shoulders as you go.
  6. Continue alternating lunges and bicep curls for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell lying  extension (across face)
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a workout bench with your feet planted firmly on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing upwards and your arms extended straight above your chest.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your face by bending your elbows. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms.
  4. Stop when the dumbbells are just above your forehead and your elbows are bent at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly lift the dumbbells back to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell lying alternate extension
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended above your chest, palms facing each other.
  3. Slowly lower one arm down towards the ground, keeping your elbow slightly bent.
  4. As you lower the weight, inhale and keep your core engaged.
  5. Once your arm is parallel to the ground, pause for a moment and then slowly lift it back up to the starting position, exhaling as you do so.
  6. Repeat the movement with your other arm, alternating back and forth for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your elbows slightly bent throughout the exercise and avoid letting the weights touch the ground.
  8. Focus on maintaining a controlled and steady movement throughout the exercise.
  9. Once you have completed the desired number of repetitions, carefully lower the weights back to your chest and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell lying elbow press
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a bench or mat with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing towards your feet and your arms extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Bend your elbows and lower the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms and elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then press the dumbbells back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then rest and repeat for additional sets.
  6. To increase the difficulty of the exercise, you can use heavier dumbbells or slow down the tempo of the movement.
  7. Be sure to engage your core and keep your back flat against the bench or mat throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell lying external shoulder rotation
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your side on a flat bench, with your arm extended straight out from your shoulder and your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle, holding a dumbbell in your hand.
  2. Keep your elbow close to your body throughout the exercise.
  3. Slowly rotate your arm, keeping your elbow in the same position, until your hand is pointing towards the ceiling.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with your other arm.
  6. Make sure to use a light weight for this exercise, as it targets a small muscle group and can easily lead to injury if performed with too much weight.
  7. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions on each side, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain proper form and prevent injury.

name: dumbbell lying femoral
instructions:
1. Begin by lying down flat on your back on an exercise mat or bench with your legs extended straight out in front of you.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand and place them on the floor next to your hips.
  3. Slowly lift your left leg off the ground, keeping it straight, and raise it as high as you can while keeping your hips and lower back on the ground.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat this movement with your right leg.
  6. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to protect your lower back.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or add ankle weights to increase the difficulty of the exercise.

name: dumbbell lying hammer press
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on a flat bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other and your arms extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  4. Once the dumbbells are just above your chest, press them back up towards the ceiling, keeping your palms facing each other.
  5. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe in as you lower the dumbbells and exhale as you press them back up.
  7. To increase the difficulty, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or perform the exercise on an incline bench.

name: dumbbell lying on floor rear delt raise
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on the floor with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, palms facing down.
  3. Engage your shoulder blades and lift your arms up and out to the sides, keeping them straight, until they are at shoulder height.
  4. Hold for a brief moment, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your neck and spine in a neutral position throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.

name: dumbbell lying one arm deltoid rear
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on a flat bench, holding a dumbbell in one hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Extend your arm straight down towards the floor, with your palm facing your body.
  3. Engage your shoulder blade and lift your arm up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbow straight.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blade and deltoid muscles.
  5. Slowly lower the weight back down towards the floor, maintaining control throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your body stable throughout the exercise.
  8. Choose an appropriate weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions on each side.
  10. Stretch your deltoid muscles after the exercise to prevent tightness and promote recovery.

name: dumbbell lying one arm press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying down on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Bend your elbow and lower the dumbbell down towards your chest.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
  5. Push the dumbbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arm.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch arms and repeat the exercise with the other arm.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  9. Choose a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the movement.

name: dumbbell lying one arm press v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a bench or mat with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing towards your feet and your arm extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest while keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then press the dumbbell back up towards the ceiling.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe steadily.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to ensure proper form and to challenge yourself appropriately.

name: dumbbell lying one arm pronated triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Extend your arm straight up toward the ceiling, with your palm facing forward.
  3. Bend your elbow and lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your upper arm stationary.
  4. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then straighten your arm to return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbow close to your head throughout the movement to target your triceps effectively.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Perform 3-4 sets of 8-12 reps per arm, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  9. As with any exercise, consult with a fitness professional before beginning to ensure proper form and technique.

name: dumbbell lying one arm rear lateral raise
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand, palm facing inwards towards the bench.
  2. Extend your arm straight towards the floor, keeping a slight bend in your elbow.
  3. Keeping your arm straight, lift the dumbbell up towards the ceiling, leading with your elbow.
  4. Stop when your arm is parallel to the ground, and hold for a brief moment.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down towards the floor, keeping your arm straight and controlled.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: dumbbell lying one arm supinated triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Hold the dumbbell with a supinated grip, meaning your palm is facing up towards the ceiling.
  3. Extend your arm straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbow in close to your head.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your head, bending at the elbow until it reaches a 90-degree angle.
  5. Pause for a moment, then use your triceps to straighten your arm back up towards the ceiling.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat.

name: dumbbell lying pronation
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and your palms facing down.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your arms extended and your elbows tucked in close to your sides.
  3. Slowly rotate your palms so they are facing up, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly rotate your palms back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. When you are finished, carefully lower the dumbbells to the floor and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell lying pronation on floor
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on the floor with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, with your palms facing down.
  3. Slowly rotate your arms so that your palms are facing up, and then back down again, keeping your elbows straight.
  4. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the floor throughout the exercise.
  6. When you are finished, gently lower the dumbbells back down to the floor and carefully sit up.

name: dumbbell lying pullover on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the exercise ball and holding a dumbbell with both hands.
  2. Carefully walk your feet forward until your head, neck, and shoulders are resting on the exercise ball.
  3. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, holding the dumbbell directly over your chest with both hands.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight and your elbows locked in place.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly lift the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully walk your feet back to the starting position and stand up.

name: dumbbell lying rear delt row
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other and arms extended towards the floor.
  2. Engage your shoulder blades and lift your arms up and out to the sides, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weights back down towards the floor.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to keep your neck in a neutral position and avoid arching your back or using momentum to lift the weights.
  6. You can increase the difficulty of the exercise by using heavier weights or increasing the incline of the bench.
  7. Be sure to warm up before starting the exercise and cool down afterwards to prevent injury.

name: dumbbell lying rear lateral raise
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on a flat bench with your feet on the ground and your arms hanging down on either side of the bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Engage your core and lift both dumbbells up towards the ceiling, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing each other.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down towards the ground, but instead of letting them touch the ground, stop when they are hovering just above the ground.
  4. Keeping your arms straight, lift the dumbbells back up towards the ceiling, but this time, lift them out to the sides of your body, so that your arms form a T-shape.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position with your arms hanging straight down.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell lying single extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your head, keeping your upper arm stationary and your elbow close to your head.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  5. Complete the desired number of repetitions with one arm before switching to the other arm.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your lower back pressed into the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Choose a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Perform 2-3 sets of 8-12 repetitions on each arm as part of your upper body strength training routine.

name: dumbbell lying supination
instructions:
1. Start by lying on a flat bench with your feet on the ground and your head at the edge of the bench.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing down and your arms extended over your chest.
  3. Slowly rotate your palms so they face up while keeping your arms straight.
  4. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position with your palms facing down.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbows locked and your shoulders stable throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you lift the dumbbells and inhale as you lower them back down.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells to suit your fitness level.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets of 8-12 repetitions for optimal results.

name: dumbbell lying supination on floor
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms straight above your chest.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells to your sides while keeping your palms facing up.
  4. As you lower the dumbbells, rotate your palms so that they are facing down at the bottom of the movement.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbells back up to the starting position while rotating your palms back to facing up.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your elbows straight throughout the exercise and to focus on using your chest and shoulders to lift the weight, rather than your arms.
  8. When you are finished, carefully lower the dumbbells back to the floor and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell lying supine biceps curl
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on a bench or mat with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms fully extended towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your palms facing up.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbells back up towards the ceiling.
  5. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back flat on the bench or mat and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. You can also vary the exercise by using different weights or by alternating arms instead of curling both at the same time.
  8. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise and to stop immediately if you feel any pain or discomfort.
  9. Once you have completed your set, carefully lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position and sit up slowly.
  10. Stretch your arms and shoulders to cool down and prevent any muscle stiffness or soreness.

name: dumbbell lying supine curl
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on a flat bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your head resting at the edge of the bench.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms extended straight above your shoulders.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your palms facing up.
  4. Pause for a moment when the dumbbells are just above your chest.
  5. Slowly raise the dumbbells back up to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your palms facing up.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe in as you lower the dumbbells and breathe out as you raise them back up.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
  9. Choose a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell lying triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and your head at the end of the bench.
  2. Hold a dumbbell with both hands and extend your arms straight up above your chest, with your palms facing each other.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your upper arms stationary and elbows in line with your shoulders.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbows close to your head and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  8. Be sure to warm up properly before beginning any exercise routine and consult with a fitness professional if you have any concerns or questions about proper form or technique.

name: dumbbell lying wide curl
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back on a bench or mat, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms extended straight above your chest.
  2. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides of your body, keeping your elbows slightly bent and your palms facing up.
  3. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbells back to the starting position, keeping your elbows slightly bent and your palms facing up.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench or mat throughout the exercise.
  6. Variations: You can also perform this exercise with one arm at a time, alternating arms with each repetition. You can also increase the weight of the dumbbells as you become stronger.

name: dumbbell neutral grip bench press
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and bring them up to your chest.
  3. Extend your arms up and press the dumbbells up towards the ceiling, making sure to keep your elbows close to your body.
  4. Lower the dumbbells back down to your chest and repeat for your desired number of reps.
  5. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  6. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the dumbbells back on the ground or on a rack.

name: dumbbell one arm bench fly
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench, with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand, with your arm extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards the ground, keeping your arm straight.
  4. Stop when your arm is parallel to the ground, and your elbow is at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch to the other arm.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the dumbbell to continue challenging your muscles.

name: dumbbell one arm bent-over row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your abs engaged.
  3. Place your free hand on a bench or sturdy object for support.
  4. With your elbow close to your body, lift the dumbbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.
  5. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your abs engaged.
  6. Complete 8-12 reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: dumbbell one arm chest fly on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a pair of dumbbells that are appropriate for your strength level.
  2. Select an exercise ball that is the right size for your height.
  3. Sit on the exercise ball and walk your feet forward until your head, neck, and shoulders are resting comfortably on the ball.
  4. Hold one dumbbell in your right hand with your arm extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell out to the side, keeping your arm straight and your elbow slightly bent.
  6. Lower the dumbbell until your arm is parallel to the ground or until you feel a stretch in your chest muscles.
  7. Pause for a moment and then slowly lift the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  8. Complete 10-12 repetitions with your right arm before switching to your left arm.
  9. Repeat the exercise for 2-3 sets.
  10. Remember to keep your core engaged and your body stable throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell one arm concetration curl (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing up and your elbow resting on the inside of your thigh.
  3. Slowly curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder, keeping your arm close to your body and your elbow stationary.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling on the way up and exhaling on the way down.

name: dumbbell one arm decline chest press
instructions:
1. Start by lying on a decline bench with your feet securely placed at the end of the bench and your head at the top.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing towards your feet.
  3. Extend your arm straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbow slightly bent.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then press the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell one arm fly on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that is appropriate for your strength level.
  2. Sit on an exercise ball with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your arm extended straight up toward the ceiling.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell out to the side of your body, keeping your arm straight and your elbow slightly bent.
  5. Pause when your arm is parallel to the ground.
  6. Slowly raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
  9. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  10. Exhale as you lift the weight and inhale as you lower it.

name: dumbbell one arm french press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your core engaged.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing upwards and your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Extend your arm upwards, keeping your elbow in the same position and your wrist straight.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position, keeping your elbow in place and your wrist straight.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. You can increase the difficulty of the exercise by using a heavier dumbbell or by adding more repetitions.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to stop if you experience any pain or discomfort.

name: dumbbell one arm hammer preacher curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a preacher bench with a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Place the back of your upper arm on the preacher bench pad, ensuring that your armpit is resting on the top of the pad.
  3. Extend your arm fully, letting the dumbbell hang down towards the floor.
  4. Keeping your elbow stationary, exhale and curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder by contracting your bicep.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep for a second.
  6. Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position, fully extending your arm.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to the other arm.

name: dumbbell one arm hammer press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that is appropriate for your fitness level and grip it with one hand.
  2. Sit on an exercise ball and walk your feet forward until your shoulders, neck, and head are resting on the ball.
  3. Keep your core engaged and your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Extend your arm straight up towards the ceiling with the dumbbell in your hand, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body and your wrist straight.
  6. Push the dumbbell back up to the starting position, keeping your wrist straight and your elbow close to your body.
  7. Complete the desired number of reps and then switch to the other arm.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of sets.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.
  10. Once you have completed the exercise, carefully stand up from the exercise ball and put the dumbbell away.

name: dumbbell one arm incline chest press
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell weight that is appropriate for your fitness level. You can start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you progress.
  2. Lie down on an incline bench with your feet planted firmly on the ground and your back flat against the bench.
  3. Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing forward and your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
  4. Slowly lift the dumbbell up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbow in the same position.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch sides.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you lift the weight and inhale as you lower it.
  9. Rest for a few seconds between sets and repeat for 3-4 sets of 8-12 reps on each side.

name: dumbbell one arm kickback
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your left hand resting on your left thigh for support.
  3. Bring your right elbow up to your side, keeping your upper arm parallel to the ground.
  4. Extend your right arm behind you, straightening your elbow and squeezing your tricep muscles.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  6. Complete 10-12 repetitions on your right arm, then switch sides and repeat with your left arm.
  7. Perform 2-3 sets of dumbbell one arm kickbacks, resting for 30 seconds to 1 minute between sets.

name: dumbbell one arm lateral raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing your body.
  2. Keep your arm straight and slowly lift the weight out to the side until your arm is parallel to the ground.
  3. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your shoulder blade.
  4. Lower the weight back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.

name: dumbbell one arm lateral raise with support
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side.
  2. Place your other hand on a stable surface, such as a bench or wall, for support.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbell out to the side, keeping your arm straight and your elbow slightly bent.
  4. Continue lifting until your arm is parallel to the ground.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to your side.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: dumbbell one arm press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that is appropriate for your strength level.
  2. Place an exercise ball on the ground and sit on it with your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Hold the dumbbell in one hand, with your elbow bent and the weight resting on your shoulder.
  4. Engage your core muscles and lift the dumbbell up and away from your shoulder, extending your arm completely.
  5. Lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  6. Repeat this exercise for the desired number of repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you lift the dumbbell and inhale as you lower it.
  9. Take breaks as needed and adjust the weight of the dumbbell if it becomes too difficult or too easy.

name: dumbbell one arm prone curl
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on a flat bench with your chest and stomach resting on the bench and your feet firmly on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing down towards the ground.
  3. Extend your arm out in front of you so that it is perpendicular to the ground.
  4. Bend your elbow and curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary and your palm facing down.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching arms.

name: dumbbell one arm prone hammer curl
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on a bench with your chest and stomach resting on it.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing your body.
  3. Extend your arm straight down towards the floor.
  4. Slowly curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the curl and squeeze your bicep.
  6. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position with control.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  8. Switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and your body still throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell one arm pullover on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that is appropriate for your fitness level and goals.
  2. Sit on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Hold the dumbbell with both hands and extend your arms straight up above your chest.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight and your elbows close to your ears.
  5. Pause for a moment, then raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat.
  7. Make sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to ensure a challenging but safe workout.
  9. As with any exercise, consult with a fitness professional if you have any concerns or questions about proper technique or form.

name: dumbbell one arm revers wrist curl
instructions:
1. Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing down.
  3. Rest your forearm on a flat surface such as a bench or table with your wrist hanging off the edge.
  4. Slowly curl the weight up towards your forearm, keeping your wrist straight.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement for a second and then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  6. Complete 10-15 repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Perform 2-3 sets of the exercise, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  8. Make sure to keep your elbow and upper arm stationary throughout the exercise and only move your wrist.
  9. Choose a weight that is challenging but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  10. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.

name: dumbbell one arm reverse fly (with support)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Place your left hand on a bench or a stable surface for support.
  3. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at your hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Extend your right arm down towards the floor, with your palm facing your body.
  5. Slowly lift your right arm out to the side, keeping it straight and parallel to the floor. Your shoulder blade should be squeezing towards your spine.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your arm back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with your left arm.

name: dumbbell one arm reverse grip press
instructions:
1. Start by holding a dumbbell in one hand with an underhand or reverse grip (palm facing down).
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and keep your back straight.
  3. Bring the dumbbell up to your shoulder level with your elbow bent and your palm facing your shoulder.
  4. Press the dumbbell up and away from your body until your arm is fully extended.
  5. Lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder level and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: dumbbell one arm reverse preacher curl
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level and grasp it with an underhand grip (palm facing up).
  2. Place your upper arm on a preacher bench so that your armpit is resting on the top of the bench and your elbow is hanging off the edge.
  3. Extend your arm fully and allow the dumbbell to hang straight down.
  4. Slowly curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary and elbow in place.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep before slowly lowering the weight back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps before switching arms.
  7. Complete 3-4 sets of 8-12 reps on each arm, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  8. Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your back straight and avoiding swinging or using momentum to lift the weight.
  9. Adjust the weight as necessary to ensure proper form and challenge yourself appropriately.

name: dumbbell one arm reverse spider curl
instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand with an underhand grip.
  2. Extend your arm straight down, with the dumbbell hanging at arm's length.
  3. Keeping your upper arm stationary, curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder by bending your elbow.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch to the other arm.
  7. Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body throughout the movement and avoid swinging the weight.
  8. Use a weight that allows you to complete the exercise with proper form.

name: dumbbell one arm seated bicep curl on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level and seating yourself on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing upward and your elbow resting against the inside of your thigh.
  3. Slowly curl the weight upward, keeping your elbow stationary and your wrist straight.
  4. Pause briefly at the top of the curl and then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch arms and repeat the exercise on the opposite side.
  6. Be sure to maintain proper posture throughout the exercise, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  7. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the weight of the dumbbell or the number of repetitions to continue challenging your biceps.

name: dumbbell one arm seated hammer curl
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level and sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing your body, and rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh.
  3. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Slowly lift the dumbbell towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow stationary and close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your bicep.
  6. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  8. Complete 2-3 sets of 8-12 repetitions per arm, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  9. Be sure to breathe steadily throughout the exercise and avoid using momentum to lift the weight.
  10. Stretch your biceps and forearms after completing the exercise.

name: dumbbell one arm seated neutral wrist curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing up and your wrist in a neutral position.
  3. Rest your elbow on your thigh, keeping your arm extended.
  4. Curl the dumbbell towards your forearm, keeping your wrist in a neutral position.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm.
  7. Make sure to keep your elbow and upper arm stationary throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you curl the weight up and inhale as you lower it back down.
  9. Choose a weight that allows you to perform the exercise with proper form and control.
  10. Perform 2-3 sets of 8-12 repetitions on each arm.

name: dumbbell one arm shoulder press
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that is appropriate for your strength level.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the dumbbell in your right hand at shoulder level with your elbow bent.
  3. Press the dumbbell upward until your arm is fully extended above your head.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to shoulder level.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with your left arm.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Exhale as you press the dumbbell upward and inhale as you lower it back down.
  10. Gradually increase the weight of the dumbbell as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.

name: dumbbell one arm shoulder press v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Bring the dumbbell up to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body and your palm facing forward.
  3. Press the dumbbell up towards the ceiling, straightening your arm fully.
  4. Lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one side before switching to the other arm.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to challenge yourself and maintain proper form.
  8. Rest for 30-60 seconds between sets and aim for 2-3 sets of 8-12 reps on each arm.

name: dumbbell one arm snatch
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the hips, lowering the dumbbell towards the ground.
  3. As you stand up, pull the dumbbell up towards your shoulder in a smooth motion, keeping it close to your body.
  4. Once the dumbbell reaches your shoulder, quickly extend your arm upwards, straightening it completely and lifting the dumbbell overhead.
  5. Lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder and then down to the ground, returning to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with the other arm.

name: dumbbell one arm standing curl
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing forward and your arm fully extended down by your side.
  3. Slowly curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder while keeping your elbow close to your body and your wrist straight.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the curl, squeezing your bicep.
  5. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch to the other arm.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. For an added challenge, you can increase the weight of the dumbbell or perform the exercise while standing on an unstable surface like a balance board or BOSU ball.

name: dumbbell one arm standing hammer curl
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
  2. Keep your elbow close to your torso and your upper arm stationary.
  3. Exhale and slowly curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your wrist straight.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Choose a weight that allows you to perform the exercise with proper form, but still challenges your muscles.
  8. You can also vary the exercise by using different types of dumbbells, such as hexagonal or adjustable weights.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting any exercise program and consult with a fitness professional if you have any concerns or injuries.

name: dumbbell one arm triceps extension (on bench)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Place your feet flat on the floor and keep your back straight.
  3. Extend your arm with the dumbbell straight up above your head.
  4. Lower the dumbbell behind your head, bending your elbow and keeping your upper arm stationary.
  5. Pause for a second, then lift the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  7. Make sure to keep your elbow close to your head and your wrist straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Use a weight that is challenging but allows you to maintain proper form.
  9. Perform the exercise slowly and with control to maximize the effectiveness of the movement.
  10. Breathe out as you lift the weight and breathe in as you lower it.
  11. Finish the exercise by putting the dumbbell down and stretching your triceps.

name: dumbbell one arm upright row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing your body.
  2. Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  3. Lift the dumbbell straight up toward your chin, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weight back down to starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  6. Make sure to breathe deeply and evenly throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell one arm wrist curl
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and strength.
  2. Stand or sit on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back straight.
  3. Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing up and your forearm resting on the bench or your thigh.
  4. Slowly curl the weight up towards your forearm, keeping your wrist straight and your elbow stationary.
  5. Hold the weight at the top of the curl for a few seconds, then slowly lower the weight back down to your starting position.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to maintain proper form to avoid injury.
  8. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  9. Include dumbbell one arm wrist curls in your regular strength training routine to improve wrist and forearm strength and flexibility.

name: dumbbell one arm zottman preacher curl
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level and placing it on a preacher curl bench.
  2. Position yourself on the preacher curl bench with your arm extended over the bench and your palm facing up.
  3. Grasp the dumbbell with your palm facing up and your thumb wrapped around the handle.
  4. Curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder while keeping your elbow stationary and your upper arm against the bench.
  5. At the top of the curl, rotate your wrist so that your palm is facing down.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position while keeping your wrist rotated.
  7. At the bottom of the curl, rotate your wrist back to the starting position with your palm facing up.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm.
  9. Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  10. Gradually increase the weight of the dumbbell as your strength improves.

name: dumbbell one leg fly on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Place an exercise ball on the floor and position yourself on it so that your lower back is supported and your feet are firmly planted on the ground.
