  2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand and extend your arm straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower your arm to the side, keeping it straight, until it is parallel to the ground.
  4. Hold for a few seconds, then slowly raise your arm back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left arm and repeat the exercise.
  6. Remember to engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to maintain balance and stability on the exercise ball.
  7. Start with a light weight and gradually increase as you become comfortable with the exercise.
  8. Aim for 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each arm.
  9. As with any exercise, consult with a fitness professional before starting and stop immediately if you experience any pain or discomfort.

name: dumbbell over bench neutral wrist curl
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Place your forearms on the bench, with your palms facing up and your wrists hanging off the end of the bench.
  3. Make sure your wrists are in a neutral position, meaning they are not bent up or down.
  4. Curl the dumbbells up towards your forearms, keeping your wrists in a neutral position throughout the movement.
  5. Squeeze your forearms at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your wrists in a neutral position throughout the exercise to avoid injury.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  9. Perform this exercise as part of a larger forearm or upper body workout for best results.

name: dumbbell over bench one arm  neutral wrist curl
instructions:
1. Place a dumbbell on the floor next to a bench.
  2. Position yourself on the bench so that your forearm and hand are hanging off the edge.
  3. Grasp the dumbbell with an underhand grip, keeping your wrist in a neutral position.
  4. Curl the weight upwards towards your forearm, keeping your elbow stationary and close to your body.
  5. Hold the contraction for a second, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: dumbbell over bench one arm reverse wrist curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing down and your wrist resting on the bench.
  3. Slowly lower the weight towards the ground, allowing your wrist to bend backwards.
  4. Pause when your wrist is fully extended, then slowly raise the weight back up towards your forearm.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  6. Remember to keep your arm and wrist stable throughout the exercise, and avoid using momentum to lift the weight.
  7. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  8. Perform this exercise as part of a well-rounded strength training routine, and always consult with a qualified fitness professional if you have any questions or concerns.

name: dumbbell over bench one arm wrist curl
instructions:
1. Place a bench in front of you and grab a dumbbell with one hand.
  2. Position yourself on the bench, with your forearm resting on the bench and your wrist hanging off the edge.
  3. Make sure your palm is facing up and your wrist is straight.
  4. Slowly curl the weight up towards your forearm, keeping your wrist straight and your arm still.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  6. Complete the desired number of reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of sets.

name: dumbbell over bench revers wrist curl
instructions:
1. Position a bench parallel to a dumbbell rack.
  2. Select a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level and grip it firmly with an overhand grip.
  3. Lie face down on the bench, with your chest and stomach resting on the bench and your arms extended over the edge of the bench, holding the dumbbell.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards the ground, keeping your arms straight and your wrists relaxed.
  5. Once the dumbbell is as low as you can comfortably go, slowly curl it back up towards your body, keeping your arms straight and your wrists flexed.
  6. Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  7. When you have completed the desired number of repetitions for both arms, carefully place the dumbbell back on the rack and sit up slowly.
  8. Stretch your arms and wrists to prevent any discomfort or soreness.

name: dumbbell over bench wrist curl
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your forearms resting on the bench and your palms facing up.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your wrists hanging off the edge of the bench.
  3. Slowly curl your wrists upward, keeping your forearms and elbows stationary.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your wrist muscles.
  5. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your wrists straight and avoid any jerking or swinging movements.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge your muscles without compromising form.
  8. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 reps for best results.

name: dumbbell palm rotational bent over row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  3. Bring the dumbbells up to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Rotate your palms so they are facing away from your body.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, rotating your palms back to a neutral grip as you do so.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight throughout the exercise and avoid using momentum to lift the dumbbells.
  8. As you get stronger, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or the number of reps you perform.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting any exercise and to stretch afterwards to prevent injury.

name: dumbbell palms in incline bench press
instructions:
1. Start by adjusting the incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  2. Grab a pair of dumbbells and sit on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Hold the dumbbells with an overhand grip, palms facing forward.
  4. Extend your arms and lift the dumbbells above your chest, keeping them shoulder-width apart.
  5. Lower the dumbbells slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. As you lower the dumbbells, rotate your palms towards your face, so they are facing each other at the bottom of the movement.
  7. Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, rotating your palms back to the starting position as you lift.
  8. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  9. When finished, carefully place the dumbbells back on the ground and sit up.

name: dumbbell peacher hammer curl
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing in towards your body.
  3. Slowly lift both dumbbells to your chest level, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  4. Rotate your wrists so that your palms are now facing outwards.
  5. Keeping your elbows stationary, curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and contract your biceps.
  7. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, rotating your wrists back to the starting position with your palms facing in towards your body.
  8. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell plyo squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
  2. Lower into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees in line with your toes.
  3. As you come up from the squat, jump explosively off the ground, pushing through your heels.
  4. As you jump, raise the dumbbells up to shoulder height, keeping your elbows bent.
  5. Land softly back in the squat position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your chest lifted throughout the exercise.
  7. Vary the weight of the dumbbells and the number of reps to increase or decrease the intensity of the exercise.

name: dumbbell preacher curl
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that you can comfortably lift for 8-12 repetitions.
  2. Adjust the preacher bench to a comfortable height, ensuring that your armpits are resting on the top of the bench.
  3. Grab the dumbbell with an underhand grip, keeping your palms facing upward.
  4. Rest your upper arms on the bench, allowing your elbows to hang off the edge.
  5. Curl the dumbbell towards your face, keeping your upper arms stationary and your elbows in line with your shoulders.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  7. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position, keeping your upper arms stationary and your elbows in line with your shoulders.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell preacher curl over exercise ball
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell that is appropriate for your fitness level and strength.
  2. Place an exercise ball in front of you and sit on it with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Extend your arms over the ball and grasp the dumbbell with an underhand grip, keeping your palms facing up.
  4. Slowly lift the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and your upper arms stationary.
  5. Hold the contraction at the top of the movement for a few seconds, squeezing your biceps.
  6. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  7. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to maintain proper form throughout.
  8. When finished, carefully place the dumbbell back on the ground and stand up from the exercise ball.

name: dumbbell press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Start by choosing a pair of dumbbells that are comfortable for you to lift and lie down on an exercise ball.
  2. Sit on an exercise ball and walk your feet forward until your lower back is supported on the ball, and your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Hold the dumbbells in each hand and extend your arms upwards with your palms facing forward.
  4. Bend your elbows and lower the dumbbells towards your chest while keeping your upper arms parallel to the ground.
  5. Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  6. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability on the exercise ball.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully lower the dumbbells to your sides and sit up slowly on the exercise ball.

name: dumbbell pronate-grip triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Extend your arms above your head with your palms facing each other and your elbows close to your ears.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your head.
  4. Stop when your forearms are parallel to the ground.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly raise the dumbbells back to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. For a greater challenge, you can use heavier dumbbells or increase the number of repetitions.
  9. Always use proper form to avoid injury and consult with a fitness professional if you have any concerns.

name: dumbbell prone incline curl
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on an incline bench with your chest and stomach resting against the bench.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing down and your arms fully extended towards the floor.
  3. Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your palms facing up.
  4. Hold the contraction at the top of the movement for a second before slowly lowering the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your chest and stomach firmly against the bench throughout the exercise to prevent cheating and ensure proper form.
  7. Adjust the incline of the bench to increase or decrease the difficulty of the exercise.
  8. Remember to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  9. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or medical professional before attempting if you have any injuries or health concerns.

name: dumbbell prone incline hammer curl
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting an appropriate weight dumbbell for your fitness level.
  2. Lie face down on an incline bench with your chest resting against the pad and your feet firmly on the ground.
  3. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other and your arms fully extended towards the floor.
  4. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, exhale and slowly curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  6. Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back towards the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the dumbbells on the ground and sit up slowly.

name: dumbbell pullover
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your head and shoulders resting on the bench.
  2. Hold a dumbbell with both hands, palms facing up, and extend your arms straight up above your chest.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight and your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Pause for a moment, then slowly lift the dumbbell back up to the starting position, keeping your arms straight and your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe in as you lower the dumbbell and breathe out as you lift it back up.
  8. Choose a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  9. As you progress, you can increase the weight or the number of repetitions to continue challenging yourself.

name: dumbbell pullover hip extension on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Hold a dumbbell with both hands and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight and your core engaged.
  4. As you lower the dumbbell, lift your hips off the ground, extending them towards the ceiling.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your hips back down to the ground.
  6. Bring the dumbbell back up to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to protect your lower back.

name: dumbbell pullover on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on an exercise ball and holding a dumbbell with both hands.
  2. Slowly walk your feet forward until your head, neck, and shoulders are resting on the exercise ball, with your hips lifted and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Extend your arms straight up over your chest, holding the dumbbell with both hands.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight and maintaining a slight bend in your elbows.
  5. Pause briefly, then slowly raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position, keeping your arms straight and maintaining a slight bend in your elbows.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to maintain stability on the exercise ball.
  8. When finished, carefully sit up and place the dumbbell on the ground.

name: dumbbell push press
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with your palms facing forward.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and dip your body down into a quarter squat.
  3. As you straighten your legs, drive the dumbbells up above your head, extending your arms fully.
  4. Lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder height and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  5. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  6. Exhale as you push the dumbbells up and inhale as you lower them back down.
  7. Start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the exercise.
  8. Perform 3-4 sets of 8-12 reps with a 60-90 second rest between sets.

name: dumbbell raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Keep your arms straight and raise the dumbbells up to shoulder level. Your palms should be facing forward.
  3. Hold the position for a second and then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your shoulders down throughout the exercise.
  6. You can also vary the exercise by raising the dumbbells to the front, side, or back of your body.
  7. Always start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you become stronger.

name: dumbbell rear delt raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at your hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  3. Extend your arms straight down towards the floor, with your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Keeping your arms straight, lift the dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge yourself.

name: dumbbell rear delt row_shoulder
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  3. Extend your arms down towards the ground, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and pull the dumbbells up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell rear fly
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Bend forward at your hips, keeping your back straight, until your torso is almost parallel to the floor.
  3. Extend your arms straight down, with your palms facing each other.
  4. Keeping your arms straight, lift the dumbbells up and out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your shoulder blades pulled together throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell rear lateral raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
  3. Engage your core and lift the dumbbells out to the sides, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Keep lifting until your arms are parallel to the ground and your shoulder blades are squeezed together.
  5. Hold this position for a second, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  6. Repeat for 10-12 reps, then rest for 30-60 seconds before doing another set.
  7. Try to maintain good form throughout the exercise, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  8. You can increase the weight of the dumbbells as you get stronger, but be sure to start with a weight that allows you to perform the exercise with proper form.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lift the dumbbells and exhaling as you lower them.
  10. Include the dumbbell rear lateral raise in your upper body workout routine for a stronger, more defined back and shoulders.

name: dumbbell rear lateral raise (support head)
instructions:
1. Begin by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  3. Bring the dumbbells up to your sides, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Slowly raise the dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly bent and your palms facing down.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your head up throughout the exercise, and to use a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level.

name: dumbbell rear lunge
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
  2. Take a step backward with your right foot, keeping your left foot planted firmly on the ground.
  3. Bend both knees to lower your body towards the ground, making sure your front knee is directly above your ankle and your back knee is hovering just above the floor.
  4. As you lower your body, raise both dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Push through your front heel to rise back up to standing, lowering the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  6. Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping back with your left foot and lowering into a lunge while raising the dumbbells to your shoulders.
  7. Continue alternating sides for a set number of repetitions or time.

name: dumbbell revers grip biceps curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing down.
  2. Rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing up and your thumbs are pointing outward.
  3. Keep your elbows close to your sides and slowly curl the dumbbells up towards your chest.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell reverse bench press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on a flat bench with your feet planted firmly on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing downwards.
  3. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then press the dumbbells back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or medical professional before beginning if you have any concerns or pre-existing conditions.

name: dumbbell reverse fly
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inwards and your arms extended down in front of you.
  3. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight, until your upper body is parallel to the ground.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and lift both arms out to the sides, keeping them straight, until they are parallel to the ground.
  5. Hold for a moment, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to ensure proper form and avoid injury.

name: dumbbell reverse grip incline bench one arm row
instructions:
1. Start by selecting a dumbbell that you are comfortable with and placing it on the floor next to an incline bench.
  2. Position yourself on the bench with your chest against the incline and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. With your left hand, reach down and pick up the dumbbell, using a reverse grip (palm facing down).
  4. Keeping your elbow close to your body, lift the dumbbell up towards your rib cage, squeezing your shoulder blade as you lift.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the movement for 10-12 reps on your left side, then switch to your right arm and repeat the exercise.
  7. Complete 3-4 sets of the exercise, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the movement and to maintain proper form to avoid injury.
  9. Once you have completed your sets, place the dumbbell back on the floor and stretch your arms and shoulders to cool down.

name: dumbbell reverse grip incline bench two arm row
instructions:
1. Start by setting up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle and placing two dumbbells on the floor at the bottom of the bench.
  2. Lie face down on the bench with your chest and stomach pressed against the incline bench.
  3. Reach down and grab the dumbbells with a reverse grip (palms facing towards your body).
  4. Slowly lift the dumbbells up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  5. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, making sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Once you have completed the set, carefully place the dumbbells back on the floor and sit up slowly.
  8. Stretch your back and shoulders to cool down and prevent injury.

name: dumbbell reverse grip row (female)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
  3. Bring your elbows close to your body and lift the dumbbells up towards your chest, with your palms facing downwards.
  4. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, with control.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell reverse preacher curl
instructions:
1. Begin by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with an underhand grip (palm facing up).
  2. Rest your upper arm on a preacher bench or any other stable surface, with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell towards the floor, keeping your upper arm stationary and your elbow close to your side.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly curl the dumbbell back up towards your shoulder.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat the exercise with the other arm.
  6. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: dumbbell reverse spider curl
instructions:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing down.
  2. Extend your arms in front of your body and bend your elbows to bring the dumbbells towards your shoulders.
  3. Rotate your palms so they face up and bring the dumbbells towards your chest.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with your palms facing down.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell reverse wrist curl
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Extend your arms in front of you, keeping them straight and parallel to the ground.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards the ground by bending your wrists, keeping your arms stationary.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbells back up by straightening your wrists.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell romanian deadlift
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Keeping your back straight, hinge forward at the hips, pushing your butt back as you lower the dumbbells towards the ground.
  3. Lower the dumbbells until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, but don't let them touch the ground.
  4. Pause for a moment, then squeeze your glutes and hamstrings as you stand back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell rotation reverse fly
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inwards.
  2. Lean forward from your hips, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  3. Extend your arms straight out to the sides, parallel to the ground, with your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Rotate your shoulders back and down, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you lift the dumbbells up towards the ceiling.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 10-12 repetitions, then rest and repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: dumbbell scott press
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip.
  2. Bring the dumbbells up to your shoulders with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
  3. Keeping your elbows close to your body, press the dumbbells up and overhead until your arms are fully extended.
  4. Lower the dumbbells back down to your shoulders and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  5. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  6. Exhale as you press the dumbbells up and inhale as you lower them back down.

name: dumbbell seated alternate front raise
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your thighs.
  3. Slowly raise one dumbbell in front of you, keeping your arm straight and your palm facing down. Stop when your arm is parallel to the floor.
  4. Lower the dumbbell back down to your thigh.
  5. Repeat the movement with the other arm.
  6. Alternate arms for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you lift the dumbbell and inhale as you lower it.
  9. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  10. Finish the exercise by lowering both dumbbells to your thighs and placing them on the floor.

name: dumbbell seated alternate hammer curl on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose a pair of dumbbells that you can comfortably lift for the exercise.
  2. Place an exercise ball on a flat surface and sit on it with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Hold the dumbbells in each hand with your palms facing your body.
  4. Begin by curling one dumbbell up towards your shoulder while keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Lower the dumbbell back down to starting position and repeat the movement with the other arm.
  6. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of reps or time.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. To increase the difficulty, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or perform the exercise on an unstable surface.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting the exercise and cool down afterwards to prevent injury.

name: dumbbell seated alternate press
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground, and a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Hold the dumbbells at shoulder height with your palms facing forward.
  3. Press one dumbbell up overhead while keeping the other dumbbell at shoulder height.
  4. Lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height and repeat with the other arm.
  5. Alternate pressing each dumbbell up overhead for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you press the dumbbell up, and inhale as you lower it back down.
  8. When finished, lower the dumbbells back down to your shoulders and then place them on the ground.

name: dumbbell seated alternate shoulder
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your back straight and your feet firmly on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your palms facing inward and your arms at your sides.
  3. Slowly lift one dumbbell up to shoulder height, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Lower the dumbbell back down to your side, and then lift the other dumbbell up to shoulder height.
  5. Continue alternating between your left and right arms for your desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you lift the dumbbell and inhale as you lower it back down to your side.
  8. Repeat for 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each arm.

name: dumbbell seated bench extension
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inward and your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Slowly extend your arms upward, keeping your elbows close to your body and your palms facing each other.
  4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  8. You can also perform this exercise with one arm at a time for an added challenge.

name: dumbbell seated bent arm lateral raise
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inwards and your arms bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbells out to the side, keeping your elbows bent and your wrists straight.
  4. Continue lifting until the dumbbells are at shoulder height.
  5. Hold the dumbbells at the top of the movement for a second or two, then slowly lower them back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. It is also important to use a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and to avoid swinging your arms or using momentum to lift the dumbbells.

name: dumbbell seated bent over alternate kickback
instructions:
1. Choose a pair of dumbbells that are appropriate for your strength level.
  2. Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Lean forward and place your left hand on your left thigh for support.
  4. Hold one dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing your body.
  5. Bend your right elbow and bring the dumbbell up to your chest.
  6. Extend your right arm back and kick the dumbbell straight back until your arm is fully extended.
  7. Hold for a second, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to your chest.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and perform the exercise with your left arm.
  9. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  10. Exhale as you extend your arm back and inhale as you lower the dumbbell back down.
  11. Start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.

name: dumbbell seated bent over triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Lean forward and bend over at the waist, keeping your back straight and parallel to the ground.
  3. Bring your upper arms close to your head, with your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle and your forearms pointing towards the ground.
  4. Extend your arms upwards, straightening your elbows and lifting the dumbbells towards the ceiling.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, squeezing your triceps muscles.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, bending your elbows and keeping your upper arms close to your head.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell seated bicep curl
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms extended down by your sides.
  3. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body and your palms facing up.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Choose a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  9. Vary the number of sets and reps to meet your fitness goals.
  10. Remember to warm up before starting any exercise and to cool down afterwards.

name: dumbbell seated biceps curl (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Choose a set of dumbbells that you can comfortably lift for multiple repetitions.
  2. Place a stability ball on the ground and sit on it with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Hold the dumbbells in both hands with your palms facing up and your arms extended straight down by your sides.
  4. Keeping your elbows close to your sides, slowly curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.
  9. Once finished, carefully place the dumbbells back on the ground and stand up from the stability ball.

name: dumbbell seated biceps curl to shoulder press
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
  2. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  3. Once the dumbbells reach your shoulders, rotate your palms so they are facing forward.
  4. Press the dumbbells up towards the ceiling, extending your arms fully.
  5. Lower the dumbbells back down to your shoulders, rotating your palms back to the starting position.
  6. Lower the dumbbells back down to your sides, fully extending your arms.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell seated calf raise
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and a dumbbell resting on your thighs.
  2. Place the ball of your feet on a raised surface such as a step or block, with your heels hanging off the edge.
  3. Grasp the dumbbell with both hands and hold it against your thighs, keeping your back straight.
  4. Raise your heels as high as possible, contracting your calf muscles at the top of the movement.
  5. Lower your heels back down to the starting position, keeping your feet flat on the floor.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to keep your core engaged.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to challenge yourself while maintaining proper form.

name: dumbbell seated curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet firmly on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms extended down by your sides.
  3. Slowly curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to ensure proper form and to challenge yourself appropriately.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower the weights and exhaling as you lift them.
  9. When finished, carefully set the dumbbells down and stretch out your arms and shoulders.

name: dumbbell seated front raise
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing down and your arms hanging straight down at your sides.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbells up in front of you, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing down. Stop when your arms are parallel to the ground.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. If you feel any pain or discomfort, stop the exercise immediately.

name: dumbbell seated hammer curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other and your elbows tucked in at your sides.
  3. Slowly raise the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows tucked in and your palms facing each other.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you lift the dumbbells and inhale as you lower them.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. Include this exercise as part of a larger upper body workout, performing 3-4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

name: dumbbell seated inner biceps curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your elbows resting on the inside of your thighs.
  3. Slowly curl the dumbbells up towards your chest, keeping your elbows in place and your palms facing up.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position while maintaining control.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your elbows in place throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to ensure proper form and technique.

name: dumbbell seated kickback
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand and extend your arm straight back, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  3. Slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for a set of reps on your right arm before switching to your left arm.
  5. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  6. For a more challenging workout, increase the weight of the dumbbell or perform the exercise while standing instead of sitting.

name: dumbbell seated lateral raise
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inward and your arms at your sides.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbells out to your sides until they reach shoulder height.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbows slightly bent throughout the exercise to avoid putting too much strain on your joints.
  7. Focus on using your shoulder muscles to lift the weights, rather than relying on momentum or other muscles.
  8. You can also try variations of this exercise, such as standing or using a cable machine, to target different parts of your shoulders.

name: dumbbell seated lateral raise v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inward and your arms resting at your sides.
  3. Slowly raise both dumbbells out to your sides until they are level with your shoulders.
  4. Pause for a moment and then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your sides.
  5. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Be sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise to avoid any unnecessary strain on your lower back.
  7. Variation: You can also perform this exercise one arm at a time by lifting one dumbbell at a time while keeping the other arm at your side.

name: dumbbell seated neutral wrist curl
instructions:
1. Choose a pair of dumbbells that you can comfortably lift for 8-12 repetitions.
  2. Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  3. Hold the dumbbells in each hand with your palms facing upwards and your wrists in a neutral position (not bent).
  4. Slowly curl the dumbbells upwards towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your wrists in a neutral position.
  5. Hold the contraction for a second, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 8-12 repetitions, aiming for 2-3 sets.
  7. Remember to keep your wrists in a neutral position throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: dumbbell seated one arm bicep curl on exercise ball with leg raised
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell of appropriate weight and sit on an exercise ball.
  2. Place your feet on the ground and keep them shoulder-width apart.
  3. Place the dumbbell in your right hand and raise your right foot off the ground.
  4. Place your right elbow on the inside of your right thigh and extend your arm downwards so that the dumbbell is hanging between your legs.
  5. Curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder while keeping your elbow stationary.
  6. Pause for a second at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the left arm and leg.
  8. Ensure that your core is engaged and your back is straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Exhale as you lift the dumbbell and inhale as you lower it.
  10. Remember to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.

name: dumbbell seated one arm kickback
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that is appropriate for your fitness level and sit on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold the dumbbell in one hand and place the other hand on your thigh for support. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
  3. Bend your elbow and bring the dumbbell up to your chest, keeping your upper arm parallel to the ground.
  4. Extend your arm behind you, straightening your elbow and squeezing your tricep muscle.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to your chest.
  6. Complete 8-12 reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  8. Make sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise and avoid swinging the weight or arching your back.
  9. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.

name: dumbbell seated one arm rotate
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm extended straight out in front of you, parallel to the ground.
  3. Slowly rotate your arm to the side, keeping it parallel to the ground. Your palm should face down.
  4. Pause for a moment at the end of the rotation, then slowly rotate your arm back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body throughout the exercise to isolate the movement in your shoulder.
  7. Choose a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Breathe in as you rotate your arm to the side and breathe out as you return to the starting position.
  9. Perform this exercise as part of a full-body workout or as a standalone exercise for your shoulders.

name: dumbbell seated one leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that you can comfortably hold in one hand.
  2. Sit on a bench or chair with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Place the dumbbell on your thigh, holding it securely with one hand.
  4. Lift one foot off the ground, keeping your toes on the floor.
  5. Slowly raise your heel as high as you can, keeping your toes on the floor.
  6. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your heel back down.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other leg.
  8. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  9. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the dumbbell or perform the exercise on a step to increase the range of motion.
  10. Always warm up before exercising and consult a doctor before starting any new exercise program.

name: dumbbell seated one leg calf raise - hammer grip
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your dumbbells resting on your thighs.
  2. Choose one leg to work on and lift your foot off the ground, keeping your heel firmly planted on the floor.
  3. Hold one dumbbell in each hand with a hammer grip (palms facing each other).
  4. Slowly raise your heel as high as you can while keeping your toes on the ground.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your heel back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other leg.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Variation: You can also perform this exercise with both legs at the same time by placing a weight plate or step under your feet.

name: dumbbell seated one leg calf raise - palm up
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench or a chair with your back straight and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand and place the ball of your foot on a raised surface, such as a step or a weight plate.
  3. Make sure your heel is hanging off the edge of the surface.
  4. Place your free hand on your thigh for support.
  5. Slowly raise your heel as high as you can, keeping your toes on the surface.
  6. Hold for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your heel back down.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch to the other leg.
  8. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  9. Also, make sure to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.

name: dumbbell seated palms up wrist curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your wrists hanging off the edge of your knees.
  3. Curl your wrists up towards your forearms, keeping your elbows stationary and your palms facing up.
  4. Hold the contraction for a second, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Remember to keep your wrists straight and avoid any jerky movements.
  7. Once you have completed your set, gently stretch out your wrists by extending your arms out in front of you and flexing your hands down towards the ground.

name: dumbbell seated preacher curl
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a preacher bench with your feet flat on the ground and your arms extended over the bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Make sure your upper arms are resting on the bench and your palms are facing up.
  3. Exhale and slowly curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary and your wrists straight.
  4. Hold for a moment and squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
  5. Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows stationary.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, carefully place the dumbbells on the ground and stand up from the bench.

name: dumbbell seated revers grip concentration curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand with an underhand grip (palm facing up).
  2. Place your left elbow on the inside of your left thigh and extend your left arm out to the side to support your upper body.
  3. Bring the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow stationary and close to your body.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on your right arm before switching to your left arm.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise to avoid any unnecessary strain on your lower back.

name: dumbbell seated reverse grip one arm overhead tricep extension
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with an overhand grip (palms facing down) and bring it up to shoulder height.
  3. Extend your arm straight up, keeping your elbow close to your head.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head, bending your elbow and keeping your upper arm stationary.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat on the other side.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid strain or injury.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to ensure that you can perform the exercise with proper form and control.
  9. As with any exercise, it's important to warm up properly beforehand and to cool down and stretch afterwards to prevent injury and promote recovery.

name: dumbbell seated shoulder press
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, held at shoulder height with your palms facing forward.
  2. Make sure your back is straight and your feet are firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Exhale and push the dumbbells up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder height while inhaling.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and avoid arching your back during the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as necessary to challenge yourself without sacrificing proper form.
  8. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or healthcare professional before beginning if you have any concerns about your ability to perform the exercise safely.

name: dumbbell seated shoulder press (parallel grip)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your back straight and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Pick up a dumbbell in each hand and bring them up to shoulder height, with your palms facing inward towards each other.
  3. Press the dumbbells up above your head, extending your arms fully.
  4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height, keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Remember to exhale as you press the dumbbells up and inhale as you lower them back down.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  9. As with any exercise, if you experience any pain or discomfort, stop immediately and consult a healthcare professional.

name: dumbbell seated triceps extension
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench or chair with your back straight and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell with both hands and raise it above your head, keeping your elbows close to your ears.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head, bending your elbows and keeping your upper arms stationary.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  8. Consult with a fitness professional before starting any new exercise program.

name: dumbbell shrug
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
  3. Keeping your arms straight, lift your shoulders up toward your ears as high as you can.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as necessary to challenge yourself without compromising proper form.
  8. Variations of this exercise can include using one arm at a time or using a barbell instead of dumbbells.

name: dumbbell side bend
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Place your other hand on your hip.
  3. Engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  4. Slowly bend to the side, lowering the dumbbell towards your knee.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement.
  6. Slowly return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on one side before switching to the other side.
  8. Make sure to keep your movements slow and controlled, and avoid jerking or swinging the dumbbell.
  9. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to ensure proper form and prevent injury.
  10. For an added challenge, try holding the dumbbell in both hands and bending to the side.

name: dumbbell side lying one hand raise
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your side on a flat bench or mat, with your legs straight out and your feet stacked on top of each other.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in your top hand, with your palm facing in towards your body.
  3. Keeping your arm straight, slowly raise the dumbbell up towards the ceiling, making sure to keep your elbow slightly bent.
  4. Once the dumbbell is at shoulder height, pause for a moment, then slowly lower it back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side and repeat the exercise with your other arm.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your body in a straight line throughout the exercise, and avoid swinging or jerking the weight.
  7. You can also vary the exercise by using a lighter or heavier weight, or by performing the exercise with both arms at once.

name: dumbbell side plank with rear fly
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your side with your legs extended and your feet stacked on top of each other.
  2. Place a dumbbell on the floor next to your top hand.
  3. Place your top hand on the dumbbell and lift your body up into a side plank position.
  4. Extend your bottom arm straight out from your shoulder and keep it in line with your body.
  5. Engage your core and lift the dumbbell off the ground with your top hand, pulling it up towards your chest.
  6. Lower the dumbbell back down to the ground and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Switch sides and repeat the exercise.

name: dumbbell single arm overhead carry
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the dumbbell in one hand with your arm extended straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Engage your core and keep your arm straight as you walk forward for a set distance or time.
  4. Switch arms and repeat the exercise on the opposite side.
  5. Make sure to keep your shoulders level and avoid leaning to one side.
  6. Focus on keeping your arm extended and engaging your core for stability.
  7. Repeat for desired number of sets and reps.

name: dumbbell single leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Shift your weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground.
  3. Place the ball of your right foot on the edge of a step or platform, with your heel hanging off the edge.
  4. Keep your core engaged and your left knee slightly bent.
  5. Slowly raise your right heel as high as you can, using your calf muscles.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your heel back down.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with the dumbbell in your left hand.

name: dumbbell single leg deadlift
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Lift your left foot off the ground and extend it behind you, keeping your knee slightly bent.
  3. Keeping your back straight, hinge forward at the hips and lower the dumbbell towards the ground, while simultaneously lifting your left leg until your body forms a T-shape.
  4. Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with the dumbbell in your left hand.

name: dumbbell single leg deadlift with stepbox support
instructions:
1. Place a stepbox in front of you and stand with your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand and extend your right leg back, resting the ball of your foot on the stepbox.
  3. Engage your core and hinge forward at the hips, lowering the dumbbell towards the ground while keeping your back straight.
  4. Pause when your torso is parallel to the ground and your right leg is extended behind you.
  5. Slowly return to the starting position, keeping your balance on your left foot.
  6. Complete the desired number of repetitions on your right leg before switching to your left leg.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of sets.

name: dumbbell single leg split squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Take a big step forward with your right foot and place it about two feet in front of your left foot.
  3. Extend your left leg behind you and rest the top of your left foot on a bench or step behind you.
  4. Lower your body down by bending your right knee until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left knee should be hovering just above the ground.
  5. Push through your right heel to stand back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 10-12 reps on your right leg before switching to your left leg.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your chest up throughout the exercise.
  8. If you want to increase the difficulty, hold heavier dumbbells or add a jump at the top of the movement.

name: dumbbell single leg squat
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Lift your left foot off the ground and extend it forward.
  3. Slowly lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your right foot firmly on the ground.
  4. As you lower yourself down, lower the dumbbell towards the ground, keeping your arm straight.
  5. Once you have reached the bottom of the squat, push yourself back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps, then switch to your left hand and left foot and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: dumbbell squat
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
  2. Engage your core and keep your chest lifted as you bend your knees and lower your hips down and back, as if you were sitting into a chair. Keep your weight on your heels.
  3. Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, then push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your back straight and your knees in line with your toes throughout the exercise.
  7. For added difficulty, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or perform the exercise with a single dumbbell held at your chest.

name: dumbbell standing alternate hammer curl and press
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
  2. Bring your left arm up in a hammer curl motion, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  3. Once your left arm is fully curled, press the dumbbell up above your head with your palm facing forward.
  4. Lower your left arm back down to the starting position and repeat the same motion with your right arm.
  5. Continue alternating between your left and right arm for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing alternate overhead press
instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with palms facing forward.
  2. Press one dumbbell overhead while keeping the other at shoulder level.
  3. Lower the overhead dumbbell back to shoulder level and repeat with the other arm.
  4. Alternate arms for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to keep your core engaged and avoid arching your back as you press the weight overhead.
  6. Breathe out as you press the weight overhead and breathe in as you lower it back down.
  7. Start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the exercise.
  8. Perform 3 sets of 12-15 repetitions for a full workout.

name: dumbbell standing alternate raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
  2. Keep your arms straight and lift one dumbbell up to shoulder height while keeping your arm close to your body.
  3. Lower the dumbbell back down to your side and repeat with the other arm.
  4. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  6. Exhale as you lift the dumbbell and inhale as you lower it back down.
  7. For added challenge, increase the weight of the dumbbells or increase the number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing alternating tricep kickback
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
  3. Bring your elbows up to shoulder height and keep them close to your body.
  4. Extend your right arm back, straightening it behind you while keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Hold for a moment and then return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat on the left side.
  7. Alternate arms for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Start with a lighter weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the movement.
  10. Complete 3 sets of 12-15 repetitions on each arm.

name: dumbbell standing around world
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your palms facing your thighs.
  2. Start by lifting one dumbbell up to shoulder height, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  3. Slowly rotate your arm and the dumbbell up and around your head, keeping your elbow in the same position.
  4. As you lower the dumbbell back down to your starting position, repeat the same movement with your other arm.
  5. Continue alternating arms and rotating the dumbbells around your head in a circular motion.
  6. Complete 10-15 repetitions in one direction, then switch directions and repeat for another 10-15 reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, try increasing the weight or number of repetitions to challenge yourself.

name: dumbbell standing bent over one arm triceps extension
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your abs engaged.
  3. Extend your arm behind you, keeping your elbow close to your head and your palm facing inward.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to your starting position.
  5. Repeat for 10-12 reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  6. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each arm for a total of 6 sets.
  7. Make sure to breathe deeply throughout the exercise and avoid swinging the weight or arching your back.
  8. Gradually increase the weight of the dumbbell as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  9. Stretch your triceps and other muscles worked in the exercise after completing your sets.

name: dumbbell standing bent over two arm triceps extension
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in both hands.
  2. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  3. Extend your arms straight down towards the floor, with your palms facing each other and the dumbbell behind your head.
  4. Slowly raise the dumbbell back up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbows close to your head.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down behind your head.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. You can also do this exercise with one arm at a time if you prefer.
  9. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as needed to challenge yourself without sacrificing proper form.
  10. Always warm up before starting any exercise routine and consult with a healthcare professional before beginning a new exercise program.

name: dumbbell standing biceps curl
instructions:
1. Begin by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms hanging down at your sides with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Slowly lift one dumbbell towards your shoulder while keeping your elbow close to your body.
  3. Pause for a second at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat the movement with the other arm.
  5. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and engage your core throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you lift the dumbbell and inhale as you lower it back down.
  8. Choose a weight that challenges you but still allows you to complete the exercise with proper form.
  9. Perform 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Place the balls of your feet on a raised surface such as a step or weight plate, with your heels hanging off the edge.
  3. Ensure that your toes are facing forward and your feet are parallel to each other.
  4. With your arms extended by your sides, slowly raise your heels off the edge of the step or weight plate, lifting your body up onto the balls of your feet.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or use a higher step or weight plate to make the exercise more challenging.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and maintain good posture throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell standing concentration curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Bring the dumbbell up to your shoulder and grasp it with your other hand to stabilize your arm.
  3. Keep your elbow close to your body and curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, squeezing your bicep at the top of the movement.
  4. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position and repeat for your desired number of reps.
  5. Switch arms and repeat the exercise with the other arm.

name: dumbbell standing front raise above head
instructions:
1. Begin by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Keep your arms straight and lift the dumbbells in front of your body until they are level with your shoulders.
  3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. For a more challenging workout, increase the weight of the dumbbells or perform the exercise with one arm at a time.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise to prevent injury.
  7. Exhale as you lift the dumbbells and inhale as you lower them back down.

name: dumbbell standing inner biceps curl v. 2
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward.
  2. Keep your elbows close to your sides and slowly curl the weights up towards your shoulders.
  3. As you curl the weights, rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing your shoulders at the top of the movement.
  4. Hold the contraction for a second before slowly lowering the weights back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbows stationary throughout the movement and avoid swinging the weights.
  7. Exhale as you curl the weights up and inhale as you lower them back down.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge yourself without sacrificing proper form.
  9. Include this exercise in your regular biceps workout routine to build strength and definition in your inner biceps.

name: dumbbell standing kickback
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
  3. Bring your right elbow up to your side, keeping your forearm parallel to the ground.
  4. Extend your right arm straight back, squeezing your tricep at the top of the movement.
  5. Lower the weight back down to starting position and repeat for desired number of reps.
  6. Switch to your left arm and repeat the exercise.

name: dumbbell standing one arm concentration curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Place the back of your upper arm against the inside of your thigh, just above the knee, with your elbow bent and the dumbbell hanging down towards the floor.
  3. Keeping your upper arm stationary, exhale and curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder by contracting your bicep.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
  5. Complete the desired number of reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.

name: dumbbell standing one arm curl (over incline bench)
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that is appropriate for your strength level and place it on the floor in front of an incline bench.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the bench.
  3. Place your non-working arm on the top of the incline bench for support.
  4. Reach down and grab the dumbbell with your working arm, palm facing up.
  5. Keeping your elbow close to your body, slowly lift the dumbbell towards your shoulder, exhaling as you lift.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your bicep.
  7. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position, inhaling as you lower.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  9. Complete 2-3 sets of 8-12 reps on each arm.
  10. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise and avoid swinging the weight or using momentum.

name: dumbbell standing one arm curl over incline bench
instructions:
1. Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
  2. Choose a dumbbell of appropriate weight for your fitness level and hold it in one hand.
  3. Stand facing the incline bench with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Place the arm holding the dumbbell on the bench, with your elbow extended and your palm facing up.
  5. Lean forward slightly, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  6. Curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body and your palm facing up.
  7. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
