  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and focus on maintaining proper form.
  10. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the dumbbell back on the ground and rest for a moment before moving on to your next exercise.

name: dumbbell standing one arm extension
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Extend your arm straight up above your head, keeping your elbow close to your ear.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Start with a light weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the exercise.
  8. Aim for 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each arm.

name: dumbbell standing one arm palm in press
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing inward towards your body.
  2. Bring the dumbbell up to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  3. Press the dumbbell up towards the ceiling, fully extending your arm.
  4. Lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to the other arm.

name: dumbbell standing one arm reverse curl
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand, with your palm facing down.
  2. Keep your elbow close to your side and slowly lift the weight up towards your shoulder, bending your elbow.
  3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch to the other arm.
  5. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  6. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  7. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each arm for a full workout.

name: dumbbell standing overhead press
instructions:
1. Start by selecting the appropriate weight dumbbells based on your fitness level and experience.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the dumbbells held at shoulder height, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
  3. Press the dumbbells up and overhead, extending your arms fully and keeping your palms facing forward.
  4. Lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder height, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to engage your core and maintain good posture throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you press the dumbbells overhead and inhale as you lower them back down.
  8. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells to continue challenging yourself.

name: dumbbell standing palms in press
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with your palms facing inward.
  2. Engage your core and press the dumbbells up above your head, fully extending your arms.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder height with your palms facing inward.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  5. Make sure to keep your elbows close to your body throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back.
  6. For an added challenge, you can increase the weight of the dumbbells or add a squat to the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to use proper form to avoid injury.

name: dumbbell standing preacher curl
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with an underhand grip, so that your palm is facing up.
  3. Rest the back of your arm against the preacher bench or an incline bench, making sure that your elbow is directly under your shoulder.
  4. Slowly curl the weight up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary and your elbow close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat the exercise on the other side.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise to avoid any unnecessary strain on your lower back.
  8. Choose a weight that allows you to perform the exercise with proper form and control, and gradually increase the weight as you get stronger.
  9. Include the dumbbell standing preacher curl as part of your regular strength training routine to build strong, defined biceps.

name: dumbbell standing reverse curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing down.
  2. Keep your elbows close to your body and lift the dumbbells towards your shoulders.
  3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing triceps extension
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Extend your arm straight up so that the dumbbell is directly above your head.
  3. Bend your elbow and lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your upper arm stationary.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then extend your arm back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. You can also perform this exercise while seated on a bench or stability ball for added stability.

name: dumbbell standing zottman preacher curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up.
  2. Rest your upper arms on the preacher bench with your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Slowly curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows in place.
  4. At the top of the curl, rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing down.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position with your palms facing up.
  6. At the bottom of the curl, rotate your wrists back so that your palms are facing up.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell step up single leg balance with bicep curl
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of a bench or step with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Place your right foot on the bench or step and step up, straightening your right leg until you are standing on top of the bench or step.
  3. As you step up, curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause at the top of the step with your right foot on the bench or step and your left foot hovering off the ground.
  5. Balance on your right foot while keeping your left foot off the ground.
  6. Lower the dumbbells back down to your sides as you step your left foot back down to the ground.
  7. Repeat the exercise on the opposite side by placing your left foot on the bench or step and stepping up while curling the dumbbells towards your shoulders.
  8. Complete 10-12 repetitions on each leg for 2-3 sets.

name: dumbbell step-up
instructions:
1. Stand in front of a sturdy bench or step with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Place your right foot on the bench or step, making sure your entire foot is on the surface.
  3. Push through your right foot and lift your body up onto the bench or step, bringing your left foot up to meet your right foot.
  4. Step back down with your left foot, followed by your right foot.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with your left foot on the bench or step.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. You can increase the difficulty of the exercise by using heavier dumbbells or by increasing the height of the bench or step.
  8. Remember to warm up before starting the exercise and to cool down afterwards.

name: dumbbell step-up lunge
instructions:
1. Start by standing in front of a bench or step with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Place your right foot on the bench or step, making sure your whole foot is on it and your heel is not hanging off the edge.
  3. Step up with your right foot, straightening your leg and lifting your body up onto the bench or step.
  4. As you step up, lift your left knee up towards your chest and hold it there for a moment.
  5. Lower your left foot back down to the ground and step your right foot back down to the ground as well.
  6. Repeat the exercise, this time stepping up with your left foot and lifting your right knee up towards your chest.
  7. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  8. Make sure to keep your core tight and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Choose a weight that challenges you but still allows you to maintain proper form.
  10. Remember to warm up before starting any exercise routine and cool down afterwards.

name: dumbbell step-up split squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of a sturdy bench or step with a pair of dumbbells in your hands.
  2. Step up onto the bench or step with your right foot, keeping your left foot on the ground.
  3. As you step up, simultaneously lower your left knee down towards the ground into a split squat position.
  4. Ensure that your right knee is directly above your right ankle and your left knee is hovering just above the ground.
  5. Push through your right heel to lift yourself back up to the starting position, while simultaneously raising your left knee back up to hip height.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on your right leg before switching to your left leg.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and maintain good posture.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  9. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise.
  10. Finish the exercise by stepping down from the bench or step and placing the dumbbells back on the ground.

name: dumbbell stiff leg deadlift
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a pair of dumbbells in front of your thighs with an overhand grip.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you hinge at the hips and lower the dumbbells towards the ground.
  3. Keep your knees slightly bent and your weight in your heels.
  4. Lower the dumbbells as far as you can while maintaining proper form and feeling a stretch in your hamstrings.
  5. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the dumbbells back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders or arching your lower back.
  8. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell straight arm pullover
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with your head at one end and your feet at the other end.
  2. Hold a dumbbell with both hands, palms facing up, and extend your arms straight up above your chest.
  3. Lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight, until you feel a stretch in your chest and lats.
  4. Pause for a moment, then lift the dumbbell back up to the starting position, keeping your arms straight the entire time.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your lower back pressed firmly against the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.

name: dumbbell straight leg deadlift
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your palms facing your thighs.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you hinge forward at your hips, lowering the dumbbells towards the floor.
  3. Lower the dumbbells as far as you can while maintaining a straight back and keeping your knees slightly bent.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise your torso back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your shoulders back and down throughout the exercise, and avoid rounding your back or letting your knees collapse inward.
  7. Variations: You can perform this exercise with a single dumbbell held in both hands, or with a barbell instead of dumbbells.

name: dumbbell sumo pull through
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and your toes pointed slightly outwards. Hold a dumbbell with both hands in front of your body.
  2. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your thighs are parallel to the ground. Keep your back straight and your chest up.
  3. Place the dumbbell on the ground between your legs, just behind your heels.
  4. Grab the dumbbell with one hand and pull it through your legs, moving it to the opposite side of your body.
  5. Release the dumbbell and grab it with your other hand, pulling it back through your legs to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the movement, alternating hands with each repetition.
  7. Complete 10-12 repetitions for 3-4 sets, with a rest period of 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: dumbbell supported squat
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Bring the dumbbells up to shoulder height, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
  3. Lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
  4. As you squat down, keep your elbows close to your sides and your dumbbells pressed against your shoulders.
  5. Once you reach the bottom of the squat, hold for a second and then push back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower down and exhaling as you push back up.
  8. Make sure to choose a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

name: dumbbell tate press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your head and shoulders supported by the bench.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand and extend your arms straight up above your chest, palms facing each other.
  3. Bend your elbows and lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  4. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then press the dumbbells back up to the starting position.
  5. As you press the dumbbells up, rotate your wrists so that your palms face away from each other at the top of the movement.
  6. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position with your palms facing each other.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell tricep kickback with stork stance
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing inward.
  2. Take a step forward with your left foot, bending your knee slightly and lifting your right foot off the ground. This is the stork stance.
  3. Lean forward at the hips so that your torso is parallel to the ground.
  4. Bend your right elbow so that the dumbbell is in line with your chest.
  5. Extend your right arm back, straightening your elbow and lifting the dumbbell behind you.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
  7. Complete 10-12 repetitions on your right arm, then switch to your left arm and repeat the exercise.

name: dumbbell twisting bench press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Hold the dumbbells at chest level with your palms facing each other.
  3. Lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. As you press the dumbbells up, twist your wrists so that your palms are facing away from each other at the top of the movement.
  5. Lower the dumbbells back down to your chest, twisting your wrists back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you press the dumbbells up and inhale as you lower them back down.
  9. Be sure to choose an appropriate weight for your fitness level and always warm up before beginning any exercise routine.

name: dumbbell upright row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your thighs.
  2. Keep your back straight and engage your core muscles.
  3. Lift the dumbbells straight up towards your chin, keeping them close to your body.
  4. As you lift the dumbbells, keep your elbows pointed outwards and above your wrists.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your thighs.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Avoid using momentum to lift the dumbbells and focus on using your shoulder muscles to perform the movement.
  9. Exhale as you lift the dumbbells and inhale as you lower them back down.
  10. Remember to warm up before starting the exercise and stretch afterwards to prevent injury.

name: dumbbell upright row (back pov)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
  2. Keep your arms straight and your palms facing your body.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbells towards your chin, keeping them close to your body.
  4. As you lift, keep your elbows pointed outwards and your shoulders relaxed.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as necessary to maintain proper form and prevent injury.

name: dumbbell upright shoulder external rotation
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Bring your arm to a 90-degree angle, with your elbow at your side and your forearm pointing straight up.
  3. Rotate your arm outward, keeping your elbow at your side and your forearm pointing up.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the rotation, then slowly lower your arm back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbow at your side throughout the exercise and use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.

name: dumbbell waiter biceps curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, palms facing up.
  3. Bend your elbows and bring the dumbbells up to shoulder height, keeping your palms facing up.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell w-press
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
  2. Press the dumbbells up and out to form a "W" shape with your arms, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
  3. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder height.
  4. Repeat for 10-12 reps, or as many as you can do with good form.
  5. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  6. Variation: You can also perform this exercise while lying on a bench, with your arms hanging down towards the floor and your palms facing inwards.

name: dumbbell zottman curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up.
  2. Curl the dumbbells up to your shoulders while keeping your elbows close to your body.
  3. At the top of the curl, rotate your wrists so your palms are facing down.
  4. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position with your palms facing down.
  5. At the bottom of the curl, rotate your wrists so your palms are facing up.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: dumbbell zottman preacher curl
instructions:
1. Choose a dumbbell that you are comfortable with, and sit on a preacher bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your arms on the bench with your palms facing up, and grip the dumbbells with your hands.
  3. Begin the exercise by curling the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. At the top of the curl, rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing down.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, with your palms facing down.
  6. At the bottom of the curl, rotate your wrists again so that your palms are facing up.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.

name: dumbbells seated triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand and bring them up to your shoulders with your palms facing inwards.
  3. Slowly extend your arms upwards, keeping your elbows close to your head and your palms facing each other.
  4. Pause when your arms are fully extended and hold for a second.
  5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your head.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as necessary to challenge yourself.
  9. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise.
  10. Finish your set and then rest before moving on to the next exercise.

name: dynamic chest stretch (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Interlace your fingers behind your back, with your palms facing inward.
  3. Slowly lift your arms up and away from your body, keeping them straight.
  4. As you lift your arms, squeeze your shoulder blades together and push your chest forward.
  5. Hold this position for 10-15 seconds, feeling a stretch in your chest muscles.
  6. Release your arms back down to your sides and repeat the stretch 2-3 times.

name: elbow dips
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a chair or bench with your hands placed on the edge of the seat, fingers facing forward.
  2. Slide your body off the chair, keeping your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
  4. Stop when your elbows reach a 90-degree angle, then push back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: elbow lift - reverse push-up
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you and your hands behind your hips, fingers pointing towards your feet.
  2. Press down through your hands and lift your hips off the ground, straightening your arms.
  3. Keeping your arms straight, lower your hips back down towards the ground.
  4. As your hips touch the ground, bend your elbows and lower your upper body towards the ground.
  5. Push back up through your hands, straightening your arms and lifting your hips off the ground again.
  6. Repeat steps 3-5 for the desired number of repetitions.

name: elbow-to-knee
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your arms extended above your head.
  2. Slowly lift your head and shoulders off the ground, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee.
  3. At the same time, lift your left leg off the ground and bring your left knee towards your right elbow.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then lower your head, shoulders, and legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise, this time bringing your left elbow towards your right knee and your right knee towards your left elbow.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: elevator
instructions:
1. Step onto the exercise elevator and press the button for the desired floor.
  2. Once the elevator arrives at the designated floor, exit the elevator and follow the signs to the exercise area.
  3. Choose a piece of exercise equipment or area to use and begin your workout.
  4. Be sure to follow any posted instructions or guidelines for the equipment or area you are using.
  5. Stay hydrated by bringing a water bottle with you or using the water fountain provided.
  6. When you are finished with your workout, return any equipment to its proper place and exit the exercise area.
  7. Take the elevator back to the floor you started on or another desired floor.
  8. Exit the elevator and continue with your day.

name: exercise ball alternating arm ups
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90 degree angle.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand and extend your arm straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder and switch to your left arm, extending it straight up towards the ceiling.
  4. Continue alternating arms, lifting and lowering the dumbbell with each arm for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Be sure to engage your core and maintain proper posture throughout the exercise.
  6. Repeat for 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

name: exercise ball back extension with arms extended
instructions:
1. Begin by laying face down on the exercise ball, with your feet flat on the ground and your toes pointing towards the floor.
  2. Slowly walk your hands out in front of you until your upper body is parallel to the ground and your arms are fully extended.
  3. Engage your core muscles and slowly lift your upper body off the ball, keeping your arms extended in front of you.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for several repetitions, making sure to keep your movements slow and controlled.
  6. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to keep your neck and shoulders relaxed.
  7. For an added challenge, hold a light weight in your hands while performing the exercise.

name: exercise ball back extension with hands behind head
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on the exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your hands behind your head.
  2. Slowly lift your upper body off the ball by contracting your lower back muscles.
  3. As you lift, keep your head in line with your spine and your elbows out to the sides.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise for several repetitions, aiming for 2-3 sets of 10-15 reps.
  6. Remember to breathe evenly throughout the exercise and avoid straining your neck or lower back.

name: exercise ball back extension with knees off ground
instructions:
1. Choose a suitable exercise ball and place it on the ground.
  2. Lie down on your stomach with your thighs resting on the exercise ball and your toes on the ground.
  3. Place your hands behind your head or cross them over your chest.
  4. Engage your core muscles and lift your upper body off the ground while keeping your lower body stable on the ball.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly lower your upper body back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 repetitions or as many as you can comfortably do.
  7. Take a break and repeat for another set if desired.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid straining your neck or lower back.
  9. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight or resistance band across your chest while performing the exercise.

name: exercise ball back extension with rotation
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your stomach on top of the exercise ball, with your feet planted firmly on the ground and your hands behind your head.
  2. Engage your core muscles and lift your upper body off the ball, extending your back and keeping your neck in a neutral position.
  3. As you reach the top of the extension, rotate your torso to the right by bringing your right elbow towards your left knee.
  4. Return to the starting position and repeat the rotation on the left side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee.
  5. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your feet planted on the ground and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you lift and rotate, and inhale as you return to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions.

name: exercise ball dip
instructions:
1. Place the exercise ball on the ground and sit on it with your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Slowly walk your feet forward while rolling the ball down your back until your head and shoulders are resting on the ball and your hips are lifted.
  3. Place your hands on the sides of your head with your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  4. Lower your hips down towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  5. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, walk your feet back towards the ball and carefully roll back up to a seated position.

name: exercise ball hip flexor stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your hands resting on your hips.
  2. Slowly walk your feet forward, rolling the ball underneath you until your upper back is resting on the ball and your feet are flat on the ground.
  3. Allow your arms to fall to your sides and relax your shoulders.
  4. Slowly lift your right foot off the ground and bring your knee towards your chest, keeping your left foot firmly planted on the ground.
  5. Hold this position for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your right hip flexor.
  6. Lower your right foot back to the ground and repeat on the other side, lifting your left foot towards your chest.
  7. Repeat this exercise for 2-3 sets on each side, taking breaks as needed.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain good posture throughout the stretch.
  9. When finished, slowly walk your feet back towards the ball and stand up carefully.

name: exercise ball hug
instructions:
1. Choose an exercise ball that is the appropriate size for your height.
  2. Sit on the exercise ball and walk your feet forward until your lower back is resting on the ball.
  3. Place your feet hip-width apart and keep them flat on the ground.
  4. Bring your arms around the ball and hug it tightly to your chest.
  5. Hold the hug for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
  6. Release the hug and repeat for 3-5 sets.
  7. For an added challenge, lift one leg off the ground while hugging the ball, and alternate legs for each set.

name: exercise ball lat stretch
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Extend your arms straight up overhead and interlace your fingers.
  3. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lean to one side, feeling a stretch along the opposite side of your body.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, then return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the stretch on the other side, leaning to the opposite side and holding for 10-15 seconds.
  6. Repeat the stretch on each side 2-3 times, taking deep breaths and relaxing into the stretch.
  7. As you become more comfortable with the stretch, you can increase the stretch by reaching further overhead and leaning further to the side.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and your posture tall throughout the stretch.
  9. Once you have completed the exercise, slowly stand up from the exercise ball and stretch out any remaining tension in your arms and shoulders.

name: exercise ball lower back stretch (pyramid)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the exercise ball with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Slowly walk your feet forward while rolling the ball down your back until your head and shoulders are resting on the ball.
  3. Place your hands behind your head or stretch them out to the sides for support.
  4. Slowly lower your hips towards the floor, keeping your feet planted firmly on the ground.
  5. Hold this position for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in your lower back.
  6. Slowly lift your hips back up towards the ball, returning to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise for a total of 10-15 repetitions.

name: exercise ball lying side lat stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your right side on an exercise mat with your legs straight and your exercise ball positioned on your left side.
  2. Place your left arm on top of the exercise ball and extend it straight out from your shoulder.
  3. Place your right hand on the mat in front of your chest for stability.
  4. Inhale as you reach your left arm over the top of the exercise ball, stretching your left side.
  5. Exhale as you return your left arm to the starting position.
  6. Repeat this movement for 10-15 repetitions on your left side before switching to your right side and repeating the exercise.

name: exercise ball on the wall calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and place an exercise ball between your back and the wall.
  2. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and about 1-2 feet away from the wall.
  3. Slowly raise your heels off the ground, keeping your toes on the ground and your knees straight.
  4. Hold the raised position for 1-2 seconds, then lower your heels back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions, or as many as you can do with proper form.
  6. To increase the difficulty, hold a dumbbell in one hand or place a resistance band around your thighs.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and engage your core muscles throughout the exercise.
  8. Perform 2-3 sets of the exercise, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.
  9. Stretch your calf muscles after the exercise by standing on a step and lowering your heels below the step, holding the stretch for 20-30 seconds.

name: exercise ball on the wall calf raise (tennis ball between ankles)
instructions:
1. Stand facing a wall with an exercise ball placed between your ankles.
  2. Place your hands on the wall at shoulder height for balance.
  3. Slowly raise your heels off the ground, pressing into the ball with your ankles.
  4. Hold at the top for a second, then slowly lower your heels back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for 10-15 reps.
  6. Rest for 30 seconds, then repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: exercise ball on the wall calf raise (tennis ball between knees)
instructions:
1. Stand facing a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart and the exercise ball between your knees.
  2. Place your hands on the wall at shoulder height.
  3. Raise your heels off the ground and push up on the balls of your feet.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds.
  5. Lower your heels back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 reps.
  7. Rest for 30 seconds and repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: exercise ball one leg prone lower body rotation
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your stomach on top of an exercise ball, with your hands resting on the floor in front of you and your toes touching the floor behind you.
  2. Extend one leg straight out behind you, keeping it parallel to the floor.
  3. Engage your core muscles and slowly rotate your lower body to one side, keeping your extended leg straight and your toes touching the floor.
  4. Pause for a moment at the end of the rotation, then slowly rotate your lower body back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the rotation on the other side.
  6. Complete 10-12 repetitions on each side, then rest and repeat for one or two more sets.
  7. Remember to breathe evenly throughout the exercise, and to keep your movements slow and controlled to avoid injury.
  8. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the difficulty by holding a light weight in your hands or by extending both legs at the same time.

name: exercise ball one legged diagonal kick hamstring curl
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back on an exercise mat with your legs straight and your arms at your sides.
  2. Place an exercise ball under your heels and lift your hips off the mat, forming a straight line from your shoulders to your feet.
  3. Lift your right leg off the ball and extend it diagonally towards the left side of your body.
  4. As you bring your leg back to center, bend your knee and curl the ball towards your buttocks, engaging your hamstring muscles.
  5. Extend your leg back out diagonally towards the right side of your body and repeat the curling motion.
  6. Complete 10-12 reps on one leg before switching to the other leg.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets on each leg.

name: exercise ball pike push up
instructions:
1. Start by placing an exercise ball on the floor and kneeling in front of it.
  2. Place your hands on the floor in front of the ball, shoulder-width apart.
  3. Walk your feet back until your shins are resting on top of the ball and you are in a push-up position.
  4. Engage your core and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, rolling the ball towards your hands.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
  6. Bend your elbows and lower your chest towards the floor, keeping your body in a straight line.
  7. Push back up to the starting position, straightening your arms.
  8. Repeat the pike movement, rolling the ball towards your hands and lifting your hips up towards the ceiling.
  9. Continue alternating between the pike movement and the push-up movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  10. When finished, carefully walk your feet off of the ball and stand up.

name: exercise ball prone leg raise
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on an exercise ball with your hands on the ground in front of you.
  2. Position the ball under your hips and thighs, with your legs straight and your toes on the ground.
  3. Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight and parallel to the floor.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for several reps, focusing on keeping your core engaged and your legs straight throughout the movement.
  6. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight between your feet or ankles during the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back or letting your hips sag.

name: exercise ball seated hamstring stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Slowly extend one leg out in front of you, keeping your foot flexed and your toes pointing up towards the ceiling.
  3. Lean forward from your hips, keeping your back straight, and reach towards your toes with both hands.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in the back of your thigh.
  5. Release the stretch and switch legs, repeating the same process on the other side.
  6. Repeat the stretch on each leg 2-3 times, gradually increasing the length of time you hold the stretch.
  7. As you become more flexible, you can increase the difficulty of the stretch by reaching further towards your toes or by straightening your knee even more.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and relax into the stretch, avoiding any jerky or sudden movements.
  9. End the stretch by sitting up slowly and rolling your shoulders back and down.

name: exercise ball seated triceps stretch
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on an exercise ball with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Place your hands behind your back on the ball, with your fingers pointing towards the ground.
  3. Slowly roll the ball away from your body while keeping your hands in place, until you feel a stretch in your triceps.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, making sure to breathe deeply.
  5. Gently roll the ball back towards your body to release the stretch.
  6. Repeat the stretch for 2-3 sets, taking a short break in between each set.

name: exercise ball supine triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back on an exercise mat with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold an exercise ball with both hands and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Bend your elbows and lower the ball towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then straighten your arms to return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions, then rest and repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: ez bar french press on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Choose an appropriate weight for the EZ bar and load it onto the bar.
  2. Place an exercise ball on the floor and sit on it with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Hold the EZ bar with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Bring the EZ bar up to your chest and then extend your arms straight up, holding the bar above your head.
  5. Bend your elbows and lower the EZ bar down towards the back of your head, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then extend your arms back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully lower the EZ bar back down to your chest before standing up from the exercise ball.

name: ez bar lying bent arms pullover
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Grasp the EZ bar with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hold the bar above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  4. Slowly lower the bar behind your head, keeping your elbows bent and close to your ears.
  5. Pause for a moment when the bar is parallel to the ground.
  6. Slowly raise the bar back to the starting position, keeping your elbows bent and close to your ears.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: ez bar lying close grip triceps extension behind head
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly on the ground and your head at the end of the bench.
  2. Take an EZ bar with a close grip and hold it straight up above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  3. Slowly lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  4. Lower the bar until it is just above your forehead, making sure to keep your elbows close to your head.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the bar back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
  6. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core tight and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  8. When you are finished, carefully return the bar to the starting position and sit up slowly.

name: ez bar reverse grip bent over row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grab the EZ bar with an overhand grip, with your hands placed shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bend forward at your hips, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. Lower the bar towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. As you lower the bar, squeeze your shoulder blades together and engage your back muscles.
  6. Once the bar is close to the ground, pause for a moment and then slowly raise it back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: ez bar seated close grip concentration curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Grab an EZ bar with an underhand grip, making sure your hands are close together.
  3. Place your elbows on the inside of your thighs, close to your knees.
  4. Curl the EZ bar up towards your chest, keeping your elbows stationary and close to your body.
  5. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, exhaling as you curl the bar up and inhaling as you lower it back down.
  8. Make sure to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  9. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the EZ bar back on the rack.

name: ez bar standing french press
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding the EZ bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bring the bar up to your shoulders, keeping your elbows tucked in and your upper arms parallel to the ground.
  3. Extend your arms straight up, keeping your elbows in the same position. This is your starting position.
  4. Slowly lower the bar down behind your head, bending at the elbows. Keep your upper arms stationary and your elbows pointed forward.
  5. Once the bar is just above your head, pause for a moment, then slowly raise it back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, carefully lower the bar back down to your shoulders and then down to the ground.
  8. Remember to keep your core tight and your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid injury.
  9. Gradually increase weight as needed to challenge yourself and continue to see progress.

name: ez barbell anti gravity press
instructions:
1. Start by loading an appropriate weight onto the EZ barbell.
  2. Lie down on a flat bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Grasp the EZ barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Extend your arms straight up above your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  6. Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your chest.
  7. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, extending your arms straight up above your chest.
  8. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  10. Once you have completed your set, carefully rack the barbell and sit up.

name: ez barbell close grip preacher curl
instructions:
1. Choose the appropriate weight for your fitness level and load it onto the EZ barbell.
  2. Adjust the height of the preacher bench so that your armpits rest comfortably on the top of the bench.
  3. Grasp the EZ barbell with an underhand grip (palms facing up) and position your hands close together, shoulder-width apart.
  4. Rest your upper arms on the preacher bench and ensure that your elbows are fully extended.
  5. Slowly curl the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and your upper arms stationary.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  7. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully rack the barbell and adjust the preacher bench back to its original height.

name: ez barbell close-grip curl
instructions:
1. Begin by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the EZ barbell with an underhand grip, keeping your hands close together, no more than 6 inches apart.
  3. Bring the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary.
  4. Pause for a moment, squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
  5. Slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: ez barbell curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold the ez barbell with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing up.
  3. Keep your elbows close to your sides and curl the bar up towards your chest, keeping your wrists straight. Exhale as you lift the bar.
  4. Pause for a second at the top of the curl, squeezing your biceps.
  5. Slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your sides and inhaling as you lower the bar.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.

name: ez barbell decline close grip face press
instructions:
1. Set up a decline bench at an angle of approximately 30 degrees.
  2. Load an EZ barbell with an appropriate weight for your fitness level and secure the weights with collars.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your head positioned at the lower end of the bench.
  4. Grasp the EZ barbell with a close grip, with your palms facing towards your face and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  5. Extend your arms upwards, keeping your elbows close to your body and the barbell directly above your chest.
  6. Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows tucked in and your wrists straight.
  7. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then press the barbell back up to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. When finished, carefully rack the barbell and sit up slowly.
  10. Stretch your chest and triceps to help prevent soreness and injury.

name: ez barbell decline triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying down on a decline bench with your feet secured under the pads.
  2. Grasp the EZ bar with an overhand grip, with your hands placed slightly closer than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, with the bar directly above your chest.
  4. Slowly lower the bar towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary and your elbows pointing towards the ceiling.
  5. Pause briefly when the bar is just above your forehead.
  6. Using your triceps, extend your arms back up towards the ceiling to complete one rep.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, carefully place the bar back on the rack and sit up slowly.

name: ez barbell incline triceps extension
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on an incline bench with your feet flat on the ground and your head at the highest point of the bench.
  2. Hold the EZ barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing forward.
  3. Extend your arms up above your chest, keeping your elbows close to your head.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, bending your elbows and keeping them close to your head.
  5. Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your forehead.
  6. Slowly lift the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.

name: ez barbell jm bench press
instructions:
1. Load the appropriate weight onto the EZ barbell.
  2. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Grip the EZ barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing forward.
  4. Lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in at a 45-degree angle.
  5. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then press the barbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the barbell and sit up from the bench.

name: ez barbell reverse grip curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the EZ barbell with an underhand grip (palms facing up) with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Keep your elbows close to your sides and lift the bar towards your chest by bending your elbows.
  3. Hold the bar at the top of the movement for a second, then slowly lower it back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  6. Start with a light weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the movement.
  7. Avoid swinging or using momentum to lift the bar, as this can lead to injury and reduce the effectiveness of the exercise.
  8. Perform 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions for optimal results.

name: ez barbell reverse grip preacher curl
instructions:
1. Start by selecting an appropriate weight for the exercise and loading it onto the EZ barbell.
  2. Sit on the preacher bench with your chest against the pad and your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Grasp the EZ barbell with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly curl the barbell towards your shoulders, exhaling as you lift.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, inhaling as you lower.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your elbows close to your body and your wrists straight throughout the exercise to avoid injury.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.
  9. Stretch your biceps and forearms to cool down and prevent muscle soreness.

name: ez barbell seated curls
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
  2. Hold the EZ barbell with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Keep your elbows close to your sides and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders.
  4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your wrists straight and avoid swinging your body during the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the barbell as necessary to ensure proper form and to challenge yourself appropriately.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, exhaling as you curl the barbell up and inhaling as you lower it back down.
  9. Finish the exercise by gently placing the barbell back on the rack.

name: ez barbell seated triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench with your back straight and feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold the EZ bar with an overhand grip and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Extend your arms straight up above your head, keeping your elbows close to your ears.
  4. Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the bar back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the bar as needed to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  9. As with any exercise, consult with a trainer or medical professional before beginning if you have any concerns about your ability to perform the movement safely.

name: ez barbell spider curl
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting an EZ barbell and adding weight plates to each end.
  2. Stand facing an incline bench and place the EZ barbell on the ground in front of you.
  3. Grab the bar with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lie face down on the incline bench with your arms extended straight down, holding the barbell.
  5. Keep your elbows close to your sides and curl the barbell up towards your chest, contracting your biceps.
  6. Hold the contraction for a second before slowly lowering the barbell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Once finished, carefully place the barbell back on the ground.
  9. Stretch your biceps to cool down and prevent injury.

name: ez barbell spider curl
instructions:
1. Start by selecting an EZ barbell and loading it with a comfortable weight.
  2. Stand in front of the barbell and grab it with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Place your elbows on an incline bench, with your upper arms parallel to the ground and your chest resting on the bench.
  4. Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  5. Curl the barbell up towards your forehead, keeping your elbows stationary and squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
  6. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, with control and without letting your elbows move.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm or take a break as needed.
  8. When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack and stretch your arms and biceps.

name: ez-bar biceps curl (with arm blaster)
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting the appropriate weight for the exercise and loading it onto the ez-bar.
  2. Attach the arm blaster to your upper arms, positioning it so that your elbows are locked in place and your arms are at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the ez-bar with an underhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Start with your arms fully extended and your elbows close to your sides.
  5. Slowly curl the bar up towards your chest, keeping your elbows stationary and your upper arms locked in place by the arm blaster.
  6. Once the bar is at chest height, pause for a moment and squeeze your biceps before slowly lowering the bar back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your back straight and engage your core throughout the exercise.
  9. When finished, carefully remove the arm blaster and return the weight to its starting position.

name: ez-bar close-grip bench press
instructions:
1. Begin by setting up a bench press station with an EZ-bar loaded with an appropriate weight.
  2. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back flat against the bench.
  3. Grasp the EZ-bar with your hands close together, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lift the EZ-bar off the rack and hold it above your chest with your arms fully extended.
  5. Slowly lower the bar down towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  6. Pause briefly when the bar touches your chest, then push it back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the EZ-bar back on the rack.

name: ez-barbell standing wide grip biceps curl
instructions:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the EZ-barbell with an underhand grip, keeping your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Keep your elbows close to your sides and curl the barbell upwards towards your chest, exhaling as you lift.
  4. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  5. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, inhaling as you lower.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise and avoid swinging your body to lift the weight.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to challenge yourself without sacrificing proper form.
  9. Stretch your biceps after the exercise to prevent soreness and injury.

name: farmers walk
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a heavy weight in each hand, such as dumbbells or kettlebells.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you lift the weights off the ground.
  3. Walk forward while maintaining your posture and keeping your shoulders down and back.
  4. Take small, controlled steps and keep your arms straight at your sides.
  5. Continue walking for a set distance or time, such as 30 seconds or 50 feet.
  6. When you reach your stopping point, carefully lower the weights back to the ground.
  7. Rest for a few seconds before repeating the exercise for a desired number of sets.

name: finger curls
instructions:
1. Place a dumbbell in your hand and sit on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Rest your forearm on a flat surface with your palm facing up and your wrist hanging over the edge.
  3. Curl your fingers towards your palm, squeezing the dumbbell tightly.
  4. Slowly release your fingers back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: flag
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
  2. Step your right foot out to the side and raise your right arm straight up overhead.
  3. Lean your torso to the left, keeping your right arm straight and your left arm by your side.
  4. Hold for a few seconds, then return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat on the other side, stepping your left foot out and raising your left arm overhead while leaning to the right.
  6. Continue alternating sides for several repetitions.
  7. As you become more comfortable with the movement, try to increase the range of motion by leaning further to the side.
  8. You can also add a slight twist to the movement by turning your torso slightly towards the raised arm.
  9. Remember to breathe deeply and engage your core muscles to help stabilize your body throughout the exercise.

name: flexion leg sit up (bent knee)
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  3. Engage your abdominal muscles and lift your head, neck, and shoulders off the ground.
  4. At the same time, lift your knees towards your chest, keeping them bent.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your head, neck, shoulders, and legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: flexion leg sit up (straight arm)
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your legs straight in front of you.
  2. Place your arms straight above your head, keeping them in line with your ears.
  3. Slowly lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight and together.
  4. At the same time, lift your arms and torso off the ground, reaching towards your toes.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, focusing on engaging your abdominal muscles.
  6. Slowly lower your arms, torso, and legs back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: floor fly (with barbell)
instructions:
1. Start by lying on a flat bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold a barbell with both hands and extend your arms straight up, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  3. Lower the barbell slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent and your palms facing each other.
  4. Once the barbell reaches chest level, pause for a moment before slowly lifting it back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the barbell as necessary to ensure proper form and avoid injury.

name: flutter kicks
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back with your arms at your sides and your legs extended straight out in front of you.
  2. Engage your core muscles and lift your legs a few inches off the ground, keeping them straight.
  3. Keeping your legs straight, begin fluttering your legs up and down in a quick, alternating motion.
  4. Continue fluttering your legs for the desired amount of time or number of repetitions.
  5. To increase the challenge, you can try lifting your head and shoulders off the ground or placing your hands underneath your lower back for support.
  6. Remember to breathe deeply throughout the exercise and to keep your movements controlled and steady.
  7. Finish by lowering your legs back down to the ground and relaxing your muscles.

name: forward jump
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and swing your arms back behind you.
  3. Jump forward as far as you can, pushing off the balls of your feet.
  4. Extend your arms in front of you to help with balance.
  5. Land softly on the balls of your feet, with your knees bent to absorb the impact.
  6. Pause briefly before jumping forward again.
  7. Repeat for a desired number of repetitions or time period.

name: forward lunge (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
  2. Take a big step forward with your right foot, landing on the heel first.
  3. Bend your right knee and lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
  4. Make sure your knee is directly above your ankle, not pushed out too far.
  5. Keep your left leg straight behind you, with your left heel lifted off the ground.
  6. Hold for a few seconds, then push off your right foot to return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat with your left foot stepping forward.
  8. Do 10-15 reps on each leg, and gradually increase the number as you get stronger.
  9. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  10. You can also add weights to increase the difficulty of the exercise.

name: frankenstein squat
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell with both hands in front of your chest, with your elbows bent and close to your body.
  3. Squat down slowly, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. As you reach the bottom of your squat, pause and hold the weight in front of your chest.
  5. Slowly stand up again, driving through your heels and keeping your core engaged.
  6. As you reach the top of your squat, press the weight overhead, fully extending your arms.
  7. Lower the weight back down to your chest and repeat the squat.
  8. Complete 3-4 sets of 8-12 repetitions.

name: frog crunch
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back with your legs extended straight out in front of you.
  2. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart.
  3. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows out to the sides.
  4. Engage your core and lift your head, neck, and shoulders off the ground.
  5. At the same time, bring your knees towards your chest and lift your feet off the ground.
  6. As you lift your upper body and lower body, bring your elbows towards your knees.
  7. Hold for a moment and then slowly lower your head, neck, shoulders, and legs back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: frog planche
instructions:
1. Start in a frog position, with your feet hip-width apart and your knees bent.
  2. Place your hands on the ground in front of you, with your fingers facing forward.
  3. Shift your weight forward onto your hands, and lift your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your core and press your hips up towards the ceiling, straightening your arms and keeping your shoulders away from your ears.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then release back down to the frog position.
  6. Repeat for several reps, focusing on maintaining proper form and engaging your core throughout the exercise.

name: front lever
instructions:
1. Begin by hanging from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Engage your core and slowly lift your legs up, keeping them straight and together.
  3. Continue lifting until your body is parallel to the ground, with your arms straight and your shoulders pulled down and back.
  4. Hold this position for as long as you can, aiming for a goal of 10-20 seconds.
  5. To release, slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for multiple sets, gradually increasing the amount of time you can hold the front lever.

name: front lever reps
instructions:
1. Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
  2. Engage your core muscles and lift your legs up until they are parallel to the ground.
  3. Slowly lower your legs until they are perpendicular to the ground, while keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then lift your legs back up to the parallel position.
  5. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.
  6. As you progress, try to hold the perpendicular position for longer periods of time and lower your legs closer to the ground.

name: front plank with twist
instructions:
1. Start by getting into a plank position with your forearms on the ground and your elbows directly under your shoulders.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back flat.
  3. Slowly rotate your body to the right, lifting your right arm off the ground and reaching it towards the ceiling.
  4. Hold for a few seconds, then return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat on the left side, lifting your left arm off the ground and reaching it towards the ceiling.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat throughout the exercise.

name: full maltese
instructions:
1. Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lower your body into a squat position while keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  3. Place your hands on the ground in front of you and jump your feet back into a plank position.
  4. Lower your body down to the ground in a push-up motion.
  5. Push your body back up into a plank position and jump your feet forward to return to the squat position.
  6. Jump up explosively, reaching your arms overhead.
  7. Land softly back in the squat position and repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: full planche
instructions:
1. Begin in a push-up position with your hands and feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Slowly lower your body down into a push-up, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  3. Once you are in the bottom position of the push-up, shift your weight forward onto your hands and lift your feet off the ground.
  4. Keep your arms straight and your shoulders engaged as you lift your hips and legs up towards the ceiling.
  5. Try to hold the position for as long as possible, aiming for a few seconds at first and gradually building up to longer holds.
  6. When you are ready to come out of the full planche, slowly lower your feet back down to the ground and push yourself back up into the starting push-up position.
  7. Repeat for several reps, taking breaks as needed.

name: full planche push-up
instructions:
1. Begin in a push-up position with your hands on the ground and your feet together.
  2. Slowly lower your body down, keeping your elbows close to your sides, until your chest is just above the ground.
  3. Push your body back up to the starting position.
  4. Once in the starting position, shift your weight forward so that your shoulders are over your hands.
  5. Lean forward until your feet come off the ground and your body is parallel to the ground.
  6. Hold this position for as long as you can.
  7. To come out of the full planche position, slowly lower your feet back to the ground and return to the starting position.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps or time.

name: gironda sternum chin
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended above your head.
  2. Lower your arms behind your head and interlock your fingers.
  3. Keep your elbows close to your ears and your chin tucked in.
  4. Slowly lower your body by bending your knees and leaning forward.
  5. As you lower your body, bring your chin towards your sternum and touch your chest with your hands.
  6. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly rise back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: glute bridge march
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart.
  2. Engage your glutes and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, creating a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
  3. While maintaining this bridge position, lift your right foot off the ground and bring your knee towards your chest.
  4. Lower your right foot back to the ground and repeat the same movement with your left foot.
  5. Continue alternating between lifting your right and left foot, while keeping your hips lifted and your core engaged.
  6. Perform 10-15 repetitions on each leg, or until you feel fatigued.
  7. Lower your hips back down to the ground and rest for a few seconds before repeating the exercise for another set.

name: glute bridge two legs on bench (male)
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent.
  2. Place a bench or step behind you and position your feet on top of it, with your toes pointing forward.
  3. Place your hands by your sides, palms facing down.
  4. Engage your glutes and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
  5. Hold for a few seconds, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back.
  8. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight on your hips or place a resistance band around your thighs.

name: glute-ham raise
instructions:
1. Start by kneeling on a soft surface with your feet secured under a stable object or with a partner holding them down.
  2. Place your hands on your hips or cross them over your chest.
  3. Slowly lower your upper body towards the ground, controlling your descent with your hamstrings.
  4. Once you can no longer control your descent, use your hands to catch yourself and push yourself back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: gorilla chin
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at the hips.
  3. Place your hands on the back of your head with your elbows out to the sides.
  4. Keeping your elbows out, bring your chin down to your chest.
  5. Slowly lift your head back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: groin crunch
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands behind your head or at your sides for support.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your feet off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
  4. At the same time, lift your head and shoulders off the ground, bringing your chin towards your chest.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then lower your head, shoulders, and feet back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for several repetitions, focusing on engaging your core muscles and maintaining proper form.

name: hack calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand on a raised surface such as a step or weight plate with the balls of your feet on the edge and your heels hanging off.
  2. Hold onto a stable object such as a wall or railing for balance.
  3. Lower your heels as far down as possible, feeling a stretch in your calves.
  4. Raise your heels as high as possible, squeezing your calves at the top of the movement.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement before lowering your heels back down.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: hack one leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place your hands on your hips or hold onto a wall for balance.
  2. Lift one foot off the ground, keeping your toes on the ground and your heel lifted.
  3. Raise your heel as high as you can off the ground, keeping your toes on the ground.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your heel back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for 10-15 reps on one leg, then switch to the other leg.
  6. For a more challenging workout, hold a dumbbell in one hand while performing the exercise.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your posture upright throughout the exercise.
  8. Perform this exercise regularly to strengthen and tone your calf muscles.

name: half knee bends (male)
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
  2. Bend your right knee, keeping your left leg straight and your back straight.
  3. Lower your body as far as you comfortably can, keeping your right knee over your right foot and your left heel on the ground.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly straighten your right leg and return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise with your left leg.
  6. Perform 10 to 15 repetitions on each leg, or as many as you can comfortably do.
  7. Take a break and repeat the exercise for another set if desired.

name: half sit-up (male)
instructions:
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Cross your arms over your chest or place your hands behind your head.
  3. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button in towards your spine.
  4. Lift your head, neck, and shoulders off the ground, while keeping your lower back pressed into the ground.
  5. Hold for a few seconds and then slowly lower back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid pulling on your neck with your hands.

name: hamstring stretch
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Lift one leg off the ground and straighten it out in front of you, keeping the other foot flat on the ground.
  3. Using a towel or strap, loop it around the ball of your foot and gently pull your leg towards your body, keeping it as straight as possible.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in the back of your thigh.
  5. Release the stretch and repeat on the other leg.
  6. Repeat the stretch on each leg 2-3 times.
  7. Make sure to breathe deeply and relax into the stretch, avoiding any pain or discomfort.
