  8. As you become more flexible, you can increase the intensity of the stretch by pulling the towel or strap closer to your body.
  9. Remember to stretch both legs evenly to maintain balance and flexibility.

name: hands bike
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height so that your knees are slightly bent when your feet are on the pedals.
  2. Adjust the resistance level to your desired intensity.
  3. Place your hands on the handlebars and grip firmly.
  4. Begin pedaling with your feet while simultaneously moving your hands back and forth as if you were riding a bicycle with your hands.
  5. Continue pedaling and moving your hands for the desired amount of time or until you reach your fitness goal.
  6. Remember to maintain proper posture and engage your core muscles while exercising.
  7. When finished, slowly stop pedaling and carefully dismount the hands bike.
  8. Wipe down the handlebars and seat with a disinfectant wipe to maintain cleanliness.

name: hands clasped circular toe touch (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms hanging by your sides.
  2. Clasp your hands together in front of your body.
  3. Slowly bend forward at the waist, keeping your legs straight and your hands clasped together.
  4. Lower your head towards the floor and try to touch your toes with your clasped hands.
  5. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds.
  6. Slowly straighten up and return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise for 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions.

name: hands reversed clasped circular toe touch (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands clasped behind your back.
  2. Reverse the clasping of your hands so that your non-dominant hand is on top.
  3. Slowly bend forward at the waist, keeping your legs straight.
  4. As you bend forward, bring your clasped hands over your head and down towards your toes.
  5. Try to touch your toes with your hands, but don't force it if you can't reach.
  6. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds.
  7. Slowly rise back up to a standing position, keeping your hands clasped behind your back.
  8. Repeat the exercise for 5-10 repetitions.

name: handstand
instructions:
1. Find a clear, open space to practice in.
  2. Warm up your wrists, shoulders, and core with some stretches and exercises.
  3. Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
  4. Place your hands on the ground about a foot away from the wall.
  5. Kick one leg up towards the wall, using your other leg to push off the ground.
  6. As you kick up, keep your core engaged and your arms straight.
  7. Try to bring both legs up to the wall, and hold the handstand for as long as you can.
  8. When you're ready to come down, gently lower your legs back to the ground.
  9. Repeat the exercise, focusing on your form and balance.
  10. As you improve, try to hold the handstand for longer periods of time or practice without the support of the wall.

name: handstand push-up
instructions:
1. Start in a handstand position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet against a wall.
  2. Lower yourself down towards the ground by bending your elbows.
  3. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  4. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  5. Make sure to engage your core and keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  6. If you are unable to do a full handstand push-up, you can modify the exercise by doing partial reps or using a resistance band for assistance.
  7. Be sure to warm up properly before attempting this exercise and consult a professional if you have any concerns about your ability to perform it safely.

name: hanging leg hip raise
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar or a sturdy horizontal bar that can support your body weight.
  2. Hang from the bar with your palms facing away from your body and your arms straight.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your legs up towards your hips while keeping them straight.
  4. Pause for a second when your legs reach your hips.
  5. Lower your legs back down to the starting position with control.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. For an added challenge, you can try to lift your legs up towards your chest instead of your hips.

name: hanging leg raise
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar or any sturdy horizontal bar that can support your weight.
  2. Stand underneath the bar and reach up to grab it with both hands, using an overhand grip with your palms facing away from you.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your core muscles and lift your legs up towards the bar, keeping them straight and together.
  5. Continue to raise your legs until they are parallel to the ground or as high as you can go without swinging.
  6. Hold this position for a few seconds before slowly lowering your legs back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. To make the exercise more challenging, you can try lifting your legs with a bent knee or adding ankle weights.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid swinging or using momentum to lift your legs.

name: hanging oblique knee raise
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy pull-up bar and grab it with both hands, palms facing away from your body.
  2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your knees up towards your chest, twisting your hips to the side as you do so.
  4. Lower your legs back down to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
  5. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Be sure to maintain control throughout the movement and avoid swinging or using momentum to lift your legs.
  7. To make the exercise more challenging, you can try holding a dumbbell between your feet or wearing ankle weights.

name: hanging pike
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar or other sturdy overhead structure to hang from.
  2. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight and together.
  4. Bend at the waist and lift your legs up towards the bar, trying to touch your toes to the bar.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps or time.

name: hanging straight leg hip raise
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy pull-up bar and grip it with both hands, shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight down.
  3. Engage your core and lift your legs up until they are parallel with the ground.
  4. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: hanging straight leg raise
instructions:
1. Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from your body and your arms fully extended.
  2. Engage your core muscles and lift your legs up until they are parallel to the ground.
  3. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  5. If you find this exercise too difficult, you can try bending your knees slightly or using a resistance band for assistance.
  6. Alternatively, if you want to make the exercise more challenging, you can try adding ankle weights or holding a dumbbell between your feet.

name: hanging straight twisting leg hip raise
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy pull-up bar and hang from it with your palms facing away from your body and your legs straight down.
  2. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button in towards your spine.
  3. Twist your hips to one side, bringing your legs up towards your chest and keeping them straight.
  4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the movement, this time twisting your hips to the opposite side.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your movements slow and controlled, and to focus on using your core muscles to lift your legs rather than relying on momentum.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully release your grip on the pull-up bar and lower yourself back down to the ground.

name: high knee against wall
instructions:
1. Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart and your hands resting on your hips.
  2. Lift your right knee up towards your chest and place your foot against the wall, keeping your hands on your hips for balance.
  3. Push against the wall with your foot and hold for a few seconds before bringing your foot back down to the ground.
  4. Repeat with your left leg.
  5. Continue alternating legs for 10-15 repetitions on each side.
  6. For an added challenge, try to increase the speed of your knee lifts and push against the wall with more force.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and maintain good posture throughout the exercise.
  8. Take a break if you feel any discomfort or pain.

name: hip raise (bent knee)
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your arms at your sides with your palms facing down.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, squeezing your glutes and engaging your core.
  5. Slowly lower your hips back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: hug keens to chest
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms hanging by your sides.
  2. Bend your elbows and bring your hands up to your chest, with your palms facing each other.
  3. Wrap your arms around your chest, crossing your forearms over your chest.
  4. Clasp your hands together and squeeze your arms and chest tightly.
  5. Hold the hug for a few seconds, then release and repeat.
  6. Repeat the hug keens to chest exercise for several repetitions, focusing on your breathing and squeezing your muscles tightly each time.

name: hyght dumbbell fly
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand and extend your arms straight above your chest, with your palms facing each other.
  3. Lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc, keeping your elbows slightly bent and your palms facing up.
  4. Lower the dumbbells until your arms are parallel to the floor, or until you feel a stretch in your chest muscles.
  5. Pause briefly, then lift the dumbbells back up to the starting position, squeezing your chest muscles as you do so.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise.

name: hyperextension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on a hyperextension bench with your feet securely anchored and your hips resting comfortably at the edge of the pad.
  2. Place your hands behind your head or across your chest and engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine.
  3. Slowly lift your torso up until your body is in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  4. Hold the contraction at the top for a second or two, then lower your body back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the difficulty by holding a weight plate or dumbbell across your chest.
  7. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the movement, keeping your spine neutral and avoiding any excessive arching or bending.
  8. Remember to breathe steadily and rhythmically throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower your body and exhaling as you lift it back up.
  9. Once you have completed your set, carefully dismount the hyperextension bench and stretch out your lower back and hamstrings to help prevent any soreness or stiffness.

name: hyperextension (on bench)
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on a hyperextension bench with your hips resting on the pad and your feet securely anchored under the footpads.
  2. Place your hands behind your head or across your chest, whichever is more comfortable for you.
  3. Engage your lower back muscles and slowly lift your torso up until your body is in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement and then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your movements slow and controlled, and to focus on using your lower back muscles to lift your body up rather than relying on momentum.
  7. Be sure to breathe in as you lower your body down and exhale as you lift it up.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the difficulty of the exercise by holding a weight plate or dumbbell across your chest.

name: impossible dips
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy surface to perform the exercise on, such as parallel bars or the edge of a bench.
  2. Place your hands on the surface and lift yourself up, supporting your weight with your arms.
  3. Slowly lower your body down as far as you can go, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. For an added challenge, you can try performing the exercise with one leg lifted off the ground or with a weighted vest.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your shoulders down and back throughout the exercise.
  8. As with any exercise, start with a few reps and gradually increase the number as you become stronger and more comfortable with the movement.
  9. If you experience any pain or discomfort during the exercise, stop immediately and consult a medical professional.

name: inchworm
instructions:
1. Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Bend forward at the waist and place your hands on the ground in front of you.
  3. Walk your hands forward until you are in a high plank position with your arms fully extended.
  4. Keeping your legs straight, walk your feet forward towards your hands until they are as close as possible.
  5. Repeat steps 2-4 for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. To finish the exercise, walk your hands back towards your feet and stand up straight.

name: inchworm v. 2
instructions:
1. Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Bend forward at the waist and place your hands on the ground in front of you.
  3. Walk your hands forward until you are in a plank position (like the top of a push-up).
  4. Once you are in the plank position, walk your feet forward towards your hands until you are back in the starting position.
  5. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions or for a set amount of time.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat throughout the exercise.
  7. You can modify the exercise by adding a push-up when you are in the plank position or by walking your hands out to the side instead of straight ahead.

name: incline close-grip push-up
instructions:
1. Start by placing your hands on an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, with your fingers pointing forward and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Step your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  3. Bend your elbows and lower your chest towards the bench or step, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Push back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: incline leg hip raise (leg straight)
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on an incline bench with your head at the higher end and your feet at the lower end.
  2. Place your hands by your sides with your palms facing down.
  3. Extend your legs straight out in front of you, lifting them up so that they are perpendicular to the bench.
  4. Keeping your legs straight, slowly lower them down towards the bench, stopping just before your feet touch the surface.
  5. Pause for a moment, then raise your legs back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to maintain stability and control.
  8. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the difficulty by holding a weight between your feet or by adding ankle weights.

name: incline push up depth jump
instructions:
1. Start by placing two sturdy boxes or benches on either side of you, with enough space in between for you to jump into.
  2. Place your hands on the edge of one of the boxes or benches, with your feet on the ground and your body in a plank position.
  3. Lower your chest towards the box or bench, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Push yourself back up to the starting position.
  5. As soon as you reach the top of the push up, jump your feet up and over to the other box or bench.
  6. Land softly on the other box or bench with both feet.
  7. Jump back to the starting position and repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.

name: incline push-up
instructions:
1. Start by placing your hands on a raised surface, such as a bench or step.
  2. Walk your feet back until your body is in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  3. Engage your core and lower your body towards the raised surface, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your sides.
  4. Push back up to the starting position, making sure to keep your body in a straight line throughout the movement.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: incline push-up (on box)
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy box or bench that can support your weight.
  2. Place your hands on the box, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step your feet back so that your body is in a straight line from head to heels.
  4. Engage your core and glutes to maintain a stable plank position.
  5. Bend your elbows and lower your chest towards the box, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your body in a straight line throughout the movement and avoid arching your back or dropping your hips.
  9. For an added challenge, you can increase the height of the box or perform the exercise with one hand on the box and the other on the ground.

name: incline reverse grip push-up
instructions:
1. Start by placing your hands on the ground, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your fingers pointing towards your feet.
  2. Place your feet on an elevated surface, such as a bench or step, to create an incline.
  3. Lower your body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides and your back straight.
  4. Pause when your chest is just above the ground, and then push back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
  6. Remember to engage your core and keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  7. Variations of this exercise include adjusting the height of the incline or adding resistance with a weight vest or resistance band.

name: incline scapula push up
instructions:
1. Get into a push up position with your hands placed on an elevated surface such as a bench or box.
  2. Ensure your hands are slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your fingers are pointing forward.
  3. Engage your core and keep your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  4. Lower your body towards the bench or box by bending your elbows and keeping them close to your body.
  5. As you lower your body, retract your shoulder blades by squeezing them together.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement and then push yourself back up to the starting position.
  7. Ensure you maintain a straight line from your head to your heels throughout the exercise.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: incline twisting sit-up
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on an incline bench with your knees bent and your feet flat on the bench.
  2. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows out to the sides.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your upper body off the bench, twisting your torso to the right as you do so.
  4. Lower your upper body back down to the bench, then lift it up again, this time twisting your torso to the left.
  5. Continue alternating between twisting to the right and left for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your feet flat on the bench and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you lift your upper body and twist, and inhale as you lower it back down.
  8. Once you have completed your desired number of repetitions, slowly lower your upper body back down to the bench and rest for a moment before getting up.

name: intermediate hip flexor and quad stretch
instructions:
1. Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Take a step forward with your right foot, keeping your left foot in place.
  3. Bend your right knee and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your left leg straight.
  4. Place your left hand on your left hip and reach your right hand behind you to grasp your left ankle.
  5. Gently pull your left ankle towards your buttocks, feeling the stretch in your left hip flexor and quad.
  6. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release and switch sides.
  7. Repeat the stretch on both sides for 2-3 sets.

name: inverse leg curl (bench support)
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on a bench with your hips at the edge of the bench and your legs hanging off.
  2. Place your hands on the floor or on the bench for support.
  3. Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks.
  4. Keeping your knees bent, slowly lower your legs towards the floor by extending your hips.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then return to the starting position by bending your knees and bringing your heels towards your buttocks.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: inverse leg curl (on pull-up cable machine)
instructions:
1. Adjust the pull-up cable machine so that the ankle strap is attached to the lowest setting.
  2. Put on the ankle strap and attach it to your ankle.
  3. Lie face down on the ground with your hands by your side.
  4. Attach the cable to the strap on your ankle.
  5. Slowly lift your leg up towards your buttocks, keeping your knee straight.
  6. Hold for a few seconds at the top of the movement.
  7. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch legs and repeat.

name: inverted row
instructions:
1. Begin by setting up a barbell or TRX suspension trainer at a height that allows you to hang from it with your arms fully extended.
  2. Grab the bar or handles with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar or handles with your arms fully extended and your body in a straight line from your heels to your head.
  4. Engage your core and pull your shoulder blades down and back.
  5. Bend your elbows and pull your chest up towards the bar or handles, keeping your body in a straight line.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps or time.

name: inverted row bent knees
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy horizontal bar or a Smith machine bar that is at a height that allows you to hang from it with your arms fully extended and your feet on the ground.
  2. Stand facing the bar and grip it with both hands using an overhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
  3. Walk your feet forward until your body is at a 45-degree angle to the ground, with your arms fully extended and your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Bend your knees, keeping your feet flat on the ground.
  5. Engage your core, squeeze your shoulder blades together, and pull your chest towards the bar.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: inverted row on bench
instructions:
1. Place a bench in front of a sturdy horizontal bar or Smith machine at a height that allows you to hang from the bar with your arms fully extended.
  2. Lie on your back on the bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
  3. Reach up and grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and glutes to lift your hips off the bench until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your heels.
  5. Pull your chest up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your sides, until your chest touches the bar.
  6. Lower your body back down to the starting position with control.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Once you have mastered the basic inverted row on the bench, you can make the exercise more challenging by elevating your feet on another bench or stability ball.

name: inverted row v. 2
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy horizontal bar that can support your body weight. A pull-up bar or a smith machine bar works well.
  2. Stand facing the bar and grasp it with an overhand grip, shoulder-width apart. Your arms should be fully extended.
  3. Walk your feet forward until your body is at a 45-degree angle to the ground. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and pull your chest towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body. Your body should remain in a straight line.
  5. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: inverted row with straps
instructions:
1. Attach the straps to a sturdy anchor point, such as a squat rack or pull-up bar.
  2. Adjust the straps to a height that allows you to hang from them with your arms fully extended and your feet on the ground.
  3. Grasp the straps with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and pull your chest towards the straps, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. To make the exercise more challenging, adjust the straps to a higher position or elevate your feet on a box or bench.

name: iron cross stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying down on your back with your arms stretched out to the sides, perpendicular to your body.
  2. Slowly lift your legs up to a 90-degree angle, keeping them straight.
  3. Lower your legs to one side of your body, keeping your shoulders and arms on the ground.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in your lower back and hips.
  5. Bring your legs back up to the center and repeat the stretch on the other side.
  6. Repeat the stretch on each side 2-3 times.

name: isometric chest squeeze
instructions:
1. Stand or sit with your back straight and your shoulders relaxed.
  2. Bring your hands together in front of your chest, with your palms facing each other.
  3. Press your palms together as hard as you can, engaging your chest muscles.
  4. Hold the contraction for 10-15 seconds, or as long as you can maintain it.
  5. Release the contraction and rest for 10-15 seconds.
  6. Repeat the exercise for a total of 3-5 sets.

name: isometric wipers
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your arms extended to the sides, palms facing down, and your legs straight up in the air, perpendicular to the ground.
  2. Engage your core muscles and press your lower back into the ground.
  3. Slowly lower your legs to one side, keeping them straight, until they are hovering just above the ground.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, squeezing your oblique muscles on the opposite side.
  5. Return your legs to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. To increase the difficulty, you can hold a weight or medicine ball between your feet.

name: jack burpee
instructions:
1. Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lower your body into a squat position with your hands on the ground in front of you.
  3. Jump both feet back into a plank position.
  4. Perform a push-up.
  5. Jump both feet back to the squat position.
  6. Jump up as high as you can while reaching your hands towards the ceiling.
  7. Land softly back into the starting position.
  8. Repeat for desired number of repetitions or time.

name: jack jump (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet together and your arms at your sides.
  2. Jump up and spread your feet apart while simultaneously raising your arms above your head.
  3. Jump again and bring your feet back together while lowering your arms back to your sides.
  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, try to increase the speed and height of your jumps.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your landing soft to avoid injury.

name: jackknife sit-up
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a mat with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight out.
  2. Engage your core muscles and lift your arms and legs off the ground simultaneously, keeping them straight.
  3. As you lift your arms and legs, try to touch your toes with your hands, forming a V-shape with your body.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly lower your arms and legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back.
  7. You can modify the exercise by bending your knees slightly or by using a stability ball to support your lower back.

name: janda sit-up
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
  2. Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  3. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
  4. Slowly lift your head, shoulders, and upper back off the floor while keeping your lower back in contact with the ground.
  5. At the top of the movement, pause and exhale.
  6. Lower your upper body back down to the starting position while inhaling.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: jump rope
instructions:
1. Choose the right jump rope: Make sure the jump rope is the right length for you. Stand in the middle of the rope and pull the handles up towards your armpits. The handles should reach your armpits, or slightly below.
  2. Wear the right shoes: Make sure you wear shoes with good support and cushioning. This will help absorb the impact of jumping and protect your feet and joints.
  3. Start with the basic jump: Hold the rope with both hands and swing it over your head. As it comes down, jump over the rope with both feet. Land softly on the balls of your feet and keep your knees slightly bent.
  4. Practice timing: Try to time your jumps so that you land just as the rope hits the ground. This will help you maintain a consistent rhythm and avoid tripping on the rope.
  5. Experiment with different jumps: Once you've mastered the basic jump, try adding in different jumps such as the double-under (where the rope passes under your feet twice in one jump) or the criss-cross (where you cross your arms in front of your body as you jump).
  6. Set a goal: Challenge yourself to jump for a certain amount of time or to complete a certain number of jumps without stopping.
  7. Take breaks: Jumping rope can be a high-impact exercise, so take breaks as needed to rest your feet and joints.
  8. Stretch afterwards: After you're done jumping, stretch your calf muscles, hamstrings, and quads to help prevent soreness and injury.

name: jump squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Bend your knees and lower your hips down into a squat position.
  3. As you push up from the squat, jump up explosively into the air.
  4. Land softly back into the squat position to complete one repetition.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your chest up throughout the exercise.
  7. Engage your core and glutes to help with the explosive jump.
  8. Modify the exercise by using a lower jump or eliminating the jump altogether if needed.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting any exercise program and consult with a healthcare professional if you have any concerns about your ability to perform this exercise.

name: jump squat v. 2
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing your hips back as if you were sitting in a chair.
  3. As you come up from the squat, jump up explosively, straightening your legs and pushing your arms up towards the ceiling.
  4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately go back into the squat position.
  5. Repeat the jump squat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your chest lifted throughout the exercise.

name: kettlebell advanced windmill
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding the kettlebell in your right hand with your arm extended overhead.
  2. Turn your left foot outwards at a 45-degree angle and shift your weight onto your left leg.
  3. Keeping your right arm extended, hinge at your hips and lower your torso towards the ground.
  4. As you lower your torso, rotate your torso and extend your left arm towards the ground, keeping your eyes on the kettlebell the entire time.
  5. Once your torso is parallel to the ground, pause for a moment and then slowly reverse the movement to return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides and performing the exercise with your left hand holding the kettlebell.

name: kettlebell alternating hang clean
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with a kettlebell on the ground in front of you.
  2. Place your right hand on the kettlebell handle and hinge at your hips, lowering your torso until your back is flat and your hips are pushed back.
  3. Drive your hips forward and pull the kettlebell up towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. As the kettlebell reaches your shoulder, rotate your wrist so your palm faces forward and the kettlebell is resting on the back of your wrist.
  5. Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left hand.
  6. Continue alternating between your right and left hand for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat throughout the exercise.
  8. Once you have completed the desired number of repetitions, lower the kettlebell back to the ground and stand up straight.

name: kettlebell alternating press
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder height.
  2. Press one kettlebell up overhead, fully extending your arm.
  3. Lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder height.
  4. Repeat the press with the other arm.
  5. Continue alternating presses for the desired number of reps or time.
  6. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you press the kettlebell up and inhale as you lower it back down.
  8. For an added challenge, increase the weight of the kettlebells or perform the exercise while standing on one leg.

name: kettlebell alternating press on floor
instructions:
1. Start by placing a kettlebell on the floor next to each hand.
  2. Assume a push-up position with your hands on the kettlebells.
  3. Make sure your feet are shoulder-width apart and your core is engaged.
  4. Grab one kettlebell with your right hand and lift it to your shoulder.
  5. Press the kettlebell straight up overhead until your arm is fully extended.
  6. Lower the kettlebell back to your shoulder and repeat on the other side with your left hand.
  7. Alternate pressing the kettlebells overhead, switching sides with each repetition.
  8. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each side.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  10. Make sure to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  11. Rest for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: kettlebell alternating renegade row
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands on the kettlebells, directly under your shoulders.
  2. Engage your core and glutes to keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  3. Row one kettlebell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blade at the top of the movement.
  4. Lower the kettlebell back down to the ground and repeat with the other arm.
  5. Continue alternating sides for the desired amount of reps or time.
  6. Make sure to keep your hips stable throughout the movement and avoid twisting or rotating your body.
  7. To increase the challenge, you can add a push-up between each renegade row or increase the weight of the kettlebells.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form to avoid injury.
  9. Finish the exercise by lowering the kettlebells back down to the ground and coming out of the plank position.

name: kettlebell alternating row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a kettlebell in your right hand with your palm facing your body.
  3. Lean forward at your hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  4. Extend your right arm down towards the floor, keeping it close to your body.
  5. As you pull the kettlebell up towards your chest, focus on squeezing your shoulder blade towards your spine.
  6. Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left arm.
  7. Continue alternating between your right and left arms for your desired number of reps.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid injury.
  9. Breathe in as you lower the kettlebell and exhale as you pull it up towards your chest.
  10. Once you have completed your desired number of reps, carefully place the kettlebell back on the ground.

name: kettlebell arnold press
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder height.
  2. Rotate your palms so they face your body.
  3. Press the kettlebells up and out, rotating your palms so they face forward at the top of the movement.
  4. Lower the kettlebells back down to shoulder height, rotating your palms back to face your body.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you press the kettlebells up, and inhale as you lower them back down.
  8. Vary the weight of the kettlebells and the number of reps to challenge yourself and achieve your fitness goals.

name: kettlebell bent press
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the kettlebell in your right hand with your palm facing inward.
  2. Press the kettlebell overhead with your right arm, keeping your elbow locked and your wrist straight.
  3. Rotate your torso to the left and bend your left knee, shifting your weight onto your left foot.
  4. Keeping your eyes on the kettlebell, lean your torso to the left and slide your right arm down the inside of your right thigh.
  5. As you lower your torso, pivot your left foot so that your toes point outward.
  6. Continue to lower your torso until your left hand touches the ground or your left forearm rests on your left thigh.
  7. Pause for a moment, then reverse the movement by pressing through your left foot and straightening your torso.
  8. As you rise, keep your right arm straight and lift the kettlebell back overhead.
  9. Return the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat for several repetitions before switching sides.

name: kettlebell bottoms up clean from the hang position
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the kettlebell on the floor in front of you.
  2. Bend down and grab the kettlebell handle with one hand, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  3. Swing the kettlebell back between your legs, bending your knees slightly and hinging at the hips.
  4. Drive your hips forward and stand up straight, using the momentum to lift the kettlebell up to your shoulder.
  5. As you lift the kettlebell, rotate your wrist so that the bottom of the kettlebell is facing up.
  6. Hold the kettlebell in the bottoms up position for a few seconds, making sure to keep your wrist straight and your elbow close to your body.
  7. Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position, swinging it back between your legs and bending your knees and hips.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps, then switch hands and repeat with the other arm.

name: kettlebell double alternating hang clean
instructions:
1. Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart and your kettlebell on the ground in front of you.
  2. With your back straight and your core engaged, bend your knees and reach down to grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  3. Stand up, using your legs to lift the kettlebell off the ground and bring it up to your waist level.
  4. From this position, quickly lower the kettlebell back down to the ground, but only let it touch the ground briefly before lifting it back up again.
  5. As you lift the kettlebell back up, switch hands so that your opposite hand is now holding the handle.
  6. Repeat this alternating motion, continuously switching hands and lifting the kettlebell up to your waist level with each rep.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise, and use the power of your legs to lift the kettlebell rather than relying on your arms.
  8. Perform the exercise for your desired number of reps or time period, then gently lower the kettlebell back down to the ground and stand up straight.

name: kettlebell double jerk
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder height.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and engage your core muscles.
  3. With a quick explosive movement, press both kettlebells overhead.
  4. As the kettlebells reach the top of the movement, quickly drop back down into a quarter squat.
  5. As you rise back up, use the momentum to press the kettlebells overhead again.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. When you are finished, carefully lower the kettlebells back to shoulder height and return to a standing position.

name: kettlebell double push press
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your kettlebells on the floor in front of you.
  2. Bend your knees and hinge at the hips to pick up the kettlebells, bringing them to your shoulders.
  3. Press the kettlebells overhead by extending your arms and pushing through your legs.
  4. Lower the kettlebells back down to your shoulders.
  5. Bend your knees slightly and use your legs to help drive the kettlebells back up for another press.
  6. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, lower the kettlebells back down to the floor with control.

name: kettlebell double snatch
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your kettlebell on the ground between your feet.
  2. Bend your knees and hinge at the hips to reach down and grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  3. Stand up and swing the kettlebell back between your legs.
  4. As you swing the kettlebell forward, use the momentum to lift it up to shoulder height with your elbows bent and the kettlebell resting on your forearms.
  5. Quickly extend your arms overhead to fully lift the kettlebell, then lower it back down to shoulder height.
  6. Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position between your feet.
  7. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.

name: kettlebell double windmill
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your kettlebell placed on the ground in front of you.
  2. With your left hand, grab the handle of the kettlebell and lift it up to shoulder height.
  3. Extend your right arm up and out to the side, keeping it straight and parallel to the ground.
  4. Rotate your torso to the right, keeping your left arm extended and the kettlebell stable in your left hand.
  5. Lower the kettlebell down towards your right foot, keeping your left arm straight and your right arm still extended out to the side.
  6. Pause at the bottom of the movement and then slowly raise the kettlebell back up to shoulder height, keeping your left arm extended and your right arm still out to the side.
  7. Rotate your torso back to center and then repeat the movement on the other side, grabbing the kettlebell with your right hand and extending your left arm out to the side.
  8. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or time.

name: kettlebell extended range one arm press on floor
instructions:
1. Begin by selecting an appropriate weight kettlebell and placing it on the floor in front of you.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bend your knees.
  3. Place your hand on the kettlebell handle and grip it firmly.
  4. Lift the kettlebell off the floor and bring it to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Engage your core and press the kettlebell overhead, fully extending your arm.
  6. Lower the kettlebell back to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  7. Lower the kettlebell back to the floor and repeat the exercise on the other arm.

name: kettlebell figure 8
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand.
  2. Begin by swinging the kettlebell between your legs, passing it from one hand to the other behind your legs.
  3. As the kettlebell comes up in front of your body, pass it to the other hand and swing it back between your legs again.
  4. Continue this figure 8 motion for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  6. Switch hands and repeat the exercise for an equal number of repetitions on the other side.
  7. As you become more comfortable with the movement, you can increase the weight of the kettlebell to make it more challenging.

name: kettlebell front squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Pick up the kettlebell with both hands and hold it close to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  3. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you lower your body into a squat position, keeping your weight on your heels.
  4. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps or for a set amount of time.
  7. Remember to keep your chest up and your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
  8. Once you have finished your set, carefully place the kettlebell back on the ground.

name: kettlebell goblet squat
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the kettlebell with both hands at chest level, gripping the sides of the handle.
  2. Engage your core and keep your chest up as you lower your hips down and back, bending your knees to perform a squat.
  3. As you squat, keep your weight in your heels and your knees tracking over your toes.
  4. Lower your hips until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, then press through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps or time.

name: kettlebell hang clean
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your kettlebell on the ground in front of you.
  2. With your knees slightly bent, hinge at the hips and grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  3. Drive through your heels and extend your hips and knees to lift the kettlebell up to your chest.
  4. As the kettlebell approaches your chest, flip your wrists and catch the weight in the rack position, with your elbows close to your body and your wrists straight.
  5. Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position by reversing the movement and hinging at the hips.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: kettlebell lunge pass through
instructions:
1. Start by holding a kettlebell in both hands at chest height, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Step forward with your right foot, bending your knee to lower your body into a lunge position.
  3. As you lower your body, pass the kettlebell under your right thigh and grab it with your left hand.
  4. Push off with your right foot to return to the starting position, passing the kettlebell back to your right hand as you stand up.
  5. Repeat the exercise, stepping forward with your left foot and passing the kettlebell under your left thigh.
  6. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each leg.

name: kettlebell one arm clean and jerk
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and the kettlebell on the ground in front of you.
  2. Bend down and grab the kettlebell with one hand, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Stand up, lifting the kettlebell off the ground and bringing it to your shoulder in one fluid motion.
  4. From here, dip down slightly and then use your legs and hips to explosively lift the kettlebell above your head.
  5. Once the kettlebell is above your head, lock your arm out and hold it there for a moment before lowering it back down to your shoulder.
  6. From your shoulder, lower the kettlebell back down to the ground in a controlled manner.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm.

name: kettlebell one arm floor press
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold the kettlebell in one hand with your palm facing towards your feet.
  3. Extend your arm upwards towards the ceiling, keeping your elbow locked and your wrist straight.
  4. Slowly lower the kettlebell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your wrist straight.
  5. Pause for a moment when the kettlebell touches your chest.
  6. Push the kettlebell back up to the starting position, exhaling as you do so.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and repeat on the other side.

name: kettlebell one arm jerk
instructions:
1. Choose a kettlebell that you can comfortably lift with one arm.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the kettlebell on the ground in front of you.
  3. Bend your knees and grip the kettlebell with one hand.
  4. Stand up, driving the kettlebell up to shoulder height with your arm bent.
  5. Quickly straighten your arm and push the kettlebell overhead in a swift motion.
  6. Lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder height, bending your arm again.
  7. Lower the kettlebell back down to the ground and repeat for desired number of reps.
  8. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: kettlebell one arm military press to the side
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand at shoulder height.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back straight.
  3. Press the kettlebell up and out to the side, keeping your arm close to your head.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder height.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with the other arm.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your wrist straight throughout the movement.
  7. Adjust the weight of the kettlebell as needed to challenge yourself without sacrificing form.
  8. As you progress, you can increase the number of reps or sets, or try the exercise with a heavier kettlebell.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting the exercise, and cool down and stretch afterward to prevent injury.

name: kettlebell one arm push press
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your kettlebell on the ground in front of you.
  2. Place one hand on the kettlebell handle and lift it up to your shoulder. Your elbow should be bent and your palm facing inward.
  3. Engage your core muscles and bend your knees slightly.
  4. Press the kettlebell overhead, extending your arm fully. Your wrist should be in line with your shoulder.
  5. Lower the kettlebell back down to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  7. Remember to breathe in as you lower the kettlebell and exhale as you press it overhead.
  8. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  9. As you become more comfortable with the movement, you can increase the weight of the kettlebell to continue challenging your muscles.

name: kettlebell one arm row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand with your palm facing inwards towards your body.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge at your hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  3. Extend your arm downwards towards the floor, ensuring that your elbow is straight and your shoulder is relaxed.
  4. Begin the exercise by pulling the kettlebell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your wrist straight.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together and engaging your back muscles.
  6. Lower the kettlebell back down towards the floor, ensuring that you maintain control throughout the movement.
  7. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one side before switching to the other arm.

name: kettlebell one arm snatch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your kettlebell on the floor between your feet.
  2. Grab the kettlebell with one hand and lift it up to your chest.
  3. Swing the kettlebell back between your legs, bending your knees and keeping your back straight.
  4. As you swing the kettlebell forward, straighten your legs and push your hips forward, using the momentum to lift the kettlebell up to shoulder height.
  5. As the kettlebell reaches shoulder height, flip your wrist and push the kettlebell up overhead, locking your arm out straight.
  6. Lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder height, then swing it back between your legs to start the next rep.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch hands and repeat with the other arm.

name: kettlebell pirate supper legs
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outwards.
  2. Hold a kettlebell in your right hand, with your arm extended down by your side.
  3. Take a large step forward with your left foot, bending your left knee and lowering your body into a lunge position.
  4. As you lower your body, raise your right arm up and over your head, as if you were a pirate raising a flag.
  5. Push off your left foot to return to the starting position, lowering your right arm back down by your side.
  6. Repeat the exercise on the other side, holding the kettlebell in your left hand and stepping forward with your right foot.
  7. Perform 10-12 reps on each side, rest for 30 seconds, and repeat for a total of 3 sets.

name: kettlebell pistol squat
instructions:
1. Start by holding a kettlebell in front of your chest with both hands, standing with your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Shift your weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground, keeping it straight and hovering slightly above the floor.
  3. Slowly lower your body down into a squat, keeping your left knee directly over your left ankle and your back straight.
  4. As you lower your body, extend your right leg straight out in front of you, keeping it parallel to the floor.
  5. Lower your body as far as you can, ideally until your left thigh is parallel to the floor.
  6. Pause at the bottom of the squat, then press through your left heel to stand back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat on the other side, shifting your weight onto your right foot and lifting your left foot off the ground.
  8. Complete 3 sets of 8-10 reps on each leg, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: kettlebell plyo push-up
instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands on a kettlebell that is placed on the ground shoulder-width apart. Your body should be in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  2. Lower your body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  3. As you push back up, explode off the ground with enough force to lift both hands off the kettlebell.
  4. Land softly back on the kettlebell and immediately lower your body into another push-up.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: kettlebell seated press
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Hold the kettlebell in one hand with your elbow bent and the weight resting on your shoulder.
  3. Engage your core and press the kettlebell overhead, fully extending your arm.
  4. Lower the kettlebell back down to your shoulder and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  5. Switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  6. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form, keeping your back straight and shoulders down.
  7. Gradually increase the weight of the kettlebell as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.

name: kettlebell seated two arm military press
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold the kettlebell in both hands at chest level, with your palms facing inward and your elbows bent.
  3. Brace your core and press the kettlebell overhead, fully extending your arms.
  4. Lower the kettlebell back down to chest level, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to breathe out as you press the kettlebell overhead and breathe in as you lower it back down.
  7. For an added challenge, you can increase the weight of the kettlebell or perform the exercise standing up.

name: kettlebell seesaw press
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder height.
  2. Press one kettlebell up overhead while simultaneously lowering the other kettlebell to shoulder height.
  3. Reverse the movement, pressing the lowered kettlebell up overhead while lowering the other kettlebell to shoulder height.
  4. Repeat this movement pattern for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your spine neutral throughout the exercise.
  6. Exhale as you press the kettlebell up overhead and inhale as you lower it back down.
  7. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the opposite arm leading the movement.
  8. Gradually increase the weight of the kettlebells as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  9. Finish the exercise by lowering the kettlebells back down to shoulder height and returning them to the starting position.

name: kettlebell sumo high pull
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet wider than hip-width apart, toes pointed slightly outward, and hold a kettlebell with both hands in front of your body.
  2. Bend your knees and lower your hips into a squat position, keeping your chest up and your back straight.
  3. As you stand up, simultaneously pull the kettlebell up towards your chest, keeping your elbows high and your shoulders down.
  4. At the top of the movement, your elbows should be above your shoulders and the kettlebell should be at chest height.
  5. Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position as you lower your hips back into the squat position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: kettlebell swing
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outwards.
  2. Place the kettlebell on the floor in front of you and hinge at the hips to grab the handle with both hands.
  3. Engage your core and lift the kettlebell off the ground, swinging it back between your legs.
  4. As you swing the kettlebell forward, use the momentum to drive your hips forward and straighten your legs.
  5. At the top of the swing, the kettlebell should be at chest height and your arms should be fully extended.
  6. Allow the kettlebell to swing back down between your legs and repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to use your hips to generate the momentum for the swing.
  8. When you are finished with the exercise, place the kettlebell back on the ground in front of you.

name: kettlebell thruster
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a kettlebell in front of your chest with both hands.
  2. Squat down, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
  3. As you stand up, press the kettlebell overhead, fully extending your arms and legs.
  4. Lower the kettlebell back down to your chest as you squat down again.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe in on the way down and out on the way up.
  7. Once you have mastered the basic kettlebell thruster, you can increase the weight of the kettlebell or add more repetitions to make the exercise more challenging.

name: kettlebell turkish get up (squat style)
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your legs straight and a kettlebell in one hand.
  2. Bend your knee on the same side as the kettlebell and place your foot flat on the ground.
  3. Press the kettlebell up towards the ceiling with your arm fully extended.
  4. Use your other arm to prop yourself up onto your elbow on the same side as the kettlebell.
  5. Push up onto your hand and then onto your opposite foot, keeping your eyes on the kettlebell the entire time.
  6. Stand up, keeping the kettlebell extended overhead.
  7. Reverse the movement to return to the starting position.
  8. Lower yourself back down to the ground, keeping your eyes on the kettlebell the entire time.
  9. Place the kettlebell back on the ground, roll onto your back, and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: kettlebell two arm clean
instructions:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward.
  2. Place a kettlebell on the floor between your feet.
  3. Squat down and grab the kettlebell with both hands, palms facing down and fingers wrapped around the handle.
  4. Stand up, keeping your back straight and lifting the kettlebell off the floor.
  5. As you stand up, use the momentum from your legs to pull the kettlebell up to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. As the kettlebell reaches chest height, flip your wrists so that your palms are facing up and the kettlebell is resting on the back of your forearms.
  7. Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully place the kettlebell back on the floor and stand up straight.

name: kettlebell two arm military press
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grab a kettlebell with both hands.
  2. Bring the kettlebell up to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  3. Press the kettlebell overhead, extending your arms fully.
  4. Lower the kettlebell back down to your chest.
  5. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe in as you lower the kettlebell and breathe out as you press it overhead.
  8. Variations of this exercise include using different weights of kettlebells or performing the press with one arm at a time.

name: kettlebell two arm row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Place the kettlebell in front of you on the ground.
  2. Bend down and grab the kettlebell with both hands, palms facing towards you.
  3. Stand up straight, keeping your back flat and your core engaged.
  4. With your arms straight, pull the kettlebell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Slowly lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: kettlebell windmill
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in your right hand.
  2. Extend your right arm straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your gaze on the kettlebell.
  3. Rotate your left foot outwards at a 45-degree angle, while keeping your right foot facing forward.
  4. Start to hinge at your hips, lowering your torso towards the left side of your body.
  5. As you lower your torso, keep your right arm extended upwards and your left arm reaching down towards your left foot.
  6. Keep your gaze on the kettlebell throughout the entire movement.
  7. Once you have lowered your torso as far as you can comfortably go, pause for a moment and then return to the starting position.
  8. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps on your right side, and then switch to your left side.

name: kick out sit
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the edge of a sturdy chair or bench with your hands on either side of your hips.
  2. Engage your core and lift your feet off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
  3. Extend your legs out in front of you, kicking them straight out while keeping your core engaged.
  4. Bring your knees back towards your chest and repeat the kick out motion for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to keep your back straight throughout the exercise and avoid leaning back or using momentum to lift your legs.
  6. To make the exercise more challenging, you can hold a weight or resistance band across your chest.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and take breaks as needed.

name: kipping muscle up
instructions:
1. Begin by hanging from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing away from you.
  2. Initiate a kipping motion by swinging your legs forward and back, generating momentum.
  3. As you swing your legs forward, pull your chest towards the bar and drive your elbows down towards your hips.
  4. At the top of your pull, quickly transition your hands from a pull-up grip to a dip grip, with your palms facing towards you.
  5. Press your body up and over the bar, extending your arms fully at the top of the movement.
  6. Lower yourself back down to the starting position, reversing the movement by bending your arms and bringing your chest towards the bar.
  7. As you come down, initiate another kip to generate momentum for your next repetition.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: knee touch crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands behind your head, keeping your elbows out to the sides.
  3. Lift your shoulders off the ground, engaging your core muscles.
  4. Bring your right elbow towards your left knee, while simultaneously lifting your left foot off the ground and bringing it towards your chest.
  5. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee while lifting your right foot off the ground.
  6. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions or time period.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to avoid pulling on your neck with your hands.
  8. You can increase the intensity of the exercise by straightening your legs or holding a weight in your hands.

name: kneeling jump squat
instructions:
1. Start by kneeling on the ground with your knees hip-width apart and your toes pointed behind you.
  2. Place your hands on the ground in front of you, shoulder-width apart.
  3. Engage your core and jump up, pushing off the ground with your feet.
  4. As you jump, bring your knees up towards your chest and land back on the ground in the kneeling position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. For a more challenging variation, you can hold a weight in each hand or add a jump at the end of the movement.

name: kneeling lat stretch
instructions:
1. Start by kneeling on the floor with your knees hip-width apart and your toes pointing behind you.
  2. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, shoulder-width apart, with your palms facing down.
  3. Slowly lower your upper body towards the floor, keeping your arms straight and your palms on the ground.
  4. As you lower your body, you should feel a stretch in your lats (the muscles on either side of your back).
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the stretch for 2-3 sets, taking a short break between each set.
  7. Be sure to breathe deeply and relax your body as you hold the stretch.
  8. As you become more flexible, you can increase the stretch by lowering your body further towards the floor.
  9. Remember to listen to your body and stop if you feel any pain.

name: kneeling plank tap shoulder (male)
instructions:
1. Begin by getting down on all fours on a mat or soft surface.
  2. Extend your legs behind you and place your toes on the ground, so that your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your heels.
  3. Lower down onto your forearms, keeping your elbows directly beneath your shoulders.
  4. Engage your core muscles by drawing your navel in towards your spine.
  5. Lift your right hand off the ground and tap your left shoulder with it.
  6. Lower your right hand back down to the ground and repeat the movement with your left hand, tapping your right shoulder.
  7. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or time period.
  8. Remember to keep your hips level and avoid any twisting or swaying of your body.
  9. Breathe steadily throughout the exercise and focus on maintaining proper form.
  10. When you are finished, lower down onto your knees and rest for a few moments before standing up.

name: kneeling push-up (male)
instructions:
1. Begin by kneeling on the ground with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms flat on the ground.
  2. Extend your legs behind you so that your body is in a straight line from your head to your knees.
  3. Engage your core and glutes to keep your body in a straight line.
  4. Lower your chest towards the ground while keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise.
  8. As you become stronger, you can increase the difficulty by moving your knees further back or performing a full push-up from your toes.

name: korean dips
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy surface to perform the exercise on, such as parallel bars or two elevated surfaces of equal height.
  2. Place your hands on the bars or surfaces, shoulder-width apart, and lift your body up so that your arms are straight.
  3. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
  4. Push your body back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: l-pull-up
instructions:
1. Start by grabbing onto a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Engage your shoulder blades by pulling them down and back.
  3. Slowly begin to pull yourself up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. As you lift yourself up, bring your legs up towards your chest and extend them out in front of you, forming an "L" shape with your body.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds before slowly lowering yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: l-sit on floor
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you.
  2. Place your hands on the floor next to your hips, fingers pointing forward.
  3. Press down through your hands and lift your hips off the floor.
  4. Keep your legs straight and lift them off the floor, bringing them parallel to the floor.
  5. Hold this position for as long as you can, aiming for 10-15 seconds.
  6. Lower your legs and hips back down to the floor.
  7. Repeat for 3-5 sets.

name: landmine 180
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the landmine with a barbell attached to it.
  2. Hold the barbell with both hands, with your arms extended in front of you at chest height.
  3. Rotate your torso to the right, keeping your feet planted on the ground.
  4. As you rotate, lift the barbell up and over your head, so that it ends up behind your head on the left side of your body.
  5. Pause briefly, then rotate back to the starting position, lifting the barbell up and over your head again as you rotate.
  6. Repeat the movement, alternating sides with each rep.
  7. Do 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each side, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: landmine lateral raise
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a landmine attachment onto a barbell and loading the appropriate weight onto the barbell.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the barbell positioned on the floor to your side.
  3. Grasp the end of the barbell with one hand, with your palm facing towards your body.
  4. Lift the barbell up and away from your body, keeping your arm straight and your elbow locked out.
  5. As you lift the barbell, raise your arm out to the side of your body until it is parallel with the ground.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and perform the exercise with your other arm.

name: lean planche
instructions:
1. Begin in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet together.
  2. Shift your weight forward and lift your feet off the ground, keeping your legs straight and squeezing your glutes and core muscles.
  3. Lower your head and shoulders towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. As you lower your body, lean forward and engage your shoulders and chest muscles.
  5. Hold the position for as long as you can, aiming for 10-15 seconds.
  6. Slowly lower your body back to the starting position and rest for 30 seconds before repeating.
  7. Repeat the exercise for 3-4 sets, gradually increasing the amount of time you hold the position.
  8. As you progress, you can also try lifting one leg off the ground or tucking your knees towards your chest to make the exercise more challenging.

name: left hook. boxing
instructions:
1. Stand in boxing stance with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bring your left hand up to your face with your elbow bent and your fist clenched.
  3. Rotate your hips and pivot your left foot, shifting your weight to your back foot.
  4. Extend your left arm forward and across your body, aiming for your opponent's temple or jaw.
  5. As you punch, rotate your fist so that your palm faces down and your thumb faces up.
  6. Recoil your arm back to your face, keeping your elbow bent and your fist clenched.
  7. Repeat the left hook exercise for several rounds, alternating with other punches and footwork.

name: leg pull in flat bench
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back on a bench with your legs extended straight out in front of you.
  2. Place your hands underneath your glutes with your palms facing down for support.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your legs up towards the ceiling, keeping them straight and together.
  4. Lower your legs back down towards the bench, stopping just before your heels touch the surface.
  5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. For an added challenge, you can hold a dumbbell or weight plate between your feet.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe deeply and evenly.
  8. Once you have completed the set, slowly lower your legs back down to the bench and release your hands from underneath your glutes.
  9. Take a few deep breaths and stretch out your legs to cool down.

name: leg up hamstring stretch
instructions:
1. Lie down on your back with your legs straight out in front of you.
  2. Bring one leg up towards your chest, keeping it as straight as possible.
  3. Grab onto the back of your thigh with both hands and gently pull the leg towards your chest.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in the back of your thigh.
  5. Release the leg and repeat on the other side.
  6. For a deeper stretch, you can use a strap or towel to help pull the leg towards your chest.
  7. Repeat the stretch on each leg 2-3 times.

name: lever alternate leg press
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on the exercise lever machine with your knees bent and your feet flat on the footrests.
  2. Place your hands on the handles of the machine and engage your core by pulling your navel towards your spine.
  3. Slowly extend one leg until it is straight, pushing against the footrest with your heel. Keep your other foot flat on the footrest.
