  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the movement with your other leg, alternating back and forth between legs for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to move slowly and deliberately, avoiding any jerky or sudden movements.
  7. Once you have completed the desired number of repetitions, carefully sit up and dismount the machine.

name: lever alternating narrow grip seated row
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise machine with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Grasp the handles with a narrow grip, with your palms facing each other and your hands close together.
  3. Lean forward slightly, keeping your back straight and your shoulders relaxed.
  4. Exhale and pull the handles towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then inhale as you release the handles and return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then rest and repeat for additional sets.

name: lever assisted chin-up
instructions:
1. Stand facing the chin-up bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Place one foot on the lever, ensuring that it is securely in place.
  4. Slowly lift your body towards the bar, using the assistance of the lever to help you.
  5. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down and back.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Switch the foot on the lever and repeat the exercise.
  9. Remember to engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
  10. Gradually decrease the assistance from the lever as you become stronger.

name: lever back extension
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on a lever back extension machine with your feet flat on the ground and your legs straight.
  2. Position the pad of the machine at the top of your hips, just below your waist.
  3. Place your hands behind your head or cross them over your chest.
  4. Engage your core and glutes to lift your torso up off the pad, keeping your neck in a neutral position.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement for a few seconds, squeezing your lower back muscles.
  6. Slowly lower your torso back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: lever bent over row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold the exercise lever with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your abs tight.
  4. Lower the exercise lever towards the floor, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then pull the exercise lever towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Lower the exercise lever back down to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your abs tight.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever bent-over row with v-bar
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of the exercise lever machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Place the v-bar attachment onto the cable and adjust the weight to your desired resistance level.
  3. Grab the v-bar with an overhand grip and bend your knees slightly, keeping your back straight.
  4. With your arms extended, pull the v-bar towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you lift.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the v-bar back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of reps, keeping your back straight and core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe in as you lower the v-bar and exhale as you lift it towards your torso.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully release the v-bar and step away from the machine.
  9. Stretch your back and shoulders to cool down and prevent injury.

name: lever bicep curl
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms fully extended down by your sides.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbells towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your body.
  4. Hold the contraction at the top of the movement for a second, squeezing your biceps.
  5. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, keeping your movements controlled and avoiding swinging your arms.
  6. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, lower the dumbbells back down to your sides and release your grip.

name: lever calf press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat of the calf press machine to fit your height.
  2. Place your feet on the foot platform, with your toes pointing forward and your heels hanging off the edge.
  3. Grasp the handles on either side of the seat for support.
  4. Press down on the foot platform with your toes, lifting your heels as high as you can.
  5. Hold the contraction at the top of the movement for a few seconds.
  6. Slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Make sure to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower your heels and exhaling as you lift them.
  9. Adjust the weight as necessary to challenge yourself appropriately.
  10. Stretch your calf muscles after your workout to prevent tightness and soreness.

name: lever chest press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level when you are seated.
  2. Sit on the machine with your back flat against the backrest and your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your elbows bent and your upper arms parallel to the floor.
  4. Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended, but do not lock out your elbows.
  5. Hold the position for a second, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to breathe in as you lower the handles and breathe out as you push them forward.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  9. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise to avoid injury and maximize results.
  10. Stretch your chest and arms after completing the exercise to prevent tightness and soreness.

name: lever chest press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat of the machine so that the handles are at chest level.
  2. Select the weight you want to use and load it onto the machine.
  3. Sit down on the machine and place your hands on the handles.
  4. Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended.
  5. Slowly bring the handles back towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. When you are finished, carefully release the handles and stand up from the machine.
  8. Remember to stretch your chest and arms after completing the exercise.

name: lever chest press v. 2
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level.
  2. Select the desired weight and load it onto the machine.
  3. Sit on the machine with your back against the pad and your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Grip the handles with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  5. Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended, but do not lock out your elbows.
  6. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position, keeping your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully release the handles and dismount the machine.
  9. Return the weight to its original position and wipe down the machine with a disinfectant wipe.

name: lever deadlift
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing forward.
  2. Squat down and grasp the handles of the lever deadlift machine with an overhand grip.
  3. Make sure your back is straight and your shoulders are pulled back.
  4. Slowly lift the handles of the machine until you are standing upright.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, making sure to engage your glutes and core.
  6. Lower the handles back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  7. Repeat for several repetitions, making sure to maintain proper form throughout.
  8. When finished, release the handles and stand up straight.

name: lever decline chest press
instructions:
1. Start by adjusting the seat and backrest to the appropriate height for your body.
  2. Lie on the bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your back flat against the backrest.
  3. Grasp the handles of the exercise lever with your palms facing down and your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  4. Push the handles forward and away from your body, extending your arms fully.
  5. Slowly bring the handles back towards your body, bending your elbows to return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully sit up and stand from the bench.
  9. Stretch your chest and arms to help prevent soreness and injury.

name: lever donkey calf raise
instructions:
1. Position the exercise lever so that the padded lever is at the appropriate height for your calf muscles.
  2. Stand facing the lever with your feet hip-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  3. Place the balls of your feet on the padded lever with your heels hanging off the edge.
  4. Hold onto the handles or frame of the machine for balance.
  5. Slowly raise your heels as high as you can while keeping your toes on the lever.
  6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. As you become stronger, you can increase the weight or resistance on the machine.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.

name: lever front pulldown
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height so that your feet are flat on the ground and your knees are at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Select the appropriate weight and attach the V-bar to the cable machine.
  3. Sit on the seat and grasp the V-bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lean back slightly and engage your core muscles.
  5. Exhale and pull the V-bar down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  7. Inhale and slowly release the V-bar back to the starting position, keeping your arms straight but not locked.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever gripless shrug
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms hanging straight down by your sides.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell up to your waist, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
  4. Slowly raise your shoulders up towards your ears, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.
  5. Hold the contraction for a few seconds, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When you are finished, carefully lower the barbell back down to the ground and release your grip.

name: lever gripless shrug v. 2
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart and arms extended in front of your body. Your palms should be facing down, and your thumbs should be pointing towards each other.
  3. Engage your shoulder blades by pulling them back and down towards your spine.
  4. Keeping your arms straight, lift the barbell by shrugging your shoulders towards your ears.
  5. Hold the top position for a second, then lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever gripper hands
instructions:
1. Choose the appropriate resistance level for your fitness level and grip strength.
  2. Hold the lever gripper in one hand with the handle facing upward.
  3. Place your fingers around the handle, making sure your thumb is on the opposite side of the handle from your fingers.
  4. Squeeze the handle with your fingers and thumb, applying as much pressure as you can comfortably handle.
  5. Hold the squeeze for 5-10 seconds, then release and repeat for 10-15 repetitions.
  6. Switch hands and repeat the exercise on the other side.
  7. Gradually increase the resistance level as your grip strength improves.
  8. Do this exercise 2-3 times per week for best results.

name: lever hammer grip preacher curl
instructions:
1. Begin by adjusting the preacher curl bench so that the seat is at the appropriate height for your body.
  2. Select the appropriate weight and load it onto the weight stack of the exercise machine.
  3. Sit on the bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight against the pad.
  4. Grasp the lever hammer grip handles with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
  5. Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the handles up towards your shoulders.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
  7. Inhale and slowly lower the handles back down to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. When finished, carefully place the handles back on the machine and stand up from the bench.

name: lever high row
instructions:
1. Start by setting the weight on the machine to a comfortable level.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your elbows slightly bent and close to your body.
  4. Slowly pull the handles towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you lift the weight.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to challenge yourself and avoid injury.
  9. Remember to breathe evenly throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lift the weight and exhaling as you lower it.
  10. Finish with a cool-down stretch to prevent soreness and promote flexibility.

name: lever hip extension v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on a bench with your hips just off the end and your legs straight out behind you.
  2. Place your hands on the bench in front of you for support.
  3. Engage your glutes and lift your legs up towards the ceiling, keeping them straight and together.
  4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, squeezing your glutes tightly.
  5. Lower your legs back down towards the bench, but don't let them touch it before lifting them back up again.
  6. Complete the desired number of repetitions before resting and repeating the exercise for additional sets.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid any strain or injury.

name: lever horizontal one leg press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height and backrest according to your comfort level.
  2. Place one foot on the platform in front of you, with your knee bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Grasp the handles on either side of the seat for stability.
  4. Push the platform away from you using your foot until your leg is fully extended.
  5. Slowly bend your knee and bring the platform back towards you, stopping just short of your starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat the exercise.

name: lever incline chest press
instructions:
1. Adjust the incline bench to the desired angle.
  2. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Grasp the handles of the exercise levers with an overhand grip.
  4. Extend your arms forward, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
  5. Inhale and lower the levers towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement.
  7. Exhale and push the levers back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully release the levers and sit up slowly.

name: lever incline chest press v. 2
instructions:
1. Adjust the incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
  2. Sit on the bench and place your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Grasp the handles of the exercise lever with an overhand grip.
  4. Bring the handles towards your chest and hold them there.
  5. Push the handles away from your chest until your arms are fully extended.
  6. Slowly lower the handles back towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully release the handles and stand up from the bench.

name: lever kneeling leg curl
instructions:
1. Adjust the machine to the appropriate resistance level.
  2. Position yourself on the machine by kneeling on the padded bench and placing your ankles under the lever pad.
  3. Grasp the handles located on the sides of the bench for stability.
  4. Slowly curl your legs up towards your buttocks, squeezing your hamstrings at the top of the movement.
  5. Lower your legs back down to the starting position, keeping the movement controlled and steady.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Once completed, release the lever pad and stand up carefully.
  8. Stretch your hamstrings to prevent tightness or injury.

name: lever kneeling twist
instructions:
1. Start by kneeling on the floor with your toes tucked under and your hands on your hips.
  2. Engage your core muscles and maintain a straight spine throughout the exercise.
  3. Place your right hand on your left shoulder and your left hand on your right shoulder.
  4. Slowly twist your torso to the right, keeping your hips facing forward.
  5. Hold the twist for a few seconds, then slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the twist to the left side, placing your left hand on your right shoulder and your right hand on your left shoulder.
  7. Continue alternating twists for 10-15 repetitions on each side.
  8. For a more challenging workout, hold a light weight or resistance band in your hands while performing the twists.
  9. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  10. Finish by returning to a neutral kneeling position and stretching out your back and shoulders.

name: lever lateral raise
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Place your left foot on the exercise lever and keep your right foot on the ground.
  3. With your arms straight and palms facing down, slowly lift the dumbbells out to the sides until they are at shoulder height.
  4. Hold for a second and then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to your right foot on the exercise lever to work the other side.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to ensure proper form and to challenge yourself appropriately.

name: lever leg extension
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat of the machine to your height.
  2. Position yourself on the machine with your back against the backrest and your feet on the footrest.
  3. Grasp the handles on either side of the seat for stability.
  4. Extend your legs forward until they are straight, but do not lock your knees.
  5. Hold the position for a moment, then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and keep your core engaged.

name: lever lying leg curl
instructions:
1. Adjust the machine to fit your body. Adjust the lever according to your height and lie face down on the bench with your knees just off the end.
  2. Grasp the handles and brace your abdominals.
  3. Curl your legs up as far as possible without lifting your thighs from the bench.
  4. Hold for a count of one.
  5. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your movements slow and controlled throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you curl your legs up and inhale as you lower them back down.
  9. Do not arch your back or lift your hips off the bench during the exercise.
  10. Choose a weight that allows you to perform the exercise with proper form.

name: lever lying two-one leg curl
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on the lever lying leg curl machine with your legs straight out behind you.
  2. Adjust the machine so that the pad is resting just above your Achilles tendon.
  3. Place one foot in the foot pad, securing it in place.
  4. Using your hamstring muscles, curl your leg up towards your buttocks, keeping your knee in line with your hip.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, squeezing your hamstring muscles.
  6. Lower your leg back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on one leg before switching to the other leg.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and avoid swinging your body during the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight as needed to ensure proper form and challenge.
  10. Complete 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions on each leg as part of your leg and hamstring workout.

name: lever military press
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the exercise lever with both hands, palms facing forward and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the exercise lever up to shoulder level, bending your elbows and keeping your forearms parallel to the ground.
  4. Press the exercise lever up and overhead, straightening your arms fully.
  5. Lower the exercise lever back down to shoulder level, bending your elbows and keeping your forearms parallel to the ground.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.

name: lever narrow grip seated row
instructions:
1. Adjust the weight on the machine to a comfortable level.
  2. Sit down on the seat and place your feet flat on the footrests.
  3. Grasp the handles with a narrow grip, with your palms facing each other.
  4. Keep your back straight and your chest up, and pull the handles back towards your body.
  5. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  6. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, exhaling as you pull the handles towards your body and inhaling as you release them.
  9. To increase the intensity of the exercise, increase the weight on the machine or perform more repetitions.
  10. To decrease the intensity of the exercise, decrease the weight on the machine or perform fewer repetitions.

name: lever one arm bent over row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Place your left hand on a bench or other sturdy surface for support.
  3. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing in.
  4. Slowly lift the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Squeeze your shoulder blade as you lift the weight up.
  6. Lower the weight back down to starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  8. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with your left arm.

name: lever one arm lateral high row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Place your left hand on your left hip.
  3. Bend your right elbow and lift the dumbbell up to your side, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blade.
  5. Lower the dumbbell back down to your side in a controlled manner.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps on your right side.
  7. Switch to your left arm and repeat the exercise.

name: lever one arm lateral wide pulldown
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise machine with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight against the pad.
  2. Grasp the handle with one hand and extend your arm fully, keeping your elbow slightly bent.
  3. Slowly pull the handle down and across your body towards your opposite hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, feeling the contraction in your back muscles.
  5. Slowly release the handle back to the starting position, keeping your arm extended and your back straight.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm and repeat the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise, inhaling as you pull the handle down and exhaling as you release it back up.
  8. Adjust the weight of the machine as needed to ensure that you are able to perform the exercise with proper form and without straining.

name: lever one arm shoulder press
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height, with your elbow bent and palm facing forward.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you extend your arm upward, pressing the weight overhead until your arm is fully extended.
  3. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weight back down to shoulder height, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with your other arm.
  5. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise and to avoid locking your elbow at the top of the movement.

name: lever overhand triceps dip
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy exercise lever that can support your weight.
  2. Stand facing the lever, with your back to a stable surface such as a bench or wall.
  3. Place your hands on the lever, with your palms facing down and your fingers gripping the edge of the lever.
  4. Step back from the lever and lean forward, keeping your arms straight and your feet together.
  5. Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your shoulders down.
  6. Pause when your elbows reach a 90-degree angle, then push back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: lever preacher curl
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat of the preacher curl machine to your height.
  2. Select the appropriate weight for your fitness level.
  3. Sit on the preacher curl bench with your feet flat on the floor and your arms extended over the pad.
  4. Grasp the handles with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
  5. Curl the handles towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary and your forearms perpendicular to the floor.
  6. Hold the contraction for a second before slowly lowering the handles back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully place the handles back on the machine and stand up.
  9. Stretch your biceps and forearms to prevent injury and promote recovery.

name: lever preacher curl v. 2
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height of the lever preacher curl machine so that your arms can rest comfortably on the pad while holding the handles.
  2. Select the desired weight on the weight stack and load it onto the machine.
  3. Stand in front of the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the handles with an underhand grip.
  4. Position your upper arms on the pad, ensuring that your elbows are in line with the lever pivot point.
  5. Exhale and curl the handles towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary and your wrists straight.
  6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  7. Inhale and slowly lower the handles back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully return the weight stack to its starting position and step away from the machine.

name: lever pullover
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a bench or the floor with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Grasp the exercise lever with both hands, palms facing up, and extend your arms straight up above your chest.
  3. Slowly lower the exercise lever behind your head, keeping your arms straight and your elbows locked in place.
  4. Pause for a second when the exercise lever is parallel to the ground, then slowly lift it back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever reverse grip lateral pulldown
instructions:
1. Adjust the weight stack to a comfortable level for your fitness level.
  2. Sit on the machine with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Grasp the handles with your palms facing you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your back muscles and pull the handles down towards your chest.
  5. Pause at the bottom of the movement and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  6. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position, keeping your back muscles engaged throughout the movement.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully release the handles and stand up from the machine.

name: lever reverse grip preacher curl
instructions:
1. Adjust the preacher curl bench to a comfortable height for your arms.
  2. Select the appropriate weight for your fitness level and load it onto the exercise lever machine.
  3. Sit on the bench and position yourself with your chest against the pad and your arms resting on the pad extension.
  4. Grasp the handles with an underhand grip, with your palms facing up and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  5. Slowly curl the handles up towards your shoulders while keeping your elbows stationary and close to the pad.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  7. Lower the handles back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully release the handles and stand up from the bench.
  10. Remove any weight plates from the machine and return them to their proper storage location.

name: lever reverse grip vertical row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of an exercise lever machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grab the handles of the machine with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
  3. Keeping your back straight and your abs engaged, pull the handles towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your movements slow and controlled, and to breathe in as you pull the handles towards your chest and out as you lower them back down.
  7. As you progress, you can increase the weight on the machine or try variations of the exercise, such as alternating arms or performing the movement with a single arm at a time.

name: lever reverse hyperextension
instructions:
1. Position yourself on the exercise lever reverse hyperextension machine by lying face down on the padded platform with your hips at the edge and your legs hanging off the end.
  2. Place your feet on the footrests and adjust the height so that your hips are slightly below the level of the padded platform.
  3. Grasp the handles on either side of the machine and lift your legs up until they are parallel to the floor.
  4. Slowly lower your legs back down towards the ground, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  5. Once your feet are close to the ground, raise them back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: lever reverse t-bar row
instructions:
1. Set up the exercise machine by attaching a lever to the T-bar row handle.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  3. Grasp the handle with an overhand grip and pull it towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to breathe in as you pull the handle towards your chest and breathe out as you lower it back down.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to ensure proper form and challenge.
  9. As you progress, you can increase the weight or add more repetitions to continue challenging your muscles.
  10. Remember to always warm up before starting any exercise and to consult with a trainer or healthcare professional if you have any concerns or injuries.

name: lever rotary calf
instructions:
1. Adjust the weight on the exercise machine to a comfortable level.
  2. Stand in front of the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  3. Place the balls of your feet on the footrests of the machine and grasp the handles for support.
  4. Slowly lift your heels off the footrests by extending your ankles as far as you can.
  5. Hold the contraction for a few seconds before slowly lowering your heels back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.
  7. Adjust the weight as needed to increase or decrease the intensity of the exercise.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and keep your core engaged for stability.
  9. Stretch your calf muscles after the exercise to prevent stiffness and soreness.

name: lever seated calf press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat of the machine so that your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle and your feet are flat on the platform.
  2. Place your hands on the handles of the machine and push the platform up with your toes until your legs are straight.
  3. Lower the platform back down slowly until your heels are below the platform.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  5. Remember to breathe evenly throughout the exercise and to keep your core engaged.
  6. Adjust the weight as necessary to challenge yourself without compromising form.
  7. Stretch your calves after the exercise by standing on a step or curb and lowering your heels below the edge of the step.

name: lever seated calf raise
instructions:
1. Adjust the lever of the calf raise machine to fit your height.
  2. Place your forefeet on the foot platform with your heels extending off.
  3. Position the shoulder pads underneath your shoulders.
  4. Grasp the handles on the sides for support.
  5. Raise your heels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as possible and flexing your calf.
  6. Hold the top contraction for a second.
  7. Lower your heels as you inhale by bending your ankles until calves are stretched.
  8. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: lever seated crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise lever machine with your feet placed firmly on the footrests.
  2. Grasp the handles or the sides of the seat to stabilize yourself.
  3. Slowly lean back and bring your knees towards your chest, keeping your feet on the footrests.
  4. Pause for a moment and then slowly return to the starting position, keeping your abs engaged throughout the movement.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid using momentum to swing your body.
  7. Adjust the resistance on the machine as needed to make the exercise more challenging or easier.
  8. Stretch your abs and lower back after completing the exercise.

name: lever seated crunch (chest pad)
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height so that the chest pad is at chest level when seated.
  2. Sit on the machine with your back pressed against the backrest and your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Place your hands on the handles next to your thighs.
  4. Engage your core and slowly lean back, keeping your back straight, until your upper body is at a 45-degree angle.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly return to the starting position, keeping your core engaged throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lean back and exhaling as you return to the starting position.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary to ensure proper form and challenge.

name: lever seated crunch v. 2
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise lever machine with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Grasp the handles on either side of the machine and lean back slightly, keeping your back straight and your abs engaged.
  3. Slowly lift your legs up towards your chest, contracting your abs as you do so.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for a set of 10-12 repetitions.
  6. For an added challenge, you can increase the resistance on the machine or hold a weight between your feet.
  7. Remember to keep your breathing steady throughout the exercise and to engage your core muscles for maximum effectiveness.

name: lever seated dip
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the edge of a sturdy bench or chair with your hands grasping the edge of the seat on either side of your hips.
  2. Place your feet flat on the ground in front of you, with your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Slowly slide your hips off the edge of the seat, keeping your hands in place on the bench or chair.
  4. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight and your shoulders down.
  5. Once your upper arms are parallel to the ground, push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your elbows close to your body throughout the exercise to target your triceps muscles.
  8. If you find this exercise too difficult, you can modify it by placing your feet further away from your body or by using a lower bench or chair.
  9. If you find this exercise too easy, you can make it more challenging by adding weight to your lap or by elevating your feet on another bench or chair.

name: lever seated fly
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height of the exercise machine so that your feet are flat on the ground and your knees are at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Adjust the handles of the machine so that they are at chest height.
  3. Sit on the machine with your back straight and your chest up.
  4. Place your hands on the handles and engage your core.
  5. Exhale and push the handles together in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles.
  6. Inhale and slowly release the handles back to the starting position, keeping your chest muscles engaged.
  7. Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: lever seated good morning
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the exercise lever machine with your knees bent and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Place the barbell across your shoulders, behind your neck, and secure it in place with your hands.
  3. Slowly lean forward, hinging at your hips, while keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. Lower your torso until it is parallel to the ground or until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement and then slowly return to the starting position by pushing your hips forward and standing up straight.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to avoid rounding your back or lifting with your lower back.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary and always use proper form to prevent injury and maximize results.

name: lever seated hip abduction
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the exercise lever machine with your back straight and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place the lever pad on the outside of your right thigh, just above your knee.
  3. Grasp the handlebars on either side of the seat with your hands for support.
  4. Slowly lift your right leg out to the side, keeping it straight, until you feel a stretch in your hip.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your leg back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for a desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with your left leg.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight on the machine as needed to ensure that you are able to perform the exercise with proper form.
  9. Remember to breathe deeply and evenly throughout the exercise.
  10. Finish the exercise by releasing the lever pad and standing up slowly.

name: lever seated hip adduction
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise lever machine with your back straight and your feet flat on the footrests.
  2. Place the lever between your legs and adjust the weight as needed.
  3. Slowly press your legs together, squeezing your inner thighs, until they touch.
  4. Hold the contraction for a few seconds before slowly releasing the tension and returning to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Remember to breathe normally and avoid holding your breath during the movement.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed and increase gradually over time as you build strength.
  9. Aim to perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions, with a rest period of 30-60 seconds between sets.
  10. Consult with a fitness professional if you have any concerns or questions about performing this exercise.

name: lever seated leg curl
instructions:
1. Adjust the machine to fit your body. The back of your legs should rest comfortably against the pad, and the lever should be positioned just above your ankles.
  2. Grasp the handles on the sides of the seat for stability.
  3. Slowly curl your legs towards your buttocks, keeping your knees in line with the lever.
  4. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, exhaling as you curl your legs up and inhaling as you lower them down.
  7. Adjust the weight as necessary to challenge yourself appropriately.
  8. Stretch your hamstrings after the exercise to prevent tightness and injury.

name: lever seated leg raise crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands holding onto the sides of the bench/chair for support.
  2. Extend your legs out in front of you, keeping them together and your toes pointed towards the ceiling.
  3. Slowly raise your legs up towards your chest, while simultaneously crunching your upper body towards your legs.
  4. Hold the contraction for a few seconds before slowly lowering your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever seated reverse fly
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise lever machine with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight against the backrest.
  2. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing each other.
  3. Slowly pull the handles back towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise, and to use a weight that challenges you without compromising your form.
  7. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the weight or the number of repetitions to continue challenging yourself.

name: lever seated reverse fly (parallel grip)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the exercise lever machine with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight against the back pad.
  2. Grasp the parallel handles with an overhand grip and your palms facing each other.
  3. Keep your elbows slightly bent and lift the handles out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the ground.
  4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you lift the handles, and hold for a second at the top of the movement.
  5. Slowly lower the handles back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows slightly bent throughout the exercise.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of reps and sets.

name: lever seated row
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise lever machine with your feet flat on the footrests and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Keep your back straight and engage your core muscles.
  4. Slowly pull the handles towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.
  5. Hold the contraction for a second or two, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you pull the handles towards your chest and exhaling as you release them back to the starting position.
  8. Adjust the weight accordingly to your fitness level.
  9. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger.
  10. Always consult with a trainer or medical professional before beginning any new exercise program.

name: lever seated shoulder press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat of the exercise lever to a comfortable height so that your feet are flat on the ground and your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Sit on the seat with your back straight and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  3. Grasp the handles of the lever with an overhand grip and lift the weight up to shoulder level.
  4. Press the weight up and overhead until your arms are fully extended.
  5. Lower the weight back down to shoulder level, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully lower the weight back down to the starting position and release the handles.
  8. Adjust the weight as necessary for your fitness level and repeat the exercise for additional sets.

name: lever seated squat calf raise on leg press machine
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat of the leg press machine so that your feet can comfortably reach the footplate.
  2. Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and your feet on the footplate, hip-width apart.
  3. Place your hands on the side handles of the machine for support.
  4. Press your feet into the footplate to straighten your legs and lift the weight stack.
  5. Slowly lower your heels towards the floor, keeping your toes on the footplate.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then push your heels up as high as possible.
  7. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your heels back down.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. When finished, release the weight stack and carefully dismount the machine.

name: lever seated twist
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the edge of a bench or sturdy chair with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold a weighted exercise lever with both hands, keeping your arms straight and parallel to the floor.
  3. Engage your core and twist your torso to the right, bringing the lever across your body to the right side.
  4. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, then slowly twist your torso back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the movement, this time twisting to the left side.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your shoulders relaxed throughout the exercise.

name: lever shoulder press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height so that the handles are at shoulder level when you are seated.
  2. Sit down on the machine and place your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and push them up and away from your body.
  4. Slowly lower the handles back down to shoulder level, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Exhale as you press the handles up and inhale as you lower them back down.
  6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully release the handles back to the starting position and stand up from the machine.

name: lever shoulder press  v. 2
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height and backrest of the machine to your comfort level.
  2. Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and lift them up to shoulder level. Your elbows should be bent and level with your shoulders.
  4. Push the handles upward until your arms are fully extended overhead. Exhale during this movement.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handles back down to shoulder level. Inhale during this movement.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. After completing the set, lower the handles back down to the starting position.
  8. Release the handles and carefully stand up from the machine.
  9. Stretch your shoulders and arms to cool down.

name: lever shoulder press  v. 3
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height so that the handles are at shoulder level when you are seated.
  2. Select the appropriate weight on the weight stack.
  3. Sit on the machine and place your feet flat on the floor.
  4. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and bring them to shoulder level.
  5. Push the handles up and away from your body until your arms are fully extended, but do not lock your elbows.
  6. Lower the handles back down to shoulder level in a controlled manner.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, release the handles and carefully stand up from the machine.
  9. Return the weight stack to its starting position.

name: lever shrug
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the handles of the exercise lever with an overhand grip.
  3. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  4. Slowly raise your shoulders toward your ears, keeping your arms straight.
  5. Hold the contraction for a few seconds, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the exercise lever as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  9. Be sure to warm up before beginning the exercise and stretch afterward to prevent injury.

name: lever standing calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand on the calf raise machine with your toes on the edge of the platform and your heels hanging off.
  2. Place your hands on the handles and stand up straight with your shoulders back and your core engaged.
  3. Slowly raise your heels as high as possible, keeping your knees straight.
  4. Hold this position for a second, then lower your heels back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Adjust the weight as necessary to ensure proper form and challenge.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid locking your knees at the top of the movement.

name: lever standing chest press
instructions:
1. Adjust the weight on the machine to a comfortable level.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Grasp the handles of the machine at chest height with your palms facing down.
  4. Slowly push the handles forward, extending your arms in front of you.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly bring the handles back towards your chest.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. Exhale as you push the handles forward, and inhale as you bring them back towards your chest.

name: lever t bar row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Place the end of the T-bar into a corner or onto a landmine attachment if available.
  3. Grab the handle with both hands, palms facing each other, and extend your arms forward.
  4. Keeping your back straight, hinge at the hips and bend your knees slightly to lower your torso until it's almost parallel to the floor.
  5. Exhale and pull the T-bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement, and hold for a second.
  7. Inhale and slowly lower the T-bar back to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully release the T-bar and stand up straight.

name: lever t-bar reverse grip row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and placing the end of the T-bar into the corner of a wall or weightlifting apparatus.
  2. Grasp the handles of the T-bar with an underhand grip, making sure your palms are facing up.
  3. Lean forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. Slowly pull the T-bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the T-bar back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully release the T-bar from the wall or apparatus and set it aside.

name: lever triceps extension
instructions:
1. Start by grabbing the handle of the exercise lever with an overhand grip and standing facing the machine.
  2. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and keep your back straight.
  3. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Slowly lower the weight by bending your elbows and bringing your hands towards your forehead.
  5. Stop when your forearms are parallel to the ground and your elbows are at a 90-degree angle.
  6. Pause for a moment and then slowly straighten your arms to return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Make sure to keep your elbows close to your body throughout the exercise and avoid swinging your arms.
  9. You can increase the weight as you become stronger, but always start with a lighter weight to ensure proper form.

name: lever unilateral row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing inwards.
  3. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  4. Place your left hand on your left knee for support.
  5. Pull the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and perform the exercise with your left arm.

name: london bridge
instructions:
1. Form two lines facing each other, with each person holding hands with the person opposite them. These are the "pillars" of the bridge.
  2. Choose two people to be the "London Bridge." They will stand in the middle of the two lines, facing each other and holding hands to form an arch.
  3. The two "London Bridge" people will sing the first verse of the song "London Bridge is Falling Down." During the last line of the verse ("My fair lady"), the "London Bridge" will drop their arms to trap one of the players passing through the arch.
  4. The trapped player will then choose a "pillar" to join their line. The game continues with the remaining players until everyone has been trapped and joined one of the "pillars."
  5. The game can be restarted with the new "London Bridge" players and the new "pillars" until everyone has had a chance to be the "London Bridge."

name: low glute bridge on floor
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your arms by your sides with your palms facing down.
  3. Engage your core and glutes, and slowly lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, making sure to keep your glutes and core engaged.
  5. Slowly lower your hips back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions.

name: lower back curl
instructions:
1. Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands behind your head or cross them over your chest.
  3. Engage your core muscles and slowly lift your head, shoulders, and upper back off the ground.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lunge with jump
instructions:
1. Start by standing up straight with your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Take a step forward with your right foot, keeping your left foot in place.
  3. Bend your right knee and lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
  4. Push off your right foot and jump up into the air.
  5. As you land, switch your legs so that your left foot is now in front and your right foot is behind you.
  6. Bend your left knee and lower your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground.
  7. Push off your left foot and jump up into the air.
  8. Repeat the exercise, alternating legs with each jump.
  9. Complete 10-12 reps on each leg for a full set.
  10. Rest for 30 seconds between sets and complete 3-4 sets total.

name: lunge with twist
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Step forward with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge position, keeping your left foot in place.
  3. As you lunge, twist your torso to the right, bringing your left elbow across your body towards your right knee.
  4. Hold the twist for a few seconds, then return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the lunge and twist on the other side, stepping forward with your left foot and twisting your torso to the left.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or time.

name: lying (side) quads stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your side on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat or carpet.
  2. Stretch your bottom arm out straight above your head, and bend your top arm at the elbow, placing your hand on the floor in front of your chest.
  3. Bend your top leg at the knee and bring your heel towards your buttocks.
  4. Grasp your ankle with your top hand and gently pull your heel towards your buttocks, feeling a stretch in your quadriceps muscle.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing your body.
  6. Release the stretch and repeat on the other side, switching your arms and legs.
  7. Perform 2-3 sets of the stretch on each side, gradually increasing the duration of the stretch as your flexibility improves.

name: lying elbow to knee
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your legs extended and your arms at your sides.
  2. Bend your left knee and bring it towards your chest.
  3. Place your left hand behind your head and lift your head and shoulders off the ground.
  4. Bring your right elbow towards your left knee, twisting your torso to the left.
  5. Hold for a few seconds and then return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat on the other side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee.
  7. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lying leg raise flat bench
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a bench or mat.
  2. Place your hands by your sides, palms facing down.
  3. Slowly lift both legs off the ground, keeping them straight and together.
  4. Continue lifting until your legs are perpendicular to the ground or until you feel a stretch in your abs.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. To increase the difficulty, you can add ankle weights or hold a dumbbell between your feet.
  8. Remember to engage your core throughout the exercise and keep your lower back flat against the bench.
  9. Avoid swinging your legs or using momentum to lift them.
  10. Breathe in as you lift your legs and exhale as you lower them.

name: lying leg-hip raise
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a mat or comfortable surface.
  2. Place your hands at your sides, palms facing down.
  3. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Engage your core muscles and slowly lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight and together.
  5. Continue to lift your legs until they are perpendicular to the ground, or as close as you can comfortably get.
  6. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for a set of 10-12 reps, or as many as you can comfortably do.
  8. For an added challenge, you can hold a small weight between your feet or ankles.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe deeply and evenly.
  10. Take breaks as needed and listen to your body to avoid injury.

name: machine inner chest press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height and backrest position to ensure proper alignment with the handles.
  2. Choose the appropriate weight for your fitness level and attach the handles to the weight stack.
  3. Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and grasp the handles with an overhand grip.
  4. Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended in front of you.
  5. Slowly bring the handles back towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Pause for a moment when the handles are close to your chest, then push them back out to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise, exhaling as you push the handles forward and inhaling as you bring them back towards your chest.
  9. When you have completed your set, release the handles and carefully stand up from the machine.
  10. Stretch your chest and arms to cool down and prevent injury.

name: march sit (wall)
instructions:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart, and arms at your sides.
  2. Slowly slide down the wall into a seated position, with your knees at a 90-degree angle and your thighs parallel to the ground.
  3. Hold this position for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or as long as you can.
  4. Slowly stand up and repeat for 3-5 sets.
  5. For an added challenge, hold a medicine ball or weight in front of your chest while performing the exercise.

name: medicine ball catch and overhead throw
instructions:
1. Stand facing a partner about 6-8 feet apart.
  2. Both partners should hold a medicine ball at chest height.
  3. One partner will throw the ball overhead to the other partner.
  4. The receiving partner will catch the ball and immediately throw it back.
  5. Continue throwing the ball back and forth for a set amount of time or number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to use your entire body to generate power for the throw, not just your arms.
  7. As you catch the ball, absorb the impact by bending your knees and using your core muscles.
  8. Vary the weight of the medicine ball and the distance between partners to increase or decrease the difficulty of the exercise.
  9. Remember to communicate with your partner and stay aware of your surroundings to avoid accidents.
  10. Finish with a cool-down stretch to prevent muscle soreness and injury.

name: medicine ball chest pass
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a medicine ball at chest level.
  2. Step forward with one foot and transfer your weight onto that foot.
  3. Engage your core and chest muscles as you push the ball forward with both hands.
  4. Release the ball when your arms are fully extended in front of you.
  5. Allow the ball to bounce off a wall or partner's hands and catch it as it returns to you.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps or time.

name: medicine ball chest push from 3 point stance
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a medicine ball on the ground in front of you.
  2. Assume a three-point stance, with one hand on the ball and the other hand on the ground.
  3. Extend your legs behind you, keeping your core engaged and your body in a straight line.
  4. Push the ball away from your body with your hand, using your chest muscles to generate force.
  5. As the ball rolls away from you, quickly switch hands and catch it with your other hand.
  6. Repeat the exercise, alternating hands with each repetition.
  7. Perform the exercise for a set number of repetitions or for a set amount of time.
  8. Rest for a brief period between sets, and repeat for multiple sets as desired.

name: medicine ball chest push multiple response
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a medicine ball at chest level with both hands.
  2. Take a step forward with your left foot and lower your body into a lunge position. Your left knee should be at a 90-degree angle and your right leg should be extended behind you.
  3. As you lower your body, push the medicine ball away from your chest and extend your arms fully.
  4. Return the medicine ball to your chest as you push yourself back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise, this time stepping forward with your right foot.
  6. Continue alternating legs and pushing the medicine ball away from your chest for the desired number of repetitions.

name: medicine ball chest push single response
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on your back on a flat bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Hold a medicine ball with both hands at chest level, with your elbows bent and close to your sides.
  3. Push the ball away from your chest with both hands, extending your arms fully.
  4. Pause for a moment, then bring the ball back to your chest by bending your elbows.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to exhale as you push the ball away from your chest.

name: medicine ball chest push with run release
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a medicine ball at chest height.
  2. Take a step forward with your left foot and simultaneously push the medicine ball away from your chest, extending your arms straight in front of you.
  3. As you push the ball away, start running forward with your left foot, keeping your arms extended in front of you.
  4. After a few steps, release the ball and continue running forward.
  5. Retrieve the ball and repeat the exercise, starting with your right foot this time.
  6. Continue alternating between left and right feet for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and maintain good posture throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight of the medicine ball as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.

name: medicine ball close grip push up
instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands on a medicine ball, shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lower your body down towards the ball, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  3. Push your body back up, using your chest and triceps to lift yourself.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  5. As you become more advanced, try lifting one hand off the ball while performing the push-up, alternating hands with each rep.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  7. Exhale as you push up, inhale as you lower down.
  8. Finish by stepping off the ball and stretching your chest and triceps.

name: medicine ball overhead slam
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a medicine ball with both hands above your head.
  2. Engage your core and lift the ball off the ground using your arms.
  3. As you lift the ball, take a step forward with one foot, shifting your weight onto that foot.
  4. Bring the ball down in a swift motion, slamming it onto the ground in front of you.
  5. As you slam the ball, pivot your back foot and twist your torso to add power to the movement.
  6. Retrieve the ball and repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
  7. Alternate stepping forward with each rep to work both sides of your body.

name: medicine ball supine chest throw
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on a mat or bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Hold a medicine ball with both hands, keeping your elbows bent and the ball close to your chest.
  3. Take a deep breath in and exhale forcefully as you throw the ball straight up towards the ceiling.
  4. As the ball reaches the top of its arc, extend your arms fully and push the ball away from your chest.
  5. Catch the ball as it comes back down and immediately repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to protect your lower back.
  7. Choose a weight that is challenging but still allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions, resting for 30-60 seconds between sets.

name: mixed grip chin-up
instructions:
1. Begin by standing directly under a chin-up bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Reach up and grab the bar with one hand in an underhand grip (palm facing towards you) and the other hand in an overhand grip (palm facing away from you).
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your shoulders relaxed.
  4. Engage your core muscles and pull your body up towards the bar, leading with your chest and keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar and your elbows are bent at a 90-degree angle.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, alternating your grip with each set.

name: modified hindu push-up (male)
instructions:
1. Start in a downward dog position with your hands and feet on the ground, forming an inverted V-shape with your body.
  2. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
  3. As you lower your body, simultaneously move your head and chest forward and upward, arching your back and keeping your arms straight.
  4. Once your chest is parallel to the ground, pause for a moment before reversing the movement.
  5. Push your body back up to the starting position, while keeping your arms straight and returning to the downward dog position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: modified push up to lower arms
instructions:
1. Begin on your hands and knees, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Extend your legs behind you, so that you are in a plank position.
  3. Lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your ribcage.
  4. Stop when your elbows reach a 90-degree angle.
  5. Push back up to the starting position, keeping your core engaged and your body in a straight line.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: monster walk
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and placing a resistance band around your ankles.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and engage your glutes and core muscles.
  3. Take a step to the side with your left foot, keeping tension on the resistance band.
  4. Bring your right foot in to meet your left foot, maintaining tension on the band.
  5. Repeat this side step motion for 10-12 steps to the left.
  6. Then, take 10-12 steps to the right, still maintaining tension on the resistance band.
  7. Make sure to keep your feet parallel and your knees slightly bent throughout the exercise.
  8. You can also vary the intensity of the exercise by using a stronger or weaker resistance band.
  9. Repeat the monster walk for 2-3 sets, resting for 30 seconds between each set.
  10. Finish by stretching your glutes and legs to prevent any tightness or soreness.

name: mountain climber
instructions:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Engage your core and bring your right knee towards your chest, keeping your left leg extended behind you.
  3. Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee towards your chest and extending your right leg behind you.
  4. Continue alternating legs at a fast pace, as if you are climbing a mountain.
  5. Make sure to keep your hips level and your shoulders stacked over your wrists.
  6. Try to maintain a steady pace for 30-60 seconds, or as long as you can without sacrificing form.
  7. You can also modify this exercise by slowing down the pace or bringing your knees towards your elbows instead of your chest.
  8. Repeat for 2-3 sets, resting for 30 seconds in between each set.

name: muscle up
instructions:
1. Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing away from you.
  2. Initiate the movement by pulling your chest towards the bar.
  3. As you reach the top of the pull-up, shift your weight forward and tuck your knees towards your chest.
  4. At the peak of your momentum, explosively push down on the bar and simultaneously push your body upwards.
  5. As you push up, transition your hands from a pulling grip to a pushing grip by rotating your wrists so that your palms are facing towards you.
  6. Once your arms are fully extended, push your shoulders forward and over the bar, allowing your hips to follow.
  7. Finish the movement by straightening your arms and pulling your chest towards the bar once again to complete the dip portion of the muscle up.
  8. Lower yourself back down to the starting position and repeat the movement.

name: muscle-up (on vertical bar)
instructions:
1. Stand facing the vertical bar.
  2. Jump up and grip the bar with both hands, palms facing away from you.
  3. Engage your core and pull your body up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. As you reach the top of the pull-up, lean your body forward and push your chest towards the bar.
  5. As you push your chest up towards the bar, simultaneously push down on the bar with your hands and pull your hips up towards the bar.
  6. As your hips come up towards the bar, continue to push down on the bar with your hands and pull your body up and over the bar.
  7. As you come over the bar, straighten your arms and lock out your elbows at the top of the movement.
  8. Reverse the movement by lowering your body back down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  9. Release your grip on the bar and land back on the ground.

name: narrow push-up on exercise ball
instructions:
1. Place an exercise ball on the floor and assume a push-up position with your hands on the ball, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Engage your core and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  3. Lower your chest towards the ball by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. For an added challenge, you can try bringing your hands closer together on the ball or lifting one leg off the ground while performing the push-up.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: neck side stretch
instructions:
1. Start by sitting or standing up straight with your shoulders relaxed.
  2. Slowly tilt your head to one side, bringing your ear towards your shoulder.
  3. Use your hand to gently pull your head further towards your shoulder, if needed.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in the side of your neck.
  5. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
  6. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times on each side.

name: negative crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your arms at your sides and your knees bent.
  2. Slowly lift your legs off the ground, keeping them bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Next, lift your head and shoulders off the ground, keeping your chin tucked into your chest.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, focusing on contracting your abdominal muscles.
  5. Slowly lower your legs and upper body back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: oblique crunch v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows pointing outwards.
  2. Engage your core muscles and lift your head, neck, and shoulders off the ground.
  3. Simultaneously, bring your right knee towards your chest and twist your torso to the right, aiming to touch your left elbow to your right knee.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your head, neck, shoulders, and right leg back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the movement, this time bringing your left knee towards your chest and twisting your torso to the left, aiming to touch your right elbow to your left knee.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or time.

name: oblique crunches floor
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on your back on a yoga mat or any comfortable surface.
  2. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
  3. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows pointing outwards.
  4. Engage your core muscles and lift your shoulders off the floor.
