  5. Twist your torso to the right, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee.
  6. Hold the contraction for a few seconds, feeling the burn in your oblique muscles.
  7. Slowly lower your shoulders back down to the floor and repeat the movement on the other side.
  8. Alternate between left and right for a total of 10-15 repetitions on each side.
  9. Remember to breathe deeply throughout the exercise and keep your neck relaxed.
  10. For an extra challenge, you can hold a weight or a medicine ball in your hands while performing the oblique crunches.

name: olympic barbell hammer curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the Olympic barbell with an underhand grip, keeping your palms facing up and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hold the barbell at arm's length in front of your thighs, with your elbows close to your sides.
  3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, exhaling as you lift.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, inhaling as you lower.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Variations of the exercise can include using dumbbells or a cable machine instead of an Olympic barbell.
  8. It's important to start with a weight that you can comfortably lift for 8-12 repetitions and gradually increase the weight as you get stronger.

name: olympic barbell triceps extension
instructions:
1. Begin by setting up an Olympic barbell with an appropriate weight for your fitness level.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell overhead, keeping your elbows close to your head.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, bending your elbows and keeping your upper arms stationary.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then extend your arms to lift the barbell back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, ensuring that you maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  7. Once you have completed your set, carefully lower the barbell back to the starting position and rest for a moment before continuing with your workout.

name: one arm against wall
instructions:
1. Stand facing a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Place one arm against the wall with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Push your arm into the wall as hard as you can for 10-15 seconds.
  4. Release the tension and rest for 10-15 seconds.
  5. Repeat the exercise for a total of 3-5 sets on each arm.

name: one arm chin-up
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy pull-up bar that can support your weight.
  2. Stand facing the bar with your dominant hand gripping the bar in an underhand grip (palm facing towards you) and your non-dominant hand hanging by your side.
  3. Engage your core and pull your shoulder blades down and back.
  4. Begin to pull yourself up towards the bar using only your dominant arm while keeping your non-dominant arm relaxed by your side.
  5. As you pull yourself up, focus on keeping your elbow close to your body and your wrist straight.
  6. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
  7. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
  8. Repeat for desired number of repetitions on your dominant arm before switching to your non-dominant arm.

name: one arm dip
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy surface to perform the dip on, such as parallel bars or the edge of a bench.
  2. Place one hand on the surface, fingers facing forward, and extend your legs out in front of you.
  3. Lower your body down by bending your elbow, keeping your back straight and chest lifted.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
  6. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement to maintain stability and prevent injury.
  7. Gradually increase the difficulty of the exercise by adding weight or performing more reps.

name: one arm slam (with medicine ball)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball in one hand.
  2. Extend your arm straight up above your head, holding the medicine ball.
  3. In one explosive movement, slam the medicine ball down to the ground as hard as you can.
  4. Catch the ball as it bounces back up off the ground.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on one side before switching to the other arm.
  6. Make sure to engage your core and use your entire body to generate power for the slam.
  7. Keep your arm straight and your wrist firm throughout the movement to avoid injury.
  8. Choose a medicine ball weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  9. Take breaks as needed and stretch before and after the exercise.

name: one arm towel row
instructions:
1. Start by placing a towel on the floor and stand with your feet hip-width apart, facing the towel.
  2. Bend down and place one hand on the towel, with your palm facing down.
  3. With your other hand, grab onto a stable object, such as a table or chair, to stabilize yourself.
  4. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you pull the towel towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  5. Hold the contraction for a few seconds, then slowly release the towel back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat on the other side.

name: one leg donkey calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your hands resting on a wall or sturdy object for balance.
  2. Lift one foot off the ground and balance on the other foot.
  3. Slowly rise up onto the ball of your foot, lifting your heel as high as possible.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your heel back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: one leg floor calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand on one foot with the other foot slightly behind you.
  2. Place your hands on a wall or stable surface for balance.
  3. Raise your heel off the ground, lifting your body weight onto the ball of your foot.
  4. Hold the contraction for a few seconds, feeling the stretch in your calf muscle.
  5. Slowly lower your heel back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch legs and repeat the exercise on the other side.

name: one leg squat
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Lift your left foot off the ground and extend it forward.
  3. Bend your right knee and lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your left foot off the ground.
  4. Lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
  5. Push through your right heel to stand back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat on the other side, lifting your right foot off the ground and extending it forward.
  7. Complete 10-15 reps on each leg for 2-3 sets.

name: otis up
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Slowly raise your arms straight up above your head, keeping them shoulder-width apart.
  3. As you raise your arms, rise up onto the balls of your feet, lifting your heels off the ground.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then lower your arms and heels back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the exercise for a total of 10-15 repetitions.
  6. For an added challenge, hold a light weight in each hand as you perform the exercise.

name: outside leg kick push-up
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Lift your right leg off the ground and kick it out to the side as high as you can, while keeping your core engaged and your hips level.
  3. Lower your leg back down and perform a push-up, keeping your elbows close to your body and your back straight.
  4. As you push back up, lift your left leg off the ground and kick it out to the side as high as you can.
  5. Lower your leg back down and perform another push-up.
  6. Continue alternating leg kicks and push-ups for your desired number of reps or time.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your movements controlled throughout the exercise.

name: overhead triceps stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Extend your arms above your head, keeping your elbows close to your ears.
  3. Grasp your right elbow with your left hand and gently pull it towards your left side, keeping your right arm straight.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your right triceps.
  5. Release and repeat with your left arm.
  6. Repeat the stretch on both arms for 2-3 sets, taking a short break between sets if needed.

name: pelvic tilt
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your arms at your sides with your palms facing down.
  3. Take a deep breath in and as you exhale, engage your abdominal muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
  4. Gently tilt your pelvis towards your belly button, pressing your lower back into the ground.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, making sure to keep your abdominal muscles engaged.
  6. Slowly release the tilt and return to your starting position.
  7. Repeat this exercise for 10-15 repetitions, focusing on the movement of your pelvis and keeping your core engaged.

name: pelvic tilt into bridge
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your arms by your sides with your palms facing down.
  3. Take a deep breath in and as you exhale, engage your core muscles by drawing your belly button towards your spine.
  4. Slowly lift your hips off the ground, pressing your feet into the floor.
  5. Keep your core engaged and your glutes tight as you lift your hips towards the ceiling.
  6. Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions.

name: peroneals stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you.
  2. Cross your right ankle over your left ankle and place your right foot on the floor to the left of your left knee.
  3. Place your hands on the floor behind you for support.
  4. Gently press your right knee down towards the floor until you feel a stretch in the outside of your right calf and ankle.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds.
  6. Release the stretch and switch legs by crossing your left ankle over your right ankle and repeating the stretch on the other side.

name: pike-to-cobra push-up
instructions:
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Engage your core and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, forming an inverted V-shape with your body. This is the pike position.
  3. Lower your body down towards the floor, bending your elbows and keeping them close to your body. As you lower, shift your weight forward and lower your hips towards the ground.
  4. As you push back up, straighten your arms and lift your chest up towards the ceiling, arching your back. This is the cobra position.
  5. Lower your chest back down towards the ground and push back up into the pike position.
  6. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.

name: plyo push up
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  3. As you push yourself back up, explode off the ground and push your hands off the ground so that your upper body lifts up into the air.
  4. Land softly back in the starting plank position and repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
  5. Make sure to engage your core and keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  6. If the full plyo push up is too difficult, you can modify by doing a regular push up and then lifting your hands off the ground at the top of the movement.
  7. Remember to focus on proper form and breathing throughout the exercise.

name: posterior step to overhead reach
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Step your right foot back, keeping your weight on your left foot.
  3. As you step back, reach your arms overhead, keeping them straight and shoulder-width apart.
  4. Lower your arms back down to your sides as you bring your right foot back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat on the other side, stepping your left foot back and reaching your arms overhead.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: posterior tibialis stretch
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with both legs extended in front of you.
  2. Cross your right leg over your left thigh, placing your right foot on the floor next to your left knee.
  3. Reach your right hand behind your right hip and place it on the floor, fingers pointing away from your body.
  4. Place your left hand on your right ankle and gently pull your right foot towards your left hip.
  5. You should feel a stretch in your right calf and the back of your right ankle.
  6. Hold this stretch for 15-30 seconds.
  7. Release the stretch and switch sides, crossing your left leg over your right thigh and repeating the stretch on your left side.

name: potty squat
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Squat down as low as you can, keeping your heels on the ground.
  3. Place your hands on your knees or in front of you for balance.
  4. Contract your pelvic floor muscles and hold for 5-10 seconds.
  5. Relax your pelvic floor muscles and stand back up.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 reps.
  7. For an added challenge, hold a weight or medicine ball in front of you while performing the exercise.

name: potty squat with support
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy object to hold onto, such as a wall or piece of furniture.
  2. Stand facing the support with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Squat down as low as you can while still holding onto the support.
  4. Hold the squat position for a few seconds, then stand back up.
  5. Repeat the squatting motion for 10-15 repetitions.
  6. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, try to squat lower and hold the position for longer periods of time.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your knees aligned with your toes throughout the exercise.
  8. This exercise is great for strengthening your leg muscles and improving your balance.

name: power clean
instructions:
1. Start with your feet shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outwards.
  2. Place your hands on the barbell, shoulder-width apart, with an overhand grip.
  3. Lower your hips and bend your knees, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. As you begin to stand up, pull the barbell up towards your chest, keeping it close to your body.
  5. As the barbell reaches chest height, quickly drop your hips and bend your knees, then explosively extend your hips and knees to propel the barbell upwards.
  6. As the barbell reaches its highest point, shrug your shoulders and pull your elbows up and out to the sides, catching the barbell on the front of your shoulders.
  7. Stand up straight, with the barbell resting on the front of your shoulders and your elbows pointing forward.
  8. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position by reversing the movement, bending your knees and lowering your hips as you lower the barbell back down to the ground.
  9. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.

name: power point plank
instructions:
1. Open Microsoft PowerPoint.
  2. Select a blank slide.
  3. Insert an image of a person performing a plank exercise.
  4. Add a title to the slide, such as "Power Point Plank".
  5. Insert a text box and write instructions for the exercise, such as:
    • Begin in a push-up position with your hands directly under your shoulders.
    • Engage your core and keep your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
    • Hold this position for as long as you can, aiming for at least 30 seconds.
    • Lower your body back down to the starting position and repeat for 3-5 sets.
  6. Add any additional tips or modifications to the text box.
  7. Format the slide with a background color or image if desired.
  8. Save and present the slide to demonstrate the exercise.

name: prisoner half sit-up (male)
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands behind your head, interlocking your fingers.
  3. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
  4. Slowly lift your head, shoulders, and upper back off the ground, keeping your elbows pointed outwards.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: prone twist on stability ball
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a stability ball on the ground and kneeling in front of it.
  2. Slowly roll forward until your hands are on the ground and your shins are resting on the top of the ball.
  3. Engage your core and lift your hips so that your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
  4. Keeping your arms straight, slowly rotate your torso to the right, reaching your right hand towards the ceiling.
  5. Hold for a few seconds, then return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat on the other side, rotating your torso to the left and reaching your left hand towards the ceiling.
  7. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to move slowly and deliberately to maintain balance on the stability ball.

name: pull up (neutral grip)
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar with a neutral grip handle. These are often found in gyms or can be purchased for home use.
  2. Stand facing the bar and place your hands on the handles with your palms facing each other.
  3. Engage your core and lift your feet off the ground, hanging from the bar with your arms fully extended.
  4. Initiate the pull-up by squeezing your shoulder blades together and pulling your elbows down towards your sides.
  5. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
  6. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: pull-in (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Slowly walk your feet forward, allowing the ball to roll down your back until your shoulders, neck, and head are resting on the ball.
  3. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  4. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, bringing your elbows towards your knees. Your shoulder blades should come off the ball.
  5. Hold for a second, then slowly lower your upper body back down onto the ball.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions, then rest and repeat for 2-3 sets.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe steadily.

name: pull-up
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar that is sturdy and can support your weight.
  2. Stand directly under the pull-up bar and reach up to grip the bar with both hands. Your palms should be facing away from you and your hands should be shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and core muscles to initiate the movement.
  5. Pull your body up towards the bar by bending your elbows and bringing your chin over the bar. Keep your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, with your chin above the bar.
  7. Lower your body back down to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  8. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  9. As you become stronger, you can increase the difficulty by adding weight or performing variations such as wide grip or chin-up pull-ups.
  10. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form to prevent injury.

name: push and pull bodyweight
instructions:
1. Start with a warm-up to get your muscles ready for the workout. This can include jogging in place, jumping jacks, or arm circles.
  2. Push-ups: Begin in a plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your body until your chest touches the ground, then push back up to the starting position. Repeat for 10-15 reps.
  3. Pull-ups: Find a sturdy bar or ledge that can support your weight. Grab onto the bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, then lower yourself back down. Repeat for 10-15 reps.
  4. Push-ups (variation): Place your hands close together in a diamond shape beneath your chest. Lower your body until your chest touches your hands, then push back up to the starting position. Repeat for 10-15 reps.
  5. Pull-ups (variation): Instead of gripping the bar with your palms facing away, grip it with your palms facing towards you. Pull your body up until your chest touches the bar, then lower yourself back down. Repeat for 10-15 reps.
  6. Repeat steps 2-5 for 3-4 sets, taking a 30-60 second break in between each set.
  7. Finish with a cool down, such as stretching your arms and shoulders.

name: push to run
instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Lower your body down towards the ground until your chest almost touches the ground.
  3. Push your body back up to the starting position.
  4. As you push up, quickly bring your left knee towards your chest.
  5. Return your left foot to the starting position and lower your body back down towards the ground.
  6. As you push up again, quickly bring your right knee towards your chest.
  7. Return your right foot to the starting position and lower your body back down towards the ground.
  8. Repeat steps 4-7 for the desired number of repetitions.

name: push up on bosu ball
instructions:
1. Start by placing the Bosu ball flat side down on the floor.
  2. Get into a plank position with your hands on the outer edges of the Bosu ball.
  3. Lower your body towards the Bosu ball by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
  4. Push yourself back up to the plank position by straightening your arms.
  5. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to engage your core and keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  7. Variations: To make the exercise easier, place your hands on the flat side of the Bosu ball. To make it more challenging, place your feet on the Bosu ball instead of your hands.

name: push-up
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight.
  3. Go down until your chest almost touches the ground.
  4. Push yourself back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: push-up (bosu ball)
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a Bosu ball on the ground with the flat side down.
  2. Position yourself in front of the Bosu ball with your hands on the outer edges of the ball and your body in a plank position.
  3. Lower your body towards the ball by bending your elbows and keeping your body straight.
  4. Push your body back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  7. Variations of the push-up on the Bosu ball can include placing your feet on the ball instead of your hands, or alternating lifting one hand or foot off the ball while performing the push-up.

name: push-up (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Start by kneeling on the floor with your hands on the stability ball.
  2. Walk your hands forward until your shins are on the ball and your hands are directly below your shoulders.
  3. Engage your core and glutes to maintain a straight line from your head to your heels.
  4. Lower your chest towards the ball by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
  5. Push back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain proper form.
  8. Variation: To increase the difficulty, try lifting one leg off the ball while performing the push-up.

name: push-up (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Begin by placing a stability ball on the floor and positioning yourself on your hands and knees in front of it.
  2. Place your hands on the ball, shoulder-width apart, and extend your legs behind you so that your body is in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  3. Engage your core and glutes to maintain stability as you lower your chest towards the ball, bending your elbows and keeping them close to your body.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push yourself back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and returning to the plank position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your body in a straight line and maintaining control throughout the movement.

name: push-up (wall)
instructions:
1. Stand facing a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place your hands on the wall, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your fingers pointing upwards.
  3. Lean forward and bend your elbows, lowering your chest towards the wall.
  4. Keep your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  5. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: push-up (wall) v. 2
instructions:
1. Stand facing a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Place your palms flat on the wall, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step back from the wall until your arms are fully extended and your body is at a diagonal angle to the wall.
  4. Keep your core engaged and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  5. Lower your body towards the wall by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
  6. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: push-up close-grip off dumbbell
instructions:
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands on two dumbbells placed close together, directly underneath your shoulders.
  2. Keep your feet hip-width apart and your core engaged.
  3. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body. Your chest should be almost touching the dumbbells.
  4. Push your body back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: push-up inside leg kick
instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet together.
  2. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows and keeping your back straight.
  3. As you push back up, lift your right leg off the ground and kick it towards your left side.
  4. Lower your leg back down and repeat the push-up, this time lifting your left leg and kicking it towards your right side.
  5. Continue alternating between push-ups and leg kicks for your desired number of repetitions.

name: push-up medicine ball
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands on a medicine ball and your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Lower your body towards the medicine ball by bending your elbows and keeping your body in a straight line.
  3. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  4. Roll the medicine ball to your other hand and repeat the exercise, alternating sides with each repetition.
  5. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

name: push-up on lower arms
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your forearms on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
  2. Ensure that your body is in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  3. Engage your core muscles and glutes to maintain stability.
  4. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
  5. Stop when your chest is just above the ground.
  6. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  7. Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: push-up plus
instructions:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet together.
  2. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows.
  3. Push your body back up to the starting position, but keep your arms straight.
  4. Once you are back in the high plank position, push your shoulder blades apart by protracting your shoulders.
  5. Hold this position for 1-2 seconds.
  6. Return your shoulder blades to the starting position by retracting your shoulders.
  7. Repeat steps 2-6 for the desired number of reps.

name: push-up to side plank
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Lower your body to the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.
  3. Push yourself back up to the starting position.
  4. Shift your weight to your left hand and rotate your body to the left, raising your right arm up towards the ceiling.
  5. Hold the side plank position for a few seconds, keeping your body in a straight line.
  6. Lower your right arm and rotate your body back to the plank position.
  7. Repeat the push-up and side plank on the other side by shifting your weight to your right hand and raising your left arm towards the ceiling.
  8. Continue alternating between push-ups and side planks for your desired number of reps or time.

name: quads
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
  2. Bend your knees and lower your body as if you were sitting in a chair.
  3. Keep your back straight and your chest lifted.
  4. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  5. Pause for a moment before pushing through your heels to stand back up.
  6. Repeat for a total of 10-15 reps.
  7. To make the exercise more challenging, hold a weight in each hand or do the exercise on a stability ball.

name: quarter sit-up
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  3. Slowly lift your head and shoulders off the ground, using your abdominal muscles to crunch forward.
  4. Pause for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your feet firmly on the ground and your lower back pressed into the floor.

name: quick feet v. 2
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms by your sides.
  2. Begin by rapidly tapping your feet on the ground, as if you were running in place.
  3. After a few seconds, start moving your feet forward and backward as quickly as possible.
  4. Next, move your feet side to side as quickly as possible.
  5. Finally, move your feet in a diagonal pattern, alternating between forward and backward and side to side movements.
  6. Repeat these movements for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
  7. Rest for 15-30 seconds and repeat for 3-4 sets.

name: raise single arm push-up
instructions:
1. Get into a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Lift one arm off the ground and extend it straight out in front of you.
  3. Slowly lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your core engaged and your arm extended.
  4. Push yourself back up to the starting position, using your chest, triceps, and core muscles.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm before switching to the other arm.
  6. Make sure to keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise, avoiding any twisting or bending.
  7. If this exercise is too challenging, try starting with regular push-ups or modified push-ups on your knees before working up to the single arm variation.

name: rear decline bridge
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands on the ground by your sides, palms facing down.
  3. Lift your hips off the ground, squeezing your glutes and engaging your core.
  4. Slowly lower your hips back down to the ground, keeping your core engaged throughout the movement.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: rear deltoid stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Bring your right arm across your chest, placing your left hand on your right elbow.
  3. Gently pull your right arm towards your left shoulder until you feel a stretch in your right shoulder.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds.
  5. Release the stretch and repeat on the other side.
  6. For a deeper stretch, you can use a resistance band or towel to pull your arm across your chest.
  7. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times on each side.

name: rear pull-up
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy horizontal bar that can support your weight. It should be high enough that you can hang from it without your feet touching the ground.
  2. Stand beneath the bar and jump up to grab it with both hands. Your palms should be facing away from your body and your hands should be slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended. Your feet should be off the ground and your body should be in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  4. Engage your back muscles and pull your shoulder blades down and back. This will help you initiate the pull-up.
  5. Bend your elbows and pull your chest towards the bar. Keep your elbows close to your body and your core engaged to prevent swinging.
  6. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
  7. Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position with control. Keep your core engaged and your shoulder blades pulled down and back.
  8. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name: reclining big toe pose with rope
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your legs extended straight out in front of you.
  2. Take a rope or strap and loop it around the ball of your right foot.
  3. Hold the ends of the rope in your hands and gently pull your foot towards your head, keeping your leg straight.
  4. As you exhale, allow your foot to relax and release any tension in your toes.
  5. Hold the stretch for 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply and relaxing your body.
  6. Release the rope and switch to the other foot, repeating the stretch on your left side.
  7. Repeat the exercise for 2-3 sets on each foot.

name: resistance band hip thrusts on knees (female)
instructions:
1. Begin by placing the resistance band around both thighs, just above the knees.
  2. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  3. Place your arms by your sides with your palms facing down.
  4. Engage your glutes and core muscles.
  5. Lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
  6. Lower your hips back down to the starting position, keeping your core and glutes engaged throughout the movement.
  7. Repeat for 10-12 reps, or as many as you can comfortably perform with good form.
  8. Rest for 30-60 seconds between sets, and aim to complete 2-3 sets total.

name: resistance band leg extension
instructions:
1. Secure one end of the resistance band to a sturdy object, such as a door or a bedpost.
  2. Place the other end of the band around your ankle.
  3. Stand facing away from the secured end of the band, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Hold onto a chair or a wall for balance if needed.
  5. Slowly lift your leg straight back, keeping your knee straight and your foot flexed.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your glutes and hamstrings.
  7. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other leg.

name: resistance band seated biceps curl
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
  2. Place the resistance band under your feet and hold the handles with your palms facing up.
  3. Keep your elbows close to your sides and slowly curl the handles up towards your shoulders, squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
  4. Pause for a second at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the handles back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and avoid swinging your arms or using momentum to complete the exercise.
  7. You can adjust the resistance of the band by either gripping closer or further away from the handles.
  8. For a more challenging variation, you can perform the exercise with one arm at a time.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting the exercise and to stretch afterwards to prevent injury and improve flexibility.

name: resistance band seated chest press
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a chair or bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place the resistance band behind your back and hold one end in each hand.
  3. Bring your hands up to shoulder height and bend your elbows so that your forearms are parallel to the ground.
  4. Push your hands forward until your arms are straight out in front of you, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly release back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions, or as many as you feel comfortable with.
  7. Remember to breathe deeply and engage your core muscles throughout the exercise.
  8. To increase the difficulty, you can use a heavier resistance band or increase the number of repetitions.
  9. Always consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise routine.

name: resistance band seated hip abduction
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Place the resistance band around your legs, just above your knees.
  3. Keeping your feet flat on the ground, slowly open your legs apart, pushing against the resistance of the band.
  4. Pause at the point where you feel the most resistance and hold for a few seconds.
  5. Slowly bring your legs back together, resisting the band as you go.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions.
  7. Take a break and repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: resistance band seated shoulder press
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a chair or bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place the resistance band under your feet and hold the handles with both hands at shoulder height.
  3. Make sure the band is taut but not overly stretched.
  4. Exhale and push the handles up towards the ceiling, straightening your arms fully.
  5. Inhale and slowly lower the handles back down to shoulder height.
  6. Repeat for 10-12 reps, or as many as you feel comfortable with.
  7. Take a short break and repeat for 2-3 sets.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the resistance of the band as needed to make the exercise more challenging or easier.
  10. Remember to breathe deeply and evenly throughout the exercise.

name: resistance band seated straight back row
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a flat surface with your legs extended in front of you.
  2. Secure one end of the resistance band under your feet and hold the other end with both hands.
  3. Keep your back straight and your arms extended in front of you, with your palms facing downward.
  4. Slowly pull the resistance band towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 repetitions, or as many as you can comfortably perform.
  7. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  8. Once you have completed the desired number of repetitions, release the resistance band from your feet and set it aside.
  9. Stretch your arms and back to cool down and prevent muscle soreness.

name: reverse crunch
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on a mat or a comfortable surface with your arms by your sides.
  2. Bend your knees and lift your feet off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
  3. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows pointing outwards.
  4. Engage your abdominal muscles and lift your hips off the ground, bringing your knees towards your head.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your hips and legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe deeply and evenly.

name: reverse dip
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy surface to perform the exercise on, such as parallel bars or the edge of a bench.
  2. Place your hands on the surface with your fingers facing forward and your palms flat.
  3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
  4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: reverse grip machine lat pulldown
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height and knee pad so that your feet are flat on the ground and your knees are comfortably resting under the pad.
  2. Select the appropriate weight on the weight stack and attach the V-bar to the pulley.
  3. Sit facing the machine with your knees under the pad and your feet flat on the ground.
  4. Grasp the V-bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up) and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  5. Lean back slightly and pull the bar down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause for a second at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the bar back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully release the bar and stand up from the machine.
  9. Return the V-bar to its place and adjust the weight stack as needed.

name: reverse grip pull-up
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar that is sturdy and can support your weight.
  2. Stand facing the bar and grab it with an underhand grip, with your palms facing towards your body and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades and begin to pull your body up towards the bar.
  5. Continue to pull until your chin is above the bar.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for your desired number of reps or until failure.
  8. Remember to engage your core and keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  9. For an added challenge, you can try to hold your chin above the bar for a few seconds before lowering down.

name: reverse hyper extension (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Begin by laying face down on a stability ball with your hips resting on the ball and your feet flat on the ground. Your hands should be placed on the ground in front of the ball for stability.
  2. Slowly lift your legs up behind you, keeping them straight and squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
  3. Lower your legs back down to starting position and repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  4. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight between your feet or add resistance bands.
  5. Remember to keep your core engaged and your movements slow and controlled.

name: reverse hyper on flat bench
instructions:
1. Position yourself face down on a flat bench with your hips at the edge of the bench and your legs hanging off the end.
  2. Hold onto the bench with your hands to maintain balance.
  3. Engage your glutes and lower back muscles to lift your legs up towards the ceiling.
  4. Hold the contraction at the top for a few seconds before slowly lowering your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. For added resistance, you can hold a weight between your feet or attach ankle weights.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and avoid arching your back during the exercise.
  8. Consult with a trainer or healthcare professional before attempting any new exercise.

name: reverse plank with leg lift
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you and your hands placed behind your hips, fingers pointing towards your feet.
  2. Press your hands and feet into the ground and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, coming into a reverse plank position.
  3. Make sure your shoulders are directly above your wrists and your hips are in line with your shoulders.
  4. Engage your core and lift one leg up towards the ceiling, keeping it straight and strong.
  5. Hold for a few seconds, then lower your leg back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat with the other leg.
  7. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  8. To release, lower your hips back down to the ground and come back to a seated position.

name: ring dips
instructions:
1. Find a set of parallel bars or rings that are stable and secure.
  2. Stand between the bars/rings and grasp them with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
  3. Jump up and straighten your arms, supporting your entire body weight with your hands on the bars/rings.
  4. Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  5. Lower your body until your shoulders are below your elbows.
  6. Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your elbows.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, carefully step down from the bars/rings and stretch your arms and shoulders.

name: rocking frog stretch
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you, feet flexed.
  2. Bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet together, allowing your knees to fall open to the sides.
  3. Bring your heels as close to your body as possible, keeping your feet together.
  4. Place your hands on your ankles or shins, whichever is most comfortable.
  5. Slowly rock your body back and forth, using your hands to support your weight as needed.
  6. As you rock forward, inhale deeply, and as you rock back, exhale slowly.
  7. Continue rocking back and forth for several breaths, feeling the stretch in your hips and inner thighs.
  8. When you're ready to release the stretch, slowly straighten your legs out in front of you.

name: rocky pull-up pulldown
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of a pull-up bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Reach up and grasp the bar with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Jump up and pull yourself up to the bar, so that your chin is above the bar.
  4. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  5. Next, step back and position yourself under a cable machine with a high pulley attachment.
  6. Attach a rope handle to the pulley, and grasp each end of the rope with an overhand grip.
  7. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended above your head.
  8. Pull the rope down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you do so.
  9. Slowly release the rope back to the starting position.
  10. Alternate between the pull-up and pulldown exercises for a complete workout.

name: roller back stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
  2. Place the exercise roller behind you and sit on top of it, with the roller positioned underneath your shoulder blades.
  3. Place your hands behind your head for support.
  4. Slowly roll the exercise roller up and down your back, focusing on the areas that feel tight or tense.
  5. Pause on any particularly tight spots and take deep breaths, allowing the roller to work out any knots or tension.
  6. Roll up and down your back for 1-2 minutes, or until you feel adequately stretched out.
  7. Carefully roll off the exercise roller and stand up slowly, taking care not to strain your back.

name: roller body saw
instructions:
1. Begin by placing the exercise roller on a flat surface, such as a yoga mat or carpeted floor.
  2. Get into a plank position, with your forearms on the roller and your toes on the ground.
  3. Engage your core and keep your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  4. Slowly roll the exercise roller forward, keeping your core engaged and your body in a straight line.
  5. Roll forward until your arms are fully extended and your body is hovering just above the ground.
  6. Pause for a moment, then use your core muscles to pull the exercise roller back towards your body.
  7. Repeat the exercise for a set number of repetitions or for a set amount of time.
  8. Remember to keep your movements slow and controlled, and to focus on engaging your core muscles throughout the exercise.
  9. Once you have completed your set, carefully remove the exercise roller from underneath your forearms and rest for a moment before moving on to your next exercise.

name: roller hip lat stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back on a mat or comfortable surface with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place an exercise roller perpendicular to your body, just below your hips.
  3. Lift your hips slightly and place your right hand on the roller to stabilize it.
  4. Extend your left leg and cross it over your right leg, placing your left foot on the ground.
  5. Slowly roll the roller towards your left hip, feeling a stretch in your hip and lat muscles.
  6. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing into the stretch.
  7. Roll the roller back towards your right hip, feeling a stretch in your right hip and lat muscles.
  8. Repeat the stretch on both sides for 2-3 sets, taking breaks as needed.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  10. Finish by slowly rolling off the roller and returning to a lying position on the mat.

name: roller hip stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place the exercise roller underneath your hips, perpendicular to your body.
  3. Slowly roll your hips over the exercise roller, moving back and forth to find any tight or sore spots.
  4. When you find a tight spot, hold the position for 10-15 seconds, allowing the roller to apply pressure and stretch the muscles.
  5. Continue rolling back and forth, moving the roller up and down your hips, for 1-2 minutes.
  6. Switch sides and repeat the exercise on the other hip.
  7. After completing both sides, remove the exercise roller and slowly sit up, taking a moment to stretch out any remaining tension in your hips.

name: roller reverse crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your legs straight and your arms extended overhead.
  2. Place the exercise roller between your ankles and grip it with your feet.
  3. Engage your core muscles and lift your hips off the ground, rolling the exercise roller towards your chest.
  4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: roller seated shoulder flexor depresor retractor
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise roller with your legs extended in front of you and your back straight.
  2. Place your hands on the roller with your palms facing down and your fingers pointing towards your feet.
  3. Inhale and raise your arms straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbows straight and your shoulders down and back.
  4. Exhale and lower your arms back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat this movement for 10-15 repetitions, focusing on keeping your shoulders down and back throughout the exercise.
  6. To increase the difficulty, you can hold a light weight in each hand or perform the exercise with your arms at a 45-degree angle to your body.
  7. Remember to breathe deeply throughout the exercise and to stop if you experience any pain or discomfort.

name: roller seated single leg shoulder flexor depresor retractor
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the exercise roller with your legs extended in front of you and your hands on the roller behind your hips for support.
  2. Lift one leg off the ground and extend it straight out in front of you, keeping your toes pointed towards the ceiling.
  3. Engage your shoulder muscles and bring your shoulder blades down and back, as if you are trying to tuck them into your back pockets.
  4. Keeping your leg lifted, slowly lower your torso towards the roller, using your shoulder muscles to control the movement.
  5. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then use your shoulder muscles to lift your torso back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat on the other side.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your spine straight throughout the exercise.

name: roller side lat stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
  2. Place the exercise roller on your right side, perpendicular to your body.
  3. Place your right hand on the roller and your left hand on the floor behind you for support.
  4. Slowly roll your right side over the roller until you feel a stretch in your left lat muscle.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply.
  6. Roll back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
  7. Repeat for 2-3 sets on each side.

name: rope climb
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy rope that can support your weight and is at least 15 feet long.
  2. Stand facing the rope with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Jump up and grab the rope with both hands, using a hand-over-hand grip.
  4. Begin pulling yourself up the rope by using your arms and legs to climb.
  5. As you climb, keep your body close to the rope to maintain balance.
  6. Continue climbing until you reach the top of the rope or until you have completed the desired number of reps.
  7. To descend, slowly lower yourself down the rope using your arms and legs.
  8. Once you reach the ground, release your grip on the rope and step away.

name: run
instructions:
1. Warm up by stretching your legs, arms and back for at least 5 minutes.
  2. Start running at a comfortable pace for 5-10 minutes.
  3. Pick up the pace and run at a moderate intensity for 10-20 minutes.
  4. If you feel comfortable, increase your speed to a sprint for 30 seconds to 1 minute, then return to a moderate pace for 2-3 minutes.
  5. Repeat step 4 for 5-10 intervals.
  6. Cool down by running at a comfortable pace for 5-10 minutes.
  7. Finish with stretching your legs, arms and back for at least 5 minutes.

name: run (equipment)
instructions:
1. Put on appropriate running shoes and clothing.
  2. Choose a safe and suitable location for running, such as a track, trail, or treadmill.
  3. If using a treadmill, adjust the speed and incline to your desired level.
  4. Begin by warming up with a light jog or dynamic stretching for 5-10 minutes.
  5. Start running at a comfortable pace, gradually increasing your speed if desired.
  6. Maintain good posture and form while running, keeping your shoulders relaxed and arms bent at a 90-degree angle.
  7. Breathe deeply and steadily, inhaling through your nose and exhaling through your mouth.
  8. Monitor your heart rate and adjust your speed as necessary to stay within your target heart rate zone.
  9. Continue running for 20-30 minutes or until you reach your desired distance or time goal.
  10. Cooldown by slowing down to a walk or light jog for 5-10 minutes, followed by static stretching.

name: runners stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands resting on your hips.
  2. Step your right foot forward, bending your right knee and keeping your left leg straight. Your right knee should be directly above your ankle.
  3. Slowly lower your left knee to the ground, keeping your toes pointed behind you.
  4. Keeping your hands on your hips, press your hips forward and hold for 15-30 seconds.
  5. Release the stretch and switch sides, stepping your left foot forward and repeating the stretch.

name: russian twist
instructions:
1. Begin seated on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Lean back slightly so that your torso is at a 45-degree angle to the floor.
  3. Clasp your hands together in front of your chest.
  4. Engage your core muscles and lift your feet off the ground, balancing on your sit bones.
  5. Rotate your torso to the right, bringing your clasped hands towards your right hip.
  6. Pause briefly, then rotate your torso to the left, bringing your clasped hands towards your left hip.
  7. Continue alternating back and forth for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to protect your lower back.
  9. Variations of this exercise can include holding a weight or medicine ball to increase resistance.
  10. Stretch your abs after completing the exercise to prevent soreness.

name: scapula dips
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy surface to perform the exercise on, such as parallel bars or the edge of a bench.
  2. Place your hands on the surface, shoulder-width apart, with your fingers pointing forward.
  3. Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your shoulders down and your chest up.
  4. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then push back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps or time.

name: scapula push-up
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your shoulders directly over your wrists.
  2. Protract your shoulder blades (push them away from your spine) as much as possible while keeping your arms straight.
  3. Lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your shoulder blades protracted.
  4. Once your chest is close to the ground, retract your shoulder blades (pull them towards your spine) as much as possible.
  5. Push your body back up to the starting position while keeping your shoulder blades retracted.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: scapular pull-up
instructions:
1. Begin by hanging from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from your body.
  2. Engage your shoulder blades by pulling them down and back, as if you were trying to squeeze a pencil between them.
  3. Without bending your elbows, pull your shoulder blades down and back even further, lifting your body a few inches higher.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: scissor jumps (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and jump up, bringing your left leg forward and your right leg back.
  3. As you jump, swing your arms forward and back to help with momentum.
  4. Land on the balls of your feet with your left foot in front and your right foot behind.
  5. Immediately jump again and switch legs, bringing your right foot forward and your left foot back.
  6. Continue jumping back and forth, alternating your legs each time, for the desired number of repetitions or time period.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your landing soft to prevent injury.
  8. Gradually increase the speed and intensity of the exercise as you become more comfortable with the movement.
  9. Finish by cooling down with some gentle stretching to prevent muscle soreness.

name: seated calf stretch (male)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Extend one leg out in front of you, keeping your heel on the ground.
  3. Place your hands on your thigh for support.
  4. Gently push your heel down towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your calf muscle.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds.
  6. Release and repeat on the other leg.
  7. For a deeper stretch, you can place a towel or resistance band around the ball of your foot and gently pull towards your body.
  8. Repeat the stretch on both legs for 2-3 sets.

name: seated glute stretch
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your right ankle on your left knee, so that your right knee is pointing out to the side.
  3. Using your hands, gently press down on your right knee to increase the stretch in your glutes.
  4. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing into the stretch.
  5. Release the stretch and switch sides, placing your left ankle on your right knee and repeating the stretch.
  6. Repeat the stretch on both sides 2-3 times, gradually increasing the intensity of the stretch as your muscles loosen up.
  7. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the stretch to avoid straining your lower back.

name: seated leg raise
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy chair or bench to sit on.
  2. Sit on the edge of the chair with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Place your hands on the sides of the chair for support.
  4. Slowly lift one leg straight out in front of you, keeping it parallel to the ground.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, then lower your leg back down.
  6. Repeat with the other leg.
  7. Complete 10-15 repetitions on each leg.
  8. For an added challenge, hold a small weight between your ankles or wear ankle weights.
  9. Remember to keep your back straight and engage your core muscles throughout the exercise.
  10. Stretch your legs and hips after completing the exercise.

name: seated lower back stretch
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a chair with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Place your hands on your lower back, with your fingers pointing down and your thumbs pointing towards your spine.
  3. Slowly lean back, using your hands to support your lower back. Keep your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, breathing deeply.
  5. Slowly return to the starting position, using your hands to support your lower back.
  6. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times, as needed.

name: seated piriformis stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a chair or bench with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Place your right ankle on top of your left knee, so that your right knee is pointing out to the side.
  3. Use your right hand to gently push down on your right knee, while using your left hand to push up on your right ankle.
  4. You should feel a stretch in your right hip and glute area.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release and switch sides.
  6. Repeat the stretch on each side 2-3 times.

name: seated side crunch (wall)
instructions:
1. Find a wall and sit down next to it.
  2. Place your feet flat on the ground and your back against the wall.
  3. Extend your arms straight out in front of you and interlock your fingers.
  4. Engage your core and slowly twist your torso to the right, bringing your hands towards your right hip.
  5. Hold for a few seconds and then slowly return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat on the left side, twisting your torso to the left and bringing your hands towards your left hip.
  7. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: seated wide angle pose sequence
instructions:
1. Begin seated on the floor with your legs extended out in front of you.
  2. Spread your legs apart as wide as you comfortably can.
  3. Flex your feet and press your heels into the ground.
  4. Place your hands on the ground in front of you and slowly walk them forward, keeping your spine straight.
  5. Stop when you feel a stretch in your inner thighs and hold for 5-10 breaths.
  6. On an inhale, lift your torso back up and bring your legs together.
  7. Repeat the sequence 2-3 times, gradually increasing the depth of your stretch.

name: self assisted inverse leg curl
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your stomach on a mat or floor with your legs extended straight behind you.
  2. Place your hands under your hips, palms facing down, to help support your lower back.
  3. Slowly lift your feet off the ground, bending your knees and bringing your heels towards your glutes.
  4. Use your hands to assist in the movement, pushing down on your hips to lift your legs higher.
  5. Once your knees are bent as far as possible, hold the position for a few seconds.
  6. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position, using your hands to control the movement.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions, focusing on using your hamstrings to lift your legs rather than momentum from your hands.

name: self assisted inverse leg curl
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your stomach on a flat surface, such as a yoga mat or exercise mat.
  2. Place your hands palm down on the mat, just below your shoulders, and keep your elbows close to your body.
  3. Slowly lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight and together.
  4. Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. To make the exercise more challenging, try holding a weight between your feet or ankles.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and engage your core muscles throughout the exercise.
  9. Stretch your legs and lower back after completing the exercise.

name: self assisted inverse leg curl (on floor)
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your stomach on the floor with your legs straight out behind you.
  2. Place your hands, palms down, underneath your hips for support.
  3. Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks, keeping your thighs on the floor.
  4. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position, keeping your thighs on the floor throughout the movement.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight between your feet or ankles.

name: semi squat jump (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward.
  2. Bend your knees and lower your body into a semi-squat position, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  3. Push off the ground with both feet and jump as high as you can.
  4. As you jump, swing your arms up and above your head to help propel you upwards.
  5. Land softly on the balls of your feet, lowering your body back into the semi-squat position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions or time.

name: short stride run
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Take a short step forward with your right foot, landing on the ball of your foot.
  3. Quickly bring your left foot forward to meet your right foot, landing on the ball of your foot.
  4. Repeat this short stride run motion, alternating your feet and keeping your steps short and quick.
  5. Keep your knees slightly bent and your core engaged to maintain balance and stability.
  6. Continue the short stride run for 30 seconds to 1 minute, gradually increasing the duration as your fitness level improves.
  7. Take a break and repeat the exercise for 2-3 sets.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

name: shoulder grip pull-up
instructions:
1. Begin by standing underneath a pull-up bar and grasping it with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  3. Engage your shoulder blades by pulling them down and back.
  4. Initiate the pull by pulling your elbows down and back, driving your shoulders towards the bar.
  5. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
  6. Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: shoulder tap
instructions:
1. Begin in a high plank position with your shoulders directly over your wrists and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  2. Engage your core and glutes to keep your body stable.
  3. Lift your right hand off the ground and tap your left shoulder.
  4. Return your right hand to the ground and repeat on the other side, tapping your right shoulder with your left hand.
  5. Continue alternating shoulder taps for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  6. Make sure to keep your hips level and avoid twisting or rotating your body as you tap your shoulders.
  7. You can modify this exercise by dropping to your knees or elevating your hands on a bench or step if needed.

name: shoulder tap push-up
instructions:
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart, wrists stacked directly under your shoulders, and feet hip-width apart.
  2. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your core engaged and your body in a straight line.
  3. Push your body back up to the starting position.
  4. Once in the starting position, lift your right hand off the ground and tap your left shoulder.
  5. Return your right hand to the ground and perform another push-up.
  6. Lift your left hand off the ground and tap your right shoulder.
  7. Return your left hand to the ground and perform another push-up.
  8. Repeat this pattern for the desired number of reps or time.

name: side bridge hip abduction
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your side with your legs straight and your bottom arm extended out in front of you for support.
  2. Place your top hand on your hip and lift your top leg off of the bottom leg, keeping it straight.
  3. Slowly raise your leg as high as you can without rotating your hips or leaning forward or backward.
  4. Hold for a few seconds, then lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for several repetitions, then switch to the other side and repeat the exercise.
  6. For an added challenge, you can place a resistance band around your ankles or add ankle weights.

name: side bridge v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your side with your legs straight and your feet stacked on top of each other.
  2. Place your elbow directly under your shoulder and lift your hips off the ground, creating a straight line from your head to your feet.
  3. Engage your core and hold this position for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
  4. Lower your hips back down to the ground and repeat on the other side.
  5. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each side.

name: side hip (on parallel bars)
instructions:
1. Place your hands on the parallel bars and lift yourself up, keeping your arms straight.
  2. Shift your weight to your left side, lifting your right leg off the ground and bringing it out to the side.
  3. Lower your right leg back down and repeat on the other side, shifting your weight to your right side and lifting your left leg out to the side.
  4. Repeat this exercise for 10-15 repetitions on each side.
  5. For an added challenge, try lifting your leg higher or holding it up for a few seconds before lowering it back down.
  6. Remember to engage your core muscles and keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise.
  7. Finish the exercise by lowering yourself back down from the parallel bars.

name: side hip abduction
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your side with your legs straight and stacked on top of each other.
  2. Engage your core and lift your top leg up towards the ceiling, keeping it straight.
  3. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the other side.
  5. For added resistance, you can place a resistance band around your ankles or use ankle weights.
  6. Make sure to keep your hips stacked and your body in a straight line throughout the movement.
  7. Aim for 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions on each side.

name: side lying floor stretch
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your side on the floor with your legs extended and your bottom arm supporting your head.
  2. Bend your top knee and place your foot on the ground in front of your bottom leg.
  3. Reach your top arm over your head, grasping your wrist with your opposite hand.
  4. Slowly lift your top leg off the ground, keeping it bent, and use your bottom arm to gently pull your top leg towards the floor behind you.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling a gentle stretch along the side of your body and the outside of your hip.
  6. Release the stretch and repeat on the other side.

name: side lying hip adduction (male)
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your side with your legs straight and your bottom arm extended out straight in front of you for support.
  2. Place your top hand on your hip to stabilize it.
  3. Slowly lift your top leg up towards the ceiling, keeping it straight and your toes pointed forward.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your inner thigh muscles.
  5. Lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Switch sides and repeat the exercise on the other leg.

name: side plank hip adduction
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your side with your legs extended and stacked on top of each other.
  2. Place your bottom arm on the ground and lift your body up onto your forearm, making sure your elbow is directly under your shoulder.
  3. Engage your core and lift your top leg a few inches off the bottom leg.
  4. Keeping your top leg straight, bring it forward and across your body, towards your bottom leg.
  5. Pause for a moment, then return your top leg to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 reps on one side, then switch to the other side and repeat.
  7. For an added challenge, you can place a resistance band around your thighs or hold a dumbbell in your top hand.

name: side push neck stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms relaxed at your sides.
  2. Place your right hand on your right hip.
  3. Slowly tilt your head to the left, bringing your left ear towards your left shoulder.
  4. Place your left hand on the top of your head and apply gentle pressure to increase the stretch.
  5. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing your shoulders.
  6. Slowly bring your head back to center and repeat on the other side.
  7. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times on each side.
  8. Do not force your head to tilt too far or too quickly, as this can cause injury.
  9. If you experience any pain or discomfort during the stretch, stop immediately and consult a healthcare professional.

name: side push-up
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Shift your weight to your left hand and rotate your body to the right, lifting your right arm up towards the ceiling.
  3. Lower your right arm back down and return to the plank position.
  4. Repeat on the other side, shifting your weight to your right hand and rotating your body to the left, lifting your left arm up towards the ceiling.
  5. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or time.

name: side wrist pull stretch
instructions:
1. Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Extend your right arm straight out in front of you with your palm facing down.
  3. With your left hand, grab your right hand's fingers and gently pull them back towards your wrist.
  4. Hold this stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in your wrist and forearm.
  5. Release your right hand and repeat the same stretch with your left arm.
  6. Do 2-3 sets of this stretch on each arm, taking a short break in between each set.

name: side-to-side chin
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Place your hands behind your head, with your fingers interlaced and your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  3. Slowly bend your knees and lower your body into a squat, keeping your back straight and your chest lifted.
  4. As you rise up out of the squat, lift your right knee up and across your body, bringing it towards your left elbow.
  5. At the same time, twist your torso to the right, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee.
  6. Lower your right foot back down to the ground as you lower your body back into the squat position.
  7. Repeat the movement on the other side, lifting your left knee up and across your body towards your right elbow, while twisting your torso to the left.
  8. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or time.

name: side-to-side toe touch (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Take a step to the right with your right foot and bend your right knee slightly.
  3. Reach down with your left hand and touch your right foot.
  4. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side.
  5. Take a step to the left with your left foot and bend your left knee slightly.
  6. Reach down with your right hand and touch your left foot.
  7. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side.
  8. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  9. Keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  10. Breathe deeply and exhale as you reach down to touch your foot.

name: single arm push-up
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Shift your weight to one side and place the hand of the opposite arm behind your back.
