  3. Lower your body to the ground by bending your elbow, keeping your body in a straight line.
  4. Push back up to the starting position, keeping your core engaged and your body in a straight line.
  5. Repeat on the other side by shifting your weight and placing the opposite hand behind your back.
  6. Alternate between sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: single leg bridge with outstretched leg
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Extend one leg straight up towards the ceiling, keeping the other foot planted on the ground.
  3. Engage your glutes and lift your hips off the ground, pressing through the heel of your planted foot.
  4. Hold for a few seconds at the top of the movement, then lower your hips back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for several repetitions on one side before switching to the other leg.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your hips level throughout the exercise.
  7. For an added challenge, you can add a resistance band around your thighs or hold a weight on your hips.

name: single leg calf raise (on a dumbbell)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your right hand.
  2. Lift your left foot off the ground and balance on your right foot.
  3. Slowly rise up onto the ball of your right foot, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  4. Hold the top position for a second, then slowly lower your heel back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for 10-15 reps on your right foot, then switch to your left foot and perform the same number of reps.
  6. For an added challenge, increase the weight of the dumbbell or perform the exercise on a raised surface such as a step.

name: single leg platform slide
instructions:
1. Start by standing on a platform or a slide board with your feet hip-width apart. Place your arms at your sides or on your hips for balance.
  2. Lift your left foot off the platform and extend it out in front of you, keeping your toes pointed forward.
  3. Slowly slide your left foot back towards the platform, keeping your leg straight and your foot flexed.
  4. Return your left foot to the starting position and repeat the exercise for several repetitions.
  5. Switch to your right leg and repeat the exercise for the same number of repetitions.
  6. For an added challenge, try sliding your foot out to the side instead of straight in front of you.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your movements slow and controlled.

name: single leg squat (pistol) male
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Shift your weight to your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground.
  3. Extend your right leg forward and keep it parallel to the ground.
  4. Slowly lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your right leg extended.
  5. Lower your body as far as you can while keeping your right leg off the ground.
  6. Pause for a moment, then push through your left foot to stand back up.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with your left leg.
  8. Make sure to keep your chest up and your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
  9. If you have trouble balancing, you can hold onto a wall or chair for support.
  10. As you get stronger, you can increase the difficulty by holding weights or adding a jump at the top of the movement.

name: sissy squat
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing straight ahead.
  2. Place your hands on your hips or in front of your chest for balance.
  3. Slowly lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
  4. Continue lowering your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  5. Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat.
  7. Slowly raise your body back up to the starting position by straightening your legs and pushing through your heels.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: sit-up v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a mat or a comfortable surface.
  2. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the ground, about hip-width apart.
  3. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows pointing outwards.
  4. Engage your core muscles and slowly lift your upper body off the ground, towards your knees.
  5. Exhale as you lift yourself up, and inhale as you lower yourself back down.
  6. Make sure to keep your neck relaxed and avoid pulling on your head with your hands.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: sit-up with arms on chest
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your back on a mat or comfortable surface with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Cross your arms over your chest, with your hands resting on your opposite shoulders.
  3. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
  4. Slowly lift your head, neck, and shoulders off the ground, while keeping your lower back pressed into the mat.
  5. Exhale as you lift your upper body, and inhale as you lower it back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for a desired number of repetitions, aiming for at least 10-15 reps.
  7. Remember to keep your chin away from your chest and avoid pulling on your neck with your hands.
  8. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight or medicine ball against your chest as you perform the sit-up.
  9. Finish by stretching your abdominal muscles and any other muscles that feel tight or sore.

name: skater hops
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Shift your weight to your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground.
  3. Hop to the right, landing on your right foot and swinging your left foot behind your right leg.
  4. Immediately hop to the left, landing on your left foot and swinging your right foot behind your left leg.
  5. Continue hopping from side to side, keeping your core engaged and your movements controlled.
  6. Perform the exercise for 30 seconds to 1 minute, rest for 30 seconds, and repeat for 3 sets.

name: ski ergometer
instructions:
1. Step 1: Adjust the resistance level of the ski ergometer to your desired level. This can be done by turning the resistance knob located on the side of the machine.
  2. Step 2: Stand in front of the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing forward. Grasp the handles with both hands, keeping your elbows bent and close to your sides.
  3. Step 3: Begin the exercise by extending your arms forward and leaning forward slightly. Simultaneously, push your legs down and back as if you were skiing downhill.
  4. Step 4: As you push your legs down, pull the handles towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides. This motion should mimic the motion of skiing with poles.
  5. Step 5: Continue this motion, alternating between pushing your legs down and pulling the handles towards your chest. Try to maintain a steady pace and rhythm throughout the exercise.
  6. Step 6: Aim to complete a set number of repetitions or a set amount of time on the ski ergometer. You can gradually increase the resistance level as you become more comfortable with the exercise.
  7. Step 7: After completing the exercise, cool down by slowing your pace and gradually coming to a stop. Stretch your legs, arms, and back to prevent any muscle soreness or injury.

name: ski step
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet together and your arms down by your sides.
  2. Step your right foot out to the side, keeping your left foot in place.
  3. Bend your right knee and shift your weight onto your right foot.
  4. Lift your left foot off the ground and swing it behind your right leg.
  5. As you swing your left foot behind your right leg, raise your arms up to shoulder height.
  6. Lower your arms back down to your sides as you step your left foot back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise by stepping your left foot out to the side and swinging your right foot behind your left leg.
  8. Continue alternating between your right and left legs for a set number of repetitions or a set amount of time.

name: skin the cat
instructions:
1. Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  2. Engage your core and lift your legs so that they are parallel to the ground.
  3. Slowly bring your knees towards your chest, and then continue to lift your legs up and over the bar.
  4. As you come over the bar, keep your legs straight and extend them out in front of you.
  5. Lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your legs extended and your core engaged.
  6. Once your body is parallel to the ground, begin to lift your legs back up towards the bar.
  7. As your legs come back over the bar, bend your knees and bring them towards your chest.
  8. Lower your body back down to the starting position with your legs parallel to the ground.
  9. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: sled 45 degrees one leg press
instructions:
1. Load weight onto the sled according to your fitness level.
  2. Lie on your back with one leg on the sled and the other leg extended straight out on the ground.
  3. Place your hands on the handles of the sled and engage your core.
  4. Press the sled up and away from your body at a 45-degree angle using only the leg on the sled.
  5. Lower the sled back down to starting position with control.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps on one leg before switching to the other leg.

name: sled 45Ð²Â° calf press
instructions:
1. Step 1: Adjust the weight on the sled to the desired resistance level.
  2. Step 2: Stand on the sled facing the calf press pad, with your toes on the lower edge of the pad and your heels hanging off the back.
  3. Step 3: Hold onto the handles on the side of the sled for balance and support.
  4. Step 4: Slowly lower your heels towards the ground, keeping your toes on the pad.
  5. Step 5: Push your heels back up towards the sky, lifting the sled with your calves.
  6. Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Step 7: To increase the intensity, pause at the bottom of the movement for a few seconds before pushing back up.
  8. Step 8: To decrease the intensity, lighten the weight on the sled.
  9. Step 9: Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and keep your core engaged for stability.

name: sled 45Ð²Â° leg press
instructions:
1. Step 1: Adjust the seat to a comfortable position.
  2. Step 2: Load the desired weight onto the sled.
  3. Step 3: Sit on the seat and place your feet on the sled, with your toes pointing slightly outward.
  4. Step 4: Grasp the handles on either side of the seat for support.
  5. Step 5: Push the sled away from you by extending your legs. Keep your back flat against the seat and your knees in line with your toes.
  6. Step 6: Slowly lower the sled back down by bending your knees and bringing the sled towards you.
  7. Step 7: Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: sled 45Ð²Â° leg press (back pov)
instructions:
1. Start by lying on the exercise sled with your back against the backrest and your feet on the footplate.
  2. Position your feet shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outward.
  3. Grasp the handles on either side of the seat to stabilize yourself.
  4. Bend your knees and slowly lower the footplate until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  5. Pause for a moment, then push the footplate away from you, extending your legs until they are almost straight.
  6. Slowly lower the footplate back down to the starting position, keeping your knees bent and your feet flat on the footplate.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower the footplate and exhaling as you push it away from you.
  9. Adjust the weight on the sled as needed to ensure that you are able to perform the exercise with proper form and without undue strain.

name: sled 45Ð²Â° leg press (side pov)
instructions:
1. Start by placing the exercise sled at a 45-degree angle.
  2. Sit on the sled with your back against the pad and your feet on the platform, shoulder-width apart.
  3. Push the platform away from you with your feet until your legs are fully extended, but do not lock your knees.
  4. Bend your knees and slowly lower the platform towards your body, keeping your back against the pad at all times.
  5. Pause for a second at the bottom of the movement, then push the platform away from you with your feet to return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lower the platform and exhaling as you push it away from you.
  8. Adjust the weight on the sled as necessary to ensure proper form and a challenging workout.
  9. Always warm up before starting any exercise routine and consult with a trainer or healthcare professional if you have any concerns or injuries.

name: sled 45Ð²Â° leg wide press
instructions:
1. Load the desired weight onto the exercise sled.
  2. Position yourself in front of the sled, facing away from it.
  3. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly turned out.
  4. Step onto the sled and position your feet on the foot pads, with your toes pointing outward at a 45-degree angle.
  5. Grasp the handles on either side of the sled for support.
  6. Bend your knees and lower your body down into a squatting position, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  7. Press through your heels and push the sled away from you, extending your legs fully.
  8. Hold the position for a moment, then slowly lower the sled back towards you by bending your knees.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  10. When finished, step off the sled and unload the weight.

name: sled calf press on leg press
instructions:
1. Adjust the leg press machine to your desired weight and seat position.
  2. Place the exercise sled on the leg press machine.
  3. Position yourself on the machine with your feet flat on the sled.
  4. Ensure that your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle and your hips are pressed firmly against the seat.
  5. Place your hands on the handles provided for support.
  6. Slowly press the sled away from you using your calves, keeping your heels on the sled.
  7. Hold for a second and then slowly release the sled back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for desired reps and sets.

name: sled closer hack squat
instructions:
1. Begin by loading weight onto the sled and adjusting the footplate to the appropriate height for your body.
  2. Stand facing the sled with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointed slightly outward.
  3. Step onto the sled and position yourself so that your shoulders are directly above your knees.
  4. Grasp the handles on either side of the sled and brace your core.
  5. Lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees tracking over your toes.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, then push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully step off the sled and unload any weight plates.
  9. Stretch your legs and hips to cool down.

name: sled forward angled calf raise
instructions:
1. Begin by standing on the exercise sled with your toes on the edge and your heels hanging off.
  2. Hold onto the handles of the sled for balance.
  3. Slowly raise your heels up as high as you can, keeping your toes on the edge of the sled.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your calves.
  5. Lower your heels back down to the starting position, keeping your movements slow and controlled.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. For an added challenge, you can increase the weight on the sled or perform the exercise with one leg at a time.

name: sled hack squat
instructions:
1. Place the exercise sled on a flat surface and load it with weight plates according to your strength level.
  2. Stand facing the sled and position your feet shoulder-width apart on the sled's footplate.
  3. Grasp the sled's handles with both hands and keep your arms straight.
  4. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips while keeping your back straight.
  5. Continue lowering your body until your thighs are parallel to the footplate or until your knees form a 90-degree angle.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat and then push through your heels to extend your legs and return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: sled lying calf press
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on the exercise sled with your feet flat against the platform.
  2. Place your hands on the handles of the sled and push the platform away from you with your feet, extending your legs fully.
  3. Bend your knees slightly and lower the platform towards your body, keeping your feet flat on the platform.
  4. Press the platform away from your body again, extending your legs fully and contracting your calf muscles.
  5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the sled throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight on the sled as necessary to challenge your calf muscles while maintaining proper form.
  8. Finish the exercise by slowly lowering the platform back down to the starting position.

name: sled lying squat
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on a flat bench or the ground with your feet on the sled.
  2. Position your feet shoulder-width apart and keep your toes pointed straight ahead.
  3. Grasp the handles on the sides of the sled with your hands for stability.
  4. Push the sled away from you by extending your legs, keeping your heels on the sled.
  5. Slowly lower the sled towards you by bending your knees, keeping your feet flat on the sled.
  6. Lower the sled until your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle, then pause for a moment.
  7. Push the sled away from you again by extending your legs, returning to the starting position.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back flat on the bench or ground throughout the exercise.
  10. Adjust the weight on the sled as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.

name: sled one leg calf press on leg press
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the leg press machine with your back against the backrest and your feet on the sled.
  2. Place one foot on the sled, keeping your toes pointed straight ahead.
  3. Slowly press the sled forward with your foot until your leg is fully extended.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly release the sled back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch legs.
  6. Make sure to keep your back against the backrest and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight on the machine as necessary to increase or decrease the intensity of the exercise.

name: sledge hammer
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold the sledgehammer with both hands, placing one hand near the end of the handle and the other hand closer to the head of the hammer.
  3. Swing the hammer over your head, keeping your arms straight and your core engaged.
  4. As you swing the hammer down, twist your torso and drive the hammer into the ground or tire in front of you.
  5. Repeat the motion, alternating sides with each swing.
  6. Start with a lighter weight sledgehammer and gradually increase the weight as you become more comfortable with the exercise.
  7. Perform 3 sets of 10-15 swings on each side, taking breaks as needed.
  8. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: smith back shrug
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of a Smith machine with the bar set at waist height.
  2. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Keeping your arms straight, lift the bar by shrugging your shoulders up towards your ears.
  4. Hold the contraction for a few seconds before slowly lowering the bar back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight on the machine as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  8. Remember to breathe steadily throughout the exercise.
  9. Finish the set and carefully rack the bar back onto the machine.
  10. Stretch your shoulders and upper back after completing the exercise.

name: smith behind neck press
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back straight.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bring the barbell up to your shoulders, with your elbows pointing forward.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your elbows pointed forward and your back straight.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then slowly raise the barbell back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Be sure to use a weight that is appropriate for your strength level, and start with a lighter weight if you are new to this exercise.
  8. Keep your movements slow and controlled, and avoid jerking or swinging the weight.
  9. If you experience any pain or discomfort during the exercise, stop immediately and consult a trainer or healthcare professional.

name: smith bench press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your back on the bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  2. Position yourself so that the bar is directly above your chest.
  3. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Unrack the bar and lower it towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  5. Pause for a moment when the bar touches your chest, then push it back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the supports.

name: smith bent knee good morning
instructions:
1. Start by setting up a barbell on a squat rack at a height that is just below shoulder level. Load the bar with an appropriate weight.
  2. Stand facing the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step forward and position yourself under the bar. The bar should rest on your upper traps and not your neck.
  4. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Take a step back and position your feet shoulder-width apart with your toes pointed slightly outward.
  6. Brace your core and keep your back straight as you hinge forward at the hips, lowering your upper body towards the ground.
  7. Lower your body until your torso is parallel to the ground and your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle.
  8. Hold the position for a moment before using your glutes and hamstrings to raise your body back up to a standing position.
  9. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  10. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the bar back on the rack.

name: smith bent over row
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your abs tight, until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
  3. Engage your back muscles to pull the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith chair squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing in front of the Smith machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Adjust the bar on the Smith machine to a height that is just below your shoulder level.
  3. Step under the bar and place it across your upper back, making sure it is resting comfortably and securely.
  4. Take a deep breath and brace your core muscles.
  5. Bend your knees and lower your hips down and back, as if you are sitting in a chair.
  6. Keep your chest up and your back straight throughout the movement.
  7. Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  8. Pause for a moment, then push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  9. Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: smith close-grip bench press
instructions:
1. Set up a flat bench in a power rack or smith machine.
  2. Select the appropriate weight and load the bar onto the machine.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground and your head positioned directly under the bar.
  4. Grip the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing towards your feet.
  5. Lift the bar off the rack and hold it above your chest with your arms extended.
  6. Lower the bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  7. Pause briefly when the bar touches your chest.
  8. Push the bar back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  10. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the machine.

name: smith deadlift
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointed slightly outward.
  2. Position yourself in front of the bar with your shins touching the bar.
  3. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart, and keep your arms straight.
  4. Engage your core and lift the bar off the ground by extending your hips and knees.
  5. As you lift the bar, keep your back straight and your shoulders back.
  6. Once the bar is at hip level, pause for a moment and squeeze your glutes.
  7. Lower the bar back down to the ground by bending your hips and knees, keeping your back straight.
  8. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: smith decline bench press
instructions:
1. Adjust the Smith machine to a decline bench press position by lowering the bar to the appropriate height and adjusting the angle of the bench to your desired decline.
  2. Lie down on the bench with your feet securely positioned under the foot pads.
  3. Grasp the bar with a shoulder-width grip and lift it off the rack. Keep your arms straight and your elbows locked.
  4. Lower the bar slowly and under control until it touches your lower chest, just below your nipples.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push the bar back up to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the Smith machine.

name: smith decline reverse-grip press
instructions:
1. Begin by lying down on a decline bench with your feet securely locked in place at the foot pad.
  2. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Slowly lower the bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows tight to your sides.
  4. Pause for a moment, then press the bar back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Be sure to keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench throughout the exercise.
  7. Remember to exhale as you press the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully rack the bar and release your feet from the foot pad.
  9. Stretch out your chest and arms to cool down.

name: smith front squat (clean grip)
instructions:
1. Start by positioning yourself under a barbell on a squat rack with the barbell at shoulder height. Your feet should be shoulder-width apart and your toes should be slightly turned out.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a clean grip, with your palms facing up and your fingers wrapped around the bar. Your hands should be slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell off the rack and step back, taking a few steps away from the rack.
  4. Keeping your torso upright and your core engaged, lower your body by bending your knees and hips. Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, then push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the barbell back onto the squat rack.

name: smith full squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Grasp the barbell with both hands, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell off the rack and take a step back, positioning your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and lower your hips down and back, bending your knees to lower yourself into a squatting position.
  5. Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the ground, keeping your chest lifted and your back straight.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat before pushing through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith hack squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing in front of the Smith machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  2. Step forward and position yourself under the barbell, making sure it rests comfortably on your shoulders. Your hands should be positioned on the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you slowly lower your body down by bending your knees. Make sure your knees do not extend past your toes.
  4. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or until you reach your desired depth. Keep your weight on your heels and maintain a straight back throughout the movement.
  5. Push through your heels and extend your legs to return to the starting position. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions and sets.

name: smith hip raise
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back on a flat bench with your feet planted firmly on the ground and your knees bent.
  2. Place a barbell across your hips and hold it securely with both hands.
  3. Engage your glutes and lift your hips off the bench until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
  4. Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your glutes and keeping your core engaged.
  5. Slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position, keeping the barbell steady and your feet firmly planted on the ground.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the movement and to avoid arching your back or using momentum to lift the weight.

name: smith incline bench press
instructions:
1. Adjust the bench to a 30-45 degree incline.
  2. Load the desired weight onto the barbell and secure the collars.
  3. Lie back on the bench and position yourself so that the barbell is directly above your chest.
  4. Grip the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Unrack the barbell and slowly lower it towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
  6. Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest.
  7. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, exhaling as you do so.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. Rack the barbell and sit up on the bench.

name: smith incline reverse-grip press
instructions:
1. Adjust the bench to a 45-degree angle.
  2. Select the appropriate weight and load the barbell onto the smith machine.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
  4. Grasp the bar with a reverse grip (palms facing towards you) with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Unrack the bar and lower it towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push the bar back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the smith machine and sit up.

name: smith incline shoulder raises
instructions:
1. Start by setting up the Smith machine to an incline position between 30-45 degrees.
  2. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back straight.
  3. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Slowly raise the bar up towards the ceiling, keeping your arms straight but not locked.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and hold for a few seconds.
  6. Lower the bar back down to starting position, keeping control of the weight as you do so.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to breathe in as you lower the weight and breathe out as you lift it.
  9. Adjust the weight as needed to ensure proper form and avoid injury.
  10. Stretch your shoulders and upper back after completing the exercise.

name: smith leg press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat and footplate to your desired position.
  2. Load the weight onto the machine, making sure it is evenly distributed on both sides.
  3. Position yourself on the seat with your back against the pad and your feet flat on the footplate.
  4. Grasp the handles on either side of the seat to stabilize yourself.
  5. Push the footplate away from you using your legs until they are fully extended.
  6. Slowly lower the footplate back towards your body, keeping your legs engaged and your back against the pad.
  7. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully unload the weight from the machine.

name: smith low bar squat
instructions:
1. Set up the barbell in a squat rack at a height that allows you to unrack it comfortably.
  2. Position yourself under the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
  3. Grab the bar with a grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, and make sure your hands are evenly spaced on the bar.
  4. Unrack the bar and step back from the rack, taking a few steps back to create enough space for the squat.
  5. Take a deep breath and brace your core, then begin to lower your body by bending your hips and knees.
  6. Keep your chest up and your back straight, and make sure your knees are tracking over your toes.
  7. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or until you reach a comfortable depth.
  8. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, then exhale and drive through your heels to stand back up.
  9. Lock out your hips and knees at the top of the squat, then take a deep breath and repeat for the desired number of reps.
  10. When you're finished with your set, walk forward to rerack the barbell in the squat rack.

name: smith machine bicep curl
instructions:
1. Adjust the height of the bar on the smith machine so that it is at the level of your waist.
  2. Load the desired amount of weight onto the bar.
  3. Stand facing the machine and grasp the bar with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Position your feet shoulder-width apart and keep your knees slightly bent.
  5. Keep your elbows close to your sides and slowly curl the bar up towards your chest, contracting your biceps.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and then slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the machine.

name: smith machine decline close grip bench press
instructions:
1. Position the bench in the decline position in the smith machine.
  2. Adjust the bar to a height that is comfortable for you to lift off and place the appropriate weight plates on the bar.
  3. Lie down on the bench and place your feet under the footpads provided on the bench.
  4. Grip the bar with your palms facing each other at a distance that is less than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Lift the bar off the rack and lower it towards your chest while keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Pause for a second when the bar touches your chest and then push it back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When you have completed your set, carefully rack the bar back onto the smith machine.
  9. Sit up and remove your feet from the footpads.
  10. Stretch your chest and triceps muscles after completing the exercise.

name: smith machine incline tricep extension
instructions:
1. Adjust the height of the Smith machine bar to a height where you can comfortably reach it while seated on the incline bench.
  2. Attach a straight bar or an EZ bar to the Smith machine bar.
  3. Sit on the incline bench, facing the Smith machine bar.
  4. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  5. Extend your arms straight up, so that the bar is directly above your head.
  6. Lower the bar behind your head, keeping your elbows close to your head and your upper arms stationary.
  7. Pause briefly when the bar is just above your head, then slowly raise it back to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the Smith machine.
  10. Stretch your triceps by reaching one arm across your chest and gently pulling it with the other arm, holding for 15-30 seconds. Repeat with the other arm.

name: smith machine reverse decline close grip bench press
instructions:
1. Adjust the smith machine to a decline angle, with the head of the bench lower than the foot.
  2. Select the appropriate weight and load it onto the bar.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet secured under the foot pads.
  4. Grip the bar with a close grip, with your hands slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Unrack the bar and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then push the bar back up to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, rack the bar and carefully sit up and dismount the bench.

name: smith narrow row
instructions:
1. Position yourself in front of a Smith machine with the bar set at waist height.
  2. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip that is slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step back a few feet from the bar and keep your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you pull the bar towards your waist.
  5. Keep your elbows close to your body and squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull the bar towards you.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the bar and stretch out your back and shoulders.

name: smith one arm row
instructions:
1. Stand next to a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand.
  2. Place the knee closest to the bench on the bench and bend your torso forward so that your back is parallel to the floor.
  3. Place your free hand on the bench for support.
  4. Begin with your arm extended downwards towards the floor.
  5. Slowly pull the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your back muscles.
  7. Lower the weight back down to the starting position.
  8. Complete the desired number of reps before switching sides and repeating the exercise with the other arm.

name: smith one leg floor calf raise
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of a sturdy object, such as a Smith machine or a wall, with one hand resting on it for balance.
  2. Place the ball of your foot on a raised surface, such as a weight plate or a step, with your heel hanging off the edge.
  3. Slowly lower your heel towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your calf muscle.
  4. Push up onto the ball of your foot, using your calf muscle to lift your body up as high as possible.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat.
  7. For added resistance, hold a dumbbell in the hand opposite the working leg.
  8. Remember to keep your core engaged and maintain proper posture throughout the exercise.

name: smith rear delt row
instructions:
1. Adjust the height of the Smith machine bar to chest level.
  2. Stand facing the machine and grip the bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step back to create tension in the bar and engage your core.
  4. Keeping your chest up and your back straight, pull the bar towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your elbows close to your body throughout the movement and to avoid using momentum to complete the exercise.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully rack the bar and rest for 30-60 seconds before beginning your next set.
  9. You can increase the intensity of the exercise by using heavier weights or by incorporating pauses or holds at the top of the movement.

name: smith reverse calf raises
instructions:
1. Position yourself on the Smith machine by standing with your back against the bar and placing the balls of your feet on a raised platform or weight plates.
  2. Grasp the bar with your hands and engage your core.
  3. Lift your heels off the platform, keeping your legs straight, until you are standing on your toes.
  4. Slowly lower your heels back down towards the platform, keeping your legs straight. This is one rep.
  5. Complete 3 sets of 12-15 reps, resting for 30 seconds between sets.
  6. To increase the difficulty, add weight to the bar or use a higher platform.

name: smith reverse calf raises
instructions:
1. Stand facing a Smith machine with the barbell resting on the supports behind your ankles.
  2. Place the balls of your feet on a raised surface, such as a block or step, with your heels hanging off the edge.
  3. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keeping your legs straight, raise your heels as high as possible by contracting your calf muscles.
  5. Lower your heels back down to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your calves.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Adjust the weight on the barbell as necessary to increase or decrease the intensity of the exercise.
  8. Be sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  9. Finish the exercise by safely returning the barbell to the supports and stepping down from the raised surface.

name: smith reverse grip bent over row
instructions:
1. Stand in front of a loaded barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your chest lifted.
  3. Grasp the barbell with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Engage your core and pull the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  6. Slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: smith reverse-grip press
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a smith machine bench, facing the bar with your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing towards you.
  3. Engage your core and press the bar upwards, extending your arms fully.
  4. Lower the bar back down to your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
  5. Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps.
  6. Remember to maintain proper form throughout the exercise, keeping your back straight and your shoulders relaxed.
  7. Once you have completed your set, carefully rack the bar back onto the smith machine.

name: smith seated one leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench or chair with your back straight and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place the ball of one foot on the edge of a weight plate or block, with your heel hanging off the edge.
  3. Place the barbell across your thighs, just above your knees.
  4. Grasp the barbell with both hands, palms facing down.
  5. Slowly raise your heel as high as possible, keeping your toes on the weight plate or block.
  6. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your heel back down until it is below the edge of the weight plate or block.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other leg.
  8. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  9. Use a weight that is challenging but allows you to maintain proper form.
  10. Perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 repetitions on each leg.

name: smith seated shoulder press
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height so that the handles are at shoulder level when seated.
  2. Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad and your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and lift them off the rack, extending your arms fully.
  4. Inhale and slowly lower the handles towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows slightly in front of your body.
  5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, then exhale and press the handles back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the handles back onto the machine.
  8. Stretch your shoulders and upper back to cool down.

name: smith seated wrist curl
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench with your forearms resting on the padded surface of the Smith machine bar.
  2. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Slowly lift the bar by flexing your wrists, keeping your forearms firmly planted on the bench.
  4. Once your wrists are fully flexed, hold the position for a second before slowly lowering the bar back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your elbows and upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight on the machine as necessary.
  8. When finished, carefully release the bar and stand up from the bench.

name: smith shoulder press
instructions:
1. Start by setting up the Smith machine to a comfortable height. The bar should be at shoulder level when you are seated on the bench.
  2. Sit on the bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bring the bar down to your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Push the bar up above your head, extending your arms fully. Keep your core tight and your back straight.
  5. Lower the bar back down to your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the bar back onto the Smith machine.

name: smith shrug
instructions:
1. Start by standing in front of a smith machine with the barbell at waist height.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Stand up straight, keeping your back straight and your shoulders back.
  4. Slowly shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
  5. Hold for a second, then slowly lower the barbell back down to waist height.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your arms straight throughout the exercise and avoid using your biceps to lift the weight.
  8. Use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lift the weight and exhaling as you lower it.
  10. Finish the exercise by carefully placing the barbell back in the starting position.

name: smith single leg split squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart, facing away from the Smith machine.
  2. Place one foot behind you on the bar of the Smith machine, with the top of your foot resting on the bar.
  3. Position your other foot a few feet in front of the Smith machine, keeping your knee bent and your weight on your front foot.
  4. Engage your core and slowly lower your back knee down towards the ground, keeping your front knee in line with your toes.
  5. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then push through your front foot to return to the starting position.
  6. Complete the desired number of repetitions on one side before switching to the other leg.
  7. Make sure to keep your chest lifted, your shoulders back, and your gaze forward throughout the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight on the Smith machine as needed to increase or decrease the intensity of the exercise.
  9. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain proper form throughout the movement.

name: smith sprint lunge
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
  2. Take a large step forward with your right foot, bending your right knee to a 90-degree angle and keeping your left foot planted behind you.
  3. Push off with your right foot, bringing it back to the starting position.
  4. Immediately take a large step forward with your left foot, bending your left knee to a 90-degree angle and keeping your right foot planted behind you.
  5. Push off with your left foot, bringing it back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise, alternating between your right and left legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith squat
instructions:
1. Start by setting the bar on the smith machine to a comfortable height, usually just below shoulder level.
  2. Position yourself under the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes slightly turned out.
  3. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip and position it across your upper back, resting it on your traps.
  4. Take a deep breath and brace your core.
  5. Slowly lower yourself down by bending your knees and hips, as if you were sitting back into a chair.
  6. Keep your chest up and your back straight as you descend, making sure your knees stay in line with your toes.
  7. Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
  8. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat.
  9. Push through your heels and drive your hips forward to stand back up, exhaling as you do so.
  10. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.
  11. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith standing back wrist curl
instructions:
1. Stand in front of a Smith machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Step back from the machine, keeping your arms straight and your back straight.
  4. Bend your wrists back, curling the bar towards your forearms.
  5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. When finished, carefully rack the bar and step away from the machine.

name: smith standing behind head military press
instructions:
1. Stand inside a Smith machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing away from the machine.
  2. Grasp the bar with a grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing forward.
  3. Lift the barbell up and position it behind your head, resting on your traps.
  4. Engage your core and keep your chest up as you slowly press the barbell up above your head until your arms are fully extended.
  5. Hold the barbell in this position for a few seconds before slowly lowering it back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your elbows pointed forward and avoid arching your back throughout the movement.
  8. Make sure to use a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

name: smith standing leg calf raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place the barbell on your shoulders behind your neck and grasp it with an overhand grip.
  3. Slowly raise your heels off the ground by pushing up with the balls of your feet.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your heels back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  7. Adjust the weight as needed to ensure proper form and prevent injury.
  8. You can also perform this exercise using a calf raise machine if one is available.
  9. Remember to breathe evenly throughout the exercise.
  10. Stretch your calves after the exercise to prevent tightness and soreness.

name: smith standing military press
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing forward) and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell off the rack and bring it to your collarbone with your elbows bent and pointing out to the sides.
  4. Take a deep breath in and brace your core.
  5. Press the barbell overhead by extending your arms and pushing the bar straight up.
  6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back down to your collarbone.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. When finished, carefully rack the barbell back onto the rack.

name: smith sumo squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outwards.
  2. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip and position it at the front of your thighs.
  3. Engage your core and lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. As you squat down, push your knees outwards and keep your weight on your heels.
  5. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
  6. Push through your heels and return to the starting position, keeping the barbell close to your body.
  7. Repeat the exercise for several reps, making sure to maintain proper form throughout.
  8. Once you have completed your desired number of reps, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.

name: smith toe raise
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of a Smith machine with the bar set at knee height.
  2. Place the balls of your feet on the edge of a weight plate or step, with your heels hanging off the edge.
  3. Hold onto the bar with your hands for balance.
  4. Slowly raise your toes as high as possible, keeping your heels on the edge of the weight plate or step.
  5. Hold for a second at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your toes back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. For an added challenge, you can perform the exercise with one foot at a time.

name: smith upright row
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Lift the barbell up to your chest, keeping your elbows pointed out to the sides.
  4. Slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Remember to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Make sure to use a weight that is appropriate for your strength level.
  8. If you experience any pain or discomfort, stop the exercise immediately.

name: smith wide grip bench press
instructions:
1. Set up the barbell on the smith machine at chest height.
  2. Add weight plates to the barbell according to your strength and fitness level.
  3. Stand facing the barbell and grasp it with a wide grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Step back from the machine and position your feet shoulder-width apart.
  5. Lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows out to the sides and your back flat on the bench.
  6. Pause for a moment with the barbell just above your chest.
  7. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
  8. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully re-rack the barbell.

name: smith wide grip decline bench press
instructions:
1. Set up the decline bench at a 30-45 degree angle.
  2. Load the desired weight onto the barbell.
  3. Lie down on the bench with your feet securely placed on the footrests.
  4. Grasp the barbell with a wide grip, placing your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Unrack the barbell and lower it towards your chest, keeping your elbows flared out to the sides.
  6. Press the barbell back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully.
  7. Repeat for desired number of reps.
  8. Rack the barbell once finished.

name: snatch pull
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place your hands on the barbell, with your palms facing down and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  3. Bend your knees and lower your hips, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. Begin to pull the barbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbows high and your wrists straight.
  5. As the barbell reaches your chest, extend your hips and knees to explosively pull the barbell upwards.
  6. Once the barbell has reached its highest point, quickly drop it back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: spell caster
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Visualize a magical energy flowing through your body, starting at your feet and moving upwards towards your head.
  3. As you inhale, raise your arms above your head and imagine the magical energy intensifying.
  4. As you exhale, bring your arms back down to your sides and release the magical energy from your body.
  5. Repeat steps 2-4 for a total of 10 repetitions.
  6. After completing the exercise, take a moment to ground yourself by standing still and taking a few deep breaths.

name: sphinx
instructions:
1. Begin by lying face down on your mat with your legs extended behind you and your hands under your shoulders, fingers facing forward.
  2. Press into your hands and lift your chest, shoulders, and head off the mat. Keep your elbows close to your sides.
  3. Engage your back muscles and keep your shoulders away from your ears.
  4. Lower your chest back down to the mat and rest for a few breaths before repeating the exercise.
  5. Repeat the exercise for several repetitions, focusing on keeping your form correct and your back muscles engaged.

name: spider crawl push up
instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your feet together.
  2. Lower your body towards the ground as you would in a regular push-up.
  3. As you lower your body, bring your right knee towards your right elbow, keeping it off the ground.
  4. Push your body back up to the starting position while returning your right leg to the starting position.
  5. Repeat the same movement with your left leg, bringing your left knee towards your left elbow as you lower your body towards the ground.
  6. Continue alternating between your right and left legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: spine stretch
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on a mat or comfortable surface with your legs extended in front of you and your arms resting at your sides.
  2. Take a deep breath in and lengthen your spine, imagining that you are growing taller through the crown of your head.
  3. As you exhale, slowly begin to round your spine, starting from your tailbone and moving up towards your head.
  4. Continue to round your spine until your chin is tucked towards your chest and you feel a stretch in your upper back.
  5. Hold this position for a few breaths, feeling the stretch in your spine and allowing your muscles to relax.
  6. On your next inhale, slowly begin to unroll your spine, starting from your head and moving down towards your tailbone.
  7. As you unroll your spine, imagine that you are stacking each vertebra on top of the one below it.
  8. Once you have returned to your starting position, take a few deep breaths and repeat the exercise as desired.

name: spine twist
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
  2. Bend your right knee and place your foot flat on the floor, crossing it over your left leg.
  3. Place your right hand on the floor behind you for support.
  4. Place your left elbow on the outside of your right knee, using it to gently twist your torso to the right.
  5. Hold the twist for a few breaths, feeling the stretch in your spine.
  6. Release the twist and switch sides, bending your left knee and crossing it over your right leg.
  7. Place your left hand on the floor behind you and your right elbow on the outside of your left knee, twisting your torso to the left.
  8. Hold the twist for a few breaths, feeling the stretch in your spine.
  9. Release the twist and return to a seated position with your legs extended in front of you.

name: split squats
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
  2. Take a large step forward with your right foot and lower your body down until your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Make sure your left knee is hovering just above the ground.
  4. Push through your right heel to stand back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat on the other side by taking a large step forward with your left foot.
  6. Continue alternating between sides for the desired number of reps or time.
  7. For an added challenge, hold a dumbbell in each hand or use a barbell across your shoulders.

name: squat jerk
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outwards.
  2. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip at shoulder height, resting on your deltoids.
  3. Bend your knees and lower your hips down into a squat position, keeping your chest up and your back straight.
  4. As you begin to rise up out of the squat, press the barbell overhead, using the momentum from your legs to help drive the weight up.
  5. As the barbell reaches full extension overhead, drop down into a split stance, with one foot forward and the other foot back.
  6. As you land in the split stance, your arms should be fully extended overhead, with the barbell directly above your head.
  7. Hold this position for a moment, then stand back up and bring your feet back together.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps, then switch legs for the split stance on the next set.

name: squat on bosu ball
instructions:
1. Start by placing the Bosu ball on the ground with the flat side up.
  2. Stand in front of the Bosu ball with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes pointing slightly outward.
  3. Slowly lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
  4. As you squat down, place your hands on the Bosu ball for balance and stability.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then slowly rise back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise for several reps, making sure to keep your form correct and your movements controlled.
  7. To increase the difficulty of the exercise, hold a weight or kettlebell in front of your body as you squat.
  8. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  9. Finish the exercise by standing up straight and stretching your legs and lower back.

name: squat to overhead reach
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell in both hands, with your arms extended straight down in front of your body.
  3. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest lifted and your weight in your heels.
  4. As you stand back up, press the weight overhead, extending your arms fully and reaching toward the ceiling.
  5. Lower the weight back down to the starting position as you squat down again.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: squat to overhead reach with twist
instructions:
1. Start standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointed slightly outward.
  2. Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell in both hands, with your arms extended straight up above your head.
  3. Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, as if you were sitting down in a chair.
  4. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can go while maintaining proper form.
  5. As you rise back up to standing, twist your torso to the right and reach your left hand toward your right foot.
  6. Return to the starting position with your arms extended overhead.
  7. Repeat the squat, this time twisting to the left and reaching your right hand toward your left foot.
  8. Continue alternating sides with each repetition.
  9. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

name: stability ball crunch (full range hands behind head)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Slowly walk your feet forward, allowing the ball to roll underneath your body until your lower back is resting on the ball.
  3. Place your hands behind your head, with your elbows pointing out to the sides.
  4. Engage your abdominal muscles and lift your upper back off the ball, curling your shoulders towards your hips.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for a desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to keep your neck relaxed and avoid pulling on your head with your hands.
  8. For an added challenge, you can hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest while performing the exercise.
  9. Make sure to exhale as you crunch up and inhale as you lower back down.
  10. Finish the exercise by walking your feet back towards the ball and sitting up.

name: stalder press
instructions:
1. Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended overhead.
  2. Slowly lower your body into a squatting position, keeping your arms extended overhead.
  3. As you squat down, shift your weight onto your heels and keep your chest up.
  4. Once you reach the bottom of the squat, explosively push through your heels and extend your legs while simultaneously pressing your arms upward.
  5. At the top of the movement, your arms should be fully extended overhead and your body should be in a straight line from your heels to your hands.
  6. Lower your body back down into the squatting position and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name: standing archer
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward, and arms at your sides.
  2. Step forward with your right foot, keeping your left foot in place.
  3. Bend your right knee and shift your weight onto your right foot.
  4. Extend your left arm straight out in front of you, parallel to the ground, with your palm facing down.
  5. Extend your right arm straight back behind you, parallel to the ground, with your palm facing up.
  6. Hold this position for a few seconds, then return to the starting position.
  7. Repeat on the other side by stepping forward with your left foot and extending your right arm forward and left arm back.
  8. Continue alternating sides for your desired number of repetitions.

name: standing behind neck press
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with both hands behind your neck, resting it on your shoulders. Your palms should be facing forward and your elbows should be pointing straight ahead.
  2. Slowly lift the barbell by extending your arms upward until they are fully extended above your head.
  3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position behind your neck.
  4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
  5. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  6. Start with a light weight and gradually increase as you become more comfortable with the movement.
  7. Avoid locking your elbows at the top of the movement to prevent injury.
  8. If you experience any pain or discomfort, stop the exercise immediately and consult a healthcare professional.

name: standing calf raise (on a staircase)
instructions:
1. Stand on the edge of a staircase with the balls of your feet on the edge and your heels hanging off.
  2. Hold onto the railing or wall for balance.
  3. Slowly raise your heels up as high as you can, keeping your legs straight.
  4. Hold your heels up for a few seconds at the top of the movement.
  5. Lower your heels back down below the level of the step.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. For an added challenge, try doing the exercise on one foot at a time.

name: standing calves
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, toes pointing forward.
  2. Place your hands on your hips or hold onto a stable surface for balance.
  3. Slowly rise up onto the balls of your feet, lifting your heels as high as possible.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your heels back down to the ground.
  5. Repeat for 10-15 reps, or until you feel a burn in your calves.
  6. To increase the intensity of the exercise, you can hold weights in your hands or do the exercise on a step or elevated surface.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and maintain good posture.
  8. Stretch your calves after the exercise by placing one foot behind the other and pressing your heel into the ground while keeping your back straight.

name: standing calves calf stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place your hands on a wall or sturdy object for balance.
  3. Slowly lift your heels off the ground, pushing up onto the balls of your feet.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-30 seconds, feeling a stretch in your calves.
  5. Lower your heels back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat the stretch for 3-5 repetitions.

name: standing hamstring and calf stretch with strap
instructions:
1. Begin by standing up straight with your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Hold the strap in both hands and place it around the ball of your right foot.
  3. Slowly extend your right leg out in front of you, keeping it straight.
  4. Flex your right foot towards your body to stretch your calf muscle.
  5. Keeping your leg straight, gently pull the strap towards your body until you feel a stretch in your hamstring.
  6. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and relaxing your body.
  7. Release the strap and slowly lower your right leg back down to the ground.
  8. Repeat the stretch on your left leg, holding for the same amount of time.
  9. Perform 2-3 sets on each leg, gradually increasing the duration of the stretch as your flexibility improves.

name: standing lateral stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Extend your right arm straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your left arm at your side.
  3. Slowly bend your torso to the left, reaching your right arm over your head towards the left side of your body.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in your right side.
  5. Return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side, extending your left arm up towards the ceiling and bending your torso to the right.
  6. Repeat the stretch on each side 2-3 times.

name: standing pelvic tilt
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button in towards your spine.
  3. Shift your weight forward onto the balls of your feet.
  4. Tilt your pelvis forward by squeezing your glutes and pushing your hips forward.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, then release.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe deeply throughout the exercise.

name: standing single leg curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Lift your right foot off the ground and balance on your left foot.
  3. Bend your left knee slightly and lift your right heel towards your buttocks.
  4. Hold this position for a count of two.
  5. Slowly lower your right foot back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat the exercise on your left leg.
  7. Complete 10-15 repetitions on each leg.
  8. If you want to increase the difficulty, you can hold onto a dumbbell or resistance band with your hands.

name: standing wheel rollerout
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the standing wheel in front of you.
  2. Bend down and grip the handles of the wheel with both hands.
  3. Engage your core muscles and roll the wheel forward by extending your arms and pushing the wheel away from your body.
  4. Keep your back straight and your abs tight as you roll the wheel out as far as you can without touching the ground.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly roll the wheel back towards your body by bending your arms and pulling the wheel towards you.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 reps or as many as you can do with good form.
  7. Make sure to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back or letting your hips sag.
  8. Variations: To increase the difficulty, try rolling the wheel out to the side or alternating between rolling the wheel out with one arm at a time.

name: star jump (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Jump up and spread your legs out to the sides while simultaneously raising your arms above your head.
  3. Land on the balls of your feet with your legs and arms still spread out.
  4. Jump again and bring your legs back together while lowering your arms back to your sides.
  5. Land on the balls of your feet with your legs together and your arms at your sides.
  6. Repeat the jump sequence for the desired number of repetitions.

name: stationary bike run v. 3
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat height to ensure proper alignment of your knees and hips while pedaling.
  2. Adjust the resistance level to your desired intensity.
  3. Place your feet on the pedals and secure them with the straps.
  4. Start pedaling at a comfortable pace for a warm-up.
  5. Gradually increase your speed and resistance level to challenge yourself.
  6. Maintain proper posture by keeping your back straight and shoulders relaxed.
  7. Engage your core muscles by pulling your navel towards your spine.
  8. Use your arms to help balance and support your upper body.
  9. Continue pedaling for at least 20 minutes to get a good cardiovascular workout.
  10. Cool down by gradually decreasing your speed and resistance level.
  11. Stretch your legs, back, and arms to prevent stiffness and soreness.
  12. Clean the bike after use to maintain hygiene.

name: stationary bike walk
instructions:
1. Adjust the seat of the stationary bike to your height. Stand next to the bike and adjust the seat so that it is at hip level.
  2. Adjust the resistance of the bike to a level that is comfortable for you. You should be able to pedal easily without too much strain.
  3. Place your feet on the pedals and start pedaling slowly.
  4. As you pedal, focus on keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  5. After a few minutes of pedaling, start to lift your feet off the pedals and walk in place on the bike. Keep your hands on the handlebars for balance.
  6. Continue walking in place on the bike for 1-2 minutes.
  7. Return your feet to the pedals and continue pedaling at a comfortable pace for a few minutes.
  8. Repeat the stationary bike walk for 1-2 minutes, alternating with periods of comfortable pedaling.
  9. When you are finished, slow down your pedaling and come to a stop. Stretch your legs and back to cool down.

name: straddle maltese
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height.
  2. Take a wide step to the side with your right foot, keeping your toes pointed forward.
  3. Lower your body into a squat position, keeping your knees in line with your toes and your back straight.
  4. Extend your arms forward, keeping them at shoulder height.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then return to the starting position.
  6. Repeat the exercise, this time stepping to the side with your left foot.
  7. Continue alternating sides for several repetitions.
  8. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, try to lower your body deeper into the squat position and hold the position for longer periods of time.
  9. Remember to breathe deeply and maintain good posture throughout the exercise.

name: straddle planche
instructions:
1. Begin in a straddle position with your legs spread wide apart and your hands on the ground in front of you.
  2. Shift your weight forward onto your hands and lift your feet off the ground, keeping your legs straight.
  3. As you lift your feet, lean forward and engage your core muscles to keep your body in a straight line.
  4. Hold the straddle planche position for as long as you can, aiming for at least 5-10 seconds.
  5. To release from the position, slowly lower your feet back to the ground and return to the starting straddle position.
  6. Repeat for several sets, gradually increasing the amount of time you can hold the planche position.

name: straight leg outer hip abductor
instructions:
1. Begin by lying on your side on a mat or comfortable surface. Make sure your body is in a straight line from head to toe.
  2. Extend your bottom arm out in front of your body to help maintain balance.
  3. Place your top hand on the floor in front of your chest for support.
  4. Engage your core muscles and lift your top leg straight up towards the ceiling. Keep your leg straight and your foot flexed.
  5. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions on each side.

name: superman push-up
instructions:
