1. Begin in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  2. Lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  3. As you push back up, simultaneously lift your right arm and left leg off the ground, keeping them straight.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then lower your arm and leg back down as you lower your body back down towards the ground.
  5. Repeat the push-up, this time lifting your left arm and right leg off the ground.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: suspended abdominal fallout
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy suspension system, such as TRX straps or gymnastics rings, and adjust them to a height that allows you to hang with your feet off the ground.
  2. Grab onto the suspension system with both hands and lift your feet off the ground, bringing your knees up towards your chest.
  3. Slowly lower your legs down towards the ground, keeping your core engaged and your back flat against the floor.
  4. Stop lowering your legs when you feel your lower back start to arch or lift off the ground. This is your end range of motion.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, then use your abs to lift your legs back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. For an added challenge, try extending your legs out straight as you lower them down towards the ground.

name: suspended push-up
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy suspension trainer or gymnastics rings and adjust them to hang about chest height from the ground.
  2. Place your feet together and grip the handles with both hands, palms facing down.
  3. Walk your feet back until your body is at a slight angle and your arms are fully extended.
  4. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your core engaged and your body in a straight line.
  5. Push yourself back up to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: suspended reverse crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by finding a sturdy overhead bar that can support your body weight.
  2. Stand under the bar and reach up to grab it with both hands, palms facing away from you.
  3. Lift your feet off the ground and allow your body to hang from the bar, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
  4. Engage your core muscles and slowly lift your knees towards your chest, curling your pelvis up towards your ribcage.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and hold for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for several reps, focusing on maintaining control and stability throughout the exercise.
  7. For an added challenge, try extending your legs out straight as you lift them towards your chest, or holding a weight between your feet.

name: suspended row
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy suspension trainer or TRX and adjust it to the appropriate length.
  2. Stand facing the anchor point and hold onto the handles with an overhand grip.
  3. Lean back with your arms extended, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  4. Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the handles, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: suspended split squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing in front of a suspension trainer with one foot in the foot cradle and the other foot on the ground.
  2. Lower your body down into a split squat position, making sure your front knee is directly above your ankle and your back knee is hovering just above the ground.
  3. Engage your core and glutes to maintain balance and stability.
  4. Push through your front foot to return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to the other leg.

name: swimmer kicks v. 2 (male)
instructions:
1. Start by lying flat on your stomach in the water, with your arms extended in front of you and your legs straight behind you.
  2. Begin kicking your legs up and down in a flutter kick motion, keeping your toes pointed and your legs straight.
  3. As you kick, focus on keeping your hips and legs close to the surface of the water, and try to create as little splashing as possible.
  4. Continue kicking for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or until you feel fatigued.
  5. Rest for 30 seconds to 1 minute, then repeat the exercise for 2-3 sets.
  6. For an added challenge, try holding a kickboard or foam buoy between your legs while you kick.

name: swing 360
instructions:
1. Start by standing in front of a horizontal bar or a sturdy tree branch that is at least 8 feet high.
  2. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Swing your body back and forth, building momentum with each swing.
  4. As you swing forward, lift your legs up and tuck them towards your chest.
  5. At the peak of your swing, release your hands from the bar and rotate your body 360 degrees in the air.
  6. As you come back around, reach out and grab the bar again with your hands.
  7. Land back on the ground with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  8. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: three bench dip
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy bench or chair and sit on the edge with your hands gripping the edge of the bench next to your hips.
  2. Walk your feet forward so that your hips are off the bench and your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Lower your body down towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight and close to the bench.
  4. Stop when your arms form a 90-degree angle, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: tire flip
instructions:
1. Approach the tire and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Squat down and grab the bottom of the tire with both hands, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  3. Using your legs and hips, lift the tire off the ground and flip it over onto its other side.
  4. Once the tire is flipped, step back and reset your stance.
  5. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions or time period.
  6. Make sure to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid injury.

name: trap bar deadlift
instructions:
1. Step 1: Approach the trap bar with your feet hip-width apart, and the bar centered between your feet.
  2. Step 2: Hinge at your hips and knees, reaching down to grab the handles of the trap bar with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
  3. Step 3: Brace your core and lift the bar by standing up, keeping your chest up and your back straight.
  4. Step 4: Once you reach the top of the lift, pause briefly and squeeze your glutes.
  5. Step 5: Lower the bar by hinging at your hips and knees, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
  6. Step 6: Return the bar to the ground and release your grip.
  7. Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: triceps dip
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy bench or chair and sit on the edge with your hands gripping the edge of the bench/chair on either side of your hips.
  2. Slide your buttocks off the edge of the bench/chair, keeping your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
  4. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms, but be careful not to lock your elbows.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: triceps dip (bench leg)
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy bench or chair that can support your weight.
  2. Sit on the edge of the bench or chair and place your hands on the edge, shoulder-width apart.
  3. Slide your body forward so that your hips are off the bench and your arms are straight.
  4. Bend your elbows and lower your body until your arms form a 90-degree angle.
  5. Push through your hands and straighten your arms to lift your body back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: triceps dip (between benches)
instructions:
1. Find two sturdy benches or surfaces that are parallel to each other and approximately shoulder-width apart.
  2. Place your hands on the edge of one bench and extend your legs out in front of you, with your feet resting on the edge of the other bench.
  3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight and your shoulders down.
  4. Stop when your arms form a 90-degree angle and your triceps are parallel to the floor.
  5. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms, but be careful not to lock your elbows.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to engage your core and keep your shoulders down throughout the exercise to avoid strain on your neck or shoulders.
  8. If you are a beginner, you can modify this exercise by bending your knees and keeping your feet on the ground instead of extending your legs out in front of you.

name: triceps dips floor
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy chair or bench that can support your weight.
  2. Place the chair or bench behind you and stand facing away from it.
  3. Place your hands on the edge of the chair or bench, shoulder-width apart, with your fingers pointing forward.
  4. Step your feet forward, keeping your knees bent at a 90-degree angle and your feet flat on the floor.
  5. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping your back close to the chair or bench.
  6. Stop when your arms reach a 90-degree angle.
  7. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  8. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: triceps press
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a bench or chair with your back straight and feet firmly on the ground.
  2. Hold a dumbbell or weight in both hands, with your palms facing up and your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, keeping your elbows close to your head.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your head.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. Variations of this exercise include using a cable machine or resistance band instead of dumbbells, as well as performing the exercise while lying on a bench.

name: triceps stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Extend your right arm straight up and bend your elbow so that your hand reaches behind your head.
  3. Use your left hand to gently push your right elbow back and down, feeling a stretch in your triceps.
  4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release and repeat on the other side.
  5. For a deeper stretch, you can use a towel or resistance band to gently pull your elbow further back.
  6. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times on each side, taking care not to overstretch or cause pain.

name: tuck crunch
instructions:
1. Start by lying down on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Bring your hands behind your head, and lift your shoulders off the ground.
  3. At the same time, bring your knees towards your chest, and lift your hips off the ground.
  4. As you bring your knees towards your chest, try to touch your elbows to your knees.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds before slowly lowering your shoulders and hips back to the ground.
  6. Repeat this exercise for a desired number of repetitions.

name: twin handle parallel grip lat pulldown
instructions:
1. Adjust the weight stack to the desired resistance level.
  2. Sit on the lat pulldown machine with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
  3. Grasp the twin handles with an overhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Keep your elbows close to your body and pull the handles down towards your chest.
  5. Pause for a moment, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to breathe properly throughout the exercise, inhaling as you pull the handles down and exhaling as you release them.
  8. Keep your core engaged and avoid using momentum to complete the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight as necessary and gradually increase the resistance over time to continue challenging your muscles.

name: twist hip lift
instructions:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Place your hands behind your head with your elbows out to the sides.
  3. Engage your core and lift your hips off the ground, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
  4. As you lower your hips back down, twist your torso to the right and touch your right elbow to your left knee.
  5. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement, this time twisting to the left and touching your left elbow to your right knee.
  6. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back.
  8. If you feel any discomfort or pain, stop the exercise immediately.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the movement, exhaling as you lift your hips and twist your torso.

name: twisted leg raise
instructions:
1. Lie down on your back with your legs straight and your arms by your sides.
  2. Lift your legs up towards the ceiling, keeping them straight.
  3. Rotate your legs to one side, twisting your hips and lower back.
  4. Lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  5. Lift your legs back up towards the ceiling and rotate them to the other side.
  6. Lower your legs back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: twisted leg raise (female)
instructions:
1. Lie down on your back on a yoga mat or any comfortable surface.
  2. Extend your legs straight up towards the ceiling, keeping them together.
  3. Place your hands behind your head, interlocking your fingers.
  4. Twist your legs to one side, keeping them straight and together.
  5. Lower your legs towards the ground, but do not let them touch the floor.
  6. Slowly raise your legs back up to the starting position.
  7. Twist your legs to the other side and repeat the exercise.
  8. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each side.
  9. Remember to engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to protect your lower back.
  10. Take deep breaths and maintain a steady pace throughout the exercise.
  11. Finish the exercise by bringing your legs back to the starting position and relaxing your body.

name: two toe touch (male)
instructions:
1. Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
  2. Slowly bend forward from your waist, keeping your back straight and your head up.
  3. Reach down with both hands and try to touch your toes.
  4. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in your hamstrings and lower back.
  5. Slowly rise back up to the starting position, keeping your back straight.
  6. Repeat the exercise for 10-12 repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe deeply and exhale as you stretch.
  8. If you have any back problems, consult with a doctor before performing this exercise.

name: upper back stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
  2. Place your hands on your hips and gently lift your chest up.
  3. Take a deep breath in and as you exhale, slowly lean forward from your hips.
  4. Allow your arms to hang down towards the floor.
  5. Keep your head and neck relaxed.
  6. Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds.
  7. Slowly come back to the starting position by rolling your spine up one vertebra at a time.
  8. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times.

name: upward facing dog
instructions:
1. Start by lying face down on your mat with your palms placed on the floor beside your chest.
  2. Press your palms firmly into the mat and straighten your arms, lifting your torso and thighs off the ground.
  3. Keep your shoulders relaxed and away from your ears.
  4. Engage your core muscles and press your hips into the mat.
  5. Look straight ahead or slightly up, keeping your neck in a neutral position.
  6. Hold the pose for a few breaths, then release back down to the mat.
  7. Repeat the pose several times, gradually increasing the duration of each hold.

name: v-sit on floor
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
  2. Place your hands on the floor beside your hips, fingers pointing towards your feet.
  3. Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
  4. At the same time, lift your upper body off the ground and reach your hands towards your feet.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds, making sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged.
  6. Slowly lower your upper body and legs back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for several reps, gradually increasing the duration of the hold as you become stronger.

name: vertical leg raise (on parallel bars)
instructions:
1. Find a set of parallel bars that are the appropriate height for you to hang from without your feet touching the ground.
  2. Stand between the parallel bars and place your hands on the bars with your palms facing down.
  3. Lift your legs up so that they are parallel to the ground.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, making sure to engage your core and keep your legs straight.
  5. Lower your legs back down to the starting position, but do not let your feet touch the ground.
  6. Repeat for several repetitions, making sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
  7. As you become more advanced, you can try lifting your legs higher or holding the position for longer periods of time.

name: walk elliptical cross trainer
instructions:
1. Step onto the foot pedals of the elliptical cross trainer.
  2. Adjust the resistance level to your desired intensity.
  3. Hold onto the handles for balance and stability.
  4. Begin pedaling in a forward motion.
  5. Keep your back straight and engage your core muscles.
  6. Move your arms in a natural motion, opposite to your legs.
  7. Continue pedaling for 10-30 minutes, depending on your fitness level.
  8. Gradually increase the resistance level or speed for a more challenging workout.
  9. Cool down by gradually decreasing the resistance level and slowing your pace.
  10. Step off the elliptical cross trainer and stretch your muscles.

name: walking high knees lunge
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Lift your right knee up towards your chest, keeping your core engaged.
  3. Step forward with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge position.
  4. Make sure your front knee is directly above your ankle and your back knee is hovering just above the ground.
  5. Push off your right foot and bring your left knee up towards your chest.
  6. Step forward with your left foot and lower your body into a lunge position.
  7. Continue alternating between right and left legs, walking forward with each lunge.
  8. Keep your chest lifted, shoulders relaxed, and core engaged throughout the exercise.
  9. Repeat for a desired number of reps or for a set amount of time.

name: walking lunge
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your hands on your hips.
  2. Take a big step forward with your right leg, keeping your torso upright.
  3. Bend both knees to create two 90-degree angles, with your right knee directly above your right ankle and your left knee hovering just above the ground.
  4. Push off with your left foot and bring it forward to step into a lunge with your left leg in front.
  5. Repeat the movement, alternating legs as you go.
  6. Complete 10-12 reps per leg, or as many as you can do with good form.
  7. For an added challenge, hold a dumbbell or kettlebell in each hand or perform the exercise on an incline surface.

name: walking on incline treadmill
instructions:
1. First, select the desired incline level on the treadmill.
  2. Next, step onto the treadmill and adjust the speed to a comfortable walking pace.
  3. Begin walking on the treadmill, focusing on keeping your posture upright and your core engaged.
  4. As you walk, focus on taking long strides and landing on your heel, then rolling through the ball of your foot and pushing off with your toes.
  5. Continue walking for a set amount of time or distance, gradually increasing the incline level as you progress.
  6. Be sure to cool down by gradually decreasing the incline level and slowing down your pace before stepping off the treadmill.
  7. Stretch your legs and hips after your workout to prevent injury and improve flexibility.

name: walking on stepmill
instructions:
1. Begin by stepping onto the stepmill and positioning yourself in the center of the machine.
  2. Adjust the resistance level to a comfortable setting. This can be done by using the buttons on the console.
  3. Start the machine by pressing the "Start" button on the console.
  4. Begin walking on the stepmill by placing one foot on the first step and then the other foot on the second step.
  5. Continue this pattern of stepping up and down on the machine.
  6. Use the handrails for balance and support, but avoid leaning on them too heavily.
  7. Keep your posture upright and engage your core muscles to maintain stability.
  8. Try to maintain a consistent pace and avoid taking breaks too frequently.
  9. When you are finished with your workout, slow down the machine by pressing the "Stop" button on the console.
  10. Step off the machine carefully, using the handrails for support if needed.
  11. Stretch your legs and cool down after your workout to prevent injury.

name: weighted bench dip
instructions:
1. Place a bench behind you and grab two dumbbells of equal weight.
  2. Sit on the edge of the bench and place your hands behind you, shoulder-width apart, with your fingers pointing forward.
  3. Slide your butt off the bench and straighten your legs, keeping your heels on the ground.
  4. Bend your arms and lower your body towards the ground until your arms form a 90-degree angle.
  5. Push yourself back up to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Repeat for your desired number of reps and sets.
  7. For added difficulty, place a weight plate on your lap or use a weighted vest.
  8. Remember to keep your core tight and your shoulders down throughout the exercise.
  9. Stretch your triceps and shoulders after completing the exercise.

name: weighted close grip chin-up on dip cage
instructions:
1. Step 1: Adjust the dip cage so that the bar for the chin-up is at a comfortable height for you to reach while standing.
  2. Step 2: Attach a weight plate or dumbbell to a weight belt and secure it around your waist.
  3. Step 3: Stand under the chin-up bar and grip it with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
  4. Step 4: Engage your core and pull yourself up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Step 5: Pause for a second when your chin is above the bar, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
  6. Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Step 7: When finished, carefully remove the weight belt and weight plate or dumbbell.
  8. Step 8: Stretch your back, shoulders, and arms to cool down and prevent injury.

name: weighted cossack squats (male)
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing outwards.
  2. Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell in both hands in front of your chest.
  3. Shift your weight to your right foot and bend your right knee, lowering your body into a squat position.
  4. Keep your left leg straight and your left foot flat on the ground.
  5. Push through your right heel to return to a standing position.
  6. Repeat on the other side, shifting your weight to your left foot and bending your left knee.
  7. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 reps on each side.
  8. Make sure to keep your chest up and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight of the dumbbell or kettlebell as needed to maintain proper form and challenge yourself.
  10. Consult with a fitness professional before starting any new exercise program.

name: weighted crunch
instructions:
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell with both hands and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Engage your core and slowly lift your upper body off the ground, bringing your chest towards your knees.
  4. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your abs.
  5. Slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for 10-12 reps, or as many as you can while maintaining proper form.
  7. Rest for 30 seconds and repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: weighted decline sit-up
instructions:
1. Begin by securing your feet under the footpads of the decline bench and lie down on the bench with your knees bent and your hands holding the weight plate behind your head.
  2. Slowly lower your torso towards the floor while keeping your hands and weight plate behind your head.
  3. Pause for a second when your torso is parallel to the floor and then slowly raise your torso back up to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted donkey calf raise
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Place a weight plate or dumbbell on your lower back, just above your glutes.
  3. Engage your core and keep your back straight as you lift your heels off the ground.
  4. Raise your heels as high as possible, squeezing your calf muscles at the top of the movement.
  5. Hold this position for a few seconds before lowering your heels back down to the ground.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Make sure to keep the weight balanced on your back and avoid leaning forward or backward during the exercise.
  8. Adjust the weight as needed to challenge yourself and gradually increase the weight over time as you get stronger.
  9. Perform this exercise as part of a well-rounded leg and calf workout routine.

name: weighted drop push up
instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart.
  2. Place a weight plate on your back, between your shoulder blades.
  3. Lower your body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  4. Once your chest touches the ground, push yourself back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted front plank
instructions:
1. Start by placing a mat or towel on the floor to cushion your elbows and forearms.
  2. Assume a push-up position with your forearms on the floor and your elbows directly under your shoulders.
  3. Place a weight plate on your upper back, between your shoulder blades.
  4. Engage your core and glutes to keep your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  5. Hold the position for 30-60 seconds, or as long as you can maintain proper form.
  6. Lower your body back down to the starting position and rest for 30 seconds before repeating for 2-3 sets.
  7. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the plate or the duration of the hold.

name: weighted front raise
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your thighs.
  2. Engage your core and keep your back straight.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbells in front of you, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing down.
  4. Continue lifting the dumbbells until they reach shoulder height.
  5. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your movements slow and controlled, and avoid swinging your arms or using momentum to lift the weights.
  8. You can increase the weight of the dumbbells as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.

name: weighted hanging leg-hip raise
instructions:
1. Attach a weight to a cable machine or weight plate to a dip belt and secure the belt around your waist.
  2. Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing away from you.
  3. Engage your core and lift your legs straight up in front of you, keeping them together and your toes pointed.
  4. As you lift your legs, also lift your hips and curl them towards your chest.
  5. Hold the contraction for a few seconds and then slowly lower your legs and hips back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the entire exercise and avoid swinging or using momentum to lift your legs.
  8. If you are unable to perform the exercise with weight, you can start with bodyweight only and gradually add weight as you progress.

name: weighted hyperextension (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Start by placing a stability ball on the floor and lying on it face down with your hips on the center of the ball and your feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest with both hands.
  3. Slowly raise your upper body up until it is in line with your legs and your torso is parallel to the floor.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, squeezing your glutes and lower back muscles.
  5. Lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise and to breathe steadily.
  8. Gradually increase the weight of the weight plate or dumbbell as you become stronger.

name: weighted kneeling step with swing
instructions:
1. Start by placing a weight on the ground in front of you.
  2. Kneel down on one knee behind the weight, with your other foot firmly on the ground in front of you.
  3. Grasp the weight with both hands and lift it up to waist height.
  4. Keeping your core engaged, swing the weight forward and up, extending your arms fully.
  5. As you swing the weight up, step forward with your front foot, so that you are now in a lunge position.
  6. Lower the weight back down to waist height as you step back into the kneeling position.
  7. Repeat the movement, alternating legs with each repetition.
  8. Complete 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions on each leg.

name: weighted lunge with swing
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell or dumbbell with both hands in front of your body.
  2. Take a large step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge position. Your right knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle and your left knee should be hovering just above the ground.
  3. As you come up from the lunge, swing the weight up and over your right shoulder, using your core and glutes to power the movement. Your left foot should come forward to meet your right foot as you stand up straight.
  4. Repeat the lunge and swing on the opposite side, stepping forward with your left foot and swinging the weight over your left shoulder on the way up.
  5. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps or time.

name: weighted muscle up
instructions:
1. Start by attaching a weight plate to a dip belt or vest.
  2. Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing away from you.
  3. Pull yourself up until your chest touches the bar.
  4. As you reach the top of the pull-up, explosively push your body up and over the bar, using the momentum from the pull-up to help you.
  5. Once you are over the bar, lower yourself down to the starting position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted muscle up (on bar)
instructions:
1. Start by standing in front of a pull-up bar, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Place a weighted vest on your body, or hold a dumbbell between your feet.
  3. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  4. Pull yourself up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. As you reach the top of the pull-up, explosively push your body up and over the bar, using your momentum to complete a muscle-up.
  6. Lower yourself back down to the starting position, with control.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: weighted one hand pull up
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy pull-up bar that can support your weight and the weight of the dumbbell you will be using.
  2. Choose a dumbbell that is heavy enough to challenge you, but not so heavy that you cannot complete the exercise with proper form. Hold the dumbbell in one hand.
  3. Hang from the pull-up bar using only one hand. Your palm should be facing away from you.
  4. Engage your core and pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar. Keep your elbow close to your body as you pull up.
  5. Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Switch hands and repeat the exercise with the other hand holding the dumbbell.
  7. Gradually increase the weight of the dumbbell as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  8. Remember to always use proper form and avoid swinging or using momentum to lift yourself up.
  9. As with any exercise, it is important to warm up properly before attempting the weighted one hand pull up.

name: weighted overhead crunch (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
  2. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell with both hands and extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling.
  3. Engage your core and slowly lower your upper body back towards the ball, keeping your arms extended overhead.
  4. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement and then use your abs to lift your upper body back up to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps and sets.
  6. Make sure to keep your feet firmly planted on the ground and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. As you progress, you can increase the weight of the plate or dumbbell to make the exercise more challenging.

name: weighted pull-up
instructions:
1. Choose a weight that you can comfortably lift for 5-6 reps on a regular pull-up bar.
  2. Attach the weight to a weight belt or vest.
  3. Find a pull-up bar that is sturdy and can support your weight plus the added weight.
  4. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
  5. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  6. Engage your back muscles and pull yourself up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
  7. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
  8. Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
  9. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  10. When finished, carefully remove the weight and belt or vest.

name: weighted round arm
instructions:
1. Choose a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and goals. A good starting point is 5-10 pounds.
  2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the weight in one hand.
  3. Bring your arm up to shoulder height, keeping your elbow close to your body.
  4. Slowly rotate your arm in a circular motion, keeping your elbow close to your body and your wrist straight.
  5. Perform 10-15 repetitions in one direction, then switch directions and perform another 10-15 repetitions.
  6. Repeat the exercise with the other arm.
  7. Gradually increase the weight as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  8. Perform the weighted round arm exercise 2-3 times per week as part of your overall strength training routine.
  9. Remember to warm up before starting any exercise and to cool down and stretch afterwards.

name: weighted russian twist
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the ground with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor.
  2. Hold a weight or medicine ball with both hands in front of your chest.
  3. Lean back slightly to engage your core muscles.
  4. Slowly twist your torso to the right, bringing the weight or medicine ball towards your right hip.
  5. Pause briefly, then twist your torso to the left, bringing the weight or medicine ball towards your left hip.
  6. Repeat this twisting motion for several repetitions, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  7. Complete the desired number of repetitions, then rest and repeat for additional sets.
  8. As you become more comfortable with the exercise, you can increase the weight of the medicine ball or weight to make it more challenging.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to keep your movements slow and controlled to avoid injury.

name: weighted russian twist (legs up)
instructions:
1. Begin by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
  2. Hold a weighted object, such as a dumbbell or medicine ball, with both hands in front of your chest.
  3. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground, keeping your knees bent.
  4. Engage your core and twist your torso to the right, bringing the weighted object towards your right hip.
  5. Return to the center and then twist your torso to the left, bringing the weighted object towards your left hip.
  6. Repeat this twisting motion for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  7. Make sure to keep your feet lifted throughout the exercise and to engage your core to maintain balance.
  8. To increase the difficulty, you can use a heavier weight or straighten your legs to make the exercise more challenging.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and to maintain proper form to avoid injury.

name: weighted russian twist v. 2
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Hold a dumbbell or weight plate with both hands in front of your chest.
  2. Lean back slightly to engage your core muscles.
  3. Twist your torso to the right, bringing the weight towards your right hip. Keep your arms straight and your back flat.
  4. Return to the starting position and then twist to the left, bringing the weight towards your left hip.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps or time.
  6. For an added challenge, lift your feet off the ground and balance on your glutes while performing the exercise.
  7. Make sure to breathe throughout the exercise and engage your core muscles to protect your lower back.

name: weighted seated bicep curl  (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Choose a set of dumbbells that are appropriate for your fitness level.
  2. Place a stability ball in front of you and sit on it with your feet flat on the ground.
  3. Hold the dumbbells in each hand with your palms facing upward and your arms extended down by your sides.
  4. Slowly curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  5. Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  9. Adjust the weight of the dumbbells as needed to challenge yourself appropriately.
  10. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid swinging your arms to use momentum.

name: weighted seated twist (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Start by sitting on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
  2. Hold a dumbbell or medicine ball with both hands at chest level.
  3. Engage your core and slowly twist your torso to the right, keeping your hips stable and your feet planted on the ground.
  4. Pause for a moment at the end of the twist, then slowly return to the center.
  5. Repeat the twist to the left side, again pausing at the end of the twist before returning to center.
  6. Continue alternating twists for the desired number of repetitions or time.
  7. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  8. Gradually increase the weight of the dumbbell or medicine ball as you become stronger and more comfortable with the exercise.
  9. Finish by slowly releasing the weight and sitting up straight on the stability ball.

name: weighted side bend (on stability ball)
instructions:
1. Place a stability ball on the floor and stand next to it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Pick up a dumbbell or a weight plate and hold it in one hand.
  3. Place your other hand on your hip or behind your head.
  4. Place the weight on the side of your body that has your hand on your hip.
  5. Lean towards the stability ball and place your hip on the ball.
  6. Keep your feet firmly planted on the ground and your core engaged.
  7. Slowly lower the weight towards the ground, keeping your arm straight.
  8. Pause when you feel a stretch in your side and slowly return to the starting position.
  9. Complete 10-12 reps on one side before switching to the other side.
  10. Repeat for 2-3 sets.

name: weighted sissy squat
instructions:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell or kettlebell in front of your chest with both hands.
  2. Step forward with your left foot, keeping your right foot in place.
  3. Lower your body down by bending your left knee and hip, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
  4. As you lower your body, lift your right heel off the ground and keep your right leg straight.
  5. Lower your body as far as you can, keeping your left knee behind your toes.
  6. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then push back up to the starting position, keeping your core engaged and your weight in your left heel.
  7. Repeat the movement for several reps on your left leg, then switch to your right leg and repeat.
  8. Gradually increase the weight of the dumbbell or kettlebell as you become stronger and more comfortable with the movement.
  9. Remember to keep your back straight, your chest up, and your core engaged throughout the exercise.

name: weighted squat
instructions:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
  2. Hold a weight in each hand, either dumbbells or a barbell, resting on your shoulders behind your neck.
  3. Engage your core and slowly lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees tracking over your toes.
  4. Lower down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can go while maintaining proper form.
  5. Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then exhale and push through your heels to return to a standing position.
  6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, typically 8-12.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise, and to not let your knees cave in or your back round.
  8. Once you have completed your set, carefully place the weights back on the ground or on a weight rack.

name: weighted standing curl
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
  2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward and your elbows close to your sides.
  3. Slowly lift the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body and your palms facing forward.
  4. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  6. Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
  7. You can adjust the weight of the dumbbells based on your strength and fitness level.
  8. Do not swing your arms or use momentum to lift the weights. This can cause injury and reduce the effectiveness of the exercise.
  9. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you lift the weights and exhaling as you lower them.
  10. Consult a fitness professional if you have any concerns or questions about performing this exercise.

name: weighted standing hand squeeze
instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a weight in each hand.
  2. Bring your hands up to shoulder height, with your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
  3. Place the weights together so that they are touching, with your palms facing each other.
  4. Squeeze the weights together as hard as you can, engaging your chest and arm muscles.
  5. Hold the squeeze for 2-3 seconds.
  6. Release the squeeze slowly, returning to the starting position with your arms at your sides.
  7. Repeat the exercise for 10-15 repetitions, or as many as you can comfortably complete.

name: weighted straight bar dip
instructions:
1. Choose a weighted straight bar that is appropriate for your fitness level.
  2. Place the bar on the dip bars and secure it in place.
  3. Stand between the dip bars with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  4. Grab the bar with both hands, palms facing downwards.
  5. Slowly lower yourself down towards the dip bars, keeping your elbows close to your body.
  6. Lower yourself until your arms are at a 90-degree angle.
  7. Push yourself back up to the starting position, using your triceps and chest muscles to lift your body weight.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, carefully remove the weighted straight bar from the dip bars and set it aside.
  10. Stretch your triceps and chest muscles to cool down and prevent injury.

name: weighted stretch lunge
instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Step forward with your right foot and lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left knee should be bent and hovering just above the floor.
  3. As you lower your body, lift your arms straight up above your head.
  4. Hold this position for a few seconds, then return to the starting position.
  5. Repeat with your left foot forward.
  6. Complete 10-12 reps on each leg for one set, and aim to complete 2-3 sets.
  7. Remember to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise.
  8. You can increase the weight of the dumbbells as you become more comfortable with the exercise.

name: weighted svend press
instructions:
1. Start by grabbing a pair of dumbbells of equal weight and standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Bring the dumbbells up to your shoulders, holding them with an overhand grip.
  3. Press the dumbbells overhead, extending your arms fully.
  4. Lower the dumbbells back down to your shoulders.
  5. Next, bring the dumbbells down to your chest, holding them with an underhand grip.
  6. Press the dumbbells back up to shoulder height, extending your arms fully.
  7. Lower the dumbbells back down to your chest.
  8. Repeat the sequence of overhead press and chest press for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. When finished, lower the dumbbells back down to your sides and stretch your arms and shoulders.

name: weighted three bench dips
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy bench or chair that can support your weight.
  2. Place your hands on the edge of the bench with your fingers pointing forward and your palms flat.
  3. Step your feet out in front of you and lower your body down towards the ground by bending your elbows.
  4. As you lower your body, keep your elbows close to your sides and your shoulders down and back.
  5. Once your elbows reach a 90-degree angle, push yourself back up to the starting position.
  6. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.
  7. To add weight to the exercise, place a weight plate or dumbbell on your lap.
  8. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain proper form and prevent injury.
  9. Gradually increase the weight or number of reps as you become stronger.
  10. Remember to always use proper form and listen to your body to avoid injury.

name: weighted tricep dips
instructions:
1. Find a sturdy bench or chair that can support your weight and the weight of the weights you will be using.
  2. Sit on the edge of the bench or chair and place your hands on the edge of the seat, fingers facing forward.
  3. Slide your butt off the bench or chair and extend your legs in front of you.
  4. Place a weight plate or dumbbell on your lap to add resistance.
  5. Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back straight.
  6. Stop when your elbows reach a 90-degree angle.
  7. Push through your hands and extend your arms to lift your body back up to the starting position.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
  9. Remember to keep your core engaged and your shoulders down throughout the exercise.
  10. When finished, carefully slide back onto the bench or chair and remove the weight from your lap.

name: weighted triceps dip on high parallel bars
instructions:
1. Begin by standing between two high parallel bars, with your back to one of the bars.
  2. Place your hands on the bars behind you, with your palms facing down and your fingers wrapped around the bars.
  3. Step forward slightly, so that your feet are a comfortable distance away from the bars.
  4. Lift your body up off the ground, supporting your weight on your arms.
  5. Slowly lower your body down towards the ground, bending your elbows and keeping your back straight.
  6. Stop when your arms are at a 90-degree angle, and hold for a moment.
  7. Push your body back up to the starting position, using your triceps to lift yourself.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  9. To make the exercise more challenging, you can add weight by wearing a weighted vest or holding a dumbbell between your feet.

name: wheel rollerout
instructions:
1. Start by kneeling on the floor and placing the exercise wheel in front of you.
  2. Place your hands on the handles of the wheel and ensure that your wrists are in a neutral position.
  3. Slowly roll the wheel forward, extending your arms and keeping your core engaged.
  4. Once you have reached a comfortable distance, hold the position for a few seconds.
  5. Slowly roll the wheel back towards your knees, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
  6. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
  7. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise and avoid arching your back or letting your hips drop.
  8. For an added challenge, try extending your arms and rolling the wheel out to the side, alternating sides with each repetition.

name: wheel run
instructions:
1. Place the exercise wheel on a flat surface.
  2. Place your hands on the handles of the exercise wheel.
  3. Get on your knees and place them on the ground.
  4. Extend your arms and roll the wheel forward while keeping your core engaged.
  5. Continue rolling the wheel forward until your body is fully extended.
  6. Hold the position for a few seconds.
  7. Slowly roll the wheel back towards your knees while keeping your core engaged.
  8. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

name: wide grip pull-up
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar that is sturdy and can support your weight.
  2. Stand underneath the bar and grasp it with both hands using an overhand grip that is wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your back muscles and pull yourself up towards the bar until your chin is above it.
  5. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  6. Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
  7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  8. Remember to breathe throughout the exercise, inhaling as you pull yourself up and exhaling as you lower yourself down.
  9. For an added challenge, you can perform this exercise with a weighted vest or belt.

name: wide grip rear pull-up
instructions:
1. Find a pull-up bar that is sturdy and can support your weight.
  2. Stand underneath the bar and grab it with both hands using a wide grip, meaning your hands should be placed wider than shoulder-width apart.
  3. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
  4. Engage your shoulder blades by pulling them down and back.
  5. Bend your elbows and pull your chest towards the bar until your chin is above the bar.
  6. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement.
  7. Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position with your arms fully extended.
  8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: wide hand push up
instructions:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width apart.
  2. Engage your core and keep your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
  3. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
  4. Push your body back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Variations: To make the exercise easier, you can perform the push up on your knees instead of your toes. To make the exercise more challenging, you can elevate your feet on a bench or step.

name: wide-grip chest dip on high parallel bars
instructions:
1. Step 1: Stand between two high parallel bars and grip each bar with your palms facing away from your body.
  2. Step 2: Straighten your arms and lift yourself up so that your arms are fully extended and your feet are off the ground.
  3. Step 3: Lean forward slightly and lower your body until your chest is level with the bars.
  4. Step 4: Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms and lifting your body.
  5. Step 5: Repeat steps 3 and 4 for the desired number of reps.
  6. Step 6: To modify the exercise, you can add weight by using a weight belt or holding a dumbbell between your feet.

name: wind sprints
instructions:
1. Start by finding a flat, open area to run in.
  2. Begin by jogging for a few minutes to warm up your muscles.
  3. Choose a distance to sprint, such as 50 or 100 yards.
  4. Sprint as fast as you can to the chosen distance.
  5. Once you reach the distance, slow down to a jog and recover for a few seconds.
  6. Repeat the sprint for a total of 6-8 times.
  7. Rest for 1-2 minutes between each sprint to allow your body to recover.
  8. Finish with a cool down jog and stretching.

name: world greatest stretch
instructions:
1. Begin in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your feet hip-distance apart.
  2. Step your right foot outside of your right hand, keeping your right knee bent and your left leg straight.
  3. Place your left hand on the ground and reach your right arm up towards the ceiling, twisting your torso to the right.
  4. Hold for a few breaths, then bring your right hand back down to the ground.
  5. Step your right foot back to meet your left foot, returning to the high plank position.
  6. Repeat on the other side, stepping your left foot outside of your left hand and reaching your left arm up towards the ceiling.
  7. Continue alternating sides for several repetitions.

name: wrist circles
instructions:
1. Start by sitting comfortably in a chair or standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
  2. Extend your right arm out in front of you, keeping it straight.
  3. Make a fist with your right hand and rotate your wrist in a circular motion, moving your hand clockwise.
  4. Continue the circular motion for 10 to 15 seconds.
  5. Reverse the direction of the circular motion, moving your hand counterclockwise.
  6. Continue the circular motion for another 10 to 15 seconds.
  7. Repeat the exercise with your left hand, following the same steps.
  8. After completing the exercise with both hands, shake them out to release any tension.

name: wrist rollerer
instructions:
1. Attach the weight to the wrist roller by sliding it onto the bar.
  2. Hold the wrist roller with both hands, palms facing down.
  3. Roll the weight up towards your hands by rotating the bar with your wrists.
  4. Once the weight is at the top, slowly lower it back down to the starting position by rotating the bar in the opposite direction.
  5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
  6. Take a break between sets if necessary.
  7. Adjust the weight as needed to increase or decrease the intensity of the exercise.
